<p>Set the child view's frame based on the parent view's bounds. Then be sure that the child view's autoresizing mask is set to both "flexible width" and "flexible height". Don't hardcode sizes like you are.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>childVC.view.frame = parentVC.view.bounds;&#xA;childVC.view.autoresizingMask = UIViewAutoresizingFlexibleWidth | UIViewAutoresizingFlexibleHeight;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Once this works, you can tweak the child view's frame as needed. But it still should be based on the parent view's bounds.</p>&#xA;

 set the child view's frame based on the parent view's bounds. then be sure that the child view's autoresizing mask is set to both "flexible width" and "flexible height". don't hardcode sizes like you are. . ;. ;  . ;. ; once this works, you can tweak the child view's frame as needed. but it still should be based on the parent view's bounds. . ;

set the child view s frame based on the parent view s bounds
then be sure that the child view s autoresizing mask is set to both flexible width and flexible height
don t hardcode sizes like you are
once this works you can tweak the child view s frame as needed
but it still should be based on the parent view s bounds



<p>One difference to be aware of is that unlike DBMS_JOB, DBMS_SCHEDULER performs a commit, which makes it unsuitable for some uses.  It is also rather cumbersome for simpler requirements.  While DBMS_JOB will no longer be enhanced, it is unlikely to ever be desupported, as there must be thousands of systems that are using it and rely on the way it works, including not performing an implicit commit of the transaction from which it was called.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>See <a href="http://asktom.oracle.com/pls/asktom/f?p=100:11:0%3a%3a%3a%3aP11_QUESTION_ID:25405608521707">this Ask Tom thread</a> for more.</p>&#xA;

 one difference to be aware of is that unlike dbms_job, dbms_scheduler performs a commit, which makes it unsuitable for some uses.  it is also rather cumbersome for simpler requirements.  while dbms_job will no longer be enhanced, it is unlikely to ever be desupported, as there must be thousands of systems that are using it and rely on the way it works, including not performing an implicit commit of the transaction from which it was called. . ;. ; see  this ask tom thread  for more. . ;

one difference to be aware of is that unlike dbms_job dbms_scheduler performs a commit which makes it unsuitable for some uses
it is also rather cumbersome for simpler requirements
while dbms_job will no longer be enhanced it is unlikely to ever be desupported as there must be thousands of systems that are using it and rely on the way it works including not performing an implicit commit of the transaction from which it was called
see this ask tom thread for more

<p>Hello guys so my code is supposed to create an unlimited amount of processes each running their own program and communicating threw pipes..</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This is done in a recursive way so that the first parent creates a pipe then a child.. After this the child does the same creating a pipe2 and child2 etc....</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Problem is that the parent process doesn't want to wait for all the children to be created and when I try to insert</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>waitpid(childpid, NULL, 0);&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>it kinda waits forever... So either I want the last child to send some kind of STOP WAIT signal or I would like another way to solve this problem!</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Here is the code:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>/* workForce.c&#xA; * &#xA; * Program created by ----Secret-----&#xA; * &#xA; * Input has to be the programs you wish the workForce to execute with following parameters seperated by '0's&#xA; * &#xA; * example input:&#xA; * printenv 0 grep L 0 sort&#xA; * &#xA; * Will result in the command: printenv | grep L | sort | chosen PAGER&#xA; * &#xA; * The program will pipe each unit of the workForce to the next unit untill it reaches the last unit where&#xA; * it will printout the result to STDOUT.&#xA; */&#xA;#include &lt;sys/types.h&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;sys/wait.h&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;errno.h&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;stdio.h&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;stdlib.h&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;unistd.h&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;string.h&gt;&#xA;&#xA;#define PIPE_READ_SIDE ( 0 )&#xA;#define PIPE_WRITE_SIDE ( 1 )&#xA;&#xA;pid_t childpid; /* f�r child-processens PID vid fork() */&#xA;&#xA;/*&#xA; * The generateWorkforce method automaticly creates it's own workforce with one process per taskset&#xA; * Each unit in the work force will execute the parameters provided&#xA; * As long as it's not the end of the workforce the unit will pipe its output to the next unit&#xA; */&#xA;void generateWorkforce(int taskpointer, int totaltasks, int taskset[], char* tasks[]){&#xA;/* Create pipe then fork */&#xA;int pipe_filedesc[ 2 ];&#xA;int return_value;&#xA;return_value = pipe( pipe_filedesc );&#xA;if( -1 == return_value ) {perror( "Cannot create pipe" ); exit( 1 );}&#xA;&#xA;childpid = fork();&#xA;&#xA;if( 0 == childpid )&#xA;{&#xA;    /* Redirecting STDIN to now read from pipe instead and removing the pipe */&#xA;    return_value = dup2( pipe_filedesc[ PIPE_READ_SIDE], STDIN_FILENO );&#xA;    if( -1 == return_value){perror( "Cannot dup" ); exit( 1 );}     &#xA;    return_value = close( pipe_filedesc[PIPE_READ_SIDE] );&#xA;    if( -1 == return_value ){perror( "Cannot close read end" ); exit( 1 );}&#xA;    return_value = close( pipe_filedesc[ PIPE_WRITE_SIDE ] );&#xA;    if( -1 == return_value ){perror( "Cannot close write end" ); exit( 1 );}&#xA;&#xA;    if(taskpointer &lt; totaltasks-1){&#xA;        generateWorkforce((taskpointer+taskset[taskpointer]), totaltasks, taskset, tasks);&#xA;    }&#xA;    else {&#xA;        kill(getppid, SIGINT);&#xA;        execlp(tasks[taskpointer], tasks[taskpointer], (char *) 0);&#xA;&#xA;        /* exec only returns if an error occured */&#xA;        perror( "Cannot exec execute[pointer]" );&#xA;        exit( 1 );&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;else&#xA;{&#xA;    if( -1 == childpid ){   perror( "Cannot fork()" );  exit( 1 );} &#xA;&#xA;    /* Redirecting STDOUT to write to pipe instead and thereafter removes the pipe */&#xA;    return_value = dup2( pipe_filedesc[ PIPE_WRITE_SIDE], STDOUT_FILENO );&#xA;    if( -1 == return_value){perror( "Cannot dup" ); exit( 1 );}&#xA;    return_value = close( pipe_filedesc[ PIPE_WRITE_SIDE ] );&#xA;    if( -1 == return_value ){perror( "Cannot close write end" ); exit( 1 );}&#xA;    return_value = close( pipe_filedesc[ PIPE_READ_SIDE ] );&#xA;    if( -1 == return_value ){perror( "Cannot close read end" ); exit( 1 );}&#xA;&#xA;    waitpid(childpid, NULL, 0);&#xA;&#xA;    /* Will define what task to execute and how many parameters it needs */&#xA;    if(taskset[taskpointer] &gt; 1){&#xA;        char* execute[taskset[taskpointer]+1];&#xA;        int i;&#xA;        char* executeHead = tasks[taskpointer];&#xA;        execute[0] = tasks[taskpointer];&#xA;        for(i = 1;i&lt;taskset[taskpointer];i++){&#xA;            execute[i] = tasks[taskpointer+i];&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        execute[taskset[taskpointer]] = (char *) 0;&#xA;&#xA;        (void) execvp( executeHead, execute );&#xA;    }&#xA;    else{&#xA;        (void) execlp( tasks[taskpointer], tasks[taskpointer], (char *) 0 );&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    /* exec only returns if an error occured */&#xA;    perror( "Cannot exec tasks[taskpointer]" );&#xA;    exit( 1 );&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;int main( int argc, char * argv[] )&#xA;{&#xA;/* The following block will determine how many tasksets was in the input */&#xA;char * separator = "0";&#xA;int i;&#xA;int j;&#xA;int tasknr = 1;&#xA;for(i = 1, j = 1;i&lt;(argc);i++)&#xA;{&#xA;    if(!(strcmp(argv[(i)], separator ))){&#xA;        j++;&#xA;    }&#xA;    else{&#xA;        tasknr++;&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;char* execute[tasknr];&#xA;int taskset[j+1];&#xA;&#xA;/* Will fill the taskset array and execute array */&#xA;if(getenv("PAGER")) execute[(tasknr-1)] = getenv("PAGER");&#xA;else execute[(tasknr-1)] = "less";&#xA;taskset[j] = 1;&#xA;taskset[0] = 0;&#xA;int k = 0;&#xA;for(i = 1, j = 0;i&lt;(argc);i++)&#xA;{&#xA;    if(!(strcmp(argv[(i)], separator ))){&#xA;        j++;&#xA;        taskset[j] = 0;&#xA;    }&#xA;    else{&#xA;        execute[k] = argv[i];&#xA;        taskset[j]++;&#xA;        k++;&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;generateWorkforce(0, tasknr, taskset, execute);&#xA;&#xA;exit( 0 );&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>EDIT: the kill(getppid, SIGINT); was an attempt to stop the wait!</p>&#xA;

 hello guys so my code is supposed to create an unlimited amount of processes each running their own program and communicating threw pipes.. . ;. ; this is done in a recursive way so that the first parent creates a pipe then a child.. after this the child does the same creating a pipe2 and child2 etc.... . ;. ; problem is that the parent process doesn't want to wait for all the children to be created and when i try to insert . ;. ;  . ;. ; it kinda waits forever... so either i want the last child to send some kind of stop wait signal or i would like another way to solve this problem! . ;. ; here is the code: . ;. ;  . ;. ; edit: the kill(getppid, sigint); was an attempt to stop the wait! . ;

after this the child does the same creating a pipe2 and child2 etc..

<p>It's because when you add the css style for that <code>th</code>, the style on that element set on <code>jquery.dataTables.css</code> was overriding yours.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>To make your style a priority, do this instead:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>table.dataTable thead th {&#xA;  font-weight: !important;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

it s because when you add the css style for that th the style on that element set on jquery.datatables.css was overriding yours
to make your style a priority do this instead



<p><code>contours</code> is actually defined as </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>vector&lt;vector&lt;Point&gt; &gt; contours;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And now I think it's clear how to access its points.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The contour area is calculated by a function nicely called <code>contourArea()</code>:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>for (unsigned int i = 0;  i &lt; contours.size();  i++)&#xA;{&#xA;     std::cout &lt;&lt; "# of contour points: " &lt;&lt; contours[i].size() &lt;&lt; std::endl;&#xA;&#xA;     for (unsigned int j=0;  j&lt;contours[i].size();  j++)&#xA;     {&#xA;         std::cout &lt;&lt; "Point(x,y)=" &lt;&lt; contours[i][j] &lt;&lt; std::endl;&#xA;     }&#xA;&#xA;     std::cout &lt;&lt; " Area: " &lt;&lt; contourArea(contours[i]) &lt;&lt; std::endl;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>If your data is being multiplied, it is either because you have duplicates in the columns in table2, or you have values repeated between the <code>propertycode</code> and <code>propertid</code> columns.  The first is a bit more painful to deal with in this situation.  The second can be handled with left outer joins.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I am assuming that you have the <code>PropertyCode</code> and <code>PropertyList</code> columns swapped for <code>Table2</code> (based on the sample data).  Here is a query that might do what you need:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>   SELECT  t1.*, coalesce(t2.PropertyCode, t3.PropertyCode) as PropertyCode&#xA;   FROM Test.dbo.DailyBudgetExtract T1 LEFT OUTER JOIN&#xA;        Test.dbo.DailyPropertylListExtract T2 &#xA;        ON t1.propertyid = t2.propertyid LEFT OUTER JOIN&#xA;        Test.dbo.DailyPropertylListExtract T3&#xA;        ON t1.propertyid = t3.proplistid ;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 if your data is being multiplied, it is either because you have duplicates in the columns in table2, or you have values repeated between the  propertycode  and  propertid  columns.  the first is a bit more painful to deal with in this situation.  the second can be handled with left outer joins. . ;. ; i am assuming that you have the  propertycode  and  propertylist  columns swapped for  table2  (based on the sample data).  here is a query that might do what you need: . ;. ;  . ;

if your data is being multiplied it is either because you have duplicates in the columns in table2 or you have values repeated between the propertycode and propertid columns
the first is a bit more painful to deal with in this situation
the second can be handled with left outer joins
i am assuming that you have the propertycode and propertylist columns swapped for table2 based on the sample data

<p>It's a CSS hack. Only IE7 and below will recognize it.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I wouldn't recommend using it. Instead, use IE conditional comments to render a different class name for the BODY tag depending on the version of IE being used. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>When I have to deal with old versions of IE, I use a method similar to this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://nicolasgallagher.com/better-conditional-classnames-for-hack-free-css/">http://nicolasgallagher.com/better-conditional-classnames-for-hack-free-css/</a></p>&#xA;

<p>If I understood what you want, you can use Join LINQ method, like that:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>public void UpdateInspection (EditInspectonViewModel editedInspection)&#xA;{&#xA;    //get the inspection we're editing&#xA;    Inspection inspection = _repo.GetAll&lt;Inspection&gt;().Single(x=&gt;x.Id==editedInspection.Id;&#xA;&#xA;    //set the values to what was passed in&#xA;    inspection.Name = editedInspection.Name;&#xA;    inspection.Description = editedInspection.Description;&#xA;&#xA;    // Here is where I'm stuck (note-Damages is of type  DamageViewModel)&#xA;    var damages = editedInspection.Damages&#xA;                                  .Join(inspection.Damages, &#xA;                                        d =&gt; d.Id, d =&gt; d.Id, &#xA;                                        (vmDmg, dbDmg) =&gt; new { vmDmg, dbDmg });&#xA;    foreach (var damage in damages)&#xA;    {&#xA;        damage.dbDmg.Property = damage.vmDmg.Property;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    _repo.SaveChanges();&#xA;}   &#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>This is quite easy to do. Canvas can listen to key press and pointer events, as well as to commands. You implement the <em>operations</em> you need in respective methods defined in the API.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you're interested, find more details on that in <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javame/config/cldc/ref-impl/midp2.0/jsr118/javax/microedition/lcdui/Canvas.html" rel="nofollow">Canvas API documentation</a>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><em>To create new canvas</em> is also easy since these are plain old Java objects, no magic.You seem to be mostly active in C#, expect it to be pretty much like you create instances of C# objects.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The only specifics worth remembering is that to make your canvas (or any <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javame/config/cldc/ref-impl/midp2.0/jsr118/javax/microedition/lcdui/Displayable.html" rel="nofollow" title="API documentation">Displayable</a> for that matter) visible, you need an instance of <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javame/config/cldc/ref-impl/midp2.0/jsr118/javax/microedition/lcdui/Display.html" rel="nofollow" title="API documentation">Display</a> that corresponds to your application. The only way to obtain that instance is from the class that extends <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javame/config/cldc/ref-impl/midp2.0/jsr118/javax/microedition/midlet/MIDlet.html" rel="nofollow" title="API documentation">MIDlet</a> - from the class that serves as an entry point to your MIDP application.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You have to get the Display instance there and further make sure that it's available anywhere you need it. That instance is also a plain Java object, pretty similar to C# object and the ways to expose it are nothing MIDP-specific.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you need to learn more details, consider also studying references to tutorials and API documentation at</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/tags/lcdui/info">lcdui tag wiki</a></li>&#xA;<li><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/tags/midp/info">midp tag wiki</a></li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;&#xA;<hr>&#xA;&#xA;<p>For the code snippet provided in question update, the way to find out what's going on there would be to add appropriate logging and re-test it in emulator, looking into emulator console when you press keys.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>public void keyPressed(int key) {&#xA;        // add logging here:&#xA;        System.out.println("keyPressed [" + key + "]");&#xA;        if (key == -3) {&#xA;            // add logging here:&#xA;            System.out.println("calling OK-event");&#xA;            // call OK-event &#xA;        }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>For a sample code, check lcdui tag wiki, there's a reference to "MIDP event Handling" tutorial, in <code>EventEx3.java</code>. Another tutorial listed in lcdui tag wiki worth looking at is "J2ME Tutorial: User Interfaces with MIDP 2.0", section <em>Working with the Low-Level API</em> - there is sample code as well.</p>&#xA;

 this is quite easy to do. canvas can listen to key press and pointer events, as well as to commands. you implement the  operations  you need in respective methods defined in the api. . ;. ; if you're interested, find more details on that in  canvas api documentation . . ;. ;  to create new canvas  is also easy since these are plain old java objects, no magic.you seem to be mostly active in c#, expect it to be pretty much like you create instances of c# objects. . ;. ; the only specifics worth remembering is that to make your canvas (or any  displayable  for that matter) visible, you need an instance of  display  that corresponds to your application. the only way to obtain that instance is from the class that extends  midlet  - from the class that serves as an entry point to your midp application. . ;. ; you have to get the display instance there and further make sure that it's available anywhere you need it. that instance is also a plain java object, pretty similar to c# object and the ways to expose it are nothing midp-specific. . ;. ; if you need to learn more details, consider also studying references to tutorials and api documentation at . ;. ; . ;  lcdui tag wiki  . ;  midp tag wiki  . ; . ;. ; . ;. ; for the code snippet provided in question update, the way to find out what's going on there would be to add appropriate logging and re-test it in emulator, looking into emulator console when you press keys. . ;. ;  . ;. ; for a sample code, check lcdui tag wiki, there's a reference to "midp event handling" tutorial, in  eventex3.java . another tutorial listed in lcdui tag wiki worth looking at is "j2me tutorial: user interfaces with midp 2.0", section  working with the low-level api  - there is sample code as well. . ;

this is quite easy to do
canvas can listen to key press and pointer events as well as to commands
you implement the operations you need in respective methods defined in the api
if you re interested find more details on that in canvas api documentation
to create new canvas is also easy since these are plain old java objects no magic.you seem to be mostly active in c# expect it to be pretty much like you create instances of c# objects
the only specifics worth remembering is that to make your canvas or any displayable for that matter visible you need an instance of display that corresponds to your application
the only way to obtain that instance is from the class that extends midlet - from the class that serves as an entry point to your midp application
you have to get the display instance there and further make sure that it s available anywhere you need it
that instance is also a plain java object pretty similar to c# object and the ways to expose it are nothing midp-specific
if you need to learn more details consider also studying references to tutorials and api documentation at
lcdui tag wiki
midp tag wiki
for the code snippet provided in question update the way to find out what s going on there would be to add appropriate logging and re-test it in emulator looking into emulator console when you press keys
for a sample code check lcdui tag wiki there s a reference to midp event handling tutorial in eventex3.java
another tutorial listed in lcdui tag wiki worth looking at is j2me tutorial user interfaces with midp 2.0 section working with the low-level api - there is sample code as well

<p>I have the following radio buttons:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>// these should be included in sauce_flavor&#xA;&lt;input type="radio" value="S." onclick="countPBClicks('S')" name="sauce.left" class="pb-radio-sauce default-sauce"&gt;&#xA;&lt;input type="radio" value="S.C" onclick="countPBClicks('SF')" name="sauce.left" class="pb-radio-sauce make-table"&gt;&#xA;&#xA;// this should be included in sauce&#xA;&lt;input type="radio" value="S.reg_sauce" onclick="countPBClicks('S')" name="sauce.left" class="pb-radio-sauce "&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I have a switch that needs to have two separate flows for items that have only the <code>pb-radio-sauce' class and items that have both the</code>pb-radio-sauce<code>class and either</code>default-sauce<code>or 'make-table</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>case 'sauce':&#xA;    retval = {};&#xA;    jQuery('.pb-radio-sauce:checked').each(function() {&#xA;&#xA;            var elem = jQuery(this);&#xA;            retval[elem.val()] = String(elem.attr('name')).split('.')[1];&#xA;            });&#xA;    break;&#xA;case 'sauce_flavor':&#xA;    retval = {};&#xA;    jQuery('.pb-radio-sauce make-table:checked').each(function() {&#xA;&#xA;            var elem = jQuery(this);&#xA;            retval[elem.val()] = String(elem.attr('name')).split('.')[1];&#xA;            });&#xA;    break;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The problem is, I can't seem to come up with the correct selectors to split them out this way. <code>('.pb-radio-sauce:checked')</code> finds all results, including the ones with the secondary class and then hits the break, so it never gets to the sauce_flavor option. And I'm not sure how to include two possible secondary classes in the sauce_flavor instance while still including the checked attribute.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I have a stripped-down <a href="http://jsfiddle.net/EmmyS/V4qmd/1/" rel="nofollow">fiddle</a> (without the switch; just defined functions) that shows what's going on. <p>Looking at the <code>titlePanel</code> function, it looks like the first argument is <code>title</code> and the second is a boolean. What you're doing is passing two separate arguments, so the "My Title" is being used as the value for the <code>windowTitle</code> parameter. You want both the image and the text to be treated as tags, as one parameter, so try something like</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code> titlePanel(&#xA;   tagList(&#xA;     img(src = "./mylogo.png", height = 60, width = 255),&#xA;     "My Title"&#xA;   )&#xA;  ),&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Note: I didn't try running this, and I'm not 100% sure this will work because it's possible that this is only meant to host text because the function documentation says the parameter is <code>an application title to display</code>. But if there is a way to achieve what you want, it'll be like this.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This is a very useful technique to know about because there are many shiny contexts in which you're supposed to only give a single tag but you may want to include multiple, so you either have to wrap it in a <code>&lt;div&gt;</code> or use a <code>tagList</code></p>&#xA;

 looking at the  titlepanel  function, it looks like the first argument is  title  and the second is a boolean. what you're doing is passing two separate arguments, so the "my title" is being used as the value for the  windowtitle  parameter. you want both the image and the text to be treated as tags, as one parameter, so try something like . ;. ;  . ;. ; note: i didn't try running this, and i'm not 100% sure this will work because it's possible that this is only meant to host text because the function documentation says the parameter is  an application title to display . but if there is a way to achieve what you want, it'll be like this. . ;. ; this is a very useful technique to know about because there are many shiny contexts in which you're supposed to only give a single tag but you may want to include multiple, so you either have to wrap it in a  or use a  taglist  . ;

<p>From the <a href="http://www.scrum.org/scrumguides/" rel="nofollow"><code>Scrum Guide</code></a> (Copyrights to Scrum.org - Ken Schwaber and Jeff Sutherland):</p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p><strong>ScrumMaster</strong></p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>The ScrumMaster is responsible for ensuring that the Scrum Team adheres to Scrum values, practices, and rules. The ScrumMaster helps the Scrum Team and the organization to adopt Scrum. The ScrumMaster teaches the Scrum Team by coaching and leading it to be more productive and produce higher quality products. The ScrumMaster helps the Scrum Team understand and use self-organization and cross-functionality. The Scrum Master also helps the Scrum Team do its best in an organizational environment that may not yet be optimized for complex product development. [...]</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The ScrumMaster could either be the Air Controller in the tower at the airport or one of the pilots within the plane. The Product Owner would be and can only be one and only one passenger, so that instructions for the pilots can only be from the that passenger. What the passenger want, is to arrive at destination, that is the most valuable top Product Backlog item. The plane should, in my opinion, be thought of as the organization. If the plane doesn't come to destination, it will crash, as no other customers will want to do business with it again. The reputation would then be flawed. As the Air Controller at the tower, he might just be another Team member, as he can be an outside resource capable of doing the work the Team alone can't.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In short, the most important role the ScrumMaster has to play in a Scrum Team is to facilitate the communication between the Team and the Product Owner, make sure the Scrum Team plays by the rules of Scrum, and remove impediments so that the Sprint (flight) is delivered sucessful, hopefully.</p>&#xA;

 from the   scrum guide   (copyrights to scrum.org - ken schwaber and jeff sutherland): . ;. ; . ;    scrummaster  . ;  . ;   the scrummaster is responsible for ensuring that the scrum team adheres to scrum values, practices, and rules. the scrummaster helps the scrum team and the organization to adopt scrum. the scrummaster teaches the scrum team by coaching and leading it to be more productive and produce higher quality products. the scrummaster helps the scrum team understand and use self-organization and cross-functionality. the scrum master also helps the scrum team do its best in an organizational environment that may not yet be optimized for complex product development. [...] . ; . ;. ; the scrummaster could either be the air controller in the tower at the airport or one of the pilots within the plane. the product owner would be and can only be one and only one passenger, so that instructions for the pilots can only be from the that passenger. what the passenger want, is to arrive at destination, that is the most valuable top product backlog item. the plane should, in my opinion, be thought of as the organization. if the plane doesn't come to destination, it will crash, as no other customers will want to do business with it again. the reputation would then be flawed. as the air controller at the tower, he might just be another team member, as he can be an outside resource capable of doing the work the team alone can't. . ;. ; in short, the most important role the scrummaster has to play in a scrum team is to facilitate the communication between the team and the product owner, make sure the scrum team plays by the rules of scrum, and remove impediments so that the sprint (flight) is delivered sucessful, hopefully. . ;

from the scrum guide copyrights to scrum.org - ken schwaber and jeff sutherland
scrummaster
the scrummaster is responsible for ensuring that the scrum team adheres to scrum values practices and rules
the scrummaster helps the scrum team and the organization to adopt scrum
the scrummaster teaches the scrum team by coaching and leading it to be more productive and produce higher quality products
the scrummaster helps the scrum team understand and use self-organization and cross-functionality
the scrum master also helps the scrum team do its best in an organizational environment that may not yet be optimized for complex product development
...
the scrummaster could either be the air controller in the tower at the airport or one of the pilots within the plane
the product owner would be and can only be one and only one passenger so that instructions for the pilots can only be from the that passenger
what the passenger want is to arrive at destination that is the most valuable top product backlog item
the plane should in my opinion be thought of as the organization
if the plane doesn t come to destination it will crash as no other customers will want to do business with it again
the reputation would then be flawed
as the air controller at the tower he might just be another team member as he can be an outside resource capable of doing the work the team alone can t
in short the most important role the scrummaster has to play in a scrum team is to facilitate the communication between the team and the product owner make sure the scrum team plays by the rules of scrum and remove impediments so that the sprint flight is delivered sucessful hopefully



<p>it seems as if your syntax isn't entirely correct. I fell upon the same issue and correcting the regular expression worked for me. After adding the line</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;constant name="struts.action.excludePattern" value="/exclude/.*?"/&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>to my struts.xml, everything works as expected. Request within this path are now returned with 404 errors instead of struts error message "There is no Action mapped for namespace ..."</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>cheers</p>&#xA;

<p>It's because your two classes are in different packages. From the <a href="http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/javaOO/accesscontrol.html" rel="nofollow">documentation</a>:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>A class may be declared with the modifier public, in which case that class is visible to all classes everywhere. If a class has no modifier (the default, also known as package-private), it is visible only <em>within its own package</em> (packages are named groups of related classes ?you will learn about them in a later lesson.)</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>At the member level, you can also use the public modifier or no modifier (package-private) just as with top-level classes, and with the same meaning. For members, there are two additional access modifiers: private and protected. The private modifier specifies that the member can only be accessed in its own class. The protected modifier specifies that the member can only be accessed within its own package (as with package-private) and, in addition, by a subclass of its class in another package.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;

 it's because your two classes are in different packages. from the  documentation : . ;. ; . ;   a class may be declared with the modifier public, in which case that class is visible to all classes everywhere. if a class has no modifier (the default, also known as package-private), it is visible only  within its own package  (packages are named groups of related classes ?you will learn about them in a later lesson.) . ;  . ;   at the member level, you can also use the public modifier or no modifier (package-private) just as with top-level classes, and with the same meaning. for members, there are two additional access modifiers: private and protected. the private modifier specifies that the member can only be accessed in its own class. the protected modifier specifies that the member can only be accessed within its own package (as with package-private) and, in addition, by a subclass of its class in another package. . ; . ;

it s because your two classes are in different packages
from the documentation
a class may be declared with the modifier public in which case that class is visible to all classes everywhere
if a class has no modifier the default also known as package-private it is visible only within its own package packages are named groups of related classes you will learn about them in a later lesson.
at the member level you can also use the public modifier or no modifier package-private just as with top-level classes and with the same meaning
for members there are two additional access modifiers private and protected
the private modifier specifies that the member can only be accessed in its own class
the protected modifier specifies that the member can only be accessed within its own package as with package-private and in addition by a subclass of its class in another package

There is nothing wrong with both approach.</p>&#xA;

<p>So, I'm seeing this output and I'm a bit surprised:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>$ echo "a,b,c,d,e,f,g" | cut -d, -f-4&#xA;a,b,c,d&#xA;$ echo "a,b,c,d,e,f,g" | cut -d, -f6-&#xA;f,g&#xA;echo "a,b,c,d,e,f,g" | awk '{ print $0 | "cut -d, -f-4"; print $0 | "cut -d, -f6-"; }'&#xA;f,g&#xA;a,b,c,d&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>(As a side note, I realize this is a completely silly thing to do in <code>awk</code>, but it's the only command I've seen it happen for!).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>As I understand it, this should pipe the record into the two commands -- in order.  But for some reason, the output appears reversed.  If I do this instead</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>$ echo "a,b,c,d,e,f,g" | awk '{ print $0 | "echo hello"; print $0 | "echo goodbye"; }'&#xA;hello&#xA;goodbye&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>then everything comes in the order I expected.  I'm thinking this must be some sort of race condition, but I'm surprised that <code>awk</code> doesn't wait for the subcommand in the pipe to finish.  Is this a known issue of using <code>awk</code> or something pecular to <code>gawk</code>? Is there any way to avoid such a pitfall?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>EDIT:</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I tried it using <code>mawk</code> too... same (reversed) result, and seems to happen consistently for both.</p>&#xA;

<p>one way to do this would be to introduce one extra loop that iterates the algorithm over all the nodes, and with distance array you can store the "via node" element.&#xA;once you have shortest path calculated from each node to every other node, all you have to do is to follow the "via node" value that you have stored.&#xA;btw, in terms of efficiency, this algorithm sucks, it's O(n^3).</p>&#xA;

once you have shortest path calculated from each node to every other node all you have to do is to follow the via node value that you have stored
btw in terms of efficiency this algorithm sucks it s o n 3

<p><code>B</code> is a (nested) class template with a <code>bool</code> template parameter (<code>b</code>); its static member <code>m_n</code> is <code>1</code> when <code>b</code> is <code>true</code>, and <code>0</code> when <code>b</code> is <code>false</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><code>t &gt; T()</code> tests whether the value <code>t</code> (which is a template parameter of <code>A</code>) is greater than a value-initialised <code>T</code>. Since <code>T</code> must be a valid type for non-type template parameters, <code>T()</code> is equivalent to <code>T(0)</code>, i.e. a zero expressed in the correct type.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The result of that test is then used as a template argument for <code>B</code>. Equivalent code would look like this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>public:&#xA;    static const T t0 = T();&#xA;    static const bool b1 = t &gt; t0;&#xA;    static const bool b2 = t &lt; t0;&#xA;    static const int m_value = B&lt;b1&gt;::m_n - B&lt;b2&gt;::m_n;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

  b  is a (nested) class template with a  bool  template parameter ( b ); its static member  m_n  is  1  when  b  is  true , and  0  when  b  is  false . . ;. ;  tests whether the value  t  (which is a template parameter of  a ) is greater than a value-initialised  t . since  t  must be a valid type for non-type template parameters,  t()  is equivalent to  t(0) ,   a zero expressed in the correct type. . ;. ; the result of that test is then used as a template argument for  b . equivalent code would look like this: . ;. ;  . ;

b is a nested class template with a bool template parameter b
its static member m_n is 1 when b is true and 0 when b is false
tests whether the value t which is a template parameter of a is greater than a value-initialised t
since t must be a valid type for non-type template parameters t is equivalent to t 0 a zero expressed in the correct type
the result of that test is then used as a template argument for b
equivalent code would look like this

<p>I am in the middle of reading the excellent <a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/0132350882" rel="nofollow noreferrer">Clean Code</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>One discussion is regarding passing nulls into a method.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>public class MetricsCalculator {&#xA;    public double xProjection(Point p1, Point p2) {&#xA;        return (p2.x - p1.x) * 1.5;&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;...&#xA;calculator.xProjection(null, new Point(12,13));&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>It represents different ways of handling this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>public double xProjection(Point p1, Point p2) {&#xA;    if (p1 == null || p2 == null) {&#xA;        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid argument for xProjection");&#xA;    }&#xA;    return (p2.x - p1.x) * 1.5;&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;public double xProjection(Point p1, Point p2) {&#xA;    assert p1 != null : "p1 should not be null";&#xA;    assert p2 != null : "p2 should not be null";&#xA;    return (p2.x - p1.x) * 1.5;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I prefer the <a href="http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/guide/lang/assert.html" rel="nofollow noreferrer">assertions</a> approach, but I don't like the fact that assertions are turned off by default.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The book finally states:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>In most programming languages there is no good way to deal with a null that is passed by a caller accidentally. Because this is the case, the rational approach is to forbid passing null by default.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>It doesn't really go into how you would enforce this restriction?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Do any of you have strong opinions either way.</p>&#xA;

 i am in the middle of reading the excellent  clean code  . ;. ; one discussion is regarding passing nulls into a method. . ;. ;  . ;. ; it represents different ways of handling this: . ;. ;  . ;. ; i prefer the  assertions  approach, but i don't like the fact that assertions are turned off by default. . ;. ; the book finally states: . ;. ; . ;   in most programming languages there is no good way to deal with a null that is passed by a caller accidentally. because this is the case, the rational approach is to forbid passing null by default. . ; . ;. ; it doesn't really go into how you would enforce this restriction? . ;. ; do any of you have strong opinions either way. . ;

i am in the middle of reading the excellent clean code
one discussion is regarding passing nulls into a method
it represents different ways of handling this
i prefer the assertions approach but i don t like the fact that assertions are turned off by default
the book finally states
in most programming languages there is no good way to deal with a null that is passed by a caller accidentally
because this is the case the rational approach is to forbid passing null by default
it doesn t really go into how you would enforce this restriction
do any of you have strong opinions either way

<p>Not sure why you are doing <code>autorelease</code> here as it seems a plain <code>release</code> should do the job seems as you are just balancing the <code>alloc</code></p>&#xA;&#xA;<hr>&#xA;&#xA;<p>With ARC there is nothing holding onto that controller so it would be instantly deallocated here.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You could rejig this slightly so that you are passing the completion after instantiation that way the block will actually capture the instance which is what I believe you are trying to achieve.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You will also need to add the <code>__block</code> storage specifier to modify <code>controller</code> within the block and <code>nil</code> out the controller so ARC will send the release</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>__block MyCustomController *controller = MyCustomController.new;&#xA;&#xA;controller.completion = ^{&#xA;  controller = nil;&#xA;};&#xA;&#xA;// Using weak in this example to ensure the dispatch_after is not the thing holding onto our controller&#xA;__weak __typeof(controller) weakController = controller;&#xA;dispatch_after(dispatch_time(DISPATCH_TIME_NOW, (int64_t)(2 * NSEC_PER_SEC)), dispatch_get_main_queue(), ^{&#xA;  weakController.completion();&#xA;});&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 not sure why you are doing  autorelease  here as it seems a plain  release  should do the job seems as you are just balancing the  alloc  . ;. ; . ;. ; with arc there is nothing holding onto that controller so it would be instantly deallocated here. . ;. ; you could rejig this slightly so that you are passing the completion after instantiation that way the block will actually capture the instance which is what i believe you are trying to achieve. . ;. ; you will also need to add the  __block  storage specifier to modify  controller  within the block and  nil  out the controller so arc will send the release . ;. ;  . ;

not sure why you are doing autorelease here as it seems a plain release should do the job seems as you are just balancing the alloc
with arc there is nothing holding onto that controller so it would be instantly deallocated here
you could rejig this slightly so that you are passing the completion after instantiation that way the block will actually capture the instance which is what i believe you are trying to achieve
you will also need to add the __block storage specifier to modify controller within the block and nil out the controller so arc will send the release



<p>You also just override the module.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Please keep in mind, how you <em>create</em> subcomponents:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>public interface ApplicationComponent {&#xA;&#xA;    ActivityComponent activityComponent(/*needed modules go here*/);&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So unless you have no-args constructors for modules, you have to put them as parameters in the method declaration.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you want to be able to override modules with a no-arg constructor, you'd have to add them to your method signature:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>public interface ApplicationComponent {&#xA;&#xA;    ActivityComponent activityComponent(AnotherModule module);&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And in your test you just supply your subclass.</p>&#xA;

 you also just override the module. . ;. ; please keep in mind, how you  create  subcomponents: . ;. ;  . ;. ; so unless you have no-args constructors for modules, you have to put them as parameters in the method declaration. . ;. ; if you want to be able to override modules with a no-arg constructor, you'd have to add them to your method signature: . ;. ;  . ;. ; and in your test you just supply your subclass. . ;

you also just override the module
please keep in mind how you create subcomponents
so unless you have no-args constructors for modules you have to put them as parameters in the method declaration
if you want to be able to override modules with a no-arg constructor you d have to add them to your method signature
and in your test you just supply your subclass



<p>I'd use the approach <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/q/2408689/230513">cited</a>. Because a <code>JRadioButton</code> is a <code>JToggleButton</code>, a mouse gesture is possible but problematic. I'd use a <code>MouseListener</code> on the enclosing panel and <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/misc/keybinding.html" rel="nofollow noreferrer"><em>Key Bindings</em></a> on the buttons as shown below. Click in the panel surrounding the buttons or press the <kbd>escape</kbd> key to clear the selection of all buttons in the <code>ButtonGroup</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="https://i.stack.imgur.com/z9it1.png" rel="nofollow noreferrer"><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/z9it1.png" alt="image"></a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>import java.awt.EventQueue;&#xA;import java.awt.GridLayout;&#xA;import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;&#xA;import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;&#xA;import java.awt.event.MouseAdapter;&#xA;import java.awt.event.MouseEvent;&#xA;import javax.swing.AbstractAction;&#xA;import javax.swing.BorderFactory;&#xA;import javax.swing.ButtonGroup;&#xA;import javax.swing.JFrame;&#xA;import javax.swing.JPanel;&#xA;import javax.swing.JRadioButton;&#xA;import javax.swing.KeyStroke;&#xA;&#xA;/**&#xA; * @see http://stackoverflow.com/a/37599961/230513&#xA; */&#xA;public class Test {&#xA;&#xA;    private static final String UNSELECT = "UNSELECT";&#xA;&#xA;    private void display() {&#xA;        JFrame f = new JFrame("Test");&#xA;        f.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);&#xA;        JPanel p = new JPanel(new GridLayout(1, 0, 5, 5));&#xA;        p.setBorder(BorderFactory.createEmptyBorder(8, 8, 8, 8));&#xA;        ButtonGroup group = new ButtonGroup();&#xA;        JRadioButton r1 = create("One", group);&#xA;        JRadioButton r2 = create("Two", group);&#xA;        p.add(r1);&#xA;        p.add(r2);&#xA;        p.addMouseListener(new MouseAdapter() {&#xA;            @Override&#xA;            public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e) {&#xA;                group.clearSelection();&#xA;            }&#xA;        });&#xA;        f.add(p);&#xA;        f.pack();&#xA;        f.setLocationRelativeTo(null);&#xA;        f.setVisible(true);&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    private JRadioButton create(String name, ButtonGroup group) {&#xA;        JRadioButton b = new JRadioButton(name);&#xA;        group.add(b);&#xA;        b.getInputMap().put(KeyStroke.getKeyStroke(KeyEvent.VK_ESCAPE, 0), UNSELECT);&#xA;        b.getActionMap().put(UNSELECT, new AbstractAction(UNSELECT) {&#xA;            @Override&#xA;            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {&#xA;                group.clearSelection();&#xA;            }&#xA;        });&#xA;        return b;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    public static void main(String[] args) {&#xA;        EventQueue.invokeLater(new Test()::display);&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 i'd use the approach  cited . because a  jradiobutton  is a  jtogglebutton , a mouse gesture is possible but problematic. i'd use a  mouselistener  on the enclosing panel and   key bindings   on the buttons as shown below. click in the panel surrounding the buttons or press the  escape  key to clear the selection of all buttons in the  buttongroup . . ;. ;     . ;. ;  . ;

i d use the approach cited
because a jradiobutton is a jtogglebutton a mouse gesture is possible but problematic
i d use a mouselistener on the enclosing panel and key bindings on the buttons as shown below
click in the panel surrounding the buttons or press the escape key to clear the selection of all buttons in the buttongroup



<p>In the same logic as @Angew's answer, you could also use std::tuple, and it's quite interesting as with tuple you can also use different kind of containers in your callee function :</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>class Test {&#xA;    std::tuple&lt;std::vector&lt;int&gt;, std::list&lt;int&gt; &gt; ab;&#xA;    void caller(...) { callee&lt;0&gt;(...); }&#xA;    template &lt;size_t idx&gt;&#xA;    void callee(...) { &#xA;    ...&#xA;    auto aIt = std::get&lt;idx&gt;(ab).begin(); // gets either the vector or the list depending on template value&#xA;    ...&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 in the same logic as @angew's answer, you could also use std::tuple, and it's quite interesting as with tuple you can also use different kind of containers in your callee function : . ;. ;  . ;

in the same logic as angew s answer you could also use std tuple and it s quite interesting as with tuple you can also use different kind of containers in your callee function

<p>It depends how you declare them:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>// Assuming the POD type's&#xA;class BaseClass&#xA;{&#xA;  public:&#xA;    int pub;&#xA;};&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<h3>Static Storage Duration Objects</h3>&#xA;&#xA;<p>These objects are always zero initialized.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>// Static storage duration objects:&#xA;// PODS are zero initialized.&#xA;&#xA;BaseClass    global; // Zero initialized pub = 0&#xA;&#xA;void plop()&#xA;{&#xA;    static BaseClass functionStatic;   // Zero initialized.&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<h3>Automatic/Dynamic Storage Duration Objects</h3>&#xA;&#xA;<p>These objects may by default or zero initialized depending on how you declare them</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>void plop1()&#xA;{&#xA;    // Dynamic&#xA;    BaseClass*  dynaObj1   = new BaseClass;   // Default initialized (does nothing)&#xA;    BaseClass*  dynaObj2   = new BaseClass(); // Zero Initialized&#xA;&#xA;    // Automatic&#xA;    BaseClass   autoObj1;                     // Default initialized (does nothing)&#xA;    BaseClass   autoObj2   =     BaseClass(); // Zero Initialized&#xA;&#xA;    // Notice that zero initialization of an automatic object is not the same&#xA;    // as the zero initialization of a dynamic object this is because of the most&#xA;    // vexing parse problem&#xA;&#xA;    BaseClass    autoObj3(); // Unfortunately not a zero initialized object.&#xA;                             // Its a forward declaration of a function.&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I use the term 'Zero-Initialized'/'Default-Initialization' but technically slightly more complex. 'Default-Initialization' will becomes 'no-initialization' of the <code>pub</code> member. While the <code>()</code> invokes 'Value-Initialization' that becomes 'Zero-Initialization' of the <code>pub</code> member. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Note: As <code>BaseClass</code> is a POD this class behaves just like the builtin types. If you swap BaseClass for any of the standard type the behavior is the same.</p>&#xA;

 it depends how you declare them: . ;. ;  . ;. ; static storage duration objects . ;. ; these objects are always zero initialized. . ;. ;  . ;. ; automatic/dynamic storage duration objects . ;. ; these objects may by default or zero initialized depending on how you declare them . ;. ;  . ;. ; i use the term 'zero-initialized'/'default-initialization' but technically slightly more complex. 'default-initialization' will becomes 'no-initialization' of the  pub  member. while the  ()  invokes 'value-initialization' that becomes 'zero-initialization' of the  pub  member.  . ;. ; note: as  baseclass  is a pod this class behaves just like the builtin types. if you swap baseclass for any of the standard type the behavior is the same. . ;

it depends how you declare them
static storage duration objects
these objects are always zero initialized
automatic dynamic storage duration objects
these objects may by default or zero initialized depending on how you declare them
i use the term zero-initialized default-initialization but technically slightly more complex
default-initialization will becomes no-initialization of the pub member
while the invokes value-initialization that becomes zero-initialization of the pub member
note as baseclass is a pod this class behaves just like the builtin types
if you swap baseclass for any of the standard type the behavior is the same



<p>This works too:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Integer a = 128, b = 128;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This doesn't:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Integer a = 127, b = 127;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Auto-boxing an <code>int</code> is syntactic sugar for a call to <code>Integer.valueOf(int)</code>. This function uses a cache for values less than 128. Thus, the assignment of 128 doesn't have a cache hit; it creates a new <code>Integer</code> instance with each auto-boxing operation, and <code>a != b</code> (reference comparison) is true.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The assignment of 127 has a cache hit, and the resulting <code>Integer</code> objects are really the same instance from the cache. So, the reference comparison <code>a != b</code> is false.</p>&#xA;

 this works too: . ;. ;  . ;. ; this doesn't: . ;. ;  . ;. ; auto-boxing an  int  is syntactic sugar for a call to  integer.valueof(int) . this function uses a cache for values less than 128. thus, the assignment of 128 doesn't have a cache hit; it creates a new  integer  instance with each auto-boxing operation, and  (reference comparison) is true. . ;. ; the assignment of 127 has a cache hit, and the resulting  integer  objects are really the same instance from the cache. so, the reference comparison  is false. . ;

this works too
this doesn t
auto-boxing an int is syntactic sugar for a call to integer.valueof int
this function uses a cache for values less than 128
thus the assignment of 128 doesn t have a cache hit
it creates a new integer instance with each auto-boxing operation and reference comparison is true
the assignment of 127 has a cache hit and the resulting integer objects are really the same instance from the cache
so the reference comparison is false



<p>If You can use Apache objectutils</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><code>ObjectUtils.equals(Object object1, Object object2)</code> -- Returns boolean </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Compares two objects for equality, where either one or both objects may be null.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code> ObjectUtils.equals(null, null)                  = true&#xA; ObjectUtils.equals(null, "")                    = false&#xA; ObjectUtils.equals("", null)                    = false&#xA; ObjectUtils.equals("", "")                      = true&#xA; ObjectUtils.equals(Boolean.TRUE, null)          = false&#xA; ObjectUtils.equals(Boolean.TRUE, "true")        = false&#xA; ObjectUtils.equals(Boolean.TRUE, Boolean.TRUE)  = true&#xA; ObjectUtils.equals(Boolean.TRUE, Boolean.FALSE) = false&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 if you can use apache objectutils . ;. ;  objectutils.equals(object object1, object object2)  -- returns boolean  . ;. ; compares two objects for equality, where either one or both objects may be null. . ;. ;  . ;

if you can use apache objectutils
objectutils.equals object object1 object object2 -- returns boolean
compares two objects for equality where either one or both objects may be null



<p>Solution 1:&#xA;You can set the textbox TabStop property to false.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Solution 2:&#xA;Set another controls TabIndex to a lower value than the TabIndex value of the texbox (the control you wish to recieve focus on startup).</p>&#xA;

 solution 1:. ;you can set the textbox tabstop property to false. . ;. ; solution 2:. ;set another controls tabindex to a lower value than the tabindex value of the texbox (the control you wish to recieve focus on startup). . ;

solution 1
you can set the textbox tabstop property to false
solution 2
set another controls tabindex to a lower value than the tabindex value of the texbox the control you wish to recieve focus on startup



<p>The below is my code,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>    ListView sourcelistview = null;&#xA;    ListView targetlistview = null;&#xA;    Point startPoint;&#xA;&#xA;    public Window1()&#xA;    {&#xA;        InitializeComponent();&#xA;        lbOne.Items.Add("xxxx");&#xA;        lbOne.Items.Add("yyyy");&#xA;        lbOne.Items.Add("zzzz");&#xA;        lbOne.Items.Add("uuuu"); &#xA;        lbOne.Items.Add("vvvv");&#xA;        lbOne.Items.Add("wwww"); &#xA;        lbOne.Items.Add("rrrr");&#xA;        lbOne.Items.Add("ssss");&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    private void lbOne_PreviewMouseLeftButtonDown(object sender, MouseButtonEventArgs e)&#xA;    {&#xA;        startPoint = e.GetPosition(null);&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    private void lbTwo_Drop(object sender, DragEventArgs e)&#xA;    {&#xA;&#xA;        targetlistview = (ListView)sender;&#xA;            var Sourcedata = sourcelistview.SelectedItems.Cast&lt;object&gt;().ToArray();&#xA;            foreach (string item in Sourcedata)&#xA;            {&#xA;                targetlistview.Items.Add(item);&#xA;                sourcelistview.Items.Remove(item);&#xA;            }            &#xA;    }        &#xA;&#xA;    private void lbOne_MouseMove(object sender, MouseEventArgs e)&#xA;    {           &#xA;        Point mousePos = e.GetPosition(null);&#xA;        Vector diff = startPoint - mousePos;&#xA;&#xA;        if (e.LeftButton == MouseButtonState.Pressed &amp;&amp; Math.Abs(diff.X) &gt; SystemParameters.MinimumVerticalDragDistance)&#xA;        {&#xA;            {&#xA;                sourcelistview = (ListView)sender;&#xA;                DragDrop.DoDragDrop(sourcelistview, sourcelistview.SelectedItems.ToString(), DragDropEffects.Copy);&#xA;            }            &#xA;        }      &#xA;    } &#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This works for single event drag, but when I attempt to drag multiple events, the last item I select gets deselected and other items are moved.&#xA;Any solution for this?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Regards,&#xA;RV</p>&#xA;

<p>Check first if the array is empty:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>if ([array count] &gt; 0) {&#xA;/* do something with your array */&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you need to look inside the array, set a breakpoint and look inside while debugging.</p>&#xA;

<p>It depends on where you are in the process.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you have not yet created the model at all you can just add more fields to the original generate scaffold line. For example if you wanted 4 fields:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>rails generate scaffold topic title:string description:text another_item:string some_number:integer</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you already created the model but have not yet run rake db:migrate then you can find the migration file in app_name/db/migrate/. Open the file and add lines for your new fields</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you have already run db:migrate then you should follow the answer for "How to add several columns to a database in Rails" that you linked in your answer.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>For the fields where you want several options to select from those options will need to be handled by a combination of your model and view code. Assuming the options will stay constant and you can only select one first define the options array in your model using something like:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>OPTIONS_FOR_TITLE = ["Title 1", "Title 2", "Title 3"]</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Then in the view code you will use the select and options_for_select helpers to create the view. More details on them are available here:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://guides.rubyonrails.org/form_helpers.html#the-select-and-option-tags" rel="nofollow">http://guides.rubyonrails.org/form_helpers.html#the-select-and-option-tags</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>For lots of detailed information about migrations:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://guides.rubyonrails.org/migrations.html" rel="nofollow">http://guides.rubyonrails.org/migrations.html</a></p>&#xA;

 it depends on where you are in the process. . ;. ; if you have not yet created the model at all you can just add more fields to the original generate scaffold line. for example if you wanted 4 fields: . ;. ; rails generate scaffold topic title:string description:text another_item:string some_number:integer . ;. ; if you already created the model but have not yet run rake db:migrate then you can find the migration file in app_name/db/migrate/. open the file and add lines for your new fields . ;. ; if you have already run db:migrate then you should follow the answer for "how to add several columns to a database in rails" that you linked in your answer. . ;. ; for the fields where you want several options to select from those options will need to be handled by a combination of your model and view code. assuming the options will stay constant and you can only select one first define the options array in your model using something like: . ;. ; options_for_title = ["title 1", "title 2", "title 3"] . ;. ; then in the view code you will use the select and options_for_select helpers to create the view. more details on them are available here: . ;. ;     . ;. ; for lots of detailed information about migrations: . ;. ;     . ;

it depends on where you are in the process
if you have not yet created the model at all you can just add more fields to the original generate scaffold line
for example if you wanted 4 fields
rails generate scaffold topic title string description text another_item string some_number integer
if you already created the model but have not yet run rake db migrate then you can find the migration file in app_name db migrate
open the file and add lines for your new fields
if you have already run db migrate then you should follow the answer for how to add several columns to a database in rails that you linked in your answer
for the fields where you want several options to select from those options will need to be handled by a combination of your model and view code
assuming the options will stay constant and you can only select one first define the options array in your model using something like
options_for_title title 1 title 2 title 3
then in the view code you will use the select and options_for_select helpers to create the view
more details on them are available here
for lots of detailed information about migrations

<p>The current filename is passed through <code>%%%{PBXFilePath}%%%</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The selection start, which is passed through <code>%%%{PBXSelectionStart}%%%</code>, returns the cursor position (as character index) when there is no selection so you should be able to use that.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you need the line number instead, it should be possible to get it from the index with some scripting (like counting the characters in the full text while keeping track of new lines).</p>&#xA;

 the current filename is passed through . . ;. ; the selection start, which is passed through , returns the cursor position (as character index) when there is no selection so you should be able to use that. . ;. ; if you need the line number instead, it should be possible to get it from the index with some scripting (like counting the characters in the full text while keeping track of new lines). . ;

the selection start which is passed through returns the cursor position as character index when there is no selection so you should be able to use that
if you need the line number instead it should be possible to get it from the index with some scripting like counting the characters in the full text while keeping track of new lines

<p><code>region:'center'</code> doesn't do anything unless the parent container/panel has <code>layout:'border'</code>, and what it does can be found in the <a href="http://docs.sencha.com/extjs/4.2.2/#!/api/Ext.layout.container.Border" rel="nofollow"><code>border</code> layout docs</a>: <code>region:'center'</code> does only work relatively to the other items in the layout. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>The child item in the center region will always be resized to fill the remaining space not used by the other regions in the layout.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p><code>region:'south'</code> is below, <code>region:'north'</code> is above, <code>region:'west'</code> is left, <code>region:'east'</code> is right, and <code>region:'center'</code> is between them, but not necessarily centered. (e.g. if some of the other regions have especially big items or no items at all).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>What you are possibly searching for is a <code>Window</code>:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Ext.create('Ext.window.Window',{&#xA;    width:200,&#xA;    height:200,&#xA;    title:'ABC',&#xA;    draggable:false,&#xA;    closable:false&#xA;}).show();&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Compare <a href="https://fiddle.sencha.com/#fiddle/1325" rel="nofollow">fiddle</a>.</p>&#xA;

  region:'center'  doesn't do anything unless the parent container/panel has  layout:'border' , and what it does can be found in the   border  layout docs :  region:'center'  does only work relatively to the other items in the layout.  . ;. ; . ;   the child item in the center region will always be resized to fill the remaining space not used by the other regions in the layout. . ; . ;. ;  region:'south'  is below,  region:'north'  is above,  region:'west'  is left,  region:'east'  is right, and  region:'center'  is between them, but not necessarily centered. (  if some of the other regions have especially big items or no items at all). . ;. ; what you are possibly searching for is a  window : . ;. ;  . ;. ; compare  fiddle . . ;

region center doesn t do anything unless the parent container panel has layout border and what it does can be found in the border layout docs region center does only work relatively to the other items in the layout
the child item in the center region will always be resized to fill the remaining space not used by the other regions in the layout
region south is below region north is above region west is left region east is right and region center is between them but not necessarily centered
if some of the other regions have especially big items or no items at all
what you are possibly searching for is a window
compare fiddle



<p>The only way I've found to prevent this (and its sister error, make error 127) from occurring in our build is to set make's maximum number of simultaneous jobs to 1.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>To do this, run make with the command-line parameters "-j 1", e.g.:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>make -j 1 CONFIG=debug&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

the only way i ve found to prevent this and its sister error make error 127 from occurring in our build is to set make s maximum number of simultaneous jobs to 1
to do this run make with the command-line parameters -j 1

<p>We are exposing the Entity objects through WCF Services. To retrieve the entities we make several requests through WCF, close to a 100 or more. We recently switched to Digest Authentication and noticing that every single server request is issuing a 401. This creating twice as much load on the server and since we have very large "posts", this will create additional traffic lag. The goal is to have only a single Challenge(401) from the server and the rest of the requests should include the Auth header so the server doesn't issue a 401. Since Digest is a challenge based protocol with an expiring nonce, even though we may not fully eliminate the 401's but at least avoid them for every request. Since we control both server and client we want send the Digest Auth header included on every request.&#xA;There is a Pre-Authenticate property in .NET 2.0 webservices Style Web Reference Proxy/Client(that inherits SOAPHttpClientProtocol) that allows the Auth header to be included with the request, but with a WCF Services Web Reference client(that uses ChannelFactory) there isn't. There is a clear difference in the Request/Response traffic when this property is set and when it isn't. Since this is Digest Authentication(NOT Basic) I cannot add the Auth header manually during BeginRequest with a ClientMessageInspector.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>    NetworkCredential creds = new NetworkCredential("username", "pass", "domain");&#xA;&#xA;    //using .NET 2.0 "Web Reference" Style client that uses inherits SoapHttpClientProtocol:&#xA;    webReferenceClient = new Service1();&#xA;    webReferenceClient.Credentials = creds;&#xA;    //**Pre Authenticate **&#xA;    webReferenceClient.PreAuthenticate = true;&#xA;    string resp1 = "";&#xA;    for (int i = 0; i &lt; 3;i++) &#xA;        resp1 = resp1 + webReferenceClient.SayHello("jack");&#xA;&#xA;    //using WCF "Service Reference" Client that uses ChannelFactory&#xA;    serviceReferenceClient = new Service1Client();&#xA;&#xA;    serviceReferenceClient.ClientCredentials.HttpDigest.ClientCredential = creds;&#xA;    serviceReferenceClient.ClientCredentials.HttpDigest.AllowedImpersonationLevel =          TokenImpersonationLevel.Impersonation;&#xA;&#xA;    string resp="";&#xA;    for (var i = 0; i &lt; 3;i++) &#xA;        resp = resp + serviceReferenceClient.SayHello("jack");&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Fiddler trace with .NET 2.0 Style Web Reference Client, with Preauthenticate set. Notice that there is only one 401 and rest of the requests have Auth header.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/3Gobq.png" alt="PreAuthenticate with .net2.0 style web reference"></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Trace with WCF Style Service reference Client. Every single request generated a 401 from the server:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/1sMzr.png" alt="Authenticate Every Singe request"></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I see two options:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ol>&#xA;<li>Switch our Client code to use .NET 2.0 style Web reference Client, &#xA;this will be a big move since we are doing some custom Fault handling.</li>&#xA;<li>Find a way to get to the WebRequest or the HTTPRequest object of the WCF &#xA;ChannelFactory and set the PreAuthenticate Property.&#xA;How to get to the actual WebRequest object??</li>&#xA;</ol>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Are there any other options??</p>&#xA;

 we are exposing the entity objects through wcf services. to retrieve the entities we make several requests through wcf, close to a 100 or more. we recently switched to digest authentication and noticing that every single server request is issuing a 401. this creating twice as much load on the server and since we have very large "posts", this will create additional traffic lag. the goal is to have only a single challenge(401) from the server and the rest of the requests should include the auth header so the server doesn't issue a 401. since digest is a challenge based protocol with an expiring nonce, even though we may not fully eliminate the 401's but at least avoid them for every request. since we control both server and client we want send the digest auth header included on every request.. ;there is a pre-authenticate property in .net 2.0 webservices style web reference proxy/client(that inherits soaphttpclientprotocol) that allows the auth header to be included with the request, but with a wcf services web reference client(that uses channelfactory) there isn't. there is a clear difference in the request/response traffic when this property is set and when it isn't. since this is digest authentication(not basic) i cannot add the auth header manually during beginrequest with a clientmessageinspector. . ;. ;  . ;. ; fiddler trace with .net 2.0 style web reference client, with preauthenticate set. notice that there is only one 401 and rest of the requests have auth header. . ;. ;   . ;. ; trace with wcf style service reference client. every single request generated a 401 from the server: . ;. ;   . ;. ; i see two options: . ;. ; . ; switch our client code to use .net 2.0 style web reference client, . ;this will be a big move since we are doing some custom fault handling. . ; find a way to get to the webrequest or the httprequest object of the wcf . ;channelfactory and set the preauthenticate property.. ;how to get to the actual webrequest object?? . ; . ;. ; are there any other options?? . ;

to retrieve the entities we make several requests through wcf close to a 100 or more
we recently switched to digest authentication and noticing that every single server request is issuing a 401
this creating twice as much load on the server and since we have very large posts this will create additional traffic lag
the goal is to have only a single challenge 401 from the server and the rest of the requests should include the auth header so the server doesn t issue a 401
since digest is a challenge based protocol with an expiring nonce even though we may not fully eliminate the 401 s but at least avoid them for every request
since we control both server and client we want send the digest auth header included on every request
there is a pre-authenticate property in .net 2.0 webservices style web reference proxy client that inherits soaphttpclientprotocol that allows the auth header to be included with the request but with a wcf services web reference client that uses channelfactory there isn t
there is a clear difference in the request response traffic when this property is set and when it isn t
since this is digest authentication not basic i cannot add the auth header manually during beginrequest with a clientmessageinspector

notice that there is only one 401 and rest of the requests have auth header

<ul>&#xA;<li>Using <code>map</code> means you are opening the entire file at once, which is what you are trying to avoid.</li>&#xA;<li>It is not clear what you are trying to do by iterating over <code>COLUMNS</code>, which is <code>['timestamp']</code>.</li>&#xA;<li>The variable <code>i</code> does not look useful; if you wanted to access the last element of an array, you can use <code>last</code>.</li>&#xA;<li>You cannot access an array's element by doing <code>date_column(2)</code>.</li>&#xA;<li>In doing <code>first=date_column(2)</code> and <code>last=date_column(i)</code>, you probably have in mind a system of indexation starting with <code>1</code>. That is rare in programming. In most languages, index starts with <code>0</code>, and you should have <code>1</code> and <code>i - 1</code> (that latter of which shouldn't be neccessary).</li>&#xA;<li>From what looks like you are trying to do, you need to initialize <code>date_column</code> outside of the iteration.</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Probably your code should look along this line:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>file = "C:\Users\hp1\Desktop\Datasets\1433825596_209257.csv"&#xA;date_column = []&#xA;CSV.foreach(file, headers: true) do |row|&#xA;  # Do something with `date_column` and `row`&#xA;  #   (Perhaps `push` some elements of `row` into `date_column`&#xA;  #   depending on a condition?)&#xA;end&#xA;first, last = date_column[1], date_column.last&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 . ; using  map  means you are opening the entire file at once, which is what you are trying to avoid. . ; it is not clear what you are trying to do by iterating over  columns , which is . . ; the variable  i  does not look useful; if you wanted to access the last element of an array, you can use  last . . ; you cannot access an array's element by doing  date_column(2) . . ; in doing  and , you probably have in mind a system of indexation starting with  1 . that is rare in programming. in most languages, index starts with  0 , and you should have  1  and  i - 1  (that latter of which shouldn't be neccessary). . ; from what looks like you are trying to do, you need to initialize  date_column  outside of the iteration. . ; . ;. ; probably your code should look along this line: . ;. ;  . ;

using map means you are opening the entire file at once which is what you are trying to avoid
it is not clear what you are trying to do by iterating over columns which is
the variable i does not look useful
if you wanted to access the last element of an array you can use last
you cannot access an array s element by doing date_column 2
in doing and you probably have in mind a system of indexation starting with 1
that is rare in programming
in most languages index starts with 0 and you should have 1 and i - 1 that latter of which shouldn t be neccessary
from what looks like you are trying to do you need to initialize date_column outside of the iteration
probably your code should look along this line



<p>HttpContext.Current not suit for bussiness layer, you can use <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.web.httpcontextbase%28v=VS.100%29.aspx" rel="nofollow">HttpContextBase</a> instead</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>    public static class HttpContextHelper {&#xA;    private static object lockObj = new object();&#xA;    private static HttpContextBase mockHttpContext;&#xA;&#xA;    /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;    /// Access the HttpContext using the Abstractions.&#xA;    /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;    public static HttpContextBase Current {&#xA;        get {&#xA;            lock (lockObj) {&#xA;                if (mockHttpContext == null &amp;&amp; HttpContext.Current != null) {&#xA;                    return new HttpContextWrapper(HttpContext.Current);&#xA;                }&#xA;            }&#xA;&#xA;            return mockHttpContext;&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        set {&#xA;            lock (lockObj) {&#xA;                mockHttpContext = value;&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 httpcontext.current not suit for bussiness layer, you can use  httpcontextbase  instead . ;. ;  . ;

httpcontext.current not suit for bussiness layer you can use httpcontextbase instead

I don't use that version, but I would guess you can use a Timer to gradually change the opacity.</p>&#xA;

<p>Everything works correctly apart from redirecting back to the index page after adding the products data, currently after my data gets save it gets redirected to <strong>127.0.0.1:8000/product/add_product/add_product</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Currently when my index page(add_product.html) loads, I have a table that renders data from the database,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ol>&#xA;<li>first my url looks like >> <strong>127.0.0.1:8000/product/</strong> </li>&#xA;<li>Then once I hit the add button url changes to <strong>127.0.0.1:8000/product/add_product/</strong> , no problem there, but</li>&#xA;<li>when i try to add data again my url goes to <strong>127.0.0.1:8000/product/add_product/add_product</strong> and i get a Page not found error</li>&#xA;</ol>&#xA;&#xA;<p>My views.py</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>from models import Product,Category&#xA;from django.shortcuts import render_to_response,get_object_or_404&#xA;from django.http import HttpResponseRedirect&#xA;&#xA;def index(request):&#xA;    category_list = Category.objects.all()&#xA;    product_list = Product.objects.all()&#xA;    return render_to_response('product/add_product.html', {'category_list': category_list, 'product_list':product_list})&#xA;&#xA;def add_product(request):&#xA;    post = request.POST.copy()&#xA;&#xA;    category = Category.objects.get(name=post['category'])&#xA;    product = post['product']&#xA;    quantity = post['quantity']&#xA;    price = post['price']&#xA;&#xA;    new_product = Product(category = category, product = product, quantity = quantity, price = price )&#xA;    new_product.save()&#xA;    category_list = Category.objects.all()&#xA;    product_list = Product.objects.all()&#xA;    return render_to_response('product/add_product.html', {'category_list': category_list, 'product_list':product_list})&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>My urls.py</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>from django.conf.urls.defaults import patterns, include, url&#xA;&#xA;urlpatterns = patterns('product.views',&#xA;    url(r'^$', 'index'),                       &#xA;    url(r'^add_product/$', 'add_product'),&#xA;)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>How do i get the URL pointing back to my index page(add_product.html) ?</p>&#xA;
