<p>From your updated question&#xA;How one would make an array of integers [1,2,3,4,..,1000].</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In the for loop</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>for(int i=0; i&lt;=1000; i++) {}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The program will iterate the value in variable 'i' start from '0' (i = 0) until 'i' is less than or equal with 1000 (i &lt;= 1000)&#xA;On each iteration, you can see from the third param in the for loop (i++) The program will add '1' to the value of 'i'. &#xA;It is the same with (i = i + 1)&#xA;So, by thought it will run like this</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>i=0, i=1, i=2, i=3, i=4, . . ., i=1000(end-of-loop)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I'm taking the code below from one people who answered this question</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>int numbers[1001];&#xA;for(int i = 0; i &lt;= 1000; i++)&#xA;  numbers[i] = i;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>After explaining how for loop works, now you can see the declaration of the array of integer as a variable where we store the data.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>int numbers[1001] means that we declare an array variable sized of 1001 integer value, start from index 0 to index 1000</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>By illustration, it will be like:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>numbers[0] - numbers[1] - numbers[2] - numbers[3] - numbers[4] - . . . - numbers[1000]&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The number inside the "[]" tag is the index number of array variable and inside the for loop, you can see each index from array variable(numbers) is assigned by the value of variable 'i'.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>numbers[0] = i = 0&#xA;i++&#xA;numbers[1] = i = 1&#xA;i++&#xA;numbers[2] = i = 2&#xA;i++&#xA;.&#xA;.&#xA;.&#xA;numbers[1000] = i = 1000&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Hope this helps.</p>&#xA;

 from your updated question. ;how one would make an array of integers [1,2,3,4,..,1000]. . ;. ; in the for loop . ;. ;  . ;. ; the program will iterate the value in variable 'i' start from '0' (i = 0) until 'i' is less than or equal with 1000 (i  = 1000). ;on each iteration, you can see from the third param in the for loop (i++) the program will add '1' to the value of 'i'. . ;it is the same with (i = i + 1). ;so, by thought it will run like this . ;. ;  . ;. ; i'm taking the code below from one people who answered this question . ;. ;  . ;. ; after explaining how for loop works, now you can see the declaration of the array of integer as a variable where we store the data. . ;. ; int numbers[1001] means that we declare an array variable sized of 1001 integer value, start from index 0 to index 1000 . ;. ; by illustration, it will be like: . ;. ;  . ;. ; the number inside the "[]" tag is the index number of array variable and inside the for loop, you can see each index from array variable(numbers) is assigned by the value of variable 'i'. . ;. ;  . ;. ; hope this helps. . ;

from your updated question
how one would make an array of integers 1 2 3 4 .. 1000
in the for loop
the program will iterate the value in variable i start from 0 i 0 until i is less than or equal with 1000 i 1000
on each iteration you can see from the third param in the for loop i++ the program will add 1 to the value of i
it is the same with i i + 1
so by thought it will run like this
i m taking the code below from one people who answered this question
after explaining how for loop works now you can see the declaration of the array of integer as a variable where we store the data
int numbers 1001 means that we declare an array variable sized of 1001 integer value start from index 0 to index 1000
by illustration it will be like
the number inside the tag is the index number of array variable and inside the for loop you can see each index from array variable numbers is assigned by the value of variable i
hope this helps



<p>In this line</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>a[0] = to_string(order).c_str();&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p><code>to_string(order)</code> generates a temporary string.  The result of <code>c_str()</code> is only valid as long as the temporary string exists, but the temporary string is destroyed after the statement.  <code>a[0]</code> is then left holding an invalid pointer.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>To work around this, you'll need to store the strings somewhere so they don't go away immediately:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>#include&lt;iostream&gt;&#xA;#include&lt;string&gt;&#xA;using namespace std;&#xA;int main()&#xA;{&#xA;        int order=1;&#xA;        for(int i=1; i&lt;10;++i,++order){&#xA;                const char* a[2];&#xA;                int b = 10;&#xA;                auto order_str = to_string(order);&#xA;                auto b_str = to_string(b);&#xA;                a[0] = order_str.c_str();&#xA;                a[1] = b_str.c_str();&#xA;                cout &lt;&lt; a[0] &lt;&lt; endl;&#xA;                cout &lt;&lt; a[1] &lt;&lt; endl;&#xA;                cout &lt;&lt; "**************" &lt;&lt; endl;&#xA;        }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 in this line . ;. ;  . ;. ;  to_string(order)  generates a temporary string.  the result of  c_str()  is only valid as long as the temporary string exists, but the temporary string is destroyed after the statement.   is then left holding an invalid pointer. . ;. ; to work around this, you'll need to store the strings somewhere so they don't go away immediately: . ;. ;  . ;

in this line
to_string order generates a temporary string
the result of c_str is only valid as long as the temporary string exists but the temporary string is destroyed after the statement
is then left holding an invalid pointer
to work around this you ll need to store the strings somewhere so they don t go away immediately



<p>probably, when the <code>onChildClicked</code> is called, you are getting the whole item, which is a <code>linear layout</code> containing the <code>TextView</code>. so you need to find the <code>child textview</code> of the clicked <code>linear layout</code> and then apply <code>paintFlags</code> on it.</p>&#xA;

 probably, when the  onchildclicked  is called, you are getting the whole item, which is a  linear layout  containing the  textview . so you need to find the  child textview  of the clicked  linear layout  and then apply  paintflags  on it. . ;

probably when the onchildclicked is called you are getting the whole item which is a linear layout containing the textview
so you need to find the child textview of the clicked linear layout and then apply paintflags on it



<p>You might putting the image as a <code>background-image</code> to a div, and setting the <code>background-size</code> to <code>cover</code> or <code>contain</code>. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The <code>div</code> should have the same classes as the covering <code>div</code> eg: <code>col-lg-4 col-md-9 col-xs-12</code></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Something like</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>HTML</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;div class="col-lg-4 col-md-9 col-xs-12 responsive-image" &#xA;     style="background-image: url(/dynamic/image/url.png)"&gt;&#xA;&lt;/div&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>CSS</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>.responsive-image {&#xA;    background-size: cover;  /* or contain */&#xA;    background-position: center center;&#xA;    height: 300px; /* or 25vh - 25% of viewport height */&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The only drawback is that you have to control the <code>height</code> of the image <code>div</code>, because on its own it won't automatically expand to best fit the image</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Also see <a href="http://caniuse.com/viewport-units" rel="nofollow">viewport units compatibility</a></p>&#xA;

 you might putting the image as a  background-image  to a div, and setting the  background-size  to  cover  or  contain .  . ;. ; the  div  should have the same classes as the covering  div  eg:  col-lg-4 col-md-9 col-xs-12  . ;. ; something like . ;. ; html . ;. ;  . ;. ; css . ;. ;  . ;. ; the only drawback is that you have to control the  height  of the image  div , because on its own it won't automatically expand to best fit the image . ;. ; also see  viewport units compatibility  . ;

you might putting the image as a background-image to a div and setting the background-size to cover or contain
the div should have the same classes as the covering div eg col-lg-4 col-md-9 col-xs-12
something like
html
css
the only drawback is that you have to control the height of the image div because on its own it won t automatically expand to best fit the image
also see viewport units compatibility



<p>A sitemap is not an RSS feed, where new items can be distinguished purely from their properties. A sitemap is just what it says. There is nothing to stop you choosing your own order but you cannot know how a client program will process the data.</p>&#xA;

 a sitemap is not an rss feed, where new items can be distinguished purely from their properties. a sitemap is just what it says. there is nothing to stop you choosing your own order but you cannot know how a client program will process the data. . ;

a sitemap is just what it says
there is nothing to stop you choosing your own order but you cannot know how a client program will process the data



<p>In my qt application i have a class (worker) which is called from the object which runs in a thread. In my worker class i create QList, like this</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>QList &lt;QString&gt; albums;&#xA;&#xA;while (i.hasNext())&#xA;{&#xA;  QRegularExpressionMatch album = i.next();&#xA;  albums.append(album.captured("album"));&#xA;}&#xA;emit SignalGotAlbums(albums);&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I receive this signal in another class which is wrapping my worker, for thread-usage.  Let's call this class GetAlbumsThread. In there i successfully receive SignalGotAlbums in a slot</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>void GetAlbumsThread::Reply(QList &lt;QString&gt; &amp;list)&#xA;{&#xA;&#xA; emit gotAlbums(list);&#xA; emit finished();&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In this slot i'am firing another signal gotAlbums which is suppose to be connected with a slot in my gui thread, and pass my QList in there. My problem is, when im trying to pass QList from a thread to gui, it's just not working! Slot not receiving gotAlbums Signal;</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Signal is declared like so:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>void gotAlbums(QList&lt;QString&gt; &amp;);&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And connected to my gui slot (of course in my gui thread) like that:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>private slots:&#xA;    void AlbumsReceived(QList&lt;QString&gt; &amp;list)&#xA;    ...&#xA;&#xA;    QThread* albumsThread = new QThread();&#xA;&#xA;    GetAlbumsThread *albumsObject = new GetAlbumsThread();&#xA;&#xA;    albumsObject-&gt;moveToThread(albumsThread);&#xA;&#xA;    connect(albumsThread, SIGNAL(started()), albumsObject, SLOT(process()));&#xA;&#xA;    connect(albumsObject, SIGNAL(gotAlbums(QList&lt;QString&gt; &amp;)), this, SLOT(AlbumsReceived(QList&lt;QString&gt; &amp;));&#xA;&#xA;     albumsThread-&gt;start();&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>AlbumsReceived never get's called for some reason. connect returns true. Can someone help me with this. I think the problem is in the passing QList between threads.</p>&#xA;

<p>I noticed something strange, related to the Drag&amp;Drop component from Anders Melander, and I wonder if anybody has an idea ?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I have been looking for the reason, without much success.  However the effect is 100% repeatable by simply removing: <code>DropFileTarget-&gt;Register(ComboBox);</code> from the project's constructor.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The other day I noticed that the drop down box on my application was not looking right:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/iKkZH.png" alt="wrong combo"></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Whereas it previously looked (correct) like this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/OQuVw.png" alt="good combo"></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So I started going back to figure out at what time the look of the component broke and I have now been able to trace the change in look 100% to:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>DropFileTarget-&gt;Register(ComboBox);&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If this line is present, the look is good.&#xA;If I remove this line of code from the form's constructor the look of the drop box is wrong !?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I actually wanted to remove DropFileTarget completely from my project since I now use <a href="https://forums.embarcadero.com/thread.jspa?threadID=105484" rel="nofollow noreferrer">another method to catch a dragged file</a>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Can anybody please tell me what <code>Register()</code> does here to change the look of the component, so that I can set the look back to what it should be.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>My gut says it has to do with theme support as well somehow ?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>ADDITIONAL INFORMATION BASED ON THE COMMENTS:</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I did some tests.  A normal looking Combobox, with theme support, looks like this:&#xA;<img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/SKkO2.png" alt="enter image description here"></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>With theme support disabled it looks like this:&#xA;<img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/SQGXm.png" alt="enter image description here"></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In other words, the Drag&amp;Drop component's Register() creates a special look, that I had grown used to, and of which I thought was the correct look.&#xA;The canvas where the text is displayed is white instead of grey (default settings).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I'm now torn between going for 'how it should be' or trying to create the look I had gotten used to.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Anybody knows what properties I should change to get the component-influenced look (second screenshot from the top) ?</p>&#xA;

<p>You have to set intent flag Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TASK.This will resolve your issue.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>      intent.setFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TASK)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>OR</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In AndroidManifest.xml file put  android:noHistory="true" for FrontScreenApplication activity.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>OR </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You can do it by another way ,simply finish the FrontScreenApplication activity after starting the intent.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>        Intent intent = new Intent(Login.this, ReadPhoneNo.class);&#xA;        intent.setFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_MULTIPLE_TASK);                     &#xA;        intent.setFlags(Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK);&#xA;        startActivity(intent);&#xA;        finish();&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 you have to set intent flag intent.flag_activity_clear_task.this will resolve your issue. . ;. ;  . ;. ; or . ;. ; in androidmanifest.xml file put  android:nohistory="true" for frontscreenapplication activity. . ;. ; or  . ;. ; you can do it by another way ,simply finish the frontscreenapplication activity after starting the intent. . ;. ;  . ;

you have to set intent flag intent.flag_activity_clear_task.this will resolve your issue
or
in androidmanifest.xml file put android nohistory true for frontscreenapplication activity
or
you can do it by another way simply finish the frontscreenapplication activity after starting the intent

<p>Need some guidance here, I have two operational esri js maps that I want to combine to have two different popups. If I/we could somehow figure out a way to add the number of parks to the census popup that would work and not worry about the two popups. But I'd prefer to have info on census groups as well as parks plus number of parks in one census block group in the demographics popup. So I'll add the work I've done to create the two working maps and then post the work I've done trying to combine them which is not working. Any help would be very much appreciated.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This first example is parks in Pierce County, WA with a popup with park details.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://students.washington.edu/sbuffor/infowindow_w_parkname.html" rel="nofollow">http://students.washington.edu/sbuffor/infowindow_w_parkname.html</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Second is the code for census block groups with demographics information for the same area.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://students.washington.edu/sbuffor/census_vs_parks.html" rel="nofollow">http://students.washington.edu/sbuffor/census_vs_parks.html</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Last but certainly not least is my attempt at combining the two pieces. This includes adding all the different require statements and functions from both and the majority of the code from each with duplicate pieces removed. I have tried moving things around to map the map render with no luck. I want to preserve the locatebutton and the search bar that are used to find addresses in this as well for added functionality. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://students.washington.edu/sbuffor/combined_census_parks.html" rel="nofollow">http://students.washington.edu/sbuffor/combined_census_parks.html</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>    &lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;&#xA;&lt;html&gt;&#xA;&lt;head&gt;&#xA;  &lt;meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8"&gt;&#xA;&#xA;  &lt;meta name="viewport" content="initial-scale=1, maximum-scale=1,user-scalable=no"&gt;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;  &lt;meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes"&gt;&#xA;&#xA;  &lt;meta name="apple-mobile-web-app-status-bar-style" content="black-translucent"&gt;&#xA;&#xA;  &lt;meta name="mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;title&gt;Pierce County Census Information and Parks Map&lt;/title&gt;&#xA;&#xA;  &lt;link rel="stylesheet" href="https://js.arcgis.com/3.15/dijit/themes/claro/claro.css"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;link rel="stylesheet" href="https://js.arcgis.com/3.15/esri/css/esri.css"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;style&gt;&#xA;    html, body, #map {&#xA;      padding: 0;&#xA;      margin: 0;&#xA;      height: 100%;&#xA;      width: 100%;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    .esriScalebar {&#xA;      padding: 20px 20px;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    .esriPopup.myTheme .titlePane,&#xA;    .dj_ie7 .esriPopup.myTheme .titlePane .title {&#xA;      background-color: #899752;&#xA;      color: #333333;&#xA;      font-weight: bold;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;      background-color:#899752;&#xA;    }&#xA;    .esriPopup.myTheme .outerPointer,  .esriPopup.myTheme .pointer.bottom{&#xA;      background-color:#424242;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    .esriPopup.myTheme .contentPane,&#xA;    .esriPopup.myTheme .actionsPane {&#xA;      border-color: 1px solid #121310;&#xA;      background-color: #424242;&#xA;      color: #ffffff;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    #ui-esri-dijit-geocoder {&#xA;      top:      20px;&#xA;      left:     70px;&#xA;      position: absolute;&#xA;      z-index:  3;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    .esriPopup .titlePane {&#xA;      text-shadow: none;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    .esriPopup .titleButton.next {&#xA;      right: 40px;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    .esriPopup .titleButton.prev {&#xA;      right: 53px;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    .demographicInfoContent {&#xA;      padding-top: 10px;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    .demographicInnerSpacing {&#xA;      display: inline-block;&#xA;      width:   8px;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    .demographicNumericPadding {&#xA;      width:      90px;&#xA;      display:    inline-block;&#xA;      text-align: right;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    #LocateButton {&#xA;      position: absolute;&#xA;      top: 95px;&#xA;      left: 20px;&#xA;      z-index: 50;&#xA;    }&#xA;  &lt;/style&gt;&#xA;&#xA;  &lt;script src="https://js.arcgis.com/3.15/"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;&#xA;  &lt;script&gt;&#xA;    var map;&#xA;&#xA;    require([&#xA;      "esri/config",&#xA;      "esri/InfoTemplate",&#xA;      "esri/map",&#xA;      "esri/dijit/Popup",&#xA;      "esri/dijit/PopupTemplate",&#xA;      "esri/geometry/Extent",&#xA;      "esri/layers/ArcGISDynamicMapServiceLayer",&#xA;      "esri/layers/FeatureLayer",&#xA;      "esri/layers/ArcGISTiledMapServiceLayer",&#xA;      "esri/symbols/SimpleFillSymbol",&#xA;      "esri/symbols/SimpleLineSymbol",&#xA;      "esri/tasks/GeometryService",&#xA;      "esri/tasks/query",&#xA;      "dojo/dom-construct",&#xA;      "dojo/dom-class",&#xA;      "dojo/parser",&#xA;      "esri/Color",&#xA;      "dojo/_base/lang",&#xA;      "dojo/date/locale",&#xA;      "esri/dijit/Geocoder",&#xA;      "esri/dijit/LocateButton",&#xA;&#xA;      "dojo/domReady!"&#xA;    ],&#xA;      function (&#xA;        esriConfig, InfoTemplate, Map, Popup, PopupTemplate, Extent, ArcGISDynamicMapServiceLayer, FeatureLayer, &#xA;        ArcGISTiledMapServiceLayer, SimpleFillSymbol, SimpleLineSymbol,&#xA;        GeometryService, Query, domConstruct, domClass, parser, Color, lang, locale, Geocoder, LocateButton &#xA;      ) {&#xA;&#xA;        parser.parse();&#xA;&#xA;      var sls = new SimpleLineSymbol("solid", new Color("#444444"), 3);&#xA;      var sfs = new SimpleFillSymbol("solid", sls, new Color([68, 68, 68, 0.25]));&#xA;&#xA;      var popup1 = new Popup1({&#xA;        fillSymbol: sfs,&#xA;        lineSymbol: null,&#xA;        markerSymbol: null&#xA;      }, domConstruct.create("div"));&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        var popup = new Popup({&#xA;          fillSymbol: new SimpleFillSymbol(SimpleFillSymbol.STYLE_SOLID,&#xA;            new SimpleLineSymbol(SimpleLineSymbol.STYLE_SOLID,&#xA;              new Color([255, 0, 0]), 2), new Color([255, 255, 0, 0.25]))&#xA;        }, domConstruct.create("div"));&#xA;&#xA;        domClass.add(popup.domNode, "myTheme");&#xA;&#xA;        map = new Map("map", {&#xA;          basemap: "topo",&#xA;          center: [-122.402, 47],&#xA;          zoom: 10,&#xA;          infoWindow: popup&#xA;&#xA;        });&#xA;&#xA;        var geocoder = new Geocoder({&#xA;        arcgisGeocoder: {&#xA;          placeholder: "Search "&#xA;        },&#xA;        map: map&#xA;      }, "ui-esri-dijit-geocoder");&#xA;&#xA;      var _countyCensusInfoTemplate = new InfoTemplate();&#xA;      _countyCensusInfoTemplate.setTitle("&lt;b&gt;Census Information&lt;/b&gt;");&#xA;&#xA;      var _blockGroupInfoTemplate = new InfoTemplate();&#xA;      _blockGroupInfoTemplate.setTitle("&lt;b&gt;Census Information&lt;/b&gt;");&#xA;&#xA;      var _censusInfoContent =&#xA;        "&lt;div class=\"demographicInfoContent\"&gt;" +&#xA;        "&lt;div class='demographicNumericPadding'&gt;${AGE_5_17:formatNumber}&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\"demographicInnerSpacing\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;people ages 5 - 17&lt;br&gt;" +&#xA;        "&lt;div class='demographicNumericPadding'&gt;${AGE_18_21:formatNumber}&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\"demographicInnerSpacing\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;people ages 18 - 21&lt;br&gt;" +&#xA;        "&lt;div class='demographicNumericPadding'&gt;${AGE_22_29:formatNumber}&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\"demographicInnerSpacing\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;people ages 22 - 29&lt;br&gt;" +&#xA;        "&lt;div class='demographicNumericPadding'&gt;${AGE_30_39:formatNumber}&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\"demographicInnerSpacing\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;people ages 30 - 39&lt;br&gt;" +&#xA;        "&lt;div class='demographicNumericPadding'&gt;${AGE_40_49:formatNumber}&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\"demographicInnerSpacing\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;people ages 40 - 49&lt;br&gt;" +&#xA;        "&lt;div class='demographicNumericPadding'&gt;${AGE_50_64:formatNumber}&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\"demographicInnerSpacing\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;people ages 50 - 64&lt;br&gt;" +&#xA;        "&lt;div class='demographicNumericPadding'&gt;${AGE_65_UP:formatNumber}&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div class=\"demographicInnerSpacing\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;people ages 65 and older" +&#xA;        "&lt;/div&gt;";&#xA;&#xA;      _countyCensusInfoTemplate.setContent("Demographics for:&lt;br&gt;${NAME} ${STATE_NAME:getCounty}, ${STATE_NAME}&lt;br&gt;" + _censusInfoContent);&#xA;      _blockGroupInfoTemplate.setContent("Demographics for:&lt;br&gt;Tract: ${TRACT:formatNumber} Blockgroup: ${BLKGRP}&lt;br&gt;" + _censusInfoContent);&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;      var demographicsLayerURL = "http://sampleserver6.arcgisonline.com/arcgis/rest/services/Census/MapServer";&#xA;      var demographicsLayerOptions = {&#xA;        "id": "demographicsLayer",&#xA;        "opacity": 0.8,&#xA;        "showAttribution": false&#xA;      };&#xA;      var demographicsLayer = new ArcGISDynamicMapServiceLayer(demographicsLayerURL, demographicsLayerOptions);&#xA;      demographicsLayer.setInfoTemplates({&#xA;        1: { infoTemplate: _blockGroupInfoTemplate },&#xA;        2: { infoTemplate: _countyCensusInfoTemplate }&#xA;      });&#xA;      demographicsLayer.setVisibleLayers([1, 2]);&#xA;      map.addLayer(demographicsLayer);&#xA;&#xA;      geocoder.startup();&#xA;&#xA;      var geoLocate = new LocateButton({&#xA;      map: map,&#xA;      highlightLocation: false&#xA;      }, "LocateButton"&#xA;      );&#xA;      geoLocate.startup();&#xA;&#xA;    });&#xA;&#xA;    var formatNumber = function(value, key, data) {&#xA;      var searchText = "" + value;&#xA;      var formattedString = searchText.replace(/(\d)(?=(\d\d\d)+(?!\d))/gm, "$1,");&#xA;      return formattedString;&#xA;    };&#xA;&#xA;    var getCounty = function(value, key, data) {&#xA;      if (value.toUpperCase() !== "LOUISIANA") {&#xA;        return "County";&#xA;      } else {&#xA;        return "Parish";&#xA;      }&#xA;    };&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        map.on("click", function (event) {&#xA;          var query = new Query();&#xA;          query.geometry = pointToExtent(map, event.mapPoint, 10);&#xA;          var deferred = featureLayer.selectFeatures(query,&#xA;            FeatureLayer.SELECTION_NEW);&#xA;          map.infoWindow.setFeatures([deferred]);&#xA;          map.infoWindow.show(event.mapPoint);&#xA;        });&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;      var template = new InfoTemplate();&#xA;        template.setContent(getTextContent);&#xA;&#xA;        var featureLayer = new FeatureLayer("https://services3.arcgis.com/J1Locv0GPOt6yBRR/ArcGIS/rest/services/Parks_polygons_Feb2012/FeatureServer/0",&#xA;          {&#xA;&#xA;            outFields: ["*"],&#xA;            infoTemplate: template&#xA;          });&#xA;&#xA;        map.addLayer(featureLayer);&#xA;&#xA;        function getTextContent (graphic) {&#xA;          var attributes = graphic.attributes;&#xA;          var namepark =&#xA;            attributes.ParkName&#xA;            .replace('"', "")&#xA;            .split("::")&#xA;            .map(function (name) {&#xA;              return lang.trim(name);&#xA;            });&#xA;          var parkdata = namepark[0];&#xA;          var commonName = namepark[1];&#xA;          var parks;&#xA;&#xA;          if (commonName) {&#xA;            parks = "&lt;b&gt;" + commonName + "&lt;/b&gt;&lt;br/&gt;" +&#xA;                          "&lt;i&gt;" + parkdata + "&lt;/i&gt;";&#xA;          }&#xA;          else {&#xA;            parks = "&lt;i&gt;" + parkdata + "&lt;/i&gt;";&#xA;          }&#xA;&#xA;          return  parks + "&lt;br&gt;" +&#xA;                  attributes.Owner + "&lt;br&gt;" + &#xA;                  attributes.ParkWebLin &#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        function pointToExtent (map, point, toleranceInPixel) {&#xA;          var pixelWidth = map.extent.getWidth() / map.width;&#xA;          var toleranceInMapCoords = toleranceInPixel * pixelWidth;&#xA;          return new Extent(point.x - toleranceInMapCoords,&#xA;                            point.y - toleranceInMapCoords,&#xA;                            point.x + toleranceInMapCoords,&#xA;                            point.y + toleranceInMapCoords,&#xA;                            map.spatialReference);&#xA;        }    &#xA;&#xA;      });&#xA;  &lt;/script&gt;&#xA;&lt;/head&gt;&#xA;&#xA;&lt;body class="claro"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;div id="map"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;div id="LocateButton"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#xA;&lt;/div&gt;&#xA;&lt;div id="ui-esri-dijit-geocoder"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&#xA;&#xA;&lt;/body&gt;&#xA;&#xA;&lt;/html&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Please do not hesitate to let me know if you need more information. I'm still new to this and learn a ton from the help that is provided here so I'm excited to do just that with this example.        </p>&#xA;

 need some guidance here, i have two operational esri js maps that i want to combine to have two different popups. if i/we could somehow figure out a way to add the number of parks to the census popup that would work and not worry about the two popups. but i'd prefer to have info on census groups as well as parks plus number of parks in one census block group in the demographics popup. so i'll add the work i've done to create the two working maps and then post the work i've done trying to combine them which is not working. any help would be very much appreciated. . ;. ; this first example is parks in pierce county, wa with a popup with park details. . ;. ;     . ;. ; second is the code for census block groups with demographics information for the same area. . ;. ;     . ;. ; last but certainly not least is my attempt at combining the two pieces. this includes adding all the different require statements and functions from both and the majority of the code from each with duplicate pieces removed. i have tried moving things around to map the map render with no luck. i want to preserve the locatebutton and the search bar that are used to find addresses in this as well for added functionality.  . ;. ;     . ;. ;  . ;. ; please do not hesitate to let me know if you need more information. i'm still new to this and learn a ton from the help that is provided here so i'm excited to do just that with this example.         . ;

if i we could somehow figure out a way to add the number of parks to the census popup that would work and not worry about the two popups
but i d prefer to have info on census groups as well as parks plus number of parks in one census block group in the demographics popup
so i ll add the work i ve done to create the two working maps and then post the work i ve done trying to combine them which is not working
any help would be very much appreciated
this first example is parks in pierce county wa with a popup with park details
second is the code for census block groups with demographics information for the same area
last but certainly not least is my attempt at combining the two pieces
this includes adding all the different require statements and functions from both and the majority of the code from each with duplicate pieces removed

<p>The <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms241903.aspx">PDB files</a> are used by the debugger in order to give you a good debugging experience.<br>&#xA;They should be left alone if you want to debug.  When you build a release version, you will not need them.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The Obj folder is used during compilation time - you can delete it at any time, but it will get recreated when you next compile.  If you delete it, the compile time (next time around) will be potentially longer, however.  Leaving it in place allows the compiler to run more quickly in most cases, since it only has to reprocess some of your project, not all of it.</p>&#xA;

 the  pdb files  are used by the debugger in order to give you a good debugging experience. . ;they should be left alone if you want to debug.  when you build a release version, you will not need them. . ;. ; the obj folder is used during compilation time - you can delete it at any time, but it will get recreated when you next compile.  if you delete it, the compile time (next time around) will be potentially longer, however.  leaving it in place allows the compiler to run more quickly in most cases, since it only has to reprocess some of your project, not all of it. . ;

the pdb files are used by the debugger in order to give you a good debugging experience
they should be left alone if you want to debug
when you build a release version you will not need them
the obj folder is used during compilation time - you can delete it at any time but it will get recreated when you next compile
if you delete it the compile time next time around will be potentially longer however
leaving it in place allows the compiler to run more quickly in most cases since it only has to reprocess some of your project not all of it



<p>Unfortunately this is the case. I don't know why, but since about last weekend, it's no longer possible to create promo codes for 17+ Apps. I've contacted Apple to ask them about this, and they confirmed that this is the case.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I've already asked Apple if they can change this again, and hopefully some more developers will do this.</p>&#xA;

<p>I made a security filter, following the book "Beginning Grails, Groovy and Griffon".</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Looks like the functionality works ok, but, for some reason, the only page that the filter allows to open without a logged in user, is lacking any style. Just textfields, labels and buttons. Also the simple capthca plugin works and the captcha image is loaded ok.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Here's the page screenshot:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/rYIoU.png" alt="enter image description here"></p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>package collab.todo&#xA;&#xA;class SecurityFilters {&#xA;&#xA;def filters = {&#xA;    securityFilters(controller:'*', action:'*') {&#xA;        before = {&#xA;            if(!session.user &amp;&amp; &#xA;                (!controllerName.equals("user") &amp;&amp; !actionName.equals("login") &#xA;                    &amp;&amp; !actionName.equals("captcha")&#xA;                     &amp;&amp;!actionName.equals("register")) ){&#xA;                redirect(controller: "user", action: "login")&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;        after = { Map model -&gt;&#xA;&#xA;        }&#xA;        afterView = { Exception e -&gt;&#xA;&#xA;        }&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>}</p>&#xA;

 i made a security filter, following the book "beginning grails, groovy and griffon". . ;. ; looks like the functionality works ok, but, for some reason, the only page that the filter allows to open without a logged in user, is lacking any style. just textfields, labels and buttons. also the simple capthca plugin works and the captcha image is loaded ok. . ;. ; here's the page screenshot: . ;. ;   . ;. ;  . ;. ; } . ;

<p>Two ways i can see:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ol>&#xA;<li>First, create a hidden field in the form. And populate its value with the <code>tag_names</code> through Jquery. It will automatically get submit during form submit.</li>&#xA;<li><p>Secondly, you can create a GLOBAL JS variable <code>tag_names</code>. It will be populated as above and then override the form submit action in Jquery to include <code>tag_names</code>. Like this :</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>$("#myForm").submit(function() {&#xA;     $(this).append("&lt;input type='hidden' name='tag_names' &#xA;     value='"+tag_names+"' /&gt;");&#xA;     $(this).submit();&#xA;})&#xA;</code></pre></li>&#xA;</ol>&#xA;

 two ways i can see: . ;. ; . ; first, create a hidden field in the form. and populate its value with the  tag_names  through jquery. it will automatically get submit during form submit. . ;  secondly, you can create a global js variable  tag_names . it will be populated as above and then override the form submit action in jquery to include  tag_names . like this : . ;. ;   . ; . ;

two ways i can see
first create a hidden field in the form
and populate its value with the tag_names through jquery
it will automatically get submit during form submit
secondly you can create a global js variable tag_names
it will be populated as above and then override the form submit action in jquery to include tag_names
like this



<p>The problem has a very large search space, for a 4x4 grid, we have something like 40 edges and so 2^40 states in the search space. For this reason is completely impossible to solve the entire game for a larger map.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>What are the solutions? First you can take a look to the work <a href="http://www.aaai.org/ocs/index.php/aaai/aaai12/paper/download/5126/5218" rel="nofollow">Solving Dots-And-Boxes</a> of Barker and Korf. It is the state of the art for this kind of problem (in 2012 and maybe also now, I'm not sure). They used a combination of the classic Alpha-Beta pruning algorithm with a bunch of problem specific solutions.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You can also try to apply <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monte_Carlo_tree_search" rel="nofollow">Monte Carlo  Tree Search</a> to the problem. I'm not aware of works in this directions but Monte Carlo has been proven successful for the Go game (that is similar to your problem in some sense). </p>&#xA;

 the problem has a very large search space, for a 4x4 grid, we have something like 40 edges and so 2^40 states in the search space. for this reason is completely impossible to solve the entire game for a larger map. . ;. ; what are the solutions? first you can take a look to the work  solving dots-and-boxes  of barker and korf. it is the state of the art for this kind of problem (in 2012 and maybe also now, i'm not sure). they used a combination of the classic alpha-beta pruning algorithm with a bunch of problem specific solutions. . ;. ; you can also try to apply  monte carlo  tree search  to the problem. i'm not aware of works in this directions but monte carlo has been proven successful for the go game (that is similar to your problem in some sense).  . ;

the problem has a very large search space for a 4x4 grid we have something like 40 edges and so 2 40 states in the search space
for this reason is completely impossible to solve the entire game for a larger map
what are the solutions
first you can take a look to the work solving dots-and-boxes of barker and korf
it is the state of the art for this kind of problem in 2012 and maybe also now i m not sure
they used a combination of the classic alpha-beta pruning algorithm with a bunch of problem specific solutions
you can also try to apply monte carlo tree search to the problem
i m not aware of works in this directions but monte carlo has been proven successful for the go game that is similar to your problem in some sense



<p>Here is the Simple Way to  <code>Parse JSON array</code> and easily get <code>Null</code> as well as a value pair . Important Thing Do not use variable name as a capital letter it must be start with lower case.&#xA;please find programme and you can modify it according to Your Requirement  </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>import java.io.File;&#xA;import java.util.ArrayList;&#xA;import java.util.Iterator;&#xA;import java.util.List;&#xA;import org.json.JSONArray;&#xA;import org.json.JSONException;&#xA;import org.json.JSONObject;&#xA;import org.json.simple.parser.JSONParser;&#xA;import org.json.simple.parser.ParseException;&#xA;&#xA;public class UnRepliedFragment_ {&#xA;//Define this as a global varraible&#xA;static Object Advisor_User_ID;&#xA;static Object Creator_User_ID;&#xA;static Object Question_Video_Title;&#xA;static Object playing_time;&#xA;static Object Created;&#xA;static Object Modified;&#xA;static Object question_video_playingTime;&#xA;static Object Answer_Video_Title;&#xA;static Object Answer_Video_Link;&#xA;static Object answer_video_playingtime;&#xA;static Object StatusName;&#xA;static Object QuestionID;&#xA;static ArrayList al;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;    public void onBindViewHolder() {&#xA;&#xA;        for (Object value : al) {&#xA;            if (value != null) {&#xA;                System.out.println("Not Null" + value);&#xA;            } else {&#xA;                System.out.println("Null" + value);&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;private void updateUIProadvice(String result) {&#xA;     //Since i have an limited JSON so Accroding to that i did  parsing . Dont try with getString just try with Get();//method&#xA;&#xA;  try {&#xA;&#xA;    JSONParser jsonParser = new JSONParser();&#xA;    org.json.simple.JSONObject jsonObject = (org.json.simple.JSONObject) jsonParser.parse(result);&#xA;    org.json.simple.JSONArray lang = (org.json.simple.JSONArray) jsonObject.get("questions");&#xA;    for (int i = 0; i &lt; lang.size(); i++) {&#xA;    }&#xA;    Iterator i = lang.iterator();&#xA;    while (i.hasNext()) {&#xA;        org.json.simple.JSONObject innerObj = (org.json.simple.JSONObject) i.next();&#xA;&#xA;        Creator_User_ID = innerObj.get("Creator_User_ID").toString();&#xA;        Advisor_User_ID = innerObj.get("Advisor_User_ID");&#xA;        Question_Video_Title = innerObj.get("Question_Video_Title");&#xA;        playing_time = innerObj.get("playing_time");&#xA;        Created = innerObj.get("Created");&#xA;        Modified = innerObj.get("Modified");&#xA;        question_video_playingTime = innerObj.get("question_video_playingTime");&#xA;        Answer_Video_Title = innerObj.get("Answer_Video_Title");&#xA;        question_video_playingTime = innerObj.get("question_video_playingTime");&#xA;        Answer_Video_Title = innerObj.get("Answer_Video_Title");&#xA;        Answer_Video_Link = innerObj.get("Answer_Video_Link");&#xA;        answer_video_playingtime = innerObj.get("answer_video_playingtime");&#xA;        StatusName = innerObj.get("StatusName");&#xA;        QuestionID = innerObj.get("QuestionID");&#xA;&#xA;        // Storing data into arrayList&#xA;        al = new ArrayList();&#xA;        al.add(Creator_User_ID);&#xA;        al.add(Advisor_User_ID);&#xA;        al.add(Question_Video_Title);&#xA;        al.add(playing_time);&#xA;        al.add(Created);&#xA;        al.add(Modified);&#xA;        al.add(question_video_playingTime);&#xA;        al.add(Answer_Video_Link);&#xA;        al.add(Answer_Video_Title);&#xA;        al.add(answer_video_playingtime);&#xA;        al.add(QuestionID);&#xA;        al.add(StatusName);&#xA;&#xA;        // First Way to get element one by one &#xA;    for (Object value : al) {&#xA;            if (value != null) {&#xA;                System.out.println("Not Null:" + value);&#xA;            } else {&#xA;                System.out.println("Null:" + value);&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;          //or  Second Way &#xA;&#xA;    Object valuenext=al.get(0); // Get First Index Value&#xA;    System.out.println(valuenext);&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;} catch (ParseException ex) {&#xA;    ex.printStackTrace();&#xA;} catch (NullPointerException ex) {&#xA;    ex.printStackTrace();&#xA;}&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 here is the simple way to   parse json array  and easily get  null  as well as a value pair . important thing do not use variable name as a capital letter it must be start with lower case.. ;please find programme and you can modify it according to your requirement   . ;. ;  . ;

here is the simple way to parse json array and easily get null as well as a value pair
important thing do not use variable name as a capital letter it must be start with lower case
please find programme and you can modify it according to your requirement



<p>Pass $PDO as an argument;</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>function function_name($PDO)&#xA;{&#xA;    // Your function code&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>I had a similar problem on a different scenario. If the body's start-height is equal or superior to the body's end-height no problem. If it goes the other way round the view port will jump to the screen top. What I did was to calculate the body's end-height and pre-set it before the content came in. I grabbed your example and put-it into a semi-functional html page.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"&gt; &#xA;&lt;html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"&gt; &#xA;&lt;head&gt; &#xA;&lt;script src="http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.3.2/jquery.min.js" type="text/javascript"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;&#xA;&lt;script&gt;&#xA;    function UpdateChartImage(ChartContent) {&#xA;        //do updates on div here&#xA;        var existingChart = $("#content");&#xA;        existingChart.fadeOut("fast", function() { &#xA;            existingChart.html(ChartContent);&#xA;&#xA;            // sets body's height to match the end-height&#xA;            $(document.body).height($(document.body).height());&#xA;        }).fadeIn("fast");&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    $(function() {&#xA;        $('#div_change').click(function(){&#xA;        UpdateChartImage("asdkaskdh asdkjhasdkh asdkhas daskdhasdkaskdh asdkjhasdkh asdkhas daskdhasdkaskdh asdkjhasdkh asdkhas daskdhasdkaskdh asdkjhasdkh <p>SENARIO: i have few folders on my FTP server, belongs to particular user. Suppose i have 10GB total space and i assign 1GB to each user i.e can accomodate 10 users having 1GB each. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>now users can add/delete/edit any type of file to utilize the storage space. All i need to do is to restrict users not to exceed 1gb space for their file storage. For this i want to use FileSystemWatcher to notify me that a user had created/deleted/edited a file so that i can minimize the space from 1gb incase of creation of a file or add a space incase of deletion. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>this is the piece of coding using FSW. when user gets loged-in with proper id and password, respective folder is opened (present at FTP server) where he can add/delete/edit any type of file and according to that i hav to monitor d space ulitilized by him.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>but d problem is the event handlers (written in console). i dont understand what happens when this code is being runned... i dontknow how to use FSW class so that i can monitor d changes user is making in his folder.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>please help ... THANX</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>using System;&#xA;using System.Diagnostics;&#xA;using System.IO;&#xA;using System.Threading;&#xA;&#xA;public class _Default: System.Web.UI.Page {&#xA;    public class ClsFileSystemWatcher {&#xA;        public static void OnChanged(object source, FileSystemEventArgs e) {&#xA;            Console.WriteLine("File "+e.FullPath+" :"+e.ChangeType);&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        public static void OnDeleted(object source, FileSystemEventArgs e) {&#xA;            Console.WriteLine("File "+e.FullPath+" :"+e.ChangeType);&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        public static void OnCreated(object source, FileSystemEventArgs e) {&#xA;            Console.WriteLine("File "+e.FullPath+" :"+e.ChangeType);&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        public static void OnRenamed(object source, RenamedEventArgs e) {&#xA;            Console.WriteLine("File "+e.OldFullPath+" [Changed to] "+e.FullPath);&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        public static void OnError(object source, ErrorEventArgs e) {&#xA;            Console.WriteLine("Error "+e);&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        public void FileWatcher(string InputDir) {&#xA;            using (FileSystemWatcher fsw = new FileSystemWatcher()) {&#xA;                fsw.Path = InputDir;&#xA;                fsw.Filter = @"*";&#xA;                fsw.IncludeSubdirectories = true;&#xA;                fsw.NotifyFilter = NotifyFilters.FileName|NotifyFilters.Attributes|NotifyFilters.LastAccess|NotifyFilters.LastWrite|NotifyFilters.Security|NotifyFilters.Size|NotifyFilters.CreationTime|NotifyFilters.DirectoryName;&#xA;                fsw.Changed += OnChanged;&#xA;                fsw.Created += OnCreated;&#xA;                fsw.Deleted += OnDeleted;&#xA;                fsw.Renamed += OnRenamed;&#xA;                fsw.Error += OnError;&#xA;                fsw.EnableRaisingEvents = true;&#xA;                //string strOldFile = InputDir + "OldFile.txt";     &#xA;                //string strNewFile = InputDir + "CreatedFile.txt";    &#xA;                //// Making changes in existing file    &#xA;                //using (FileStream stream = File.Open(strOldFile, FileMode.Append))     &#xA;                //{     &#xA;                // StreamWriter sw = new StreamWriter(stream);     &#xA;                // sw.Write("Appending new line in Old File");     &#xA;                // sw.Flush();     &#xA;                // sw.Close();     &#xA;                //}    &#xA;                //// Writing new file on FileSystem     &#xA;                //using (FileStream stream = File.Create(strNewFile))    &#xA;                //{    &#xA;                // StreamWriter sw = new StreamWriter(stream);    &#xA;                // sw.Write("Writing First line into the File");    &#xA;                // sw.Flush();     &#xA;                // sw.Close();     &#xA;                //}    &#xA;                //File.Delete(strOldFile);     &#xA;                //File.Delete(strNewFile);     &#xA;                // Minimum time given to event handler to track new events raised by the filesystem.    &#xA;                Thread.Sleep(1000);&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    private DAL conn;&#xA;    private string connection;&#xA;    private string id = string.Empty;&#xA;&#xA;    protected void Page_Load(object sender, EventArgs e) {&#xA;        connection = "Provider=Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0;Data Source=C:\\Documents and Settings\\project\\Desktop\\BE prj\\dbsan.mdb;Persist Security Info=False";&#xA;        conn = new DAL(connection);&#xA;        ////*** Opening Respective Folder of a User ***////     &#xA;        DirectoryInfo directories = new DirectoryInfo(@"C:\\Inetpub\\ftproot\\san\\");&#xA;        DirectoryInfo[] folderList = directories.GetDirectories();&#xA;        if (Request.QueryString["id"] != null) {&#xA;            id = Request.QueryString["id"];&#xA;        }&#xA;        string path = Path.Combine(@"C:\\Inetpub\\ftproot\\san\\", id);&#xA;        int folder_count = folderList.Length;&#xA;        for (int j = 0; j &lt; folder_count; j++) {&#xA;            if (Convert.ToString(folderList[j]) == id) {&#xA;                Process p = new Process();&#xA;                p.StartInfo.FileName = path;&#xA;                p.Start();&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;        ClsFileSystemWatcher FSysWatcher = new ClsFileSystemWatcher();&#xA;        FSysWatcher.FileWatcher(path);&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 senario: i have few folders on my ftp server, belongs to particular user. suppose i have 10gb total space and i assign 1gb to each user i.e can accomodate 10 users having 1gb each.  . ;. ; now users can add/delete/edit any type of file to utilize the storage space. all i need to do is to restrict users not to exceed 1gb space for their file storage. for this i want to use filesystemwatcher to notify me that a user had created/deleted/edited a file so that i can minimize the space from 1gb incase of creation of a file or add a space incase of deletion.  . ;. ; this is the piece of coding using fsw. when user gets loged-in with proper id and password, respective folder is opened (present at ftp server) where he can add/delete/edit any type of file and according to that i hav to monitor d space ulitilized by him. . ;. ; but d problem is the event handlers (written in console). i dont understand what happens when this code is being runned... i dontknow how to use fsw class so that i can monitor d changes user is making in his folder. . ;. ; please help ... thanx . ;. ;  . ;

senario i have few folders on my ftp server belongs to particular user
suppose i have 10gb total space and i assign 1gb to each user i.e can accomodate 10 users having 1gb each
now users can add delete edit any type of file to utilize the storage space
all i need to do is to restrict users not to exceed 1gb space for their file storage
for this i want to use filesystemwatcher to notify me that a user had created deleted edited a file so that i can minimize the space from 1gb incase of creation of a file or add a space incase of deletion
this is the piece of coding using fsw
when user gets loged-in with proper id and password respective folder is opened present at ftp server where he can add delete edit any type of file and according to that i hav to monitor d space ulitilized by him
but d problem is the event handlers written in console
i dont understand what happens when this code is being runned.
i dontknow how to use fsw class so that i can monitor d changes user is making in his folder
please help .
thanx



<p>jdbc executes <strong>one</strong> statement at a time, so your statements, even if are multiple seperated by \n, are in fact executed as one instruction hence the error from mysql.</p>&#xA;

 jdbc executes  one  statement at a time, so your statements, even if are multiple seperated by \n, are in fact executed as one instruction hence the error from mysql. . ;

jdbc executes one statement at a time so your statements even if are multiple seperated by n are in fact executed as one instruction hence the error from mysql



<p>You can use the <a href="http://confluence.highsource.org/display/J2B/Simplify+Plugin" rel="nofollow">Simplify plugin</a> to simplify your <code>content</code> property.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>SO disclaimer: I'm the author.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Please see this questions:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26138753/generate-java-classes-from-xsd-with-jaxb-from-a-choice">Generate java classes from xsd with jaxb from a choice</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26107727/extracting-element-text-value">extracting element text value</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In short, if you use this plugin and customize one of the elements which go into your <code>content</code> property with <code>simplify:as-element-property</code>, you can get distinct easy to use element properties per element. I hope this is what you mean with "pretty".</p>&#xA;

 you can use the  simplify plugin  to simplify your  content  property. . ;. ; so disclaimer: i'm the author. . ;. ; please see this questions: . ;. ;  generate java classes from xsd with jaxb from a choice  . ;. ;  extracting element text value  . ;. ; in short, if you use this plugin and customize one of the elements which go into your  content  property with  simplify:as-element-property , you can get distinct easy to use element properties per element. i hope this is what you mean with "pretty". . ;

you can use the simplify plugin to simplify your content property
so disclaimer i m the author
please see this questions
generate java classes from xsd with jaxb from a choice
extracting element text value
in short if you use this plugin and customize one of the elements which go into your content property with simplify as-element-property you can get distinct easy to use element properties per element
i hope this is what you mean with pretty



<p>I have a website I am trying to convert to an iPad application.  I am new to iPad/iPhone development and I am not sure what type of object is the best to use.  The website is <a href="http://www.distripplanner.com" rel="nofollow">http://www.distripplanner.com</a>.  If you look at section #3 (Choose Your Restaurants), the number of rows changes dynamically with number of days for the trip - with a max of 30 days.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>My application is set up as a single-view application and I have my main view set up as a Scroll View (to scroll the page when the user chooses enough days) and the top portion of the application is completed.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I have tried to set up the view as a UICollectionView but did not get very far as it did not appear to be right object type.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I am currently working with an array of UIViews but the solution does not seem to be very optimized.  In the initial application load I am looping through 30 (max number of days for a trip) and creating a view (no sub objects yet) for each day.  I place the view based on calculations of the array index.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I do not add the subview to the main view if the array index is greater than the number of days for travel.  My plan was to add more (already created) subviews when the user adds days to their trip and removing (hiding) the subview if the user reduces the number of days of their trip.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This approach just does not seem like a good solution and I am at a loss s to what type of view or object to use for this.  Any help would be greatly appreciated.</p>&#xA;

<p>If the result you're looking for is this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>idmy_form   summary             station     action_id   action_required action_date&#xA;1       OSR puncture            Thornbury   203         Close           2013-01-06 00:00:00.000&#xA;2       Windscreen wiper broke  Bristol     NULL        NULL            NULL&#xA;3       Out of screenwash       Cardiff     403         Close           2013-09-17 00:00:00.000&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Then the query you want is this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>SELECT &#xA;    mf.idmy_form, &#xA;    mf.summary, &#xA;    mf.station, &#xA;    a.action_id, &#xA;    a.action_required, &#xA;    a.action_date &#xA;FROM my_form mf&#xA;LEFT JOIN (&#xA;    SELECT &#xA;       act.action_id, &#xA;       act.action_required, &#xA;       act.action_date, &#xA;       fa.idmy_form &#xA;    FROM form_action fa&#xA;    JOIN actions act &#xA;     ON fa.action_id = act.action_id &#xA;     AND act.action_required = 'Close'&#xA;) a &#xA;ON a.idmy_form = mf.idmy_form &#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you add a where condition to the left join you effectively eliminate the null values (and make it an implicit inner join), so add the filter to the join condition instead.</p>&#xA;

 if the result you're looking for is this: . ;. ;  . ;. ; then the query you want is this: . ;. ;  . ;. ; if you add a where condition to the left join you effectively eliminate the null values (and make it an implicit inner join), so add the filter to the join condition instead. . ;

<p>No, that's not possible without using an equivalent list of descriptions:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>YourClass.h:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>typedef enum YouJustUnlocked {&#xA;    Unlocked_A,&#xA;    Unlocked_B,&#xA;    //etc... many more&#xA;    Unlocked_Nothing,&#xA;    // Add this:&#xA;    Num_Unlocked&#xA;}YouJustUnlocked;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>YourClass.m:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>static NSString *_youJustUnlockedDesc[Num_Unlocked] = {&#xA;    @"Unlocked_A",&#xA;    @"Unlocked_B",&#xA;    //etc... many more&#xA;    @"Unlocked_Nothing",&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;@implementation YourClass&#xA;&#xA;+ (NSString *)youHaveUnlockedDesc:(YouJustUnlocked)yju {&#xA;    NSAssert(yju &lt; Num_Unlocked, @"Out-of-range");&#xA;    return _youJustUnlockedDesc[yju];&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;...&#xA;&#xA;@end&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Notes:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li>The <code>typedef</code> will be in the header file, while the description array will be within the implementation file.</li>&#xA;<li>The <code>Unlocked_Nothing</code> should, conventionally, be the first element of the <code>enum</code>.</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;

 no, that's not possible without using an equivalent list of descriptions: . ;. ; yourclass.h: . ;. ;  . ;. ; yourclass.m: . ;. ;  . ;. ; notes: . ;. ; . ; the  typedef  will be in the header file, while the description array will be within the implementation file. . ; the  unlocked_nothing  should, conventionally, be the first element of the  enum . . ; . ;

no that s not possible without using an equivalent list of descriptions
yourclass.h
yourclass.m
notes
the typedef will be in the header file while the description array will be within the implementation file
the unlocked_nothing should conventionally be the first element of the enum

<p>There is a third way besides long ugly strings or huge methods chained together. You can use <strong>plain old variables</strong> to hold the <em>individual</em> elements:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>var $wrapper = $("&lt;div/&gt;", { class: "wrapper" }),&#xA;    $inner = $("&lt;p/&gt;", { class: "inner" }),&#xA;    $text = $("&lt;span/&gt;", { class: "text", text: "Some text" });&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Then, tie it all together with <code>append</code>:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>$wrapper.append($inner.append($text)).appendTo("#whatever");&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Result:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;div class="wrapper"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;p class="inner"&gt;&#xA;    &lt;span class="text"&gt;Some text&lt;/span&gt;&#xA;  &lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;/div&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In my opinion this is by far the cleanest and most readable approach, and it also has the advantage of separating the data from the code.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>EDIT:</strong> One caveat, however, is that there is no easy way to mix <code>textContent</code> with nested elements (e.g., <code>&lt;p&gt;Hello, &lt;b&gt;world!&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</code>.) In that case you would probably need to use one of the other techniques such as a string literal.</p>&#xA;

 there is a third way besides long ugly strings or huge methods chained together. you can use  plain old variables  to hold the  individual  elements: . ;. ;  . ;. ; then, tie it all together with  append : . ;. ;  . ;. ; result: . ;. ;  . ;. ; in my opinion this is by far the cleanest and most readable approach, and it also has the advantage of separating the data from the code. . ;. ;  edit:  one caveat, however, is that there is no easy way to mix  textcontent  with nested elements ( , .) in that case you would probably need to use one of the other techniques such as a string literal. . ;

there is a third way besides long ugly strings or huge methods chained together
you can use plain old variables to hold the individual elements
then tie it all together with append
result
in my opinion this is by far the cleanest and most readable approach and it also has the advantage of separating the data from the code
edit one caveat however is that there is no easy way to mix textcontent with nested elements . in that case you would probably need to use one of the other techniques such as a string literal

<p>Assuming you already got as far as you have created <code>IDWriteFontFile</code> instance, then it's easy to read arbitrary file fragment:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ol>&#xA;<li>Get file reference key with <code>IDwriteFontFile::GetReferenceKey();</code>.</li>&#xA;<li>Get loader interface with <code>IDWriteFontFile::GetLoader();</code></li>&#xA;<li>Create stream instance with <code>IDWriteFontFileLoader::CreateStreamFromKey()</code> using key from step 1.</li>&#xA;<li>Use <code>IDWriteFontFileStream::ReadFileFragment/ReleaseFileFragment</code> to read from file stream to your buffer.</li>&#xA;</ol>&#xA;

 assuming you already got as far as you have created  idwritefontfile  instance, then it's easy to read arbitrary file fragment: . ;. ; . ; get file reference key with  idwritefontfile::getreferencekey(); . . ; get loader interface with  idwritefontfile::getloader();  . ; create stream instance with  idwritefontfileloader::createstreamfromkey()  using key from step 1. . ; use  idwritefontfilestream::readfilefragment/releasefilefragment  to read from file stream to your buffer. . ; . ;

assuming you already got as far as you have created idwritefontfile instance then it s easy to read arbitrary file fragment
get file reference key with idwritefontfile getreferencekey
get loader interface with idwritefontfile getloader
create stream instance with idwritefontfileloader createstreamfromkey using key from step 1
use idwritefontfilestream readfilefragment releasefilefragment to read from file stream to your buffer

Maybe see <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/a/28592577/2176211">http://stackoverflow.com/a/28592577/2176211</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>library(dplyr)&#xA;df &lt;- mutate(df,id_code = ifelse(id_code == "", distribution.type, id_code))&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>Is there a way to do that without having to duplicate all fields in an interface?</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You can put the object into a <code>config</code> property: </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>interface MyObjOptions {&#xA;    a?:number;&#xA;    b?:number;&#xA;    c?:number;&#xA;    d?:number;&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;class MyObj { &#xA;    constructor(public options:MyObjOptions) {&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>But if you want <em>defaults</em> you have to list them in the interface + write them out so <strong>you must write e.g. <code>a</code> twice</strong>. No way around it </p>&#xA;

<p>reverse the routes:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Route::get('users/{id}/{pages}', 'AdminController@users', array('before'=&gt;'auth'));&#xA;Route::post('users/{id}/{pages}', 'AdminController@users', array('before'=&gt;'auth'));&#xA;&#xA;Route::get('users/{id}', 'AdminController@users', array('before'=&gt;'auth'));&#xA;Route::post('users/{id}', 'AdminController@users', array('before'=&gt;'auth'));&#xA;&#xA;Route::resource('users', 'AdminController@users', array('before'=&gt;'auth'));&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>because otherwise "<a href="http://example.com/user/25/disable" rel="nofollow">http://example.com/user/25/disable</a>" will hit Route::resource() first, and match with /user first</p>&#xA;

<p>My solution, not very clean but it use just reduce:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code># int, (int, int, ...) -&gt; ((int, ...), ...)&#xA;def grupBySum(capacity, _tuple):&#xA;&#xA;    def  _grupBySum(prev, number):&#xA;        counter = prev['counter']&#xA;        result = prev['result']&#xA;        counter = counter + (number,)&#xA;        if sum(counter) &gt; capacity:&#xA;            result = result + (counter[:-1],)&#xA;            return {'counter': (number,), 'result': result}&#xA;        else:&#xA;            return {'counter': counter, 'result': result}&#xA;&#xA;result = reduce(_grupBySum, _tuple, {'counter': (), 'result': ()}).values()&#xA;return result[1]  + (result[0],)&#xA;&#xA;f = (3, 1, 4, 2, 2, 1, 1, 2)&#xA;h = grupBySum(5, f)&#xA;print(h) # -&gt; ((3, 1), (4,), (2, 2, 1), (1, 2))&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 my solution, not very clean but it use just reduce: . ;. ;  . ;

my solution not very clean but it use just reduce

Why not query the table?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>//If [Type] and [Sub] arguments are external inputs - as in, they come from a user request or something - they should be sanitized. (remove or escape '\' and apostrophe signs)&#xA;//create connection&#xA;&#xA;string queryTmpl = "SELECT LinkedId FROM [yourTable] WHERE [TYPE] = '{0}' AND [SUB] = '{1}' AND [TRANSID] IN ({2})";&#xA;string query = string.Format(queryTmpl, Type, Sub, string.Join(", ", ListTypes);&#xA;SqlCommand select = new SqlCommand(query, cs);&#xA;&#xA;//and so forth&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>To use Linq-to-SQL you would need to map the table to a class. This would make the query simpler to perform.</p>&#xA;

<p>Are you sure doInBackground isn't getting called? There are plenty of other ways which could cause theEntries to be null. For instance, an exception here: </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>        Entry entries = mDBApi.metadata("/", 20000, null, true, null);&#xA;        for (Entry e : entries.contents)&#xA;        {&#xA;            Log.i("Hm", e.fileName());&#xA;            if (!e.isDeleted)&#xA;            {&#xA;                if(!e.isDir)&#xA;                {&#xA;                    theFiles.add(e);&#xA;                }&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>could cause theEntries to be null. Also, I think you could do this a better way. Instead of setting theEntries within doInBackground (which is in a different thread than your object was created in) you should instead have that function return the entries which will pass them to onPostExecute.I believe the code would look like this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>protected class FilesLister extends AsyncTask&lt;String, Integer, Entry[]&gt;&#xA;{&#xA;    @Override&#xA;    protected Entry[] doInBackground(String... params)&#xA;    {&#xA;        Log.i("Entries", "We believe Entries has some values now.");&#xA;        Entry[] entriesReturn = null;&#xA;        ArrayList&lt;Entry&gt; theFiles = new ArrayList&lt;Entry&gt;();&#xA;        try&#xA;        {&#xA;            Entry entries = mDBApi.metadata("/", 20000, null, true, null);&#xA;            for (Entry e : entries.contents)&#xA;            {&#xA;                Log.i("Hm", e.fileName());&#xA;                if (!e.isDeleted)&#xA;                {&#xA;                    if(!e.isDir)&#xA;                    {&#xA;                        theFiles.add(e);&#xA;                    }&#xA;                }&#xA;            }&#xA;            entriesReturn = theFiles.toArray(new Entry[theFiles.size()]);&#xA;        } catch (DropboxException e1)&#xA;        {&#xA;            // TODO Auto-generated catch block&#xA;            e1.printStackTrace();&#xA;        }&#xA;        return entriesReturn;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    protected void onPostExecute(Entry[] result)&#xA;    {&#xA;        super.onPostExecute(result);&#xA;        Log.i("Now", "Calling refresh.");&#xA;        refresh(result);&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Then in your refresh method do the assignment.. Also you should check for null in the refresh method.</p>&#xA;

 are you sure doinbackground isn't getting called? there are plenty of other ways which could cause theentries to be null. for instance, an exception here:  . ;. ;  . ;. ; could cause theentries to be null. also, i think you could do this a better way. instead of setting theentries within doinbackground (which is in a different thread than your object was created in) you should instead have that function return the entries which will pass them to onpostexecute.i believe the code would look like this: . ;. ;  . ;. ; then in your refresh method do the assignment.. also you should check for null in the refresh method. . ;

<p>You cannot get each frame as UIImages (except if you used <code>UIGraphicsGetCurrentContext</code> at a very fast rate on the frame of the animating view, and I'm not even sure if that would work), but with a Core Animation, you can access the <code>presentationLayer</code> property of a CALayer, which (from the <a href="http://developer.apple.com/library/ios/#documentation/GraphicsImaging/Reference/CALayer_class/Introduction/Introduction.html" rel="nofollow">CALayer Class Reference</a>):</p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>Returns a copy of the layer containing all properties as they were at the start of the current transaction, with any active animations applied.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Hope this helps!</p>&#xA;

 you cannot get each frame as uiimages (except if you used  uigraphicsgetcurrentcontext  at a very fast rate on the frame of the animating view, and i'm not even sure if that would work), but with a core animation, you can access the  presentationlayer  property of a calayer, which (from the  calayer class reference ): . ;. ; . ;   returns a copy of the layer containing all properties as they were at the start of the current transaction, with any active animations applied. . ; . ;. ; hope this helps! . ;

you cannot get each frame as uiimages except if you used uigraphicsgetcurrentcontext at a very fast rate on the frame of the animating view and i m not even sure if that would work but with a core animation you can access the presentationlayer property of a calayer which from the calayer class reference
returns a copy of the layer containing all properties as they were at the start of the current transaction with any active animations applied
hope this helps

<p>ASP.NET is changing the IDs, thats why you have to take the clientID of your element.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>document.getElementById("&lt;%= CTL.ClientID %&gt;").style.display = "block";&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 asp.net is changing the ids, thats why you have to take the clientid of your element. . ;. ;  . ;

<p>You can do so ,by getting the max of comment id for each post group and join with your posts table then do order by comments id</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>select p.id, p.title, c.id &#xA;from &#xA;Posts as p&#xA;JOIN &#xA;(select max(id) id ,post_id &#xA;  from Comments group by &#xA;  post_id LIMIT 50) c&#xA;   ON(c.post_id = p.id)&#xA; order by c.id DESC;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Note above query will give the recent comment id only for each post group you can't use <code>*</code> in subquery to fetch the entire row for a comment this means this will not give the recent comment for each post if you select all in subquery</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>Edit</strong> this query will use only one join with limit in inner query so only 50 post's recent comment will be joined and its the inner join so it will take care to returned only associated posts,moreover the performance can be clear if you see the explain plan for your quesries</p>&#xA;

 you can do so ,by getting the max of comment id for each post group and join with your posts table then do order by comments id . ;. ;  . ;. ; note above query will give the recent comment id only for each post group you can't use  in subquery to fetch the entire row for a comment this means this will not give the recent comment for each post if you select all in subquery . ;. ;  edit  this query will use only one join with limit in inner query so only 50 post's recent comment will be joined and its the inner join so it will take care to returned only associated posts,moreover the performance can be clear if you see the explain plan for your quesries . ;

you can do so by getting the max of comment id for each post group and join with your posts table then do order by comments id
note above query will give the recent comment id only for each post group you can t use in subquery to fetch the entire row for a comment this means this will not give the recent comment for each post if you select all in subquery
edit this query will use only one join with limit in inner query so only 50 post s recent comment will be joined and its the inner join so it will take care to returned only associated posts moreover the performance can be clear if you see the explain plan for your quesries



<p>In fact I would go right in between the two suggested answers so far. I would use javascript to replace the line breaks with a tag that will add structure around text e.g.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>var str = document.getElementById('Parol').innerHTML;&#xA;str = '&lt;span&gt;' + str.replace(/(?:\r\n|\r|\n)/g, '&lt;/span&gt;&lt;span&gt;') + '&lt;span&gt;';&#xA;document.getElementById('Roman').innerHTML = str;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And than style it in whichever way you want using CSS, your case would be </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>   span {&#xA;        display: block;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    span:first-letter {&#xA;        text-transform: uppercase;&#xA;    }&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Here's a fiddle</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://jsfiddle.net/58qkwezk/1/" rel="nofollow">http://jsfiddle.net/58qkwezk/1/</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Adding structure to your text will help you manipulate it much easier</p>&#xA;

 in fact i would go right in between the two suggested answers so far. i would use javascript to replace the line breaks with a tag that will add structure around text   . ;. ;  . ;. ; and than style it in whichever way you want using css, your case would be  . ;. ;  . ;. ; here's a fiddle . ;. ;     . ;. ; adding structure to your text will help you manipulate it much easier . ;

and than style it in whichever way you want using css your case would be

<p>I am trying to download images from the net in my android application, it works most of the times but some pictures are failing to download and the Bitmap is null. The link to the images is always being there however. Any ideas what is causing this?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>     private class GetImage extends AsyncTask&lt;String, Void, String&gt; {&#xA;            @Override&#xA;            protected String doInBackground(String... urls) {&#xA;&#xA;                int len = 500;&#xA;&#xA;                try {&#xA;                    URL url = new URL(urls[0]);&#xA;                    Log.v("url",urls[0]);&#xA;                    HttpURLConnection connection = (HttpURLConnection) url&#xA;                            .openConnection();&#xA;                    connection.setReadTimeout(10000);&#xA;                    connection.setConnectTimeout(15000);&#xA;                    connection.setRequestMethod("GET");&#xA;                    connection.setDoInput(true);&#xA;&#xA;                    connection.connect();&#xA;                    int response = connection.getResponseCode();&#xA;&#xA;                    inputstream = connection.getInputStream();&#xA;                    System.out.println(inputstream.toString());&#xA;&#xA;                    bitmap = BitmapFactory.decodeStream(inputstream);&#xA;                    if(bitmap==null)&#xA;                        Log.v("Bitmap","fail");&#xA;                } catch (IOException e) {&#xA;                    // TODO Auto-generated catch block&#xA;                    e.printStackTrace();&#xA;                } finally {&#xA;                    if (inputstream != null) {&#xA;                        try {&#xA;                            inputstream.close();&#xA;                        } catch (IOException e) {&#xA;                            // TODO Auto-generated catch block&#xA;                            e.printStackTrace();&#xA;                        }&#xA;                    }&#xA;                }&#xA;                return "some string since it bitmap is sometimes null";&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>I have found a few links talking about switch cases being faster in c++ than if else because it can be optimized in compilation.  I then found some suggestions people had that using a dictionary may be faster than an If statement.  However, most of the conversation are about someones work end just end up discussing that they should optimize other parts of the code first and it wont matter unless your doing millions of if else.  Can anyone explain why this is?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Say I have 100 unique numbers that are going to be streamed in to a python code constantly.  I want to check which number it is, then execute something.  So i could either do a ton of if else, or i could put each number in a dictionary.  For arguments sake, lets say its a single thread. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Does someone understand the layer between python and the low level execution that can explain how this is working?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Thanks :)</p>&#xA;

 i have found a few links talking about switch cases being faster in c++ than if else because it can be optimized in compilation.  i then found some suggestions people had that using a dictionary may be faster than an if statement.  however, most of the conversation are about someones work end just end up discussing that they should optimize other parts of the code first and it wont matter unless your doing millions of if else.  can anyone explain why this is? . ;. ; say i have 100 unique numbers that are going to be streamed in to a python code constantly.  i want to check which number it is, then execute something.  so i could either do a ton of if else, or i could put each number in a dictionary.  for arguments sake, lets say its a single thread.  . ;. ; does someone understand the layer between python and the low level execution that can explain how this is working? . ;. ; thanks :) . ;
