strictly 4.0 i believe
check out the doc on actionbar



<p>OK I have created a simple Windows Forms Application put on form the TextBox component&#xA;with name textBox1 and Button control with name ValidateButton in the button click event handler I've written this code</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>using System;&#xA;using System.Windows.Forms;&#xA;&#xA;namespace ValidateSimple&#xA;{&#xA;  using System.Text.RegularExpressions;&#xA;&#xA;public partial class Form1 : Form&#xA;{&#xA;    public Form1()&#xA;    {&#xA;        InitializeComponent();&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    private void ValidateButton_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)&#xA;    {&#xA;        string strRegex = @"^(S\d{7}[a-zA-Z])$";&#xA;&#xA;        Regex myRegex = new Regex(strRegex);&#xA;&#xA;        string strTargetString = textBox1.Text;&#xA;        if (myRegex.IsMatch(strTargetString))&#xA;        {&#xA;            MessageBox.Show(@"The NRIC is correct!");&#xA;        }&#xA;        else&#xA;        {&#xA;            MessageBox.Show(@"The NRIC is incorrect!");&#xA;&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;    }&#xA;  }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>run application and put in the textBox your NRIC and press button&#xA;if input correct will show appropriate message, else incorrect NRIC message</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>also you can use the MaskedTextBox control instead look at the <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/ru-ru/library/kkx4h3az.aspx" rel="nofollow">msdn</a> </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>and in the property Mask put this S0000000L&#xA;S - is your start letter&#xA;0 -means any digit &#xA;L - means letter required a-z and A-Z&#xA;if you will use the MaskedTextBox control, user cannot enter incorrect value</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>for mode info look at <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.forms.maskedtextbox.mask.aspx" rel="nofollow">msdn</a></p>&#xA;

 ok i have created a simple windows forms application put on form the textbox component. ;with name textbox1 and button control with name validatebutton in the button click event handler i've written this code . ;. ;  . ;. ; run application and put in the textbox your nric and press button. ;if input correct will show appropriate message, else incorrect nric message . ;. ; also you can use the maskedtextbox control instead look at the  msdn   . ;. ; and in the property mask put this s0000000l. ;s - is your start letter. ;0 -means any digit . ;l - means letter required a-z and a-z. ;if you will use the maskedtextbox control, user cannot enter incorrect value . ;. ; for mode info look at  msdn  . ;

ok i have created a simple windows forms application put on form the textbox component
with name textbox1 and button control with name validatebutton in the button click event handler i ve written this code
run application and put in the textbox your nric and press button
if input correct will show appropriate message else incorrect nric message
also you can use the maskedtextbox control instead look at the msdn
and in the property mask put this s0000000l
s - is your start letter
0 -means any digit
l - means letter required a-z and a-z
if you will use the maskedtextbox control user cannot enter incorrect value
for mode info look at msdn

<p>I think the easiest solution to this problem would be to add a transparent view that matches parent of your ViewGroup. Basically, you would have the ViewPager, LinearLayout and View at the same level. You can then register an onClickListener on your transparent View and that should do the trick.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Layout should be something as simple as this :</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;View android:id="@+id/transparent_view"&#xA;      android:layout_width="match_parent"&#xA;      android:layout_height="match_parent"&#xA;      android:clickable="true"/&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 i think the easiest solution to this problem would be to add a transparent view that matches parent of your viewgroup. basically, you would have the viewpager, linearlayout and view at the same level. you can then register an onclicklistener on your transparent view and that should do the trick. . ;. ; layout should be something as simple as this : . ;. ;  . ;

i think the easiest solution to this problem would be to add a transparent view that matches parent of your viewgroup
basically you would have the viewpager linearlayout and view at the same level
you can then register an onclicklistener on your transparent view and that should do the trick
layout should be something as simple as this

Maybe there are otherways to achieve what i want, but converting Bindings is something so essential it must be possible.</p>&#xA;

<p>I am implementing a <code>BlueTooth</code> and <code>Wifi</code> Based chat program for <code>iPhone</code>. For connection purpose I am using <code>GameKit</code>. But because of some special requirements application I can't use the default <code>GKPeerPickerController</code>. So I instead I created a <code>GKSession</code> and <code>GKSessionDelegate</code> combo to detect the peers. After they find each other, they can chat.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Now I have tested the chat functionality on three <code>mac-minis</code> using <code>simulator</code>, one simulator and one <code>iPod</code>, one <code>iPhone</code> and one <code>Simulator</code>. I am able to chat in all of the above scenarios. But some how the <code>iPhone</code> and <code>iPod</code> won't detect each other.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Also I am curious about type of connection is happening between all these devices. Because theoretically <code>GameKit</code> supports both, <code>BlueTooth</code> and <code>WiFi</code>. Now the problem is that <code>GKPeerPickerController</code> let's one choose specifically between <code>BlueTooth</code> and <code>WiFi</code>, (unfortunately the implementation of <code>WiFi</code> is not documented anywhere.) This is fine, but what about the custom scenario when one implements his or her own <code>GKSession</code> and <code>GKSessionDelegate</code> Combo. When one creates <code>GKSession</code> Object using the only <code>init</code> method available: </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>��initWithSessionID:displayName:sessionMode:&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>only configuration option this provides is <code>sessionMode</code> but it has only three options </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>   GKSessionModeServer,&#xA;   GKSessionModeClient,&#xA;   GKSessionModePeer,&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>None of which indicates connection choice between <code>Bluetooth</code> and <code>WiFi</code>. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>But I have disabled <code>bluetooth</code> on the <code>iPod</code> and tested it with a <code>mac-mini</code> it works so I guess this is using <code>WiFi</code>. Also in the log I get following line:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>DNSServiceRegister callback: Ref=4c3f3d0, Flags=2, ErrorType=0 name=00XGT0H0A..BTChat1 regtype=_0eilkgh5o2mq17._udp. domain=local.&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The <code>DNSServiceRegister</code> and <code>udp</code> part make me think the communication is happening over <code>TCP/IP</code>. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So does this mean that when I start with <code>GKSession</code> and <code>GKSessionDelegate</code> the default method of communication is WiFi only, or does it support <code>WiFi</code> and <code>bluetooth</code> both at the same time (though I never got a single indication that <code>BlueTooth</code> connection was happening). </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>But <code>GameKit</code> is supposed to be mainly about <code>BlueTooth</code> Right? Can anybody   put light on the situation about what exactly is happening?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Also have you seen any sample code where somebody has implemented  WiFi interface for  <code>GKPeerPickerController</code>?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>Update:</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>OK Found it myself. <code>GKSession</code> and <code>GKSessionDelegate</code> custom implementations as I have mentioned in the question works for both <code>bluetooth</code> and <code>WiFi</code>. Actually the <code>iPhone (JailBroked)</code> I am using had some issues with <code>BlueTooth</code> and possibly that was preventing <code>Gamekit</code> to Work Properly, After hard resetting the phone and turning <code>Airplane</code> mode on off , <code>bluetooth</code> on off  a few times got the <code>bluetooth</code> working on the phone. Now the app is working fine in both <code>WiFi</code> and <code>BlueTooth</code> mode.</p>&#xA;

 i am implementing a  bluetooth  and  wifi  based chat program for  iphone . for connection purpose i am using  gamekit . but because of some special requirements application i can't use the default  gkpeerpickercontroller . so i instead i created a  gksession  and  gksessiondelegate  combo to detect the peers. after they find each other, they can chat. . ;. ; now i have tested the chat functionality on three  mac-minis  using  simulator , one simulator and one  ipod , one  iphone  and one  simulator . i am able to chat in all of the above scenarios. but some how the  iphone  and  ipod  won't detect each other. . ;. ; also i am curious about type of connection is happening between all these devices. because theoretically  gamekit  supports both,  bluetooth  and  wifi . now the problem is that  gkpeerpickercontroller  let's one choose specifically between  bluetooth  and  wifi , (unfortunately the implementation of  wifi  is not documented anywhere.) this is fine, but what about the custom scenario when one implements his or her own  gksession  and  gksessiondelegate  combo. when one creates  gksession  object using the only  init  method available:  . ;. ;  . ;. ; only configuration option this provides is  sessionmode  but it has only three options  . ;. ;  . ;. ; none of which indicates connection choice between  bluetooth  and  wifi .  . ;. ; but i have disabled  bluetooth  on the  ipod  and tested it with a  mac-mini  it works so i guess this is using  wifi . also in the log i get following line: . ;. ;  . ;. ; the  dnsserviceregister  and  udp  part make me think the communication is happening over  tcp/ip .  . ;. ; so does this mean that when i start with  gksession  and  gksessiondelegate  the default method of communication is wifi only, or does it support  wifi  and  bluetooth  both at the same time (though i never got a single indication that  bluetooth  connection was happening).  . ;. ; but  gamekit  is supposed to be mainly about  bluetooth  right? can anybody   put light on the situation about what exactly is happening? . ;. ; also have you seen any sample code where somebody has implemented  wifi interface for   gkpeerpickercontroller ? . ;. ;  update:  . ;. ; ok found it myself.  gksession  and  gksessiondelegate  custom implementations as i have mentioned in the question works for both  bluetooth  and  wifi . actually the  iphone (jailbroked)  i am using had some issues with  bluetooth  and possibly that was preventing  gamekit  to work properly, after hard resetting the phone and turning  airplane  mode on off ,  bluetooth  on off  a few times got the  bluetooth  working on the phone. now the app is working fine in both  wifi  and  bluetooth  mode. . ;

i am implementing a bluetooth and wifi based chat program for iphone
for connection purpose i am using gamekit
but because of some special requirements application i can t use the default gkpeerpickercontroller
so i instead i created a gksession and gksessiondelegate combo to detect the peers
after they find each other they can chat
now i have tested the chat functionality on three mac-minis using simulator one simulator and one ipod one iphone and one simulator
i am able to chat in all of the above scenarios
but some how the iphone and ipod won t detect each other
also i am curious about type of connection is happening between all these devices
because theoretically gamekit supports both bluetooth and wifi
now the problem is that gkpeerpickercontroller let s one choose specifically between bluetooth and wifi unfortunately the implementation of wifi is not documented anywhere. this is fine but what about the custom scenario when one implements his or her own gksession and gksessiondelegate combo
when one creates gksession object using the only init method available
only configuration option this provides is sessionmode but it has only three options
none of which indicates connection choice between bluetooth and wifi
but i have disabled bluetooth on the ipod and tested it with a mac-mini it works so i guess this is using wifi
also in the log i get following line
the dnsserviceregister and udp part make me think the communication is happening over tcp ip
so does this mean that when i start with gksession and gksessiondelegate the default method of communication is wifi only or does it support wifi and bluetooth both at the same time though i never got a single indication that bluetooth connection was happening
but gamekit is supposed to be mainly about bluetooth right
can anybody put light on the situation about what exactly is happening
also have you seen any sample code where somebody has implemented wifi interface for gkpeerpickercontroller
update
ok found it myself
gksession and gksessiondelegate custom implementations as i have mentioned in the question works for both bluetooth and wifi
actually the iphone jailbroked i am using had some issues with bluetooth and possibly that was preventing gamekit to work properly after hard resetting the phone and turning airplane mode on off bluetooth on off a few times got the bluetooth working on the phone
now the app is working fine in both wifi and bluetooth mode

<p>You can set your own values to the 2nd number picker (the minute number picker), with a call of <code>setDisplayedValues</code>. However you first need to find the <code>NumberPicker</code> view.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Android Device Monitor, has a nice feature of capturing the device's screen and the separate views, so you can find the id (or a path) to your wanted view:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/3dZdj.png" alt="enter image description here"></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Since your new value array holds 6 values (0...5),  you will need to convert the current minutes to <strong>tens</strong>, so you don't go out of range.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Here's a complete example:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>@Override&#xA;public Dialog onCreateDialog(Bundle savedInstanceState) {&#xA;    final Calendar c = Calendar.getInstance();&#xA;    int hour = c.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY);&#xA;    // Convert current minutes to tens&#xA;    // 55 = 50, 56 = 00&#xA;    int minute = c.get(Calendar.MINUTE) / 10;&#xA;    minute = (minute &gt; 5) ? 0 : minute;&#xA;&#xA;    // Create a new instance of TimePickerDialog and return it&#xA;    final TimePickerDialog tpd = new TimePickerDialog(getActivity(), this, hour, minute,&#xA;            DateFormat.is24HourFormat(getActivity()));&#xA;&#xA;    tpd.setOnShowListener(new DialogInterface.OnShowListener() {&#xA;        @Override&#xA;        public void onShow(DialogInterface dialog) {&#xA;            int tpLayoutId = getResources().getIdentifier("timePickerLayout", "id", "android");&#xA;&#xA;            ViewGroup tpLayout = (ViewGroup) tpd.findViewById(tpLayoutId);&#xA;            ViewGroup layout = (ViewGroup) tpLayout.getChildAt(0);&#xA;&#xA;            // Customize minute NumberPicker&#xA;            NumberPicker minutePicker = (NumberPicker) layout.getChildAt(2);&#xA;            minutePicker.setDisplayedValues(new String[]{"00", "10", "20", "30", "40", "50"});&#xA;            minutePicker.setMinValue(0);&#xA;            minutePicker.setMaxValue(5);&#xA;        }&#xA;    });&#xA;&#xA;    return tpd;&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;public void onTimeSet(TimePicker view, int hourOfDay, int minute) {&#xA;    minute = minute * 10;&#xA;    Toast.makeText(getActivity(), "Selected minute: " + minute, Toast.LENGTH_LONG).show();&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>Edit:</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>When using AppCompat theme, the dialog will show a circular slider, which is uncustomizable. However you can tell the dialog to use a newer theme (which won't be a problem because your minSdk is 15):</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>final TimePickerDialog tpd = new TimePickerDialog(getActivity(),&#xA;        android.R.style.Theme_Holo_Light_Dialog, this, hour, minute,&#xA;        DateFormat.is24HourFormat(getActivity()));&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 you can set your own values to the 2nd number picker (the minute number picker), with a call of  setdisplayedvalues . however you first need to find the  numberpicker  view. . ;. ; android device monitor, has a nice feature of capturing the device's screen and the separate views, so you can find the id (or a path) to your wanted view: . ;. ;   . ;. ; since your new value array holds 6 values (0...5),  you will need to convert the current minutes to  tens , so you don't go out of range. . ;. ; here's a complete example: . ;. ;  . ;. ;  edit:  . ;. ; when using appcompat theme, the dialog will show a circular slider, which is uncustomizable. however you can tell the dialog to use a newer theme (which won't be a problem because your minsdk is 15): . ;. ;  . ;

you can set your own values to the 2nd number picker the minute number picker with a call of setdisplayedvalues
however you first need to find the numberpicker view
android device monitor has a nice feature of capturing the device s screen and the separate views so you can find the id or a path to your wanted view
since your new value array holds 6 values 0...5 you will need to convert the current minutes to tens so you don t go out of range
here s a complete example
edit
when using appcompat theme the dialog will show a circular slider which is uncustomizable
however you can tell the dialog to use a newer theme which won t be a problem because your minsdk is 15

<p>To run codeception with Chrome, use the following <code>acceptance.suite.yml</code>:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>class_name: WebGuy&#xA;modules:&#xA;  enabled:&#xA;    - Selenium2&#xA;    - WebHelper&#xA;  config:&#xA;    Selenium2:&#xA;      url: 'http://www.google.com'&#xA;      browser: chrome&#xA;      delay: 350&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Note that i changed your browser in the config from <code>googlechrome</code> to <code>chrome</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Also, start Selenium2 by using this command:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><code>java -Dwebdriver.chrome.driver=./chromedriver -jar selenium-server-standalone-2.31.0.jar</code></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Note that you don't need to specify the browser when starting selenium.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You can download chromedriver <a href="https://code.google.com/p/chromedriver/downloads/list">here</a>. You should also update your selenium standalone server; you can get the latest version from <a href="http://code.google.com/p/selenium/downloads/list">here</a>.</p>&#xA;

 to run codeception with chrome, use the following  acceptance.suite.yml : . ;. ;  . ;. ; note that i changed your browser in the config from  googlechrome  to  chrome . . ;. ; also, start selenium2 by using this command: . ;. ;  . ;. ; note that you don't need to specify the browser when starting selenium. . ;. ; you can download chromedriver  here . you should also update your selenium standalone server; you can get the latest version from  here . . ;

<p>when you are binding the event handler, you need to pass the handler function reference also</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>$(object).bind('mouseleave', myfunction);&#xA;&#xA;// a handler method&#xA;function myfunction(){&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>where <code>myfunction</code> is the reference to the previously registered handler method</p>&#xA;

 when you are binding the event handler, you need to pass the handler function reference also . ;. ;  . ;. ; where  myfunction  is the reference to the previously registered handler method . ;

when you are binding the event handler you need to pass the handler function reference also
where myfunction is the reference to the previously registered handler method



<p>Why not try this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code> public class Item &#xA;   {&#xA;      public Item()&#xA;      {&#xA;            ChildItems = new HashSet&lt;Item&gt;();&#xA;      }&#xA;&#xA;      public int Id { get; set; }&#xA;      public int? ParentItemId { get; set; }&#xA;      public string Value { get; set; }&#xA;&#xA;      public virtual Item ParentItem { get; set; }&#xA;      public virtual ICollection&lt;Item&gt; ChildItems { get; set; }&#xA;  }&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And in your DataContex Class: </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>protected override void OnModelCreating(DbModelBuilder modelBuilder)&#xA;    {&#xA;        modelBuilder.Entity&lt;Item&gt;()&#xA;                    .HasOptional(i =&gt; i.ParentItem)&#xA;                    .WithMany()&#xA;                    .HasForeignKey(i =&gt; i.ParentItemId);&#xA;    }&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Hope this work.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Also there is a good article here:&#xA;<b>How to Configure a Self Referencing Entity in Code First</b>&#xA;<a href="http://blogs.microsoft.co.il/gilf/2011/06/03/how-to-configure-a-self-referencing-entity-in-code-first/" rel="nofollow">http://blogs.microsoft.co.il/gilf/2011/06/03/how-to-configure-a-self-referencing-entity-in-code-first/</a></p>&#xA;

 why not try this: . ;. ;  . ;. ; and in your datacontex class:  . ;. ;  . ;. ; hope this work. . ;. ; also there is a good article here:. ; how to configure a self referencing entity in code first . ;    . ;

<p>I found the solution </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>First of all to clean up your CSS , never use minified version of CSS as Dust me selectors is unable to process such files and store css files locally</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>After you click on Clean up you then click on save to get the cleansed css file</p>&#xA;

 i found the solution  . ;. ; first of all to clean up your css , never use minified version of css as dust me selectors is unable to process such files and store css files locally . ;. ; after you click on clean up you then click on save to get the cleansed css file . ;

i found the solution
first of all to clean up your css never use minified version of css as dust me selectors is unable to process such files and store css files locally
after you click on clean up you then click on save to get the cleansed css file



<p>Just watch both <code>mousedown</code> and <code>mouseup</code> and calculate the difference. <a href="http://jsfiddle.net/taylorbuley/PdJDe/">Here's an example</a>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>(function() { &#xA;&#xA;    // how many milliseconds is a long press?&#xA;    var longpress = 3000;&#xA;    // holds the start time&#xA;    var start;&#xA;&#xA;    jQuery( "#pressme" ).on( 'mousedown', function( e ) {&#xA;        start = new Date().getTime();&#xA;    } );&#xA;&#xA;    jQuery( "#pressme" ).on( 'mouseleave', function( e ) {&#xA;        start = 0;&#xA;    } );&#xA;&#xA;    jQuery( "#pressme" ).on( 'mouseup', function( e ) {&#xA;        if ( new Date().getTime() &gt;= ( start + longpress )  ) {&#xA;           alert('long press!');   &#xA;        } else {&#xA;           alert('short press!');   &#xA;        }&#xA;    } );&#xA;&#xA;}());&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 just watch both  mousedown  and  mouseup  and calculate the difference.  here's an example . . ;. ;  . ;

just watch both mousedown and mouseup and calculate the difference
here s an example



<p>The problem is that you are not paying attention to the length of the packet that you received.  Change</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>    msg = new String(pack.getData());&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>to</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>    msg = new String(pack.getData(), 0, pack.getLength());&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The first time you create a String in your code, it (kind of) works .... because you then <code>trim()</code> the string to get rid of the trailing NUL (zero) characters.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The second time, you are reading into a dirty buffer, so the junk is decoding as non-NUL characters.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>FWIW, if you make use of the packet length when creating the String, it is no longer necessary to <code>trim()</code> it to get rid of trailing NUL characters.</p>&#xA;

 the problem is that you are not paying attention to the length of the packet that you received.  change . ;. ;  . ;. ; to . ;. ;  . ;. ; the first time you create a string in your code, it (kind of) works .... because you then  trim()  the string to get rid of the trailing nul (zero) characters. . ;. ; the second time, you are reading into a dirty buffer, so the junk is decoding as non-nul characters. . ;. ; fwiw, if you make use of the packet length when creating the string, it is no longer necessary to  trim()  it to get rid of trailing nul characters. . ;

the problem is that you are not paying attention to the length of the packet that you received
change
to
the first time you create a string in your code it kind of works ..
because you then trim the string to get rid of the trailing nul zero characters
the second time you are reading into a dirty buffer so the junk is decoding as non-nul characters
fwiw if you make use of the packet length when creating the string it is no longer necessary to trim it to get rid of trailing nul characters



<p>There are float, double, BigInteger and BigDecimal.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li><p>float has less precision than double</p></li>&#xA;<li><p>float AND double both aren't infinite</p></li>&#xA;<li><p>BigInteger can hold infinite big values (only integers, no comma!)</p></li>&#xA;<li><p>BigDecimal is the same as BigInteger, but also can have decimals after the comma, i.e. 3.14</p></li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;

 there are float, double, biginteger and bigdecimal. . ;. ; . ;  float has less precision than double  . ;  float and double both aren't infinite  . ;  biginteger can hold infinite big values (only integers, no comma!)  . ;  bigdecimal is the same as biginteger, but also can have decimals after the comma,   3.14  . ; . ;

there are float double biginteger and bigdecimal
float has less precision than double
float and double both aren t infinite
biginteger can hold infinite big values only integers no comma

bigdecimal is the same as biginteger but also can have decimals after the comma 3.14

<p>if I understand you correctly, you want to replace the login button with simple text (a link?).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The url to start the login flow is as follows: <code>https://www.facebook.com/dialog/oauth?client_id=$your_app_id&amp;redirect_uri=YOUR_URL&amp;scope=YOUR_PERMISSIONS</code>&#xA;Of course, this doesn't even bring you half way there (this type of login has a code as a reponse. You have to exchange the code for a token, and then the token for another token with "long expiry" (or that doesn't expire. Depending on the latest changes on Facebook's side).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This is something I retrieved for you that is addressing the JS login you're using <a href="http://giacomofurlan.name/my-experiments/login-to-your-website-via-facebook-using-javascript-and-php" rel="nofollow">http://giacomofurlan.name/my-experiments/login-to-your-website-via-facebook-using-javascript-and-php</a> (random pick, but I see that the post is recent, and that it's using the last version of the PHP SDK Library). </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If for some reason you don't like AJAX, you can do the same thing  and achieve the same result with PHP only. Here's the link to the guide "How to Manually Build a Login Flow" <a href="https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login/manually-build-a-login-flow/v2.0" rel="nofollow">https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login/manually-build-a-login-flow/v2.0</a></p>&#xA;

<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>Is any differance between this two method?</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Yes. The first method just escapes the <code>$name</code> string while the second escapes the entire query string.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>While this is not a problem for your specific query, it could be a problem for queries, such as:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>SELECT * FROM table WHERE name = 'string';&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Since <a href="http://php.net/manual/en/mysqli.real-escape-string.php" rel="nofollow"><code>mysqli_real_escape_string</code></a> would escape the quotes, resulting in the query:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>SELECT * FROM table WHERE name = \'string\';&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>On a related note, I would encourage you to read about <a href="http://php.net/manual/en/mysqli.quickstart.prepared-statements.php" rel="nofollow">Prepared Statements</a>.</p>&#xA;

 . ;   is any differance between this two method? . ; . ;. ; yes. the first method just escapes the  string while the second escapes the entire query string. . ;. ; while this is not a problem for your specific query, it could be a problem for queries, such as: . ;. ;  . ;. ; since   mysqli_real_escape_string   would escape the quotes, resulting in the query: . ;. ;  . ;. ; on a related note, i would encourage you to read about  prepared statements . . ;

is any differance between this two method
yes
the first method just escapes the string while the second escapes the entire query string
while this is not a problem for your specific query it could be a problem for queries such as
since mysqli_real_escape_string would escape the quotes resulting in the query
on a related note i would encourage you to read about prepared statements

<p>Hy guys, first: My english is not good, but.. come on:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I have two projects in eclipse: </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>JPA (with models &amp; dao's)&#xA;EJB (with my web services)</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>and an EAR Project (JPA + EJB). My setup: JBoss 7.1 AS</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>My problem:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>@Stateless&#xA;@WebService --&gt; THIS IS IN EBJ PROJECT&#xA;public class PessoaFisicaWS implements Service {&#xA;&#xA;    @EJB&#xA;    private PessoaFisicaDAO dao;&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>this is my DAO Impl</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>@Stateless -&gt;&gt; THIS IS IN MY JPA PROJECT&#xA;public class JPAPessoaFisicaDAO extends JPAAbstractDAO&lt;PessoaFisicaBean&gt;&#xA;        implements PessoaFisicaDAO {&#xA;&#xA;    public PessoaFisicaBean getPessoaFisicaByCPF(String cpf) {&#xA;        TypedQuery&lt;PessoaFisicaBean&gt; query = manager.createQuery(&#xA;                "SELECT p from PessoaFisicaBean p where p.cpf = :cpf",&#xA;                PessoaFisicaBean.class);&#xA;        query.setParameter("cpf", cpf);&#xA;&#xA;        return query.getSingleResult();&#xA;    }&#xA;// with others impl&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>OK</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>EJB Project</strong> add <strong>JPA Project</strong> in your classpath. OK</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>NO ERRORS. <p>I figured out the solution to my problem. Python redis client was sending SELECT command when the configuration had URL like: 127.0.0.1:6379?db=1. The db=1 triggers the SELECT command which is not supported by nutcracker. I changed it to db=0 and things work well now.</p>&#xA;

 i figured out the solution to my problem. python redis client was sending select command when the configuration had url like: 127.0.0.1:6379?db=1. the db=1 triggers the select command which is not supported by nutcracker. i changed it to db=0 and things work well now. . ;

i figured out the solution to my problem
python redis client was sending select command when the configuration had url like 127.0.0.1 6379
db 1
the db 1 triggers the select command which is not supported by nutcracker
i changed it to db 0 and things work well now

<p><code>BarData</code> constructor accepts <code>IBarDataSet</code> instead of <code>BarDataSet</code> that you have been passing. <br><br>&#xA;Try this way:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>IBarDataSet barDataSet = new BarDataSet(barEntries,"Dates");&#xA;BarData theData;&#xA;&#xA;theData = new BarData(theDates,barDataSet);&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>To <em>get</em> all the <code>id</code>s, and push to an array:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>var ids = [];&#xA;&#xA;$('.colorwell').each(function(){&#xA;    ids.push(this.id);&#xA;});&#xA;console.log(ids);&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://jsfiddle.net/davidThomas/hPB7q/" rel="nofollow">JS Fiddle demo</a>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>To get other details, and populate an object, or rather an <em>array</em> of objects, with various properties:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>var colorwells = [],&#xA;    self;&#xA;&#xA;$('.colorwell').each(function(){&#xA;    self = this;&#xA;    colorwells.push(&#xA;        {&#xA;            id : self.id,&#xA;            name : self.name,&#xA;            value : self.value&#xA;        }&#xA;    );&#xA;});&#xA;console.log(colorwells);&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://jsfiddle.net/davidThomas/hPB7q/1/" rel="nofollow">JS Fiddle demo</a>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Specifically to address your question, and bear in mind that I've never used farbtastic (as a developer, though I'm aware it's used widely for UI), and assuming that your posted code (to alert the colour) works, then I'd suggest:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>$('#picker').farbtastic('#color_picker_input').mouseup(function (){&#xA;    var colore = $.farbtastic('#picker').color,&#xA;        nome = this.id || '';&#xA;        console.log(colore, nome);&#xA;});&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This should retrieve <em>either</em> the <code>id</code> of the current DOM node, or an empty string (to prevent error messages regarding <code>undefined</code> strings/properties/objects).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>While <code>$(this).attr('id')</code> or <code>$(this).prop('id')</code> <em>works</em>, it's needlessly expensive to invoke jQuery to retrieve a property of a DOM node (that's perfectly available without wrapping a node into a jQuery object).</p>&#xA;

 to  get  all the  id s, and push to an array: . ;. ;  . ;. ;  js fiddle demo . . ;. ; to get other details, and populate an object, or rather an  array  of objects, with various properties: . ;. ;  . ;. ;  js fiddle demo . . ;. ; specifically to address your question, and bear in mind that i've never used farbtastic (as a developer, though i'm aware it's used widely for ui), and assuming that your posted code (to alert the colour) works, then i'd suggest: . ;. ;  . ;. ; this should retrieve  either  the  id  of the current dom node, or an empty string (to prevent error messages regarding  undefined  strings/properties/objects). . ;. ; while  or   works , it's needlessly expensive to invoke jquery to retrieve a property of a dom node (that's perfectly available without wrapping a node into a jquery object). . ;

<p>I'm using a storyboard and my custom UICollectionViewCell is not appearing. I played around with it for a few hours and have googled a ton of different solutions but none worked. Just to clarify, the data exists, and the UICollectionView is appearing, but the cell is not. Here is my code. Any suggestions would be appreciated!</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>- (NSInteger)collectionView:(UICollectionView *)mutualFriendsView numberOfItemsInSection:(NSInteger)section {&#xA;return [self.resultsDictionary count];&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;- (UICollectionViewCell *)collectionView:(UICollectionView *)mutualFriendsView&#xA;              cellForItemAtIndexPath:(NSIndexPath *)indexPath{&#xA;static NSString *identifier = @"PCRRequesterMutualFriendsCollectionViewCell";&#xA;&#xA;PCRRequesterMutualFriendsCollectionViewCell *cell = [self.mutualFriendsView dequeueReusableCellWithReuseIdentifier:identifier forIndexPath:indexPath];&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;NSArray *idArray = [self.resultsDictionary objectForKey:@"id"];&#xA;NSArray *nameArray = [self.resultsDictionary objectForKey:@"name"];&#xA;&#xA;cell.profileName.text = [nameArray objectAtIndex:indexPath.row];&#xA;cell.backgroundColor = [UIColor redColor];&#xA;&#xA;return cell;&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;- (void)collectionView:(UICollectionView *)mutualFriendsView didSelectItemAtIndexPath:(NSIndexPath *)indexPath&#xA;{&#xA;NSLog(@"cell #%d was selected", indexPath.row);&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;- (BOOL)shouldAutorotate {&#xA;[mutualFriendsView.collectionViewLayout invalidateLayout];&#xA;&#xA;BOOL retVal = YES;&#xA;return retVal;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>EDIT</strong> Here is my viewDidLoad</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>self.mutualFriendsView.dataSource = self;&#xA;self.mutualFriendsView.delegate = self;&#xA;&#xA;self.mutualFriendsView.pagingEnabled = YES;&#xA;&#xA;//    [self.mutualFriendsView registerClass:[PCRMutualFriendsCollectionViewCell class] forCellWithReuseIdentifier:@"PCRMutualFriendsCollectionViewCell"];&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>Edit</strong> I think I figured out the problem. I don't think the dictionary is being populated after the completion block finishes. Any suggestions for saving the value of the dictionary from the block to be used outside of it?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>__block NSMutableDictionary *mutualFriends = nil;&#xA;&#xA;__block NSNumber *total;&#xA;&#xA;NSString *u = [NSString stringWithFormat:@"%@",self.details[@"Requester"][@"profile"][@"facebookId"]];&#xA;/* make the API call */&#xA;[FBRequestConnection startWithGraphPath:(@"/%@", u)&#xA;                             parameters:params&#xA;                             HTTPMethod:@"GET"&#xA;                      completionHandler:^(FBRequestConnection *connection, id result, NSError *error) {&#xA;                      }];&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;self.resultsDictionary = mutualFriends;&#xA;self.number = total;&#xA;NSLog(@"NUMBER %@", self.number);&#xA;NSLog(@"RESULTS DICTIONARY %@", self.resultsDictionary);&#xA;NSString *friends = [NSString stringWithFormat:@"You have %@ friends in common including:", self.number];&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>Check this out</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://security.stackexchange.com/questions/49684/difference-between-password-expiration-and-account-expiration">http://security.stackexchange.com/questions/49684/difference-between-password-expiration-and-account-expiration</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>I think password expiration and account expiration are two differents means to achieve the same goal, that is to prevent someone to log in. However, they are used in different context and for different needs.</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>Password expiration is used when you want to force someone to renew their password at a specific interval (maybe 90 days) but you want the account to stay enabled. The user will be prompted to change his password and the next logon.</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>Account expiration should be used in another context. For example if you hire a contractor for 6 months and you want the account to be disabled at the end of the contract, you can set an account expiration at a fixed date and you won't have to be concerned about removing access to this contractor when the contract is finished since the account will be automatically disabled.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;

 check this out . ;. ;     . ;. ; . ;   i think password expiration and account expiration are two differents means to achieve the same goal, that is to prevent someone to log in. however, they are used in different context and for different needs. . ;  . ;   password expiration is used when you want to force someone to renew their password at a specific interval (maybe 90 days) but you want the account to stay enabled. the user will be prompted to change his password and the next logon. . ;  . ;   account expiration should be used in another context. for example if you hire a contractor for 6 months and you want the account to be disabled at the end of the contract, you can set an account expiration at a fixed date and you won't have to be concerned about removing access to this contractor when the contract is finished since the account will be automatically disabled. . ; . ;

check this out
i think password expiration and account expiration are two differents means to achieve the same goal that is to prevent someone to log in
however they are used in different context and for different needs
password expiration is used when you want to force someone to renew their password at a specific interval maybe 90 days but you want the account to stay enabled
the user will be prompted to change his password and the next logon
account expiration should be used in another context
for example if you hire a contractor for 6 months and you want the account to be disabled at the end of the contract you can set an account expiration at a fixed date and you won t have to be concerned about removing access to this contractor when the contract is finished since the account will be automatically disabled



<p><a href="http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/string/basic_string/resize" rel="nofollow"><code>resize</code></a> <code>temp</code> before using</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>string temp;&#xA;&#xA;temp.resize(inStringP.size());&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>When you don't know the real size in the beginning, you can <a href="http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/string/basic_string/append" rel="nofollow"><code>append</code></a>, <a href="http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/string/basic_string/push_back" rel="nofollow"><code>push_back</code></a> and <a href="http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/string/basic_string/operator+=" rel="nofollow"><code>operator+=</code></a>:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>temp.append(1, inStringP[i]);&#xA;&#xA;or&#xA;&#xA;temp.push_back(inStringP[i]);&#xA;&#xA;or&#xA;&#xA;temp += inStringP[i];&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

   resize    temp  before using . ;. ;  . ;. ; when you don't know the real size in the beginning, you can   append  ,   push_back   and   : . ;. ;  . ;

resize temp before using
when you don t know the real size in the beginning you can append push_back and

I use en Excel form to create an HTML file, which is saved locally and navigated to within an instance of IE.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Unfortunately, the code doesn't work when I load it from file (it seems to ignore the <code>li:before</code> styling), however it seems to work fine in Chrome, and fine in IE <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7698764/custom-bullet-symbol-for-li-elements-in-ul-that-is-a-regular-character-and">here</a>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I'm using the following CSS / HTML:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;&#xA;&lt;html&gt;&#xA; <p>Your inner loops can be replaced by simple string multiplication. Instead of writing</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>for i in range(a, b):&#xA;    print(" ", end=" ")&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>you could just write</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>print("  " * (b - a))&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>With this, you can combine all three inner loops of both your outer loops into one print call:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>print(" " * num_spaces + "*"*num_asterisks)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I'm not sure what you mean by removing the diamond inside the shape though.</p>&#xA;

 your inner loops can be replaced by simple string multiplication. instead of writing . ;. ;  . ;. ; you could just write . ;. ;  . ;. ; with this, you can combine all three inner loops of both your outer loops into one print call: . ;. ;  . ;. ; i'm not sure what you mean by removing the diamond inside the shape though. . ;

<p>Ok so I'm doing a program which collects information about employees and the nsorts them according to how the user wants them sorted. So my question is, how do I move the data to these abstract classes to prepare for sorting and stuff.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>import java.util.Scanner;&#xA;import java.util.ArrayList;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;public class Assignment55_000848913&#xA;{&#xA;  public static void main(String[] args)&#xA;  {&#xA;    Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);&#xA;    ArrayList&lt;String&gt; Names       = new ArrayList&lt;String&gt;();&#xA;    ArrayList&lt;String&gt; Department  = new ArrayList&lt;String&gt;();&#xA;    ArrayList&lt;String&gt; Designation = new ArrayList&lt;String&gt;();&#xA;    ArrayList&lt;Float&gt;  Salary      = new ArrayList&lt;Float&gt;();&#xA;    String Continue = "y";&#xA;&#xA;    //******************************************************//&#xA;&#xA;    do&#xA;{&#xA;   System.out.println("Enter Employee Name: ");&#xA;   String x = in.next();&#xA;   Names.add(x);&#xA;&#xA;   System.out.println("Enter Employee Designation ('temporary or permanent'): ");&#xA;   String y = in.next();&#xA;   Designation.add(y);&#xA;&#xA;   System.out.println("Enter Employee Department: ");&#xA;   String z = in.next();&#xA;   Department.add(z);&#xA;&#xA;   System.out.println("Enter Employee Salary: ");&#xA;   float i = in.nextFloat();&#xA;   Salary.add(i);&#xA;&#xA;   System.out.println("Do you wish to add another employee? ('y'/'n'): ");&#xA;   Continue = in.next();&#xA;}&#xA;while(Continue.equals("y"));&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;  }&#xA;&#xA;  public abstract class Employee&#xA;  {&#xA;  ////////&#xA;  }&#xA;&#xA;  public class TempEmployee extends Employee&#xA;  {&#xA;    /////&#xA;  }&#xA;&#xA;  public class PermEmployee extends Employee&#xA;  {&#xA;    /////&#xA;  }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>Adobe DTM allows for firing rules based on popstate or hashtag change.  The best approach is to setup your rules based on these events and if your app supports deep linking then also setup page load rules based on the deep link URL's.</p>&#xA;

<p>Following query is taking 3.06min to execute. How to speedup this query? How to use existing index column while executing query?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>SELECT samples_collected.talukname,sample_count,TotalSamples from &#xA;(&#xA;SELECT a.talukname talukname, COUNT (DISTINCT b.globalid) sample_count&#xA;FROM village a, gridpoint_1 b ,gridpoint_1__attach c&#xA;WHERE  st_intersects(a.shape,b.shape)&#xA;and b.globalid=c.rel_globalid&#xA;and  a.districtname='Bagalkot'&#xA;GROUP BY a.talukname&#xA;) samples_collected,&#xA;(&#xA;SELECT a.talukname talukname,COUNT (DISTINCT b.globalid) TotalSamples&#xA;FROM village a&#xA;INNER JOIN&#xA;gridpoint_1 b ON  st_intersects(a.shape,b.shape)&#xA;WHERE a.districtname='Bagalkot'&#xA;GROUP BY a.talukname&#xA;) total&#xA;WHERE samples_collected.talukname=total.talukname;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 following query is taking 3.06min to execute. how to speedup this query? how to use existing index column while executing query? . ;. ;  . ;

following query is taking 3.06min to execute
how to speedup this query
how to use existing index column while executing query



<p>Each index will be separate - there's no cross referencing and so forth. So yes, if those indices are duplicates, you might end up wasting some time. But: it can totally make sense to include a single column in multiple indices - things like compound indices (several fields) and so on might make sense to be present side by side.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>SQL Server as of 2005 has a really nice feature called the DMV (Dynamic Management View) which allow you to check for</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li>indices not being used at all</li>&#xA;<li>missing indices that might speed up your query load</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Find missing indices:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>SELECT  &#xA;    object_name(object_id), d.*, s.*&#xA;FROM&#xA;    sys.dm_db_missing_index_details d &#xA;INNER JOIN &#xA;    sys.dm_db_missing_index_groups g ON d.index_handle = g.index_handle&#xA;INNER JOIN &#xA;    sys.dm_db_missing_index_group_stats s ON    g.index_group_handle = s.group_handle&#xA;WHERE   &#xA;    database_id = db_id()&#xA;ORDER BY  &#xA;    object_id&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Find unused indices:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>DECLARE  @dbid INT&#xA;&#xA;SELECT @dbid = DB_ID(DB_NAME())&#xA;&#xA;SELECT   &#xA;    OBJECTNAME = OBJECT_NAME(I.OBJECT_ID),&#xA;    INDEXNAME = I.NAME,&#xA;    I.INDEX_ID&#xA;FROM     &#xA;    SYS.INDEXES I&#xA;JOIN &#xA;    SYS.OBJECTS O ON I.OBJECT_ID = O.OBJECT_ID&#xA;WHERE    &#xA;    OBJECTPROPERTY(O.OBJECT_ID, 'IsUserTable') = 1&#xA;    AND I.INDEX_ID NOT IN (SELECT S.INDEX_ID&#xA;                            FROM SYS.DM_DB_INDEX_USAGE_STATS S&#xA;                            WHERE S.OBJECT_ID = I.OBJECT_ID&#xA;                                    AND I.INDEX_ID = S.INDEX_ID&#xA;                                    AND DATABASE_ID = @dbid)&#xA;ORDER BY &#xA;    OBJECTNAME, I.INDEX_ID, INDEXNAME ASC&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 each index will be separate - there's no cross referencing and so forth. so yes, if those indices are duplicates, you might end up wasting some time. but: it can totally make sense to include a single column in multiple indices - things like compound indices (several fields) and so on might make sense to be present side by side. . ;. ; sql server as of 2005 has a really nice feature called the dmv (dynamic management view) which allow you to check for . ;. ; . ; indices not being used at all . ; missing indices that might speed up your query load . ; . ;. ; find missing indices: . ;. ;  . ;. ; find unused indices: . ;. ;  . ;

each index will be separate - there s no cross referencing and so forth
so yes if those indices are duplicates you might end up wasting some time
but it can totally make sense to include a single column in multiple indices - things like compound indices several fields and so on might make sense to be present side by side
sql server as of 2005 has a really nice feature called the dmv dynamic management view which allow you to check for
indices not being used at all
missing indices that might speed up your query load
find missing indices
find unused indices



<p>I have a fairly simple piece of C# code that I use often</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>        SqlCommand sql = new SqlCommand();&#xA;        sql.Connection = new SqlConnection(getConnectionString());&#xA;        sql.CommandText = @"update [Reporting].[dbo].[Customer_Master]&#xA;                            set groupID = @groupID&#xA;                            where customer = @customerID";&#xA;&#xA;        sql.Parameters.Add(new SqlParameter("@groupID", groupID));&#xA;        sql.Parameters.Add(new SqlParameter("@customer", customer));&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        sql.Connection.Open();&#xA;        sql.ExecuteNonQuery();&#xA;        sql.Connection.Close();&#xA;&#xA;        sql.Dispose();&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>For some reason it wasn't updating my DB correctly so I decided to add a break point at the beginning of the method and step through each line to make sure my variables were coming in correctly.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>However, the method closes after sql.Connection.Open(), as in it just returns me back to the main code.  </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Any thoughts?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Thanks.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Edit:  I found the problem.  I had used the wrong param name.  I still find it odd that it closed out the method after opening the connection without throwing an error though.</p>&#xA;

<p>So based on this line:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Command="{Binding ElementName=MainGrid.DataContext ... }&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I'm assuming you have something like this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;Grid Name="MainGrid"&gt;&#xA;    &lt;Grid.DataContext&gt;&#xA;        &lt;lol:GridViewModel /&gt; &lt;!--Some kind of view model of sorts--&gt;&#xA;    &lt;/Grid.DataContext&gt;&#xA;    ... content&#xA;&lt;/Grid&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Then all you would have to do is on the ViewModel class create a public property that returns some sort of <code>ICommand</code>, such as:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>class GridViewModel {&#xA;    public ICommand SelectionEditorSelectionSelectedCommand { &#xA;        get { return new TestCommand(); } &#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Where <code>TestCommand</code> would be some kind of class implementing <code>ICommand</code> as in:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>class TestCommand : ICommand {&#xA;    public event EventHandler CanExecuteChanged { get; set; }&#xA;&#xA;    public bool CanExecute(object parameter)&#xA;    {&#xA;        return true; // Expresses whether the command is operable or disabled.&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    public void Execute(object parameter)&#xA;    {&#xA;         // The code to execute here when the command fires.&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Basically, for <code>ICommand</code> you just need to define what happens when the command <code>Executes</code>, how to determine whether or not it <code>CanExecute</code> and then supply an event handle for when <code>CanExecuteChanged</code>. Once you have this setup, all you have to do is wire up your button like this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;Button Command="{Binding SelectionEditorSelectionSelectedCommand}" /&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And that's it. Basically the binding will automatically check your ViewModel class for a property called <code>SelectionEditorSelectionSelectedCommand</code>, that implements <code>ICommand</code>. When it reads the property it will instantiate an instance of <code>TestCommand</code>, and WPF will handle it from there. When the button is clicked <code>Execute</code> will be fired like clockwork.</p>&#xA;

 so based on this line: . ;. ;  . ;. ; i'm assuming you have something like this: . ;. ;  . ;. ; then all you would have to do is on the viewmodel class create a public property that returns some sort of  icommand , such as: . ;. ;  . ;. ; where  testcommand  would be some kind of class implementing  icommand  as in: . ;. ;  . ;. ; basically, for  icommand  you just need to define what happens when the command  executes , how to determine whether or not it  canexecute  and then supply an event handle for when  canexecutechanged . once you have this setup, all you have to do is wire up your button like this: . ;. ;  . ;. ; and that's it. basically the binding will automatically check your viewmodel class for a property called  selectioneditorselectionselectedcommand , that implements  icommand . when it reads the property it will instantiate an instance of  testcommand , and wpf will handle it from there. when the button is clicked  execute  will be fired like clockwork. . ;

<p>In <em>C++11</em> this is relatively straight forward using the <a href="http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/random">random header</a> and <a href="http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/random/normal_distribution">std::normal_distribution</a> (<em><A href="http://rextester.com/GJONC5798">live example</a></em>):</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>#include &lt;iostream&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;iomanip&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;string&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;map&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;random&gt;&#xA;&#xA;int main()&#xA;{&#xA;    std::random_device rd;&#xA;&#xA;    std::mt19937 e2(rd());&#xA;&#xA;    std::normal_distribution&lt;&gt; dist(70, 10);&#xA;&#xA;    std::map&lt;int, int&gt; hist;&#xA;    for (int n = 0; n &lt; 100000; ++n) {&#xA;        ++hist[std::round(dist(e2))];&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    for (auto p : hist) {&#xA;        std::cout &lt;&lt; std::fixed &lt;&lt; std::setprecision(1) &lt;&lt; std::setw(2)&#xA;                  &lt;&lt; p.first &lt;&lt; ' ' &lt;&lt; std::string(p.second/200, '*') &lt;&lt; '\n';&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If <em>C++11</em> is not an option than <em>boost</em> also provides a library(<em><a href="http://rextester.com/NNH27186">live example</a></em>):</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>#include &lt;iostream&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;iomanip&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;string&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;map&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;random&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;boost/random.hpp&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;boost/random/normal_distribution.hpp&gt;&#xA;&#xA;int main()&#xA;{&#xA;&#xA;  boost::mt19937 *rng = new boost::mt19937();&#xA;  rng-&gt;seed(time(NULL));&#xA;&#xA;  boost::normal_distribution&lt;&gt; distribution(70, 10);&#xA;  boost::variate_generator&lt; boost::mt19937, boost::normal_distribution&lt;&gt; &gt; dist(*rng, distribution);&#xA;&#xA;  std::map&lt;int, int&gt; hist;&#xA;  for (int n = 0; n &lt; 100000; ++n) {&#xA;    ++hist[std::round(dist())];&#xA;  }&#xA;&#xA;  for (auto p : hist) {&#xA;    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::fixed &lt;&lt; std::setprecision(1) &lt;&lt; std::setw(2)&#xA;              &lt;&lt; p.first &lt;&lt; ' ' &lt;&lt; std::string(p.second/200, '*') &lt;&lt; '\n';&#xA;  }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>and if for some reason neither of these options is possible then you can roll your own <a href="http://en.literateprograms.org/Box-Muller_transform_%28C%29">Box-Muller transform</a>, the code provided in the link looks reasonable.</p>&#xA;

 in  c++11  this is relatively straight forward using the  random header  and  std::normal_distribution  ( <a href="  example  ): . ;. ;  . ;. ; if  c++11  is not an option than  boost  also provides a library(  live example  ): . ;. ;  . ;. ; and if for some reason neither of these options is possible then you can roll your own  box-muller transform , the code provided in the link looks reasonable. . ;

in c++11 this is relatively straight forward using the random header and std normal_distribution a href example
if c++11 is not an option than boost also provides a library live example
and if for some reason neither of these options is possible then you can roll your own box-muller transform the code provided in the link looks reasonable



<p>sort in place - Let's call it sort1&#xA;clone and sort - Let's call it sort2</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>With sort1,&#xA;If you want new instance of sorted array preserving the original one, clone and sort.&#xA;If you want to sort in place, just sort.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>With sort2,&#xA;If you want new instance of sorted array preserving the original one, just sort.&#xA;If you want to sort in place, you cannot.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Practice for sort1? I am developing a game. For every frame updates, I have to sort every visible objects in z-order and sort in place is much effecient.</p>&#xA;

 sort in place - let's call it sort1. ;clone and sort - let's call it sort2 . ;. ; with sort1,. ;if you want new instance of sorted array preserving the original one, clone and sort.. ;if you want to sort in place, just sort. . ;. ; with sort2,. ;if you want new instance of sorted array preserving the original one, just sort.. ;if you want to sort in place, you cannot. . ;. ; practice for sort1? i am developing a game. for every frame updates, i have to sort every visible objects in z-order and sort in place is much effecient. . ;

sort in place - let s call it sort1
clone and sort - let s call it sort2
with sort1
if you want new instance of sorted array preserving the original one clone and sort
if you want to sort in place just sort
with sort2
if you want new instance of sorted array preserving the original one just sort
if you want to sort in place you cannot
practice for sort1
i am developing a game
for every frame updates i have to sort every visible objects in z-order and sort in place is much effecient



<p>A simple join</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>SELECT people.*&#xA;FROM departments &#xA;INNER JOIN jobs ON departments.deperatment_id = jobs.deperatment_id&#xA;INNER JOIN people ON jobs.job_id = people.job_id&#xA;WHERE departments.deperatment_id = 1&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You will need to amend the column names in the join conditions to the ones used in your tables.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Note that your sample tables on SQL fiddle do not have any indexes. Adding these is VERY important for performance.</p>&#xA;

<p>Welcome to the wonderful world of iPhone memory management.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Whenever <strong>you</strong> alloc a piece of memory you have to make sure you release it.  Unless you use autorelease, which would look like:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>MasterViewController *masterView = [[[MasterViewController alloc] initWithNibName:@"MasterViewController" bundle:nil andArrayOfTags:[self arrayOfButtonTags:self.language]]autorelease];&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>and</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>SplitViewDelegate* splitViewDelegate = [[[SplitViewDelegate alloc] init]autorelease];&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Here is a really good overview which explains how to use memory better than I could right now: <a href="http://interfacelab.com/objective-c-memory-management-for-lazy-people" rel="nofollow">http://interfacelab.com/objective-c-memory-management-for-lazy-people</a>  (ignore the rant about HN at the start)</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I hope it helps solve your issue.</p>&#xA;

<p>I have input strings that look something like these </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>inspect [foo - bar] with [errors - 15] &#xA;create [doodle]&#xA;force delete [quux]&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>That is, lines which contain information within square brackets. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>What I want is to take one of those lines at a time and get an array like </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>["inspect", "[foo - bar], "with", "[errors - 15]"]&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Using a regular expression it's easy to collect the bracketed expressions and the parts between the bracketed expressions separately:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>var src = "inspect [foo - bar] with [errors - 15]"&#xA;var regexBracketed = /\[[a-zA-Z0-9_\- ]+\]/g;&#xA;&#xA;// this returns an array of the bracketed expressions&#xA;console.log(src.match(regexBracketed));&#xA;&#xA;// and this returns an array of the parts between the expressions&#xA;console.log(src.split(regexBracketed));&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Is there a simple way to get everything in just one array? Maybe I'm attacking this entirely the wrong way. </p>&#xA;

<p>I need to sort this table by hour, from 19 to 18 next day.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Hour  HourCount&#xA;0     234&#xA;1     322&#xA;2     333&#xA;3     433&#xA;4     544&#xA;5     589&#xA;6     675&#xA;7     688&#xA;8     734&#xA;9     789&#xA;10    821&#xA;11    892&#xA;12    922&#xA;13    954&#xA;14    987&#xA;15    996&#xA;16    1007&#xA;17    1068&#xA;18    1121&#xA;19    0&#xA;20    36&#xA;21    78&#xA;22    126&#xA;23    189&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>How can I do it? <p>Case one, I don't really know why you have a delay the first time. I guess it's doing some kind of initialization (otherwise you'd have the delay every time you press the button), but I'm not sure what precisely.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>For case two and three, you must understand two things: </p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li>Whatever is inside your <code>Dispatcher.Invoke</code> gets executed by the UI thread</li>&#xA;<li>The UI isn't refreshed while a dispatcher callback is running. Long story short, the UI thread executes an infinite loop that alternates between refreshing the UI (that is, drawing what should be on screen, depending on the value of the controls), and executing whatever callback you queued with the dispatcher</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;&#xA;<p>From there, it's easy to understand what happens:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li>In case two, your <code>Thread.Sleep</code> is executed by the UI thread. While it's sleeping, it can't refresh the UI.</li>&#xA;<li>In case three, you never exit the dispatcher, leaving no chance for the UI thread to redraw the screen</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;&#xA;<p>As to know how to fix it... Of course, the best way is to use animation. If you really don't want to, at least use a <code>TranslateTransform</code> to move your control instead of changing the margin. Using a <code>TranslateTransform</code> (assigned to the <code>RenderTransform</code> property of your control) only changes the visual appearance of the control (not the actual position), and therefore is fast. Changing the margin forces WPF to recompute part of the layout, which is CPU hungry.</p>&#xA;

 case one, i don't really know why you have a delay the first time. i guess it's doing some kind of initialization (otherwise you'd have the delay every time you press the button), but i'm not sure what precisely. . ;. ; for case two and three, you must understand two things:  . ;. ; . ; whatever is inside your  dispatcher.invoke  gets executed by the ui thread . ; the ui isn't refreshed while a dispatcher callback is running. long story short, the ui thread executes an infinite loop that alternates between refreshing the ui (that is, drawing what should be on screen, depending on the value of the controls), and executing whatever callback you queued with the dispatcher . ; . ;. ; from there, it's easy to understand what happens: . ;. ; . ; in case two, your  thread.sleep  is executed by the ui thread. while it's sleeping, it can't refresh the ui. . ; in case three, you never exit the dispatcher, leaving no chance for the ui thread to redraw the screen . ; . ;. ; as to know how to fix it... of course, the best way is to use animation. if you really don't want to, at least use a  translatetransform  to move your control instead of changing the margin. using a  translatetransform  (assigned to the  rendertransform  property of your control) only changes the visual appearance of the control (not the actual position), and therefore is fast. changing the margin forces wpf to recompute part of the layout, which is cpu hungry. . ;

case one i don t really know why you have a delay the first time
i guess it s doing some kind of initialization otherwise you d have the delay every time you press the button but i m not sure what precisely
for case two and three you must understand two things
whatever is inside your dispatcher.invoke gets executed by the ui thread
the ui isn t refreshed while a dispatcher callback is running
long story short the ui thread executes an infinite loop that alternates between refreshing the ui that is drawing what should be on screen depending on the value of the controls and executing whatever callback you queued with the dispatcher
from there it s easy to understand what happens
in case two your thread.sleep is executed by the ui thread
while it s sleeping it can t refresh the ui
in case three you never exit the dispatcher leaving no chance for the ui thread to redraw the screen
as to know how to fix it.
of course the best way is to use animation
if you really don t want to at least use a translatetransform to move your control instead of changing the margin
using a translatetransform assigned to the rendertransform property of your control only changes the visual appearance of the control not the actual position and therefore is fast
changing the margin forces wpf to recompute part of the layout which is cpu hungry

<p>A quick hack based on my old animation: <a href="http://jsfiddle.net/alkhoo/JwkYm/11/" rel="nofollow">http://jsfiddle.net/alkhoo/JwkYm/11/</a> - mouse over to activate animation.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Note: The greensock animation contains the <code>paths</code> value. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><div class="snippet" data-lang="js" data-hide="false" data-console="true" data-babel="false">&#xD;&#xA;<div class="snippet-code">&#xD;&#xA;<pre class="snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override"><code> $(function () {&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;     //Grab an array of all the main SVG Elements&#xD;&#xA;     var containers = $(".category .item a");&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;     //Define some vars that we will use later&#xD;&#xA;     var speed = 1000;&#xD;&#xA;     var animation = mina.backout;&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;     //Loop through all of these containers and insert the SVG's&#xD;&#xA;     containers.each(function (index) {&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;         //Get each of our SVG tags&#xD;&#xA;         var s = Snap(".animated-overlay.svg-" + index);&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;         //Define our Paths&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;         var defaultWhitePath = "M1.8978756799999998,64.59785067199999 C4.5919579200000005,94.29202528 74.7848272,99.01918832 128.25879712,95.43520928 361.0060832,78.08572735999999 468.2360832,8.157339040000004 562.54879712,6.478409280000005 646.3748272,4.004430240000005 663.93195792,95.19048896 664.08987568,93.45505007999999 664.24724128,114.2054704 664.1263182399999,144.17150224 664.1263182399999,166.67625712 443.1668704,166.67625712 222.2168704,166.67625712 1.26631824,166.67625712 1.26631824,165.36156416 -0.8027587199999999,36.217596 1.8898756799999998,64.59746416 z";&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;         //Define our Hover Paths&#xD;&#xA;         var hoverWhitePath = "M0.6989956799999999,94.82189867199999 C0.6932379199999996,94.83954528000001 15.029627200000007,-2.205931680000006 100.71287712,0.6387292800000068 186.5548832,3.4719673599999936 293.78488319999997,81.96869904 535.00287712,100.48192928 586.6196272000001,104.43659024 660.0332379199999,93.83112896 662.89099568,62.42577008 665.7387612800001,31.0390704 663.55047824,166.25166224 663.55047824,166.27033712000002 442.6004704,166.27033712000002 221.65047040000002,166.27033712000002 0.6904782399999999,166.27033712000002 0.6904782399999999,142.47900416000002 0.6887612800000001,118.58159599999999 0.6909956799999999,94.81490416 z";&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;         //Load up the default paths in the SVG&#xD;&#xA;         var whitePath = s.path(defaultWhitePath);&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;         whitePath.attr({&#xD;&#xA;             fill: "#00f"&#xD;&#xA;         });&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;         //Let's group our paths, it doesn't seem like you can animate the whole group though :(&#xD;&#xA;         var paths = s.group(whitePath);&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;         //Animate on Mouse Enter&#xD;&#xA;         $(containers[index]).mouseenter(function () {&#xD;&#xA;             whitePath.animate({&#xD;&#xA;                 path: hoverWhitePath&#xD;&#xA;             }, speed, animation);&#xD;&#xA;         });&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;         //Animate on Mouse Leave, return the paths to the default&#xD;&#xA;         $(containers[index]).mouseleave(function () {&#xD;&#xA;             whitePath.animate({&#xD;&#xA;                 path: defaultWhitePath&#xD;&#xA;             }, speed, animation);&#xD;&#xA;         });&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;     });&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA; });</code></pre>&#xD;&#xA;<pre class="snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override"><code>body {&#xD;&#xA;    background: #ddd;&#xD;&#xA;}&#xD;&#xA;.item {&#xD;&#xA;    max-height: 300px;&#xD;&#xA;    background: #ddd;&#xD;&#xA;}</code></pre>&#xD;&#xA;<pre class="snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override"><code>&lt;script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/snap.svg/0.4.1/snap.svg-min.js"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;&#xD;&#xA;&lt;script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.1/jquery.min.js"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;&#xD;&#xA;&lt;div class="category"&gt;&#xD;&#xA;    &lt;div class="item" style="background-image: url('images/category.jpg');"&gt; &lt;a href="#" title="Category Title"&gt;&#xD;&#xA;           &#xD;&#xA;           &lt;svg viewbox="0, 0, 700, 300" preserveAspectRatio="none" class="animated-overlay svg-0"&gt;&#xD;&#xA;               &#xD;&#xA;           &lt;/svg&gt;&#xD;&#xA;    &#xD;&#xA;        &lt;/a&gt;&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;    &lt;/div&gt;&#xD;&#xA;&lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>&#xD;&#xA;</div>&#xD;&#xA;</div>&#xD;&#xA;</p>&#xA;

<p>You can create this layout using simple html and css, but if you are asking if there is a specific layout component in Primefaces that could help you with this layout - there is.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The p:layout can help you with that.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This example shows the bottom layout:&#xA;<a href="http://www.primefaces.org/showcase/ui/layoutMailbox.jsf" rel="nofollow">http://www.primefaces.org/showcase/ui/layoutMailbox.jsf</a> </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And here are some others:&#xA;<a href="http://www.primefaces.org/showcase/ui/layoutHome.jsf" rel="nofollow">http://www.primefaces.org/showcase/ui/layoutHome.jsf</a></p>&#xA;

<p>The error seems to state that port 5555 is already in use. Perhaps a previously (aborted) start left a process that still has a handle on the port ?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Do a <code>netstat -ao</code> (Windows) or <code>netstat -ap</code> (Linux) to see if there's already a listening port 5555, and which process has a handle on it, then kill that process.</p>&#xA;

 the error seems to state that port 5555 is already in use. perhaps a previously (aborted) start left a process that still has a handle on the port ? . ;. ; do a  netstat -ao  (windows) or  netstat -ap  (linux) to see if there's already a listening port 5555, and which process has a handle on it, then kill that process. . ;

the error seems to state that port 5555 is already in use
perhaps a previously aborted start left a process that still has a handle on the port
do a netstat -ao windows or netstat -ap linux to see if there s already a listening port 5555 and which process has a handle on it then kill that process



<p>Here's a handy article I found:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://www.sqljunkies.ddj.com/Article/6676BEAE-1967-402D-9578-9A1C7FD826E5.scuk" rel="nofollow noreferrer">http://www.sqljunkies.ddj.com/Article/6676BEAE-1967-402D-9578-9A1C7FD826E5.scuk</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>What you're looking for is:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>CONVERT(datetime,'05/08/2004',120)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This will return a date in the format you're after yyyy-mm-dd hh:mi:ss(24h) format (ODBC canonical, not ISO).</p>&#xA;

<p>Inheritance in embedded entities hardly makes sense, because it calls for a different set of columns in the containing entity table depending on the actual class of the embedded entity, but at the time of declaration, the ORM does not know anything about the classes that may be derived from the base class that you want to make embedded.  I hear that EclipseLink somehow does it, (I don't want to even think of what kind of evil deeds they do to pull that trick,) but as far as I know, hibernate does not support it.</p>&#xA;

 inheritance in embedded entities hardly makes sense, because it calls for a different set of columns in the containing entity table depending on the actual class of the embedded entity, but at the time of declaration, the orm does not know anything about the classes that may be derived from the base class that you want to make embedded.  i hear that eclipselink somehow does it, (i don't want to even think of what kind of evil deeds they do to pull that trick,) but as far as i know, hibernate does not support it. . ;

inheritance in embedded entities hardly makes sense because it calls for a different set of columns in the containing entity table depending on the actual class of the embedded entity but at the time of declaration the orm does not know anything about the classes that may be derived from the base class that you want to make embedded
i hear that eclipselink somehow does it i don t want to even think of what kind of evil deeds they do to pull that trick but as far as i know hibernate does not support it

The input is echoed in a TextArea as it is being typed (i.e. this is the focus at the time) - is it related to that?</p>&#xA;

<p>Persistence Provider can't be found refers to JPA provider Jar file not being included into your test environment. Make sure JPA provider (Hibernate/ OpenJPA or whatever is provided with your app server) jar is available in classpath from where your test case reads dependent libraries.</p>&#xA;

 persistence provider can't be found refers to jpa provider jar file not being included into your test environment. make sure jpa provider (hibernate/ openjpa or whatever is provided with your app server) jar is available in classpath from where your test case reads dependent libraries. . ;
