this is now the same case as my first paragraph jks contains privatekey but wrong cert s
if you have or get openssl use it to unpack the pkcs12 into separate privatekey and cert files replace the wrong cert files with the right ones and reconstruct a new pkcs12
this puts you back in my fourth paragraph pkcs12 with correct cert s which you can either use or convert to jks and use that



<p>There are commercial <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Packet_generator" rel="nofollow">packet generators</a> that do this, and also a few freely available ones like <a href="http://packeth.sourceforge.net/" rel="nofollow">PackETH</a> and <a href="http://bittwist.sourceforge.net/" rel="nofollow">Bit-Twist</a>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>There are also other creative solutions. For example, do the packets need to be IP packets for your purpose? If not, you could always get a "dumb" switch or hub (no <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spanning_Tree_Protocol" rel="nofollow">spanning-tree</a> or other loop protection) and plug a <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethernet_crossover_cable" rel="nofollow">crossover cable</a> into it. (or a straight-through Ethernet cable would work if the switch supports <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medium_dependent_interface#Auto-MDIX" rel="nofollow">Auto-MDIX</a>) The idea would be that with a loop in your network, the hub/switch will flood the network to 100% for you since it will continually re-forward the same packets.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you try this, be sure yours is the only computer on the network, since this technique will effectively render it useless. ;-) </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You could always send some IP broadcast packets to "seed" the loop. Otherwise, the first thing I think you'd likely see is broadcast ARP packets, which won't help if you're measuring <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Network_Layer" rel="nofollow">layer 3</a> traffic only.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Lastly, (and especially if this sounds like too much trouble) I recommend you read up on <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dependency_injection" rel="nofollow">dependency injection</a> and refactor your code so you can test it without the need for a high-speed interface. Of course, you'll still need to test your code in a real high-speed environment, but doing this will give you much more confidence in your code.</p>&#xA;

 there are commercial  packet generators  that do this, and also a few freely available ones like  packeth  and  bit-twist . . ;. ; there are also other creative solutions. for example, do the packets need to be ip packets for your purpose? if not, you could always get a "dumb" switch or hub (no  spanning-tree  or other loop protection) and plug a  crossover cable  into it. (or a straight-through ethernet cable would work if the switch supports  auto-mdix ) the idea would be that with a loop in your network, the hub/switch will flood the network to 100% for you since it will continually re-forward the same packets. . ;. ; if you try this, be sure yours is the only computer on the network, since this technique will effectively render it useless. ;-)  . ;. ; you could always send some ip broadcast packets to "seed" the loop. otherwise, the first thing i think you'd likely see is broadcast arp packets, which won't help if you're measuring  layer 3  traffic only. . ;. ; lastly, (and especially if this sounds like too much trouble) i recommend you read up on  dependency injection  and refactor your code so you can test it without the need for a high-speed interface. of course, you'll still need to test your code in a real high-speed environment, but doing this will give you much more confidence in your code. . ;

there are commercial packet generators that do this and also a few freely available ones like packeth and bit-twist
there are also other creative solutions
for example do the packets need to be ip packets for your purpose
if not you could always get a dumb switch or hub no spanning-tree or other loop protection and plug a crossover cable into it
or a straight-through ethernet cable would work if the switch supports auto-mdix the idea would be that with a loop in your network the hub switch will flood the network to 100 for you since it will continually re-forward the same packets
if you try this be sure yours is the only computer on the network since this technique will effectively render it useless
-
you could always send some ip broadcast packets to seed the loop
otherwise the first thing i think you d likely see is broadcast arp packets which won t help if you re measuring layer 3 traffic only
lastly and especially if this sounds like too much trouble i recommend you read up on dependency injection and refactor your code so you can test it without the need for a high-speed interface
of course you ll still need to test your code in a real high-speed environment but doing this will give you much more confidence in your code



<p>If I run <code>tf workspace /new /noprompt</code> to create a local TFS workspace, it appears to automatically create a working folder mapping of $/ -> <code>current-dir</code>. This is annoying as I have to remove it before setting up the working folders I actually want. It also means <code>tf workspace</code> will fail if another workspace has a working folder to any any sub-dir of my current directory.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>e.g. if D: is my TFS dir, running <code>D:\&gt;tf workspace /new /noprompt ...</code> will fail if <em>any</em> other working folder is set up, because the automatic mapping /$ -> d:\ conflicts.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Isn't it possible to create the workspace with <em>no</em> initial working folders? Otherwise I deliberately have to change-dir to some 'fake' directory to make sure.</p>&#xA;

<p>First you need to instruct Apache to listen on the ports you need:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Listen 80&#xA;Listen 8089&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Second you need to tell it what to do with 80 and 8089 traffic:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;VirtualHost *:80&gt;&#xA;    DocumentRoot /website/site80&#xA;    ServerName internet.dev&#xA;&lt;/VirtualHost&gt;&#xA;&#xA;&lt;VirtualHost *:8089&gt;&#xA;    DocumentRoot /website/site8089&#xA;&lt;/VirtualHost&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Third you need to "allow" Apache to use those directories:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;Directory "C:/website/site80"&gt;&#xA;    Options Indexes FollowSymLinks Includes ExecCGI&#xA;    AllowOverride All&#xA;    Order allow,deny&#xA;    Allow from all&#xA;&lt;/Directory&gt;&#xA;&#xA;&lt;Directory "C:/website/site8089"&gt;&#xA;    Options Indexes FollowSymLinks Includes ExecCGI&#xA;    AllowOverride All&#xA;    Order allow,deny&#xA;    Allow from all&#xA;&lt;/Directory&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 first you need to instruct apache to listen on the ports you need: . ;. ;  . ;. ; second you need to tell it what to do with 80 and 8089 traffic: . ;. ;  . ;. ; third you need to "allow" apache to use those directories: . ;. ;  . ;

first you need to instruct apache to listen on the ports you need
second you need to tell it what to do with 80 and 8089 traffic
third you need to allow apache to use those directories



<p>I am trying to write a ruby string to a file in such a way that any newline characters embedded in the string remain embedded. This is being written out to a file which will then be processed by another tool.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>An example is below.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>I want this: 1 [label="this is a\ntest"] \n (second \n is a true newline)&#xA;I have tried this: string = '1 [label="this is a\ntest"]' + "\n"&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Any thoughts?</p>&#xA;

 i am trying to write a ruby string to a file in such a way that any newline characters embedded in the string remain embedded. this is being written out to a file which will then be processed by another tool. . ;. ; an example is below. . ;. ;  . ;. ; any thoughts? . ;

<p>Use <code>background-image</code> instead of <code>list-style-image</code>. First, you'll have to add these declarations for cross-browser compatibility.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>ul {&#xA;    list-style-type: none;  &#xA;    padding: 0px;&#xA;    margin: 0px;  &#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Then replace your <code>.moutlook</code> declarations with these:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>.moutlook {&#xA;    background-image: url(../images/icon.png);&#xA;    background-repeat: no-repeat;&#xA;    padding-left: (width of your image + 7) px;&#xA;    line-height: (height of your image) px;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>See this <a href="http://jsfiddle.net/wGXeG/">fiddle</a> for a live example.</p>&#xA;

<p><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/8544J.png" alt="Sample"></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I did something like that ones, let me try to explain it whit this simple drawing.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The black square is the background image, the grey one the sketch screen of Processing and the red ball your moving object.&#xA;The idea it's that while the distance between the side of the backImage and the side of the screen is greater than 0, you move the background image using the same speed than the ball, but in the opposite direction. Ones this condition changes you move the ball normally.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Hope this help's.&#xA;Regards&#xA;Jose</p>&#xA;

<p>The script with the definition of the <code>helloWorld</code> definition is put <em>after</em> the function is executed. This means JavaScript doesn't yet know the function and triggers this error.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Solution: Put your javascript below your imports (before <code>&lt;/body&gt;</code>, in the javascripts block for instance) or put the imports before the page javascript (in the head for instance).</p>&#xA;

 the script with the definition of the  helloworld  definition is put  after  the function is executed. this means javascript doesn't yet know the function and triggers this error. . ;. ; solution: put your javascript below your imports (before , in the javascripts block for instance) or put the imports before the page javascript (in the head for instance). . ;

the script with the definition of the helloworld definition is put after the function is executed
this means javascript doesn t yet know the function and triggers this error
solution put your javascript below your imports before in the javascripts block for instance or put the imports before the page javascript in the head for instance

<p>Not sure if there is a more elegant way, but you can do the following as a workaround:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Once the button is clicked</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li>Create a file</li>&#xA;<li>Write new default values instead of older ones</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;&#xA;<p>At the start of GUI</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li>Open the file</li>&#xA;<li>Get the default values</li>&#xA;<li>Set the default values on GUI</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;

 not sure if there is a more elegant way, but you can do the following as a workaround: . ;. ; once the button is clicked . ;. ; . ; create a file . ; write new default values instead of older ones . ; . ;. ; at the start of gui . ;. ; . ; open the file . ; get the default values . ; set the default values on gui . ; . ;

once the button is clicked
create a file
write new default values instead of older ones
at the start of gui
open the file
get the default values
set the default values on gui

<p>Possibly you haven't put the required libraries into the <a href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/guides/jar/jar.html#Main%20Attributes" rel="nofollow"><em>Class-path</em></a> attribute of your manifest file? </p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>Class-Path :</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>The value of this attribute specifies&#xA;  the relative URLs of the extensions or&#xA;  libraries that this application or&#xA;  extension needs. URLs are separated by&#xA;  one or more spaces. The application or&#xA;  extension class loader uses the value&#xA;  of this attribute to construct its&#xA;  internal search path.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Read <a href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/guides/jar/jar.html#JAR%20Manifest" rel="nofollow">this tutorial</a> about manifest files. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And there's an <a href="http://ant.apache.org/manual/Tasks/manifest.html" rel="nofollow">ant task</a> for creating one on the fly.</p>&#xA;

<p>Here is another way.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>SELECT *&#xA;FROM item_list&#xA;WHERE itemNAME&#xA;IN (&#xA;SELECT itemNAME&#xA;FROM   item_list&#xA;WHERE  &#xA;(itemID = '17'&#xA;AND    (itemSUB ='1' OR itemSUB ='0')&#xA; )&#xA;OR&#xA;(&#xA;itemID = '57' AND    (itemSUB ='0' OR itemSUB ='0')&#xA;)&#xA;&#xA;)&#xA;ORDER  BY itemSUB DESC&#xA;LIMIT  1&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>However, unless you are practising subqueries, you don't need one.  You just need this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>SELECT *&#xA;FROM   item_list&#xA;WHERE  &#xA;(itemID = '17'&#xA;AND    (itemSUB ='1' OR itemSUB ='0')&#xA; )&#xA;OR&#xA;(&#xA;itemID = '57' AND    (itemSUB ='0' OR itemSUB ='0')&#xA;)&#xA;ORDER  BY itemSUB DESC&#xA;LIMIT  1&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>Looking for some expert advice here about how best to style the following HTML:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;body&gt;&#xA;-Some content-&#xA;&lt;div class="parent" style="height:50%;"&gt;&#xA;&lt;div class="child" style="background-color:#FF9999;"&gt;An image&lt;/div&gt;&#xA;&lt;div class="child" style="background-color:#9999FF;"&gt;Some text&lt;/div&gt;&#xA;&lt;/div&gt;&#xA;&lt;/body&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>To obtain a result that behaves like this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/kuJry.png" alt="enter image description here"></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The criteria that I am working with are the following:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li>The container div, .parent, is a block element and fills the entire width of the browser window.</li>&#xA;<li>I know the width of the first/left inner div, in pixels but not as a percentage, based on the regularity of the images that will go there.</li>&#xA;<li>I don't know the width of the second/right inner div - as it contains a variable amount of text that should automatically fill the entire space to the right, regardless of browser window width</li>&#xA;<li>The height of the first/left div, when shorter than the second/right div, should stretch to the same height (here's the reason: the first/left div will have a right-border to set it off from the second/right div, and this border should be the height of the .parent div; however, the first/left div is not always present in the mark-up, in which case the border should not appear).</li>&#xA;<li>I cannot use JavaScript trickery.</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Solutions I have tried based on my experience and help from web sources:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ol>&#xA;<li><p>Float:&#xA;The traditional method that uses float:left leaves me apparently unable to stretch the first/left div to the (variable) height of either its sibling or .parent.</p></li>&#xA;<li><p>Inline-block:&#xA;.parent {background-color:#999999;}&#xA;.parent > .child {display:inline-block;vertical-align:top;height:100%;}</p></li>&#xA;</ol>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Using display:inline-block appears to work like a charm when the text in the second/right div is not enough to fill an entire line.  The moment there is more text, however, the second/right div grows as wide as the outer container will let it, forcing it to wrap under the first/right div.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Any insights would be much appreciated!</p>&#xA;

 looking for some expert advice here about how best to style the following html: . ;. ;  . ;. ; to obtain a result that behaves like this: . ;. ;   . ;. ; the criteria that i am working with are the following: . ;. ; . ; the container div, .parent, is a block element and fills the entire width of the browser window. . ; i know the width of the first/left inner div, in pixels but not as a percentage, based on the regularity of the images that will go there. . ; i don't know the width of the second/right inner div - as it contains a variable amount of text that should automatically fill the entire space to the right, regardless of browser window width . ; the height of the first/left div, when shorter than the second/right div, should stretch to the same height (here's the reason: the first/left div will have a right-border to set it off from the second/right div, and this border should be the height of the .parent div; however, the first/left div is not always present in the mark-up, in which case the border should not appear). . ; i cannot use javascript trickery. . ; . ;. ; solutions i have tried based on my experience and help from web sources: . ;. ; . ;  float:. ;the traditional method that uses float:left leaves me apparently unable to stretch the first/left div to the (variable) height of either its sibling or .parent.  . ;  inline-block:. ;.parent {background-color:#999999;}. ;.parent > .child {display:inline-block;vertical-align:top;height:100%;}  . ; . ;. ; using display:inline-block appears to work like a charm when the text in the second/right div is not enough to fill an entire line.  the moment there is more text, however, the second/right div grows as wide as the outer container will let it, forcing it to wrap under the first/right div. . ;. ; any insights would be much appreciated! . ;

looking for some expert advice here about how best to style the following html
to obtain a result that behaves like this
the criteria that i am working with are the following
the container div .parent is a block element and fills the entire width of the browser window
i know the width of the first left inner div in pixels but not as a percentage based on the regularity of the images that will go there
i don t know the width of the second right inner div - as it contains a variable amount of text that should automatically fill the entire space to the right regardless of browser window width
the height of the first left div when shorter than the second right div should stretch to the same height here s the reason the first left div will have a right-border to set it off from the second right div and this border should be the height of the .parent div
however the first left div is not always present in the mark-up in which case the border should not appear
i cannot use javascript trickery
solutions i have tried based on my experience and help from web sources
float
the traditional method that uses float left leaves me apparently unable to stretch the first left div to the variable height of either its sibling or .parent
inline-block
.parent background-color #999999

.parent .child display inline-block
vertical-align top
height 100

using display inline-block appears to work like a charm when the text in the second right div is not enough to fill an entire line
the moment there is more text however the second right div grows as wide as the outer container will let it forcing it to wrap under the first right div
any insights would be much appreciated



<p>This is not exact answer. But I hope guide you some extent.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><code>__udp4_lib_rcv+0x16f/0x680</code> is the trouble maker.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>offending instruction is <code>0x16f</code> bytes from the start of the function <code>__udp4_lib_rcv</code> with <code>0x680</code> bytes long in total. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I suggest to reproduce the issue and investigate in this area. </p>&#xA;

 this is not exact answer. but i hope guide you some extent. . ;. ;  __udp4_lib_rcv+0x16f/0x680  is the trouble maker. . ;. ; offending instruction is  0x16f  bytes from the start of the function  __udp4_lib_rcv  with  0x680  bytes long in total.  . ;. ; i suggest to reproduce the issue and investigate in this area.  . ;

this is not exact answer
but i hope guide you some extent

offending instruction is 0x16f bytes from the start of the function __udp4_lib_rcv with 0x680 bytes long in total
i suggest to reproduce the issue and investigate in this area

<p>I'm trying to write a Fizz Buzz script using a <code>while</code> loop to cycle through the numbers <code>1-100</code> and <code>echo</code> each one to the screen.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I'm using the modulus operator to find if a number is a multiple of:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li>3 in which case it echos Fizz,</li>&#xA;<li>5 in which case it echos Buzz,</li>&#xA;<li>or if its a multiple of both 3 and 5 it echos FizzBuzz </li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I've written the code below, tested all its parts and it seems to work, but when I run the script, it gets stuck in an infinite loop, echoing <code>Fizz</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>$i = 1;&#xA;&#xA;while ($i &lt;= 100) {&#xA;&#xA;    if ((3 % $i) === 0) {&#xA;        echo 'Fizz';&#xA;        $i = $i++;&#xA;    } else if ((5 % $i) === 0) {    &#xA;        $i = $i++;&#xA;        echo 'Buzz';        &#xA;    } else if ( ((3 % $i) === 0) &amp;&amp; ((5 % $i) === 0)){&#xA;        echo 'FizzBuzz';&#xA;    } else {&#xA;        echo $i++;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Any idea were I went wrong?</p>&#xA;

 i'm trying to write a fizz buzz script using a  while  loop to cycle through the numbers  1-100  and  echo  each one to the screen. . ;. ; i'm using the modulus operator to find if a number is a multiple of: . ;. ; . ; 3 in which case it echos fizz, . ; 5 in which case it echos buzz, . ; or if its a multiple of both 3 and 5 it echos fizzbuzz  . ; . ;. ; i've written the code below, tested all its parts and it seems to work, but when i run the script, it gets stuck in an infinite loop, echoing  fizz . . ;. ;  . ;. ; any idea were i went wrong? . ;

5 in which case it echos buzz
or if its a multiple of both 3 and 5 it echos fizzbuzz

any idea were i went wrong

<p>I would also suggest, like Tudor, to use only one agent. But then I would use inheritance, declaring a base_driver and a base_sequencer (that may have common functionalities from both ModeA or ModeB drivers and/or sequencers), and ModeA and ModeB units would extend those base ones. Then, in the agent, and using a flag in the uvm_config_db set in each test, you would select between instantiating one or the other:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Base driver:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>class my_proj_base_driver extends uvm_driver#(my_proj_tr);&#xA;[...]&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>ModeA driver:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>class my_proj_ModeA_driver extends my_proj_base_driver;&#xA;[...]&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>ModeB driver:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>class my_proj_ModeB_driver extends my_proj_base_driver;&#xA;[...]&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In the agent:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>[...]&#xA;&#xA;my_proj_base_driver driver;&#xA;bit modeAorB // 0 for A, 1 for B&#xA;&#xA;[...]&#xA;&#xA;if (!uvm_config_db#(bit)::get(this,"","modeAorB", modeAorB))&#xA;  `uvm_fatal("NOMODE","No mode set for this agent")&#xA;&#xA;if(!modeAorB)&#xA;  driver = my_proj_ModeA_driver::type_id::create(.name("driver"), .parent(this));&#xA;else&#xA;  driver = my_proj_ModeB_driver::type_id::create(.name("driver"), .parent(this));&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And the same for the sequencer.</p>&#xA;

 i would also suggest, like tudor, to use only one agent. but then i would use inheritance, declaring a base_driver and a base_sequencer (that may have common functionalities from both modea or modeb drivers and/or sequencers), and modea and modeb units would extend those base ones. then, in the agent, and using a flag in the uvm_config_db set in each test, you would select between instantiating one or the other: . ;. ; base driver: . ;. ;  . ;. ; modea driver: . ;. ;  . ;. ; modeb driver: . ;. ;  . ;. ; in the agent: . ;. ;  . ;. ; and the same for the sequencer. . ;

i would also suggest like tudor to use only one agent
but then i would use inheritance declaring a base_driver and a base_sequencer that may have common functionalities from both modea or modeb drivers and or sequencers and modea and modeb units would extend those base ones
then in the agent and using a flag in the uvm_config_db set in each test you would select between instantiating one or the other

<p>How to use displatch_once, so the given code is executed once, per instance lifetime</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Equivalent would be to have a property inside the object, and use it like this</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>- (void)viewWillAppear:(..).. {&#xA;&#xA;   ...&#xA;&#xA;   if (self.isDisplatched == NO) {&#xA;      ...&#xA;      self.isDisplatched = YES;&#xA;   }&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>But i don't want to use an extra property, but the dispatch_once_t or simmilar</p>&#xA;

<p>Welcome to the world of Python iterators :)</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You have the right idea with the list comprehensions, except you want it to lazy-load and not build up the entire list in memory first (which may even be untenable for very large files): use <strong>generator expressions</strong> instead, which have the same syntax except the square brackets are replaced by parentheses (which you can omit if it is the sole argument to a function):</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>with open(filename) as f:&#xA;    for l in (l.strip() for l in f.readlines()):&#xA;        print(l)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p><strong>Source:</strong> Read more about them in <a href="http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0289/" rel="nofollow">the relevant Python Enhancement Proposal</a> and the <a href="https://docs.python.org/3/reference/expressions.html#grammar-token-generator_expression" rel="nofollow">official docs</a>.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<hr>&#xA;&#xA;<p>An alternative, functional way of doing it with a syntax similar to LISP's is using <code>map</code> which applies a function to each element of an iterator ?it doesn't have to be a sequence, and assuming you're on Python this will involve looping through all the lines just once:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>for l in map(lambda l: l.strip (), f):&#xA;    print(l)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<hr>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Also, <code>f.readlines()</code> would probably be clearer than just looping over <code>f</code>, and a <code>with</code> statement is more Pythonic than calling <code>f.close()</code> yourself.</p>&#xA;

 welcome to the world of python iterators :) . ;. ; you have the right idea with the list comprehensions, except you want it to lazy-load and not build up the entire list in memory first (which may even be untenable for very large files): use  generator expressions  instead, which have the same syntax except the square brackets are replaced by parentheses (which you can omit if it is the sole argument to a function): . ;. ;  . ;. ; . ;    source:  read more about them in  the relevant python enhancement proposal  and the  official docs . . ; . ;. ; . ;. ; an alternative, functional way of doing it with a syntax similar to lisp's is using  map  which applies a function to each element of an iterator ?it doesn't have to be a sequence, and assuming you're on python this will involve looping through all the lines just once: . ;. ;  . ;. ; . ;. ; also,  f.readlines()  would probably be clearer than just looping over  f , and a  with  statement is more pythonic than calling  f.close()  yourself. . ;

welcome to the world of python iterators
you have the right idea with the list comprehensions except you want it to lazy-load and not build up the entire list in memory first which may even be untenable for very large files use generator expressions instead which have the same syntax except the square brackets are replaced by parentheses which you can omit if it is the sole argument to a function
source read more about them in the relevant python enhancement proposal and the official docs
an alternative functional way of doing it with a syntax similar to lisp s is using map which applies a function to each element of an iterator it doesn t have to be a sequence and assuming you re on python this will involve looping through all the lines just once
also f.readlines would probably be clearer than just looping over f and a with statement is more pythonic than calling f.close yourself

<p>You could use an open source shader managing library like mine:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="https://github.com/ILOVEPIE/Shader.js" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/ILOVEPIE/Shader.js</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>It lets you load shaders from urls and caches shader source code for future visits to the site.&#xA;It also makes it simpler to use uniforms.</p>&#xA;

<p>You should not really mix file handle and file descriptor calls like that.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>What's almost certainly happening without the fflush is that the <code>some string</code> is waiting in file handle buffers for delivery to the file descriptor. You then truncate the file descriptor and fclose the file handle, flushing the string, hence it shows up in the file.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><em>With</em> the fflush, <code>some string</code> is sent to the file descriptor and <em>then</em> you truncate it. With no further flushing, the file stays truncated.</p>&#xA;

 you should not really mix file handle and file descriptor calls like that. . ;. ; what's almost certainly happening without the fflush is that the  some string  is waiting in file handle buffers for delivery to the file descriptor. you then truncate the file descriptor and fclose the file handle, flushing the string, hence it shows up in the file. . ;. ;  with  the fflush,  some string  is sent to the file descriptor and  then  you truncate it. with no further flushing, the file stays truncated. . ;

you should not really mix file handle and file descriptor calls like that
what s almost certainly happening without the fflush is that the some string is waiting in file handle buffers for delivery to the file descriptor
you then truncate the file descriptor and fclose the file handle flushing the string hence it shows up in the file
with the fflush some string is sent to the file descriptor and then you truncate it
with no further flushing the file stays truncated



<pre><code>SELECT  MIN(price) AS min_price,&#xA;        LEFT(date, 7) AS yyyy_mm&#xA;    FROM aircrafts_in_parsed_data&#xA;    GROUP BY LEFT(date, 7)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>will get the lowest price for each month.  But it can't say 'first'.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>From <a href="http://mysql.rjweb.org/doc.php/groupwise_max" rel="nofollow">my groupwise-max cheat-sheet</a>, I derive this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>SELECT&#xA;        yyyy_mm, date, price, airline  -- The desired columns&#xA;    FROM&#xA;      ( SELECT  @prev := '' ) init&#xA;    JOIN&#xA;      ( SELECT  LEFT(date, 7) != @prev  AS first,&#xA;                @prev := LEFT(date, 7)&#xA;                LEFT(date, 7) AS yyyy_mm, date, price, airline&#xA;            FROM  aircrafts_in_parsed_data&#xA;            ORDER BY&#xA;                LEFT(date, 7),   -- The 'GROUP BY'&#xA;                price ASC,       -- ASC to do "MIN()"&#xA;                date             -- To get the 'first' if there are dup prices for a month&#xA;      ) x&#xA;    WHERE  first           -- extract only the first of the lowest price for each month&#xA;    ORDER BY  yyyy_mm;     -- Whatever you like&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Sorry, but subqueries are necessary.  (I avoided <code>YEAR()</code>, <code>MONTH()</code>, and <code>DAY()</code>.)</p>&#xA;

  . ;. ; will get the lowest price for each month.  but it can't say 'first'. . ;. ; from  my groupwise-max cheat-sheet , i derive this: . ;. ;  . ;. ; sorry, but subqueries are necessary.  (i avoided  year() ,  month() , and  day() .) . ;

will get the lowest price for each month
but it can t say first
from my groupwise-max cheat-sheet i derive this
sorry but subqueries are necessary
i avoided year month and day .



<p>I have a model for which i'll have one single instance, so i need to override the changelist_view to by-pass it (only if i have at least one record saved), and jump directly to change_view. i found snippet online and it works well for it, so i wrote my custom changelist_view:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>def changelist_view(self, request, extra_context=None):&#xA;    queryset = self.model.objects.all()&#xA;    if queryset.count()&gt;0:&#xA;        try:&#xA;            obj = queryset[0]&#xA;            return self.change_view(request, str(obj.id), extra_context)&#xA;        except IndexError:&#xA;            pass&#xA;    return super(MyModelAdmin, self).changelist_view(request, extra_context)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>this works until I try to save. The difference from the normal change_view is in the url. the normal has the object id:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/myapp/mymodel/2&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>instead with modified version i have:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/myapp/mymodel/&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>if i try to save i got this error:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>    You called this URL via POST, but the URL doesn't end &#xA;    in a slash and you have APPEND_SLASH set. Django can't redirect to &#xA;    the slash URL while maintaining POST data. Change your form to &#xA;    point to 127.0.0.1:8000/admin/myapp1/mymodel/None/ (note &#xA;    the trailing slash), or set APPEND_SLASH=False in your &#xA;    Django settings.&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>At the moment the only trick that works for me is a HttpResponseRedirect(url), with as url the change_view url hardcoded with object id. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>is there a more elegant way?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>thanks&#xA;Luke</p>&#xA;

 i have a model for which i'll have one single instance, so i need to override the changelist_view to by-pass it (only if i have at least one record saved), and jump directly to change_view. i found snippet online and it works well for it, so i wrote my custom changelist_view: . ;. ;  . ;. ; this works until i try to save. the difference from the normal change_view is in the url. the normal has the object id: . ;. ;  . ;. ; instead with modified version i have: . ;. ;  . ;. ; if i try to save i got this error: . ;. ;  . ;. ; at the moment the only trick that works for me is a httpresponseredirect(url), with as url the change_view url hardcoded with object id.  . ;. ; is there a more elegant way? . ;. ; thanks. ;luke . ;

i have a model for which i ll have one single instance so i need to override the changelist_view to by-pass it only if i have at least one record saved and jump directly to change_view
i found snippet online and it works well for it so i wrote my custom changelist_view
this works until i try to save
the difference from the normal change_view is in the url
the normal has the object id
instead with modified version i have
if i try to save i got this error
at the moment the only trick that works for me is a httpresponseredirect url with as url the change_view url hardcoded with object id
is there a more elegant way
thanks
luke

<p>I'm building a web app using AngularJS. The app needs to poll a URL that returns JSON data and make that data available to any part of the app. From what I've read so far, my best bet is to create a service that handles the polling and keeps its own internal cache of the JSON data, and then inject the service into any part of the app that wants to consult that data. What I'm lost on is how to actually go about doing that. The closest example I've found is <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13937318/convert-angular-http-get-function-to-a-service">this question</a>, but it appears to be creating a service that's manually called by a specific controller (which is itself tied to a given route), whereas I want something that persistently runs in the background of the app forever regardless of what part of the app is active. Is this doable, or am I taking the completely wrong approach?</p>&#xA;

<p>I think you're conflating security and permissions with Django's authentication system. For the most part, Django's tools are mainly designed for separating users into two groups: authenticated (logged in), and anonymous. This makes sense for 90% of the web sites out there, as you don't really need too much differentiation (maybe another for a hidden admin, but that's an edge case, rather than the norm).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The permission_required decorator is a very simple hook for people wishing to redirect people who failed to have permissions to go to the login page. At some point, though, this is not enough. If you need a specific permission and the user does not have it, how does redirecting them to the login page help them?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In this case, it's so easy to roll your own decorator using the messages for specific errors. One such example:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>def user_has_permissions(method):&#xA;    return user_passes_test(lambda u: u.has_perm('my_permission'), login_url='/permission-denied/')(method)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 i think you're conflating security and permissions with django's authentication system. for the most part, django's tools are mainly designed for separating users into two groups: authenticated (logged in), and anonymous. this makes sense for 90% of the web sites out there, as you don't really need too much differentiation (maybe another for a hidden admin, but that's an edge case, rather than the norm). . ;. ; the permission_required decorator is a very simple hook for people wishing to redirect people who failed to have permissions to go to the login page. at some point, though, this is not enough. if you need a specific permission and the user does not have it, how does redirecting them to the login page help them? . ;. ; in this case, it's so easy to roll your own decorator using the messages for specific errors. one such example: . ;. ;  . ;

i think you re conflating security and permissions with django s authentication system
for the most part django s tools are mainly designed for separating users into two groups authenticated logged in and anonymous
this makes sense for 90 of the web sites out there as you don t really need too much differentiation maybe another for a hidden admin but that s an edge case rather than the norm
the permission_required decorator is a very simple hook for people wishing to redirect people who failed to have permissions to go to the login page
at some point though this is not enough
if you need a specific permission and the user does not have it how does redirecting them to the login page help them
in this case it s so easy to roll your own decorator using the messages for specific errors
one such example

<p>you must try using a wide system <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms644959%28v=vs.85%29.aspx" rel="nofollow">hook</a> to detect the mouse activity. check the <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms644959%28v=vs.85%29.aspx#wh_mouse_llhook" rel="nofollow"><code>WH_MOUSE_LL</code></a> and the <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms644959%28v=vs.85%29.aspx#wh_mousehook" rel="nofollow"><code>WH_MOUSE</code></a> hooks.</p>&#xA;

<p>You are right, <code>the_content()</code> echos the content rather than returning it. Read the <a href="https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/the_content/" rel="nofollow">WordPress manual</a>. You will find the source code:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>function the_content( $more_link_text = null, $strip_teaser = false) {&#xA;  $content = get_the_content( $more_link_text, $strip_teaser );&#xA;&#xA;  /**&#xA;   * Filter the post content.&#xA;   *&#xA;   * @since 0.71&#xA;   *&#xA;   * @param string $content Content of the current post.&#xA;   */&#xA;  $content = apply_filters( 'the_content', $content );&#xA;  $content = str_replace( ']]&gt;', ']]&amp;gt;', $content );&#xA;  echo $content;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>As you can see, it outputs the content. You can use use <code>get_the_content()</code> to check if there is any. Then output your <code>&lt;div&gt;</code> or what ever you want, call <code>the_content()</code> and after that output <code>&lt;/div&gt;</code>. Do not try to concatenate <code>the_content</code> into a string.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You might also want to store <code>get_the_content()</code> into a variable and apply filters and do the string replace yourself within the <code>if</code> block.</p>&#xA;

 you are right,  the_content()  echos the content rather than returning it. read the  wordpress manual . you will find the source code: . ;. ;  . ;. ; as you can see, it outputs the content. you can use use  get_the_content()  to check if there is any. then output your  or what ever you want, call  the_content()  and after that output . do not try to concatenate  the_content  into a string. . ;. ; you might also want to store  get_the_content()  into a variable and apply filters and do the string replace yourself within the  if  block. . ;

you are right the_content echos the content rather than returning it
read the wordpress manual
you will find the source code
as you can see it outputs the content
you can use use get_the_content to check if there is any
then output your or what ever you want call the_content and after that output
do not try to concatenate the_content into a string
you might also want to store get_the_content into a variable and apply filters and do the string replace yourself within the if block

Then it should be work. </p>&#xA;

<p>I have a code generator that parses xml specifications of classes &amp; properties - including the type of each property.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Properties of type <code>string</code> <code>int</code> <code>bool</code> are simple to process.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>But if the type is not a primitive then I need to determine if it's a <code>class</code> or an <code>enum</code></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If I had an instance <code>MyObject</code> of <code>MyType</code> I could determine if <code>MyType</code> was an <code>enum type</code> via : </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>if (MyType.IsEnum()) {}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>but all I have is the name of the type.</p>&#xA;

 i have a code generator that parses xml specifications of classes   properties - including the type of each property. . ;. ; properties of type  string   int   bool  are simple to process. . ;. ; but if the type is not a primitive then i need to determine if it's a  class  or an  enum  . ;. ; if i had an instance  myobject  of  mytype  i could determine if  mytype  was an  enum type  via :  . ;. ;  . ;. ; but all i have is the name of the type. . ;

i have a code generator that parses xml specifications of classes properties - including the type of each property
properties of type string int bool are simple to process
but if the type is not a primitive then i need to determine if it s a class or an enum
if i had an instance myobject of mytype i could determine if mytype was an enum type via
but all i have is the name of the type



<p>Here's my htm file including the javascript functions.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;html&gt;&#xA;&lt;head&gt;&#xA;&lt;title&gt;Personal Info&lt;/title&gt;&#xA;&lt;script type="text/javascript" src="library.js"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;&#xA;&lt;script type="text/javascript"&gt;&#xA;   var IE= window.ActiveXObject ? true:false;&#xA;   var MOZ= document.implementation.createDocument ? true: false;&#xA;&#xA;   var xmlFile="person.xml";&#xA;   var xsltFile="person.xsl";&#xA;&#xA;   var xmlDoc;  &lt;!--//Source XML document--&gt;&#xA;   var xsltDoc; &lt;!--//XSLT style sheet document for person.xsl--&gt;&#xA;&#xA;   function createXDoc(xFile, PID)&#xA;   {&#xA;    if (IE) {&#xA;    xDoc=new ActiveXObject(getPID(PID));&#xA;    }&#xA;    else if (MOZ) {&#xA;    xDoc= document.implementation.createDocument("", "", null);&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    loadDoc(xDoc, xFile);&#xA;    return xDoc;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;function runTransform(xDoc, xsltDoc) {&#xA;    if (IE) {&#xA;    var resultStr=xDoc.transformNode(xsltDoc);&#xA;         }&#xA;    }               &#xA;function init() &#xA;           {&#xA;           var myElem= document.getElementById("persontable");&#xA;           xmlDoc=createXDoc(xmlFile, DOMPID);&#xA;           xsltDoc= createXDoc(xsltFile, DOMPID);&#xA;           myElem.innerHTML=runTransform(xmlDoc, xsltDoc);&#xA;     }&#xA;&lt;/script&gt;&#xA;&lt;/head&gt;&#xA;&lt;body&gt;&#xA;&lt;div&gt;&#xA;&lt;h1 class="title"&gt;&#xA;     &lt;/select&gt;  &#xA;&lt;/div&gt;&#xA;&lt;div id="persontable"&gt;&#xA;   &lt;!--Contents goes here--&gt;&#xA;&lt;/div&gt;&#xA;&lt;/body&gt;&#xA;&lt;/html&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Here's my XML file.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;person&gt;&#xA;  &lt;last_name&gt;Nicholson&lt;/last_name&gt;&#xA;  &lt;state&gt;MI&lt;/state&gt;&#xA;&lt;/person&gt;&#xA;&lt;person&gt;&#xA;  &lt;first_name&gt;Jane&lt;/first_name&gt;&#xA;  &lt;last_name&gt;Eyre&lt;/last_name&gt;&#xA;  &lt;state&gt;MN&lt;/state&gt;&#xA;&lt;/person&gt;&#xA;&lt;person&gt;&#xA;  &lt;first_name&gt;Michael&lt;/first_name&gt;&#xA;  &lt;last_name&gt;Johnson&lt;/last_name&gt;&#xA;  &lt;state&gt;MN&lt;/state&gt;&#xA;&lt;/person&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Here's my XSL file</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;xsl:stylesheet version='1.0' xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"&gt;&#xA;&lt;xsl:output method="html" version="4.0" omit-xml-declaration="yes" /&gt;&#xA;&lt;xsl:param name="group" select="//person" /&gt;&#xA;&lt;xsl:template match="/"&gt;&#xA;&lt;table&gt;&#xA;  &lt;tr&gt;&#xA;    &lt;th&gt;First_Name&lt;/th&gt;&#xA;    &lt;th&gt;Last_Name&lt;/th&gt; &#xA;  &lt;/tr&gt;   &#xA;&lt;xsl:apply-templates select="$group"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;xsl:sort select="Last_Name" data-type="text" order="descending" /&gt;&#xA;&lt;/xsl:apply-templates&gt; <p>Hi every one i hope you help me with this please</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I have a website where product are with euro currency but when i make payement on my gateway methode it deose not convert to mu local currency</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>for example i have a product which coast 1EURO so when i proceed to payement i should get 10MAD</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>here is my gateway code</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;?php&#xA;/**&#xA; * maroctelecommerce Payment Gateway&#xA; *&#xA; * Provides a maroctelecommerce Payment Gateway.&#xA; *&#xA; * @class       woocommerce_maroctelecommerce&#xA; * @package     WooCommerce&#xA; * @category    Payment Gateways&#xA; * @author      MarocTelecommerce - MTC&#xA; *&#xA; *&#xA; * Table Of Contents&#xA; *&#xA; * __construct() &#xA; * init_form_fields()&#xA; * setup_constants() &#xA; * plugin_url()&#xA; * is_valid_for_use()&#xA; * admin_options()&#xA; * payment_fields()&#xA; * generate_maroctelecommerce_form()&#xA; * process_payment()&#xA; * receipt_page()&#xA; * check_MTC_request_is_valid()&#xA; * check_MTC_response()&#xA; * successful_request()&#xA; * log()&#xA; * check_amounts()&#xA; */&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA; function utf8entities($source)&#xA;{&#xA;//    array used to figure what number to decrement from character order value &#xA;//    according to number of characters used to map unicode to ascii by utf-8&#xA;   $decrement[4] = 240;&#xA;   $decrement[3] = 224;&#xA;   $decrement[2] = 192;&#xA;   $decrement[1] = 0;&#xA;&#xA;//    the number of bits to shift each charNum by&#xA;   $shift[1][0] = 0;&#xA;   $shift[2][0] = 6;&#xA;   $shift[2][1] = 0;&#xA;   $shift[3][0] = 12;&#xA;   $shift[3][1] = 6;&#xA;   $shift[3][2] = 0;&#xA;   $shift[4][0] = 18;&#xA;   $shift[4][1] = 12;&#xA;   $shift[4][2] = 6;&#xA;   $shift[4][3] = 0;&#xA;&#xA;   $pos = 0;&#xA;   $len = strlen($source);&#xA;   $encodedString = '';&#xA;   while ($pos &lt; $len)&#xA;   {&#xA;      $charPos = substr($source, $pos, 1);&#xA;      $asciiPos = ord($charPos);&#xA;      if ($asciiPos &lt; 128)&#xA;      {&#xA;         $encodedString .= htmlentities($charPos);&#xA;         $pos++;&#xA;         continue;&#xA;      }&#xA;&#xA;      $i=1;&#xA;      if (($asciiPos &gt;= 240) &amp;&amp; ($asciiPos &lt;= 255))  // 4 chars representing one unicode character&#xA;         $i=4;&#xA;      else if (($asciiPos &gt;= 224) &amp;&amp; ($asciiPos &lt;= 239))  // 3 chars representing one unicode character&#xA;         $i=3;&#xA;      else if (($asciiPos &gt;= 192) &amp;&amp; ($asciiPos &lt;= 223))  // 2 chars representing one unicode character&#xA;         $i=2;&#xA;      else  // 1 char (lower ascii)&#xA;         $i=1;&#xA;      $thisLetter = substr($source, $pos, $i);&#xA;      $pos += $i;&#xA;&#xA;//       process the string representing the letter to a unicode entity&#xA;      $thisLen = strlen($thisLetter);&#xA;      $thisPos = 0;&#xA;      $decimalCode = 0;&#xA;      while ($thisPos &lt; $thisLen)&#xA;      {&#xA;         $thisCharOrd = ord(substr($thisLetter, $thisPos, 1));&#xA;         if ($thisPos == 0)&#xA;         {&#xA;            $charNum = intval($thisCharOrd - $decrement[$thisLen]);&#xA;            $decimalCode += ($charNum &lt;&lt; $shift[$thisLen][$thisPos]);&#xA;         }&#xA;         else&#xA;         {&#xA;            $charNum = intval($thisCharOrd - 128);&#xA;            $decimalCode += ($charNum &lt;&lt; $shift[$thisLen][$thisPos]);&#xA;         }&#xA;&#xA;         $thisPos++;&#xA;      }&#xA;&#xA;      $encodedLetter = '&amp;#'. str_pad($decimalCode, ($thisLen==1)?3:5, '0', STR_PAD_LEFT).';';&#xA;      $encodedString .= $encodedLetter;&#xA;   }&#xA;&#xA;   return $encodedString;&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;class WC_Gateway_maroctelecommerce extends WC_Payment_Gateway {&#xA;&#xA;    public $version = '1.0.0';&#xA;&#xA;    public function __construct() {&#xA;        global $woocommerce;&#xA;        $this-&gt;id           = 'maroctelecommerce';&#xA;        $this-&gt;method_title = __( 'maroctelecommerce', 'MarocTelecommerce - MTC' );&#xA;        $this-&gt;icon         = $this-&gt;plugin_url() . '/assets/images/icon.png';&#xA;        $this-&gt;has_fields   = true;&#xA;        $this-&gt;debug_email  = get_option( 'admin_email' );&#xA;&#xA;        // Setup available countries.&#xA;        $this-&gt;available_countries = array( 'FR' );&#xA;&#xA;        // Setup available currency codes.&#xA;        $this-&gt;available_currencies = array( 'MAD' );&#xA;&#xA;        // Load the form fields.&#xA;        $this-&gt;init_form_fields();&#xA;&#xA;        // Load the settings.&#xA;        $this-&gt;init_settings();&#xA;&#xA;        // Setup constants.&#xA;        $this-&gt;setup_constants();&#xA;&#xA;        // Setup default merchant data.&#xA;        $this-&gt;merchant_id = $this-&gt;settings['merchant_id'];&#xA;        $this-&gt;actionslk = $this-&gt;settings['actionslk'];&#xA;        $this-&gt;SLKSecretkey = $this-&gt;settings['SLKSecretkey'];&#xA;        $this-&gt;title = $this-&gt;settings['title'];&#xA;        $this-&gt;confirmation_mode = $this-&gt;settings['confirmation_mode'];&#xA;        if($this-&gt;confirmation_mode == "yes") $this-&gt;confirmation_mode = 1; else $this-&gt;confirmation_mode = 2 ;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        $this-&gt;response_url = add_query_arg( 'wc-api', 'WC_Gateway_maroctelecommerce', home_url( '/' ) );&#xA;&#xA;        add_action( 'woocommerce_api_wc_gateway_maroctelecommerce', array( $this, 'check_MTC_response' ) );&#xA;        add_action( 'valid-maroctelecommerce-standard-MTC-request', array( $this, 'successful_request' ) );&#xA;        /* 1.0.1 */&#xA;        add_action( 'woocommerce_update_options_payment_gateways', array( $this, 'process_admin_options' ) );&#xA;        /* 1.0 */&#xA;        add_action( 'woocommerce_update_options_payment_gateways_' . $this-&gt;id, array( $this, 'process_admin_options' ) );&#xA;        add_action( 'woocommerce_receipt_maroctelecommerce', array( $this, 'receipt_page' ) );&#xA;&#xA;        // Check if the base currency supports this gateway.&#xA;        if ( ! $this-&gt;is_valid_for_use() )&#xA;            $this-&gt;enabled = false;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * Initialise Gateway Settings Form Fields&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    function init_form_fields () {&#xA;&#xA;        $this-&gt;form_fields = array(&#xA;                            'enabled' =&gt; array(&#xA;                                            'title' =&gt; __( 'Enable/Disable', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'label' =&gt; __( 'Enable maroctelecommerce', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'type' =&gt; 'checkbox',&#xA;                                            'description' =&gt; __( 'This controls whether or not this gateway is enabled within WooCommerce.', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'default' =&gt; 'yes'&#xA;                                        ),&#xA;                            'title' =&gt; array(&#xA;                                            'title' =&gt; __( 'Title', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'type' =&gt; 'text',&#xA;                                            'description' =&gt; __( 'This controls the title which the user sees during checkout.', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'default' =&gt; __( 'Maroctelecommerce', 'woothemes' )&#xA;                                        ),&#xA;                            'description' =&gt; array(&#xA;                                            'title' =&gt; __( 'Description', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'type' =&gt; 'text',&#xA;                                            'description' =&gt; __( 'This controls the description which the user sees during checkout.', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'default' =&gt; ''&#xA;                                        ),&#xA;                            'merchant_id' =&gt; array(&#xA;                                            'title' =&gt; __( 'StoreID', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'type' =&gt; 'text',&#xA;                                            'description' =&gt; __( 'StoreID fourni par Maroctelecommerce.', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'default' =&gt; ''&#xA;                                        ),&#xA;                            'SLKSecretkey' =&gt; array(&#xA;                                            'title' =&gt; __( 'SLKSecretkey', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'type' =&gt; 'text',&#xA;                                            'description' =&gt; __( 'Cl�s secr�tes fourni par Maroctelecommerce.', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'default' =&gt; ''&#xA;                                        ),&#xA;                            'actionslk' =&gt; array(&#xA;                                            'title' =&gt; __( 'actionslk', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'type' =&gt; 'text',&#xA;                                            'description' =&gt; __( 'URL de la passerelle fourni par Maroctelecommerce.', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'default' =&gt; ''&#xA;                                        ),&#xA;                            'confirmation_mode' =&gt; array(&#xA;                                            'title' =&gt; __( 'Mode de confirmation', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'type' =&gt; 'checkbox',&#xA;                                            'label' =&gt; __( 'Confirmation automatique des transactions Maroctelecommerce.', 'woothemes' ),&#xA;                                            'default' =&gt; 'yes'&#xA;                                        )&#xA;                            );&#xA;&#xA;    } // End init_form_fields()&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * Get the plugin URL&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    function plugin_url() {&#xA;        if( isset( $this-&gt;plugin_url ) )&#xA;            return $this-&gt;plugin_url;&#xA;&#xA;        if ( is_ssl() ) {&#xA;            return $this-&gt;plugin_url = str_replace( 'http://', 'https://', WP_PLUGIN_URL ) . "/" . plugin_basename( dirname( dirname( __FILE__ ) ) );&#xA;        } else {&#xA;            return $this-&gt;plugin_url = WP_PLUGIN_URL . "/" . plugin_basename( dirname( dirname( __FILE__ ) ) );&#xA;        }&#xA;    } // End plugin_url()&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * is_valid_for_use()&#xA;     *&#xA;     * Check if this gateway is enabled and available in the base currency being traded with.&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    function is_valid_for_use() {&#xA;        global $woocommerce;&#xA;&#xA;        $is_available = false;&#xA;&#xA;        $user_currency = get_option( 'woocommerce_currency' );&#xA;&#xA;        $is_available_currency = in_array( $user_currency, $this-&gt;available_currencies );&#xA;&#xA;        if ($this-&gt;enabled == 'yes' &amp;&amp; $this-&gt;settings['merchant_id'] != '' )&#xA;            $is_available = true;&#xA;        return $is_available;&#xA;    } // End is_valid_for_use()&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * Admin Panel Options&#xA;     * - Options for bits like 'title' and availability on a country-by-country basis&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    public function admin_options() {&#xA;        // Make sure to empty the log file if not in test mode.&#xA;        if ( $this-&gt;settings['testmode'] != 'yes' ) {&#xA;            $this-&gt;log( '' );&#xA;            $this-&gt;log( '', true );&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        ?&gt;&#xA;        &lt;h3&gt;&lt;?php _e( 'Maroctelecommerce', 'MarocTelecommerce - MTC' ); ?&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;&#xA;&#xA;        &lt;?php&#xA;            ?&gt;&lt;table class="form-table"&gt;&lt;?php&#xA;            // Generate the HTML For the settings form.&#xA;            $this-&gt;generate_settings_html();&#xA;            ?&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;!--/.form-table--&gt;&#xA;        &lt;?php&#xA;    } // End admin_options()&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * There are no payment fields for maroctelecommerce, but we want to show the description if set.&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    function payment_fields() {&#xA;        if ( isset( $this-&gt;settings['description'] ) &amp;&amp; ( '' != $this-&gt;settings['description'] ) ) {&#xA;            echo wpautop( wptexturize( $this-&gt;settings['description'] ) );&#xA;        }&#xA;    } // End payment_fields()&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * Generate the maroctelecommerce button link.&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    public function generate_maroctelecommerce_form( $order_id ) {&#xA;&#xA;        global $woocommerce;&#xA;&#xA;        $order = new WC_Order( $order_id );&#xA;&#xA;        $shipping_name = explode(' ', $order-&gt;shipping_method);&#xA;        $user_currency = get_option( 'woocommerce_currency' );&#xA;&#xA;        $return_url = $this-&gt;get_return_url( $order );&#xA;        $cancel_url = $order-&gt;get_cancel_order_url();&#xA;        $notify_url = $this-&gt;response_url;&#xA;&#xA;        //Verify if data come from maroctelecommerce&#xA;        $dataMD5=$this-&gt;settings['actionslk'] . $order-&gt;order_total  . $this-&gt;settings['merchant_id'] . $order-&gt;id. $order-&gt;billing_email . $this-&gt;settings['SLKSecretkey'];&#xA;        //echo $dataMD5;&#xA;        $checksum=MD5(utf8entities(rawurlencode($dataMD5)));&#xA;        // Construct variables for post&#xA;        $lang = get_locale();&#xA;        if($lang == "fr-FR")&#xA;        {&#xA;            $lang = "FR";&#xA;        }else&#xA;        {&#xA;            $lang = "EN";&#xA;        }&#xA;        $this-&gt;data_to_send = array(&#xA;            // Merchant details&#xA;            'storeId' =&gt; $this-&gt;settings['merchant_id'],&#xA;            'updateURL' =&gt; $return_url,&#xA;            'offerURL' =&gt; $cancel_url,&#xA;            'bookURL' =&gt; $notify_url,&#xA;            'name' =&gt; $order-&gt;billing_first_name." ".$order-&gt;billing_last_name,&#xA;            'email' =&gt; $order-&gt;billing_email,&#xA;            'totalAmountTx' =&gt; $order-&gt;order_total,&#xA;            'checksum' =&gt; $checksum,&#xA;            'cartId' =&gt; $order-&gt;id,&#xA;            'langue' =&gt; $lang,&#xA;            'address' =&gt; $order-&gt;billing_address_1,&#xA;            'city' =&gt; $order-&gt;billing_city,&#xA;            'state' =&gt; $order-&gt;billing_state,&#xA;            'country' =&gt; $order-&gt;billing_country,&#xA;            'postCode' =&gt; $order-&gt;billing_postcode,&#xA;            'tel' =&gt; $order-&gt;billing_phone,&#xA;        );&#xA;&#xA;        $maroctelecommerce_args_array = array();&#xA;&#xA;        foreach ($this-&gt;data_to_send as $key =&gt; $value) {&#xA;            $maroctelecommerce_args_array[] = '&lt;input type="hidden" name="'.$key.'" value="'.$value.'" /&gt;';&#xA;        }&#xA;        wc_enqueue_js( '&#xA;            $.blockUI({&#xA;                    message: "' . esc_js( __( 'Merci pour votre commande. vous serez redirig?vers MarocTelecommerce pour effectuer le paiement.', 'woocommerce' ) ) . '",&#xA;                    baseZ: 99999,&#xA;                    overlayCSS:&#xA;                    {&#xA;                        background: "#fff",&#xA;                        opacity: 0.6&#xA;                    },&#xA;                    css: {&#xA;                        padding:        "20px",&#xA;                        zindex:         "9999999",&#xA;                        textAlign:      "center",&#xA;                        color:          "#555",&#xA;                        border:         "3px solid #aaa",&#xA;                        backgroundColor:"#fff",&#xA;                        cursor:         "wait",&#xA;                        lineHeight:     "24px",&#xA;                    }&#xA;                });&#xA;            jQuery("#submit_maroctelecommerce_payment_form").click();&#xA;        ' );&#xA;        return '&lt;form action="' .  $this-&gt;settings['actionslk']  . '" method="post" id="maroctelecommerce_payment_form" target="_top"&gt;&#xA;                ' . implode( '', $maroctelecommerce_args_array ) . '&#xA;                &lt;!-- Button Fallback --&gt;&#xA;                &lt;div class="payment_buttons"&gt;&#xA;                    &lt;input type="submit" class="button alt" id="submit_maroctelecommerce_payment_form" value="' . __( 'Payez via maroctelecommerce', 'woocommerce' ) . '" /&gt; &lt;a class="button cancel" href="' . esc_url( $order-&gt;get_cancel_order_url() ) . '"&gt;' . __( 'Annuler la commande', 'woocommerce' ) . '&lt;/a&gt;&#xA;                &lt;/div&gt;&#xA;                &lt;script type="text/javascript"&gt;&#xA;                    jQuery(".payment_buttons").hide();&#xA;                &lt;/script&gt;&#xA;            &lt;/form&gt;';&#xA;&#xA;    } // End generate_maroctelecommerce_form()&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * Process the payment and return the result.&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    function process_payment( $order_id ) {&#xA;&#xA;        $order = new WC_Order( $order_id );&#xA;&#xA;        return array(&#xA;            'result'    =&gt; 'success',&#xA;            'redirect'  =&gt; $order-&gt;get_checkout_payment_url( true )&#xA;        );&#xA;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * Reciept page.&#xA;     *&#xA;     * Display text and a button to direct the user to maroctelecommerce.&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    function receipt_page( $order ) {&#xA;        echo '&lt;p&gt;' . __( 'Merci pour votre commande, s\'il vous pla�t cliquez sur le bouton ci-dessous pour payer avec Maroctelecommerce.', 'woothemes' ) . '&lt;/p&gt;';&#xA;&#xA;        echo $this-&gt;generate_maroctelecommerce_form( $order );&#xA;    } // End receipt_page()&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * Check maroctelecommerce MTC validity.&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @param array $data&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    function check_MTC_request_is_valid( $data ) {          &#xA;&#xA;        global $woocommerce;&#xA;&#xA;        $pfError = false;&#xA;        $pfDone = false;&#xA;&#xA;        $orderNumber = $data['orderNumber'];&#xA;        $vendor_name = get_option( 'blogname' );&#xA;        $vendor_url = home_url( '/' );&#xA;&#xA;        $order_id = (int) $data['cartId'];&#xA;        $order = new WC_Order( $order_id );&#xA;        $order_key = $order-&gt;order_key;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        $dataMD5=$this-&gt;response_url . $data['totalAmountTx'] . $this-&gt;merchant_id . $order_id  . $data['email'] . $this-&gt;SLKSecretkey;&#xA;        //echo $dataMD5;&#xA;        $checksum=MD5(utf8entities(rawurlencode($dataMD5)));&#xA;&#xA;        $this-&gt;log( "\n" . '----------' . "\n" . 'maroctelecommerce call received' );&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        // Get data sent by maroctelecommerce&#xA;        if ( ! $pfError &amp;&amp; ! $pfDone ) {&#xA;            $this-&gt;log( 'Get posted data' );&#xA;&#xA;            $this-&gt;log( 'maroctelecommerce Data: '. print_r( $data, true ) );&#xA;&#xA;            if ( $data === false ) {&#xA;                $pfError = true;&#xA;                $pfErrMsg = BPI_ERR_BAD_ACCESS;&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        // Verify security checksum&#xA;        if( ! $pfError &amp;&amp; ! $pfDone ) {&#xA;            $this-&gt;log( 'Verify security checksum' );&#xA;&#xA;            // If checksum different, log for debugging&#xA;            if($checksum != $data['checksum']) {&#xA;                $pfError = true;&#xA;                $pfErrMsg = BPI_ERR_INVALID_SIGNATURE;&#xA;&#xA;                echo "0;" . $order_id . ";".date("Ymd").";2";&#xA;                exit;&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        // Get internal order and verify it hasn't already been processed&#xA;        if( ! $pfError &amp;&amp; ! $pfDone ) {&#xA;&#xA;            $this-&gt;log( "Purchase:\n". print_r( $order, true )  );&#xA;&#xA;            // Check if order has already been processed&#xA;            if( $order-&gt;status == 'completed' ) {&#xA;                $this-&gt;log( 'Order has already been processed' );&#xA;                $pfDone = true;&#xA;                echo "0;" . $order_id . ";".date("Ymd").";2";&#xA;                exit;&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        // Check data against internal order&#xA;        if( ! $pfError &amp;&amp; ! $pfDone ) {&#xA;            $this-&gt;log( 'Check data against internal order' );&#xA;&#xA;            // Check order amount&#xA;            if( ! $this-&gt;check_amounts( $data['totalAmountTx'], $order-&gt;order_total ) ) {&#xA;                $pfError = true;&#xA;                $pfErrMsg = BPI_ERR_AMOUNT_MISMATCH;&#xA;                echo "0;" . $order_id . ";".date("Ymd").";2";&#xA;                exit;&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        // Check status and update order&#xA;        if( ! $pfError &amp;&amp; ! $pfDone ) {&#xA;            $this-&gt;log( 'Check status and update order' );&#xA;&#xA;        if ( $order-&gt;order_key !== $order_key ) { exit; }&#xA;&#xA;                        $this-&gt;log( '- Complete' );         &#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        // If an error occurred&#xA;        if( $pfError ) {&#xA;            $this-&gt;log( 'Error occurred: '. $pfErrMsg );&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        // Close log&#xA;        $this-&gt;log( '', true );&#xA;&#xA;        return $pfError;&#xA;    } // End check_MTC_request_is_valid()&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * Check maroctelecommerce MTC response.&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    function check_MTC_response() {     &#xA;        $_POST = stripslashes_deep( $_REQUEST );&#xA;        if ( !$this-&gt;check_MTC_request_is_valid( $_POST ) ) {&#xA;            do_action( 'valid-maroctelecommerce-standard-MTC-request', $_POST );&#xA;        }&#xA;    } // End check_MTC_response()&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * Successful Payment!&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    function successful_request( $posted ) {&#xA;&#xA;        if ( ! isset( $posted['orderNumber'] ) &amp;&amp; ! is_numeric( $posted['orderNumber'] ) ) { return false; }&#xA;&#xA;        $order_id = (int) $posted['orderNumber'];&#xA;        $order = new WC_Order( $posted['cartId'] );&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        if ( $order-&gt;status !== 'completed' ) {&#xA;            // We are here so lets check status and do actions&#xA;&#xA;                $msg = 'Paiement accept?par MTC';&#xA;                $msg .= "\n" . '- M�thode de paiement: '.$posted['paymentBrandName'] ;&#xA;                $msg .= "\n" . '- les quatre derniers chiffres de la carte bancaire: '.$posted['ccn'];&#xA;                $msg .= "\n" . '- Date d\'expiration de la carte bancaire: '.$posted['expirationDate'];&#xA;                $msg .= "\n" . '- Nom de la banque: '.$posted['bankName'];&#xA;                if ($posted['paymentCardType'] == "1") $paymentCardType = "Carte Marocaine"; else  $paymentCardType = "Carte �trang�re";&#xA;                $msg .= "\n" . '- Type de la carte de paiement: '.$paymentCardType;&#xA;                $msg .= "\n" . '- Num�ro de paiement MTC (orderNumber): '.$posted['orderNumber'];&#xA;                $msg .= "\n" . '- Identifiant de l�autorisation de paiement accord�e par la banque du porteur: '.$posted['approvalCode'];&#xA;                $msg .= "\n" . '- Identifiant de la transaction chez le centre mon�tique: '.$posted['pmtSeqId'];&#xA;&#xA;                // Payment completed&#xA;                $order-&gt;add_order_note( __( $msg , 'woothemes' ) );&#xA;                $order-&gt;payment_complete();&#xA;&#xA;            //wp_redirect( $this-&gt;get_return_url( $order ) );&#xA;            echo "1;" . $order_id . ";".date("Ymd").";".$this-&gt;confirmation_mode;&#xA;                exit;&#xA;        } // End IF Statement&#xA;&#xA;        exit;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * Setup constants.&#xA;     *&#xA;     * Setup common values and messages used by the maroctelecommerce gateway.&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    function setup_constants () {&#xA;        global $woocommerce;&#xA;        //// Create user agent string&#xA;        // User agent constituents (for cURL)&#xA;        define( 'BPI_SOFTWARE_NAME', 'WooCommerce' );&#xA;        define( 'BPI_SOFTWARE_VER', $woocommerce-&gt;version );&#xA;        define( 'BPI_MODULE_NAME', 'WooCommerce-maroctelecommerce-Free' );&#xA;        define( 'BPI_MODULE_VER', $this-&gt;version );&#xA;&#xA;        // Features&#xA;        // - PHP&#xA;        $pfFeatures = 'PHP '. phpversion() .';';&#xA;&#xA;        // - cURL&#xA;        if( in_array( 'curl', get_loaded_extensions() ) )&#xA;        {&#xA;            define( 'BPI_CURL', '' );&#xA;            $pfVersion = curl_version();&#xA;            $pfFeatures .= ' curl '. $pfVersion['version'] .';';&#xA;        }&#xA;        else&#xA;            $pfFeatures .= ' nocurl;';&#xA;&#xA;        // Create user agrent&#xA;        define( 'BPI_USER_AGENT', BPI_SOFTWARE_NAME .'/'. BPI_SOFTWARE_VER .' ('. trim( $pfFeatures ) .') '. BPI_MODULE_NAME .'/'. BPI_MODULE_VER );&#xA;&#xA;        // General Defines&#xA;        define( 'BPI_TIMEOUT', 15 );&#xA;        define( 'BPI_EPSILON', 0.01 );&#xA;&#xA;        // Messages&#xA;            // Error&#xA;        define( 'BPI_ERR_AMOUNT_MISMATCH', __( 'Amount mismatch', 'woothemes' ) );&#xA;        define( 'BPI_ERR_BAD_ACCESS', __( 'Bad access of page', 'woothemes' ) );&#xA;        define( 'BPI_ERR_INVALID_SIGNATURE', __( 'Security signature mismatch', 'woothemes' ) );&#xA;&#xA;    } // End setup_constants()&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * log()&#xA;     *&#xA;     * Log system processes.&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;&#xA;    function log ( $message, $close = false ) {&#xA;&#xA;        static $fh = 0;&#xA;&#xA;        if( $close ) {&#xA;            @fclose( $fh );&#xA;        } else {&#xA;            // If file doesn't exist, create it&#xA;            if( !$fh ) {&#xA;                $pathinfo = pathinfo( __FILE__ );&#xA;                $dir = str_replace( '/classes', '/logs', $pathinfo['dirname'] );&#xA;                $fh = @fopen( $dir .'/maroctelecommerce.log', 'a+' );&#xA;            }&#xA;&#xA;            // If file was successfully created&#xA;            if( $fh ) {&#xA;                $line = $message ."\n";&#xA;&#xA;                fwrite( $fh, $line );&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;    } // End log()&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * check_amounts()&#xA;     *&#xA;     * Checks if received amount is equal to sent amount&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @param $amount1 Float 1st amount for comparison&#xA;     * @param $amount2 Float 2nd amount for comparison&#xA;     * @since 1.0.0&#xA;     */&#xA;    function check_amounts ( $amount1, $amount2 ) {&#xA;        if(number_format($amount1) !== number_format($amount2))return false;&#xA;        return true;&#xA;    } // End check_amounts()&#xA;&#xA;} // End Class&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Here the link to download it </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://www.maroctelecommerce.com/docs/woocommerce-gateway-maroctelecommerce.zip" rel="nofollow">http://www.maroctelecommerce.com/docs/woocommerce-gateway-maroctelecommerce.zip</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>here ise my website </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://sunassistanceservices.ma" rel="nofollow">http://sunassistanceservices.ma</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Thank you for help in advance</p>&#xA;

<p><code>HashSet</code> doesn't allow duplicated based on <code>hashCode</code> and <code>equals</code> methods, but arrays don't override such methods, so even if you have two arrays with the same content, they <strong>are not</strong> the <em>same</em> arrays, so they will be allowed in a <code>Set</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Use <code>List&lt;Integer&gt;</code> instead. Note the usage of <code>Integer</code> over <code>int</code> because generics don't support primitive types.</p>&#xA;

  hashset  doesn't allow duplicated based on  hashcode  and  equals  methods, but arrays don't override such methods, so even if you have two arrays with the same content, they  are not  the  same  arrays, so they will be allowed in a  set . . ;. ; use  instead. note the usage of  integer  over  int  because generics don't support primitive types. . ;

hashset doesn t allow duplicated based on hashcode and equals methods but arrays don t override such methods so even if you have two arrays with the same content they are not the same arrays so they will be allowed in a set
use instead
note the usage of integer over int because generics don t support primitive types

<p>Are there any reasons that PHP frameworks such as Laravel or Zend can not or should not be used with front-end frameworks such as Foundation or Bootstrap? Or any particular pitfalls/gotchas to be aware of?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Our site doesn't use frameworks of any kind at the moment but I'm keen to adopt both for scalability and ease of maintenance. Is there any best practice advice anyone can provide on the order adoption should take place in (e.g. always do the back-end framework first, followed by the front-end) or should the separation between the two layers be clean enough that the order shouldn't matter? </p>&#xA;
