<p>There are a lot of things wrong here, you should read some good basic docs about SignalR concepts first. The guide you are referring to is very poor. The main things you should check:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li>hubs are created by SignalR from scratch each time a hub method is called from a client, and then destroyed, therefore for something as basic as this you should not interfere with that, which instead you do with your event handler</li>&#xA;<li>because of the previous point, your <code>UserID</code> member is simply not in the right place, and it <em>sort of</em> works for you just because of wrong side effects you are generating with more mistakes (described below): do not store any state supposed to live across calls inside hubs instance members, it is not meant to survive</li>&#xA;<li>you explicitly do a <code>new NotificationHub()</code> for something that has nothing to do with SignalR broadcasting, you should move the sql dependency stuff outside of the hub and do it there, while leaving hubs do their own stuff only</li>&#xA;<li>when you change page your connection is lost, buy your event handler is (probably) artificially keeping a "dead" hub instance alive, and it uses it for notification, but that's simply wrong</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You should review your design, starting by managing the sql dependency outside of hubs. You already know about <code>IHubContext</code>, so use that from outside hubs, and you should use hubs just for what they are for, without keeping them alive artificially when attaching them to dependency event or, even worse, creating them explicitly. You're on the road to entangled spaghetti code which is hard to reason about and understand, as you are clearly experiencing.</p>&#xA;

 there are a lot of things wrong here, you should read some good basic docs about signalr concepts first. the guide you are referring to is very poor. the main things you should check: . ;. ; . ; hubs are created by signalr from scratch each time a hub method is called from a client, and then destroyed, therefore for something as basic as this you should not interfere with that, which instead you do with your event handler . ; because of the previous point, your  userid  member is simply not in the right place, and it  sort of  works for you just because of wrong side effects you are generating with more mistakes (described below): do not store any state supposed to live across calls inside hubs instance members, it is not meant to survive . ; you explicitly do a  new notificationhub()  for something that has nothing to do with signalr broadcasting, you should move the sql dependency stuff outside of the hub and do it there, while leaving hubs do their own stuff only . ; when you change page your connection is lost, buy your event handler is (probably) artificially keeping a "dead" hub instance alive, and it uses it for notification, but that's simply wrong . ; . ;. ; you should review your design, starting by managing the sql dependency outside of hubs. you already know about  ihubcontext , so use that from outside hubs, and you should use hubs just for what they are for, without keeping them alive artificially when attaching them to dependency event or, even worse, creating them explicitly. you're on the road to entangled spaghetti code which is hard to reason about and understand, as you are clearly experiencing. . ;

there are a lot of things wrong here you should read some good basic docs about signalr concepts first
the guide you are referring to is very poor
the main things you should check
hubs are created by signalr from scratch each time a hub method is called from a client and then destroyed therefore for something as basic as this you should not interfere with that which instead you do with your event handler
because of the previous point your userid member is simply not in the right place and it sort of works for you just because of wrong side effects you are generating with more mistakes described below do not store any state supposed to live across calls inside hubs instance members it is not meant to survive
you explicitly do a new notificationhub for something that has nothing to do with signalr broadcasting you should move the sql dependency stuff outside of the hub and do it there while leaving hubs do their own stuff only
when you change page your connection is lost buy your event handler is probably artificially keeping a dead hub instance alive and it uses it for notification but that s simply wrong
you should review your design starting by managing the sql dependency outside of hubs
you already know about ihubcontext so use that from outside hubs and you should use hubs just for what they are for without keeping them alive artificially when attaching them to dependency event or even worse creating them explicitly
you re on the road to entangled spaghetti code which is hard to reason about and understand as you are clearly experiencing



<p>I resolved this issue from the <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/27398473/ipa-app-could-not-added-to-our-itunes-library-it-is-not-a-valid-app">Link</a>:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In order to resolve this issue, do these steps:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Renamed the exported ipa file to .zip and opened her up.&#xA;XCode is now putting the .app file inside a folder named "Applications".&#xA;Rename this folder to "Payload", zipped it back up, and rename the zip back to .ipa.&#xA;Now dragged this new ipa file to iTunes it should works fine this time and can be installed on my phone.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This seems a bug in Xcode in latest Xcode versions.</p>&#xA;

 i resolved this issue from the  link : . ;. ; in order to resolve this issue, do these steps: . ;. ; renamed the exported ipa file to .zip and opened her up.. ;xcode is now putting the .app file inside a folder named "applications".. ;rename this folder to "payload", zipped it back up, and rename the zip back to .ipa.. ;now dragged this new ipa file to itunes it should works fine this time and can be installed on my phone. . ;. ; this seems a bug in xcode in latest xcode versions. . ;

i resolved this issue from the link
in order to resolve this issue do these steps
renamed the exported ipa file to .zip and opened her up
xcode is now putting the .app file inside a folder named applications
rename this folder to payload zipped it back up and rename the zip back to .ipa
now dragged this new ipa file to itunes it should works fine this time and can be installed on my phone
this seems a bug in xcode in latest xcode versions

<p>I have managed to get a Working playlist but I want to make the Next and Previous Buttons actually skip forwards and backwards in the playlist but I can't seem to figure it out.&#xA;I thought maybe if I used the playNext function when next is clicked but either i messed that up or thats not what needs to be done.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;body&gt;&#xA;&#xA;&lt;audio id="player"&gt;&lt;/audio&gt;&#xA;&#xA;&lt;ul id="playlist"&gt;&lt;li data-ogg="media/CallToArms.mp3"&gt;Call To Arms&lt;/li&gt;  &lt;li data-ogg="media/SkinheadProblems.mp3"&gt;Skinhead Problems&lt;/li&gt;&lt;li data- ogg="media/KillTheBill.mp3"&gt;Kill The Bill&lt;/li&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&#xA;&#xA;&lt;button id="stop"&gt;Stop&lt;/button&gt;&#xA;&#xA;&lt;button id="next"&gt;Next&lt;/button&gt;&#xA;&lt;button id="next"&gt;Previous&lt;/button&gt;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&lt;script type="text/javascript"    src="//ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.7.2/jquery.min.js"&gt;&#xA;&lt;/script&gt;&#xA;        &lt;script type="text/javascript"&gt;&#xA;var _player = document.getElementById("player"),&#xA;    _playlist = document.getElementById("playlist"),&#xA;    _stop = document.getElementById("stop");&#xA;&#xA;// functions&#xA;function playlistItemClick(clickedElement) {&#xA;    var selected = _playlist.querySelector(".selected");&#xA;    if (selected) {&#xA;        selected.classList.remove("selected");&#xA;    }&#xA;    clickedElement.classList.add("selected");&#xA;&#xA;    _player.src = clickedElement.getAttribute("data-ogg");&#xA;    _player.play();&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA; function playNext() {&#xA;    var selected = _playlist.querySelector("li.selected");&#xA;    if (selected &amp;&amp; selected.nextSibling) {&#xA;        playlistItemClick(selected.nextSibling);&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;// event listeners&#xA;_stop.addEventListener("click", function () {&#xA;    _player.pause();&#xA;});&#xA;_player.addEventListener("ended", playNext);&#xA;_playlist.addEventListener("click", function (e) {&#xA;     if (e.target &amp;&amp; e.target.nodeName === "LI") {&#xA;        playlistItemClick(e.target);&#xA;    }&#xA;});&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&lt;/script&gt;&#xA;&lt;/body&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Anyone who might have some advice it would be greatly appreciated. </p>&#xA;

<p>Using a CSS background is much more dependable across browsers than using list-style-image for custom bullets. Controlling the position of a list-image is quite difficult on its own.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Something like:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>.bullets {&#xA;  background-image:url(/img/bpt_clear.png); &#xA;  background-repeat:no-repeat; &#xA;  padding-left:30px; &#xA;  margin-left:-30px;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>See: <a href="http://preview.moveable.com/JM/ilovelists/" rel="nofollow">http://preview.moveable.com/JM/ilovelists/</a></p>&#xA;

 using a css background is much more dependable across browsers than using list-style-image for custom bullets. controlling the position of a list-image is quite difficult on its own. . ;. ; something like: . ;. ;  . ;. ; see:     . ;

using a css background is much more dependable across browsers than using list-style-image for custom bullets
controlling the position of a list-image is quite difficult on its own
something like
see



<p>Don't try to access the second element in the array until you're sure it exists. Example:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>if(comando2.length &lt; 1) {&#xA;    // the user typed only spaces&#xA;} else {&#xA;    String first = comando2[0];&#xA;    if(first.equalsIgnoreCase("exit")) { // or comando.equalsIgnoreCase("exit"), depending on whether the user is allowed to type things after "exit"&#xA;        // something here&#xA;&#xA;    } else if(first.equalsIgnoreCase("enter")) {&#xA;        if(comando2.length &lt; 2) {&#xA;            // they typed "enter" by itself; what do you want to do?&#xA;            // (probably print an error message)&#xA;        } else {&#xA;            String second = comando2[1];&#xA;            // do something here&#xA;        }&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Notice how this code always checks <code>comando2.length</code> before trying to access the elements of <code>comando2</code>. You should do the same.</p>&#xA;

 don't try to access the second element in the array until you're sure it exists. example: . ;. ;  . ;. ; notice how this code always checks  comando2.length  before trying to access the elements of  comando2 . you should do the same. . ;

don t try to access the second element in the array until you re sure it exists
example
notice how this code always checks comando2.length before trying to access the elements of comando2
you should do the same



<p>You do not need to edit the CSProj file: just use CMD.EXE syntax in Visual Studio Post-Build events</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You can test if running inside Visual Studio</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><code>IF "$(BuildingInsideVisualStudio)"=="true" (&#xA;  ?#xA;)</code></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>or inside TFS Build (2013 or later)</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><code>IF "$(TF_BUILD)"=="True" (&#xA;  ?#xA;)</code></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>See the discussion a&#xA;<a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5068884/tfs-2010-build-automation-and-post-build-event/6137142#6137142">TFS 2010 Build Automation and post-build event</a> and <a href="https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh850448.aspx" rel="nofollow">Team Foundation Build environment variables</a>.</p>&#xA;

 you do not need to edit the csproj file: just use cmd.exe syntax in visual studio post-build events . ;. ; you can test if running inside visual studio . ;. ;  . ;. ; or inside tfs build (2013 or later) . ;. ;  . ;. ; see the discussion a. ; tfs 2010 build automation and post-build event  and  team foundation build environment variables . . ;

<p>In my case this problem was because because npm was installed using homebrew. A description of this problem and how to fix it can be found at on <a href="https://gist.github.com/DanHerbert/9520689" rel="nofollow">this gist</a>.  In summary the required fix is to uninstall all your npm globably installed packages, uninstall node, then reinstall node, and reinstall npm without brew.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>npm list -g --depth=0 # to list all your globally installed packages&#xA;rm -rf /usr/local/lib/node_modules&#xA;brew uninstall node&#xA;brew install node --without-npm&#xA;echo prefix=~/.npm-packages &gt;&gt; ~/.npmrc&#xA;curl -L https://www.npmjs.com/install.sh | sh&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>and then, you have to reinstall all your npm packages that were installed globally using <code>npm install -g &lt;package_name&gt;</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Unfortunately, when I rebooted my machine, the same problem re-occured. My current work around is to follow the suggestion <a href="https://github.com/facebook/react-native/issues/4515" rel="nofollow">here</a> i.e</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>npm install --save-dev react-native-cli&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Any explanation as to what is going on is welcome.</p>&#xA;

<p>You should check for GL errors, ilGetInteger(IL_IMAGE_BPP) returns the number of bytes per pixel, which is NOT a internal format enum value. Use a enumeration such as GL_RGB or GL_RGBA instead. That was valid in the compatibility profile, but is not in the core profile.</p>&#xA;

 you should check for gl errors, ilgetinteger(il_image_bpp) returns the number of bytes per pixel, which is not a internal format enum value. use a enumeration such as gl_rgb or gl_rgba instead. that was valid in the compatibility profile, but is not in the core profile. . ;

you should check for gl errors ilgetinteger il_image_bpp returns the number of bytes per pixel which is not a internal format enum value
use a enumeration such as gl_rgb or gl_rgba instead
that was valid in the compatibility profile but is not in the core profile



<p>LINQ to SQL "understands" <code>p.Orders.Count</code>, but it can't look inside your method to work out what it means - it could be doing anything as far as LINQ to SQL is concerned.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In your first query, <code>p.Orders.Count</code> is all represented in an <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb397951.aspx" rel="nofollow noreferrer">expression tree</a> which can be examined programmatically at execution time.</p>&#xA;

 linq to sql "understands"  p.orders.count , but it can't look inside your method to work out what it means - it could be doing anything as far as linq to sql is concerned. . ;. ; in your first query,  p.orders.count  is all represented in an  expression tree  which can be examined programmatically at execution time. . ;

linq to sql understands p.orders.count but it can t look inside your method to work out what it means - it could be doing anything as far as linq to sql is concerned
in your first query p.orders.count is all represented in an expression tree which can be examined programmatically at execution time



<p>I'm sure this is a totally normal thing to do, but I can't figure out how to get make to do this.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I have a compiler that generates make dependencies of the usual form:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>M/A.o : M/A.hs&#xA;M/B.o : M/A.o&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So I write a rule to compile %.hs into %.o, add a rule to link the binary, include the dependencies file, and all is well.  But I want to have several binary targets with different flags.  E.g. I want build/test built with -DTESTING and build/profile built with -prof.  So I need to keep the .o files in a separate tree, where they will be compiled with special flags.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The straightforward way I can think of would be to have dependencies that look something like this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>build/test/M/A.o : M/A.hs&#xA;build/test/M/B.o : build/test/M/A.o&#xA;&#xA;build/profile/M/A.o : M/A.hs&#xA;... etc.&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And then rules so that %.hs to build/test/%.o compiles with -DTESTING, etc.  I think this would work, but it's clumsy, means preprocessing the deps file to add all that build/whatever/ prefix stuff, and would multiply its size by however many kinds of builds.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>VPATH appears to be designed for this sort of thing and my idea was that I could set the VPATH and compiler flags depending on the target, and it almost works, but:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>%.o: %.hs&#xA;    @mkdir -p build/M&#xA;    cp $&lt; build/$@&#xA;&#xA;VPATH = build&#xA;&#xA;main: M/A.o M/B.o&#xA;    cat $^ &gt;$@&#xA;&#xA;M/A.o : M/A.hs&#xA;M/B.o : M/B.hs&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The first time the main target wants to run 'cat M/A.o M/B.o >main' which seems contrary to the gnu make documentation that says $^ should include the include the VPATH directory in which the dependency was found.  Curiously, if I remove 'main' and make again, this time it uses the correct path.  This is GNU make, 3.81.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>What's going on here?  Is there a better way to build with different flags?  VPATH seems like a clumsy tool, surely there is a better way?</p>&#xA;

<p>There's not going to be a single answer to that question.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In fact there's not even a single answer on Windows. Different executables specify different stack limits. And even within a single process, individual threads can have different stack limits.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And it gets even more complicated when you factor in the differences between .net and native executables. Rather strangely .net executables commit the entire stack allocation for each thread as soon as the thread starts. On the other hand, native executables reserve the stack allocation and then commit memory on demand using guard pages.</p>&#xA;

 there's not going to be a single answer to that question. . ;. ; in fact there's not even a single answer on windows. different executables specify different stack limits. and even within a single process, individual threads can have different stack limits. . ;. ; and it gets even more complicated when you factor in the differences between .net and native executables. rather strangely .net executables commit the entire stack allocation for each thread as soon as the thread starts. on the other hand, native executables reserve the stack allocation and then commit memory on demand using guard pages. . ;

there s not going to be a single answer to that question
in fact there s not even a single answer on windows
different executables specify different stack limits
and even within a single process individual threads can have different stack limits
and it gets even more complicated when you factor in the differences between .net and native executables
rather strangely .net executables commit the entire stack allocation for each thread as soon as the thread starts
on the other hand native executables reserve the stack allocation and then commit memory on demand using guard pages

<p>Do you use this Filter only in this Form? You could place your filter and validator description directly in your form. This is done right now in your add()-Factory.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I wrote an answer in an older question <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/a/30335124/3893182">here</a>. Its about implementing Zends <code>InputProviderInterface</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So you don't have to set InpuFilter manually, it is set automatically.</p>&#xA;

so you don t have to set inpufilter manually it is set automatically

<p>You can force the user to paste without styles. I've done some adjusting from the Codex:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>function my_format_TinyMCE( $in ) {&#xA;    $in['remove_linebreaks'] = false;&#xA;    $in['gecko_spellcheck'] = false;&#xA;    $in['keep_styles'] = false;&#xA;    $in['accessibility_focus'] = true;&#xA;    $in['tabfocus_elements'] = 'major-publishing-actions';&#xA;    $in['media_strict'] = false;&#xA;    $in['paste_remove_styles'] = true;&#xA;    $in['paste_remove_spans'] = true;&#xA;    $in['paste_strip_class_attributes'] = 'none';&#xA;    $in['paste_text_use_dialog'] = true; // this is the one you REALLY want! &#xA;    $in['wpeditimage_disable_captions'] = true;&#xA;    $in['plugins'] = 'tabfocus,paste,media,fullscreen,wordpress,wpeditimage,wpgallery,wplink,wpdialogs,wpfullscreen';&#xA;    $in['content_css'] = get_template_directory_uri() . "/editor-style.css";&#xA;    $in['wpautop'] = true;&#xA;    $in['apply_source_formatting'] = false;&#xA;    $in['toolbar1'] = 'spellchecker,wp_fullscreen ';&#xA;    $in['toolbar2'] = 'pastetext,removeformat,charmap,undo,redo,wp_help ';&#xA;    $in['toolbar3'] = '';&#xA;    $in['toolbar4'] = '';&#xA;    return $in;&#xA;}&#xA;add_filter( 'tiny_mce_before_init', 'my_format_TinyMCE' );&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Untested, but you can see the defaults here: <a href="http://codex.wordpress.org/TinyMCE" rel="nofollow">http://codex.wordpress.org/TinyMCE</a></p>&#xA;

 you can force the user to paste without styles. i've done some adjusting from the codex: . ;. ;  . ;. ; untested, but you can see the defaults here:     . ;

<p>You can only just cast/convert the datatype in a query</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Select distinct ec.category,ec.id&#xA;from print ec&#xA;order by cast(ec.id as int) asc</p>&#xA;

 you can only just cast/convert the datatype in a query . ;. ; select distinct ec.category,ec.id. ;from print ec. ;order by cast(ec.id as int) asc . ;

you can only just cast convert the datatype in a query
select distinct ec.category ec.id
from print ec
order by cast ec.id as int asc



<p>I have a web server returning an thrift object serialized used the JSON protocol to a client html page using the pure Javascript Thrift library (<a href="https://github.com/apache/thrift/tree/master/lib/js/src" rel="nofollow"><code>thrift.js</code></a>). </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The server for example:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>from MyThriftFile.ttypes import ThriftClass&#xA;from thrift import TSerialization&#xA;from thrift.protocol import TJSONProtocol&#xA;&#xA;thrift_obj = new ThriftClass()&#xA;result = TSerialization.serialize(&#xA;    thrift_obj,&#xA;    protocol_factory=TJSONProtocol.TJSONProtocolFactory())&#xA;&#xA;return result&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Now in the C#, Python, Java, and even the node.js Thrift libraries there is some form of this generic TSerialization or TDeserialization utlity and its more or less implemented like so:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>def deserialize(base,&#xA;        buf,&#xA;        protocol_factory=TBinaryProtocol.TBinaryProtocolFactory()):&#xA;&#xA;    transport = TTransport.TMemoryBuffer(buf)&#xA;    protocol = protocol_factory.getProtocol(transport)&#xA;    base.read(protocol)&#xA;    return base&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So it gets it data, loads it up into a throw away transport (because we are not going to send this information anywhere), creates a new protocol object for encoding this data, and finally the actual thrift object reads this data to populate itself.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The pure javacript library however seems to lack this functionality. I understand why the client library only support the JSON protocol (web pages don't deal in raw binary data) but why not method for de/serialization from/to JSON?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I made my own method for doing the job but it seems hacky. Anyone have a better trick?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>$(document).ready(function() {&#xA;    $.get("www.mysite.com/thrift_object_i_want/", function(data,     status) {&#xA;        var transport = new Thrift.Transport();&#xA;        var protocol  = new Thrift.Protocol(transport);&#xA;&#xA;        // Sets the data we are going to read from.&#xA;        transport.setRecvBuffer(data);&#xA;&#xA;        // This is basically equal to&#xA;        // rawd = data&#xA;        rawd = transport.readAll();&#xA;&#xA;        // The following is lifited from &#xA;        // readMessageBegin().&#xA;        // These params I am setting are private memeber&#xA;        // vars that protocol needs set in order to read&#xA;        // data set in setRevBuff()&#xA;        obj = $.parseJSON(rawd);&#xA;        protocol.rpos = []&#xA;        protocol.rstack = []&#xA;        protocol.rstack.push(obj)&#xA;&#xA;        // Now that the protocl has been hacked to function&#xA;        // populate our object from it&#xA;        tc = new ThriftClass();&#xA;        tc.read(protocol);&#xA;&#xA;        // u is now a js object equal to the python object&#xA;    });&#xA;});&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 i have a web server returning an thrift object serialized used the json protocol to a client html page using the pure javascript thrift library (  thrift.js  ).  . ;. ; the server for example: . ;. ;  . ;. ; now in the c#, python, java, and even the node.js thrift libraries there is some form of this generic tserialization or tdeserialization utlity and its more or less implemented like so: . ;. ;  . ;. ; so it gets it data, loads it up into a throw away transport (because we are not going to send this information anywhere), creates a new protocol object for encoding this data, and finally the actual thrift object reads this data to populate itself. . ;. ; the pure javacript library however seems to lack this functionality. i understand why the client library only support the json protocol (web pages don't deal in raw binary data) but why not method for de/serialization from/to json? . ;. ; i made my own method for doing the job but it seems hacky. anyone have a better trick? . ;. ;  . ;

so it gets it data loads it up into a throw away transport because we are not going to send this information anywhere creates a new protocol object for encoding this data and finally the actual thrift object reads this data to populate itself

<p><code>R</code> is generated after saving all files, because then the XMLs are parsed and this so-called <code>resource</code> class is created. If it cannot be resolved to a variable, that means you probably made a mistake somewhere in your XMLs. If you didn't, then try to clean the project.</p>&#xA;

  r  is generated after saving all files, because then the xmls are parsed and this so-called  resource  class is created. if it cannot be resolved to a variable, that means you probably made a mistake somewhere in your xmls. if you didn't, then try to clean the project. . ;

r is generated after saving all files because then the xmls are parsed and this so-called resource class is created
if it cannot be resolved to a variable that means you probably made a mistake somewhere in your xmls
if you didn t then try to clean the project



<p>You need to add a <code>step</code> attribute</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><div class="snippet" data-lang="js" data-hide="false">&#xD;&#xA;<div class="snippet-code">&#xD;&#xA;<pre class="snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override"><code>  input:invalid {&#xD;&#xA;    border: 2px solid red;&#xD;&#xA;  }</code></pre>&#xD;&#xA;<pre class="snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override"><code>&lt;input type="number" name="quantity1" pattern="[-+]?[0-9]*[.,]?[0-9]+" step="any"&gt;&#xD;&#xA;&#xD;&#xA;&lt;input type="number" name="quantity1" pattern="[-+]?[0-9]*[.,]?[0-9]+" step="0.1"&gt;</code></pre>&#xD;&#xA;</div>&#xD;&#xA;</div>&#xD;&#xA;</p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>Numeric input fields can take additional attributes �min?and �step? which constrain the range of values allowed in your input. The �min?attribute is fairly obvious: it�s the minimum value your number can be. The �step?attribute is less intuitive: by playing with different values, you would most likely work out that it controls the increase/decrease when clicking the up/down buttons on the field. If you input the number 1 and click the up arrow, it will increase to 2. This is because the default step is 1. So far, so obvious. However, the step attribute also determines which values are valid, so a step of 1 means you can enter 1, 2, 3 etc. and a step of 2 means you can enter 2, 4, 6 etc, and when you click the up/down buttons the number will increase/decrease by 2 each time, but entering 3 or 5 in the box will cause a validation error. You can also use a decimal value: for example, a step of 0.3 will allow values such as 0.3, 0.6, 0.9 etc, but not 1 or 2.</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>But what if you want all the numbers to be valid, integers and decimals alike? In this case, set step to �any?</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;input type="number" step="any" /&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>Now you don�t get a validation error. Yay! Also note that if you only want to accept positive numbers, you�ll want to add min=??.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Found in this <a href="http://blog.isotoma.com/2012/03/html5-input-typenumber-and-decimalsfloats-in-chrome/" rel="nofollow"><strong>Article</strong></a></p>&#xA;

 you need to add a  step  attribute . ;. ;  &#xd;. ; &#xd;. ;  &#xd;. ;  &#xd;. ; &#xd;. ; &#xd;. ; . ;. ; . ;   numeric input fields can take additional attributes �min?and �step? which constrain the range of values allowed in your input. the �min?attribute is fairly obvious: it�s the minimum value your number can be. the �step?attribute is less intuitive: by playing with different values, you would most likely work out that it controls the increase/decrease when clicking the up/down buttons on the field. if you input the number 1 and click the up arrow, it will increase to 2. this is because the default step is 1. so far, so obvious. however, the step attribute also determines which values are valid, so a step of 1 means you can enter 1, 2, 3 etc. and a step of 2 means you can enter 2, 4, 6 etc, and when you click the up/down buttons the number will increase/decrease by 2 each time, but entering 3 or 5 in the box will cause a validation error. you can also use a decimal value: for example, a step of 0.3 will allow values such as 0.3, 0.6, 0.9 etc, but not 1 or 2. . ;  . ;   but what if you want all the numbers to be valid, integers and decimals alike? in this case, set step to �any? . ; . ;. ;  . ;. ; . ;   now you don�t get a validation error. yay! also note that if you only want to accept positive numbers, you�ll want to add min=??. . ; . ;. ; found in this   article   . ;

you need to add a step attribute
numeric input fields can take additional attributes min and step which constrain the range of values allowed in your input
the min attribute is fairly obvious it s the minimum value your number can be
the step attribute is less intuitive by playing with different values you would most likely work out that it controls the increase decrease when clicking the up down buttons on the field
if you input the number 1 and click the up arrow it will increase to 2
this is because the default step is 1
so far so obvious
however the step attribute also determines which values are valid so a step of 1 means you can enter 1 2 3 etc
and a step of 2 means you can enter 2 4 6 etc and when you click the up down buttons the number will increase decrease by 2 each time but entering 3 or 5 in the box will cause a validation error
you can also use a decimal value for example a step of 0.3 will allow values such as 0.3 0.6 0.9 etc but not 1 or 2
but what if you want all the numbers to be valid integers and decimals alike
in this case set step to any
now you don t get a validation error
yay
also note that if you only want to accept positive numbers you ll want to add min 0
found in this article



<p>In my WCF serive project this issue is due to Reference of System.Web.Mvc.dll 's different version. So it may be compatibility issue of DLL's different version</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>When I use</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>System.Web.Mvc.dll version 5.2.2.0</strong> -> it thorows the <strong>Error</strong> The content type text/html; charset=utf-8 of the response message</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>but when I use&#xA;<strong>System.Web.Mvc.dll version 4.0.0.0 or lower</strong> -> it <strong>works fine</strong>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I don't know the reason of different version DLL's issue but by changing the DLL's verison it works for me.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>This Error even generate when you add reference of other Project in your WCF Project and this reference project has different version of System.Web.Mvc DLL or could be any other DLL.</strong></p>&#xA;

<p>I googled a lot, but hacked the solution for your problem myself. Cleaning the project, re-building etc. wasn't working for me.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The solution is to wrap API into Cocoa Class, and use this class in your imports instead of original.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ol>&#xA;<li>Create class, for example <code>APAnalyticsTracker</code>, where <code>AP</code> supposed to be your common application prefix. Here you'll have two files: <code>APAnalyticsTracker.m</code> and <code>APAnalyticsTracker.h</code></li>&#xA;<li>Import <code>#import &lt;Google/Analytics.h&gt;</code> in <code>APAnalyticsTracker</code> and wrap the original implementation like this (see Gist for more information): <a href="https://gist.github.com/vladignatyev/c240a1a4867b17894b10" rel="nofollow">https://gist.github.com/vladignatyev/c240a1a4867b17894b10</a></li>&#xA;<li>Use <code>APAnalyticsTracker.h</code> from <code>.mm</code> files freely.</li>&#xA;<li>Remember to enable modules, see <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/a/33125158/882187">http://stackoverflow.com/a/33125158/882187</a> comment from @barrast</li>&#xA;</ol>&#xA;

 i googled a lot, but hacked the solution for your problem myself. cleaning the project, re-building etc. wasn't working for me. . ;. ; the solution is to wrap api into cocoa class, and use this class in your imports instead of original. . ;. ; . ; create class, for example  apanalyticstracker , where  ap  supposed to be your common application prefix. here you'll have two files:  apanalyticstracker.m  and  apanalyticstracker.h  . ; import  in  apanalyticstracker  and wrap the original implementation like this (see gist for more information):     . ; use  apanalyticstracker.h  from  .mm  files freely. . ; remember to enable modules, see     comment from @barrast . ; . ;

i googled a lot but hacked the solution for your problem myself
cleaning the project re-building etc
wasn t working for me
the solution is to wrap api into cocoa class and use this class in your imports instead of original
create class for example apanalyticstracker where ap supposed to be your common application prefix
here you ll have two files apanalyticstracker.m and apanalyticstracker.h
import in apanalyticstracker and wrap the original implementation like this see gist for more information
use apanalyticstracker.h from .mm files freely
remember to enable modules see comment from barrast



<p>The related names field in Contacts doesn't store linkages, just names. You'll notice this from a user perspective if you go to edit related names in the iOS or OS X Contacts app ?it's just a freeform text field. Those apps (and other system apps) will recognize when a related name matches that of another contact (which is why you can ask Siri to call your mother, etc), but they also let you put down names for people you don't have contact info for.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So a <code>CNContactRelation</code> just contains a string, and the only way to find (if there are any) contacts matching a related name is to search the contact store. Use <a href="https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/Contacts/Reference/CNContactStore_Class/index.html#//apple_ref/occ/instm/CNContactStore/unifiedContactsMatchingPredicate:keysToFetch:error:" rel="nofollow"><code>unifiedContactsMatchingPredicate:keysToFetch:error:</code></a> to search, with a predicate constructed by calling <a href="https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/Contacts/Reference/CNContact_Class/index.html#//apple_ref/occ/clm/CNContact/predicateForContactsMatchingName:" rel="nofollow"><code>predicateForContactsMatchingName:</code></a>.</p>&#xA;

 the related names field in contacts doesn't store linkages, just names. you'll notice this from a user perspective if you go to edit related names in the ios or os x contacts app ?it's just a freeform text field. those apps (and other system apps) will recognize when a related name matches that of another contact (which is why you can ask siri to call your mother, etc), but they also let you put down names for people you don't have contact info for. . ;. ; so a  cncontactrelation  just contains a string, and the only way to find (if there are any) contacts matching a related name is to search the contact store. use   unifiedcontactsmatchingpredicate:keystofetch:error:   to search, with a predicate constructed by calling   predicateforcontactsmatchingname:  . . ;

the related names field in contacts doesn t store linkages just names
you ll notice this from a user perspective if you go to edit related names in the ios or os x contacts app it s just a freeform text field
those apps and other system apps will recognize when a related name matches that of another contact which is why you can ask siri to call your mother etc but they also let you put down names for people you don t have contact info for
so a cncontactrelation just contains a string and the only way to find if there are any contacts matching a related name is to search the contact store
use unifiedcontactsmatchingpredicate keystofetch error to search with a predicate constructed by calling predicateforcontactsmatchingname



<p>The way that PostgreSQL handles this is called multi-version concurrency control.  Basically concurrent transactions see a snapshot of the data when they begin the statement (by default) or more seldom when they begin the transaction (depending on transaction level).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In this approach readers never block writers, and writers only block readers when the reader requests it.  For just reading and inserting you are unlikely to get lock exceptions/</p>&#xA;

 the way that postgresql handles this is called multi-version concurrency control.  basically concurrent transactions see a snapshot of the data when they begin the statement (by default) or more seldom when they begin the transaction (depending on transaction level). . ;. ; in this approach readers never block writers, and writers only block readers when the reader requests it.  for just reading and inserting you are unlikely to get lock exceptions/ . ;

the way that postgresql handles this is called multi-version concurrency control
basically concurrent transactions see a snapshot of the data when they begin the statement by default or more seldom when they begin the transaction depending on transaction level
in this approach readers never block writers and writers only block readers when the reader requests it
for just reading and inserting you are unlikely to get lock exceptions

<p>I'm using TinyMCE (v3.5.8) and integrated iBrowser plugin (v1.4.5) with Codeigniter 2.1.3 and i'm getting the JavaScript error <code>Uncaught TypeError: Cannot set property 'isMSIE' of null</code>&#xA;Please help me to solve this.&#xA;Thanks.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>EDIT</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Error is in iBrowser plugin.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I didn't changed anything as from the downloaded file.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Error occurring in editor_plugin.js in iBrowser plugin folder.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>iBrowser plugin url : <a href="http://seoroot.com/blog/computing/programming/tinymce-ibrowser-plugin.html" rel="nofollow">http://seoroot.com/blog/computing/programming/tinymce-ibrowser-plugin.html</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>editor_plugin.js contains below code.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>ib = null;&#xA;&#xA;(function() {&#xA;    tinymce.create('tinymce.plugins.IBrowserPlugin', {&#xA;        init : function(ed, url) {&#xA;            // load common script&#xA;            tinymce.ScriptLoader.load(url + '/interface/common.js');&#xA;&#xA;            // Register commands&#xA;            ed.addCommand('mceIBrowser', function() {&#xA;                var e = ed.selection.getNode();&#xA;&#xA;                // Internal image object like a flash placeholder&#xA;                if (ed.dom.getAttrib(ed.selection.getNode(), 'class').indexOf('mceItem') != -1) {return}&#xA;&#xA;                ib.isMSIE  = tinymce.isIE;&#xA;                ib.isGecko = tinymce.isGecko;&#xA;                ib.isWebKit= tinymce.isWebKit;&#xA;                ib.oEditor = ed; &#xA;                ib.editor  = ed;&#xA;                ib.selectedElement = e;                 &#xA;                ib.baseURL = url + '/ibrowser.php'; &#xA;                iBrowser_open();&#xA;            });&#xA;&#xA;            // Register buttons&#xA;            ed.addButton('ibrowser', {&#xA;                title : 'iBrowser',&#xA;                cmd :   'mceIBrowser',&#xA;                image:  url + '/interface/images/tinyMCE/ibrowser.gif'&#xA;            });&#xA;&#xA;            // Add a node change handler, selects the button in the UI when a image is selected&#xA;            ed.onNodeChange.add(function(ed, cm, n) {&#xA;                cm.setActive('ibrowser', n.nodeName == 'IMG');&#xA;            });&#xA;        },&#xA;&#xA;        getInfo : function() {&#xA;            return {&#xA;                longname :  'iBrowser',&#xA;                author :    'net4visions.com',&#xA;                authorurl : 'http://net4visions.com',&#xA;                infourl :   'http://net4visions.com/ibrowser.html',&#xA;                version :   '1.4.0'&#xA;            };&#xA;        }&#xA;    });&#xA;&#xA;    // Register plugin&#xA;    tinymce.PluginManager.add('ibrowser', tinymce.plugins.IBrowserPlugin);&#xA;&#xA;})();&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Sorry. Its a long code.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>NOTE : <strong>TinyMCE is working well but this plugin has some errors.</strong></p>&#xA;

<p>There is a question that is very similar in spirit <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2476425/c-stl-stdtransform-with-given-stride">here</a>. Unfortunately that question didn't prompt much response - I thought I would ask a more specific question with the hope that an alternative method can be suggested.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I'm writing a binary file into <code>std::cin</code> (with <code>tar --to-command=./myprog</code>). &#xA;The binary file happens to be a set of floats and I want to put the data into <code>std::vector&lt;float&gt;</code> - ideally the c++ way.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I can generate a <code>std::vector&lt;char&gt;</code> very nicely (thanks to  <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5420317/c-reading-and-writing-binary-file/5420568#5420568">this answer</a>)</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>#include &lt;fstream&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;iostream&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;iterator&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;algorithm&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;vector&gt;&#xA;&#xA;int&#xA;main  (int ac, char **av)&#xA;{&#xA;  std::istream&amp; input = std::cin;&#xA;  std::vector&lt;char&gt; buffer;&#xA;  std::copy( &#xA;        std::istreambuf_iterator&lt;char&gt;(input), &#xA;           std::istreambuf_iterator&lt;char&gt;( ),&#xA;           std::back_inserter(buffer)); // copies all data into buffer&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I now want to transform my <code>std::vector&lt;char&gt;</code> into a <code>std::vector&lt;float&gt;</code>, presumably with <code>std::transform</code> and a function that does the conversion (a <code>char[2]</code> to a <code>float</code>, say).  I am struggling however, because my <code>std::vector&lt;float&gt;</code> will have half as many elements as <code>std::vector&lt;char&gt;</code>.  If I could iterate with a stride of 2 then I think I would be fine, but from the previous question it seems that I cannot do that (at least not elegantly).</p>&#xA;

<p>Actually it is:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li>The i loop iterates O(N) times, so the value of i is O(N), so we can say O(I)=O(N).</li>&#xA;<li>The j loop iterates O(I^2) = O(N^2) times (when considered on its own, without the outer loop).</li>&#xA;<li>The k loop iterates O(I*J) = O(N*N^2) = O(N^3) times.</li>&#xA;<li>The l loop just iterates 10 times so that is O(1).</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The loops are nested so we have to multiply these together (do you understand why?).  The total is O(N)*O(N^2)*O(N^3) = O(N^6).</p>&#xA;

 actually it is: . ;. ; . ; the i loop iterates o(n) times, so the value of i is o(n), so we can say o(i)=o(n). . ; the j loop iterates o(i^2) = o(n^2) times (when considered on its own, without the outer loop). . ; the k loop iterates o(i j) = o(n n^2) = o(n^3) times. . ; the l loop just iterates 10 times so that is o(1). . ; . ;. ; the loops are nested so we have to multiply these together (do you understand why?).  the total is o(n) o(n^2) o(n^3) = o(n^6). . ;

actually it is
the i loop iterates o n times so the value of i is o n so we can say o i o n
the j loop iterates o i 2 o n 2 times when considered on its own without the outer loop
the k loop iterates o i j o n n 2 o n 3 times
the l loop just iterates 10 times so that is o 1
the loops are nested so we have to multiply these together do you understand why

the total is o n o n 2 o n 3 o n 6

When all my controls are visible on in ScrollView, then dra-n-drop works fine. But when not all controls are visible on screnn and scrolling appears, I can't use dra-n-drop. All events come to ScrollView and only scrollview proceed them. Contols didn't get touch events and as result, I can't drag my controls.&#xA;Does anybody know how to resolve this issue? I suppose, that scrollview should proceed self touch event, but then it should transfer this touch event to the children controls. How can I do it? Or any other solutions?&#xA;Thanks.</p>&#xA;

<p>Asynchronous methods are the power of JavaScript which we must be utilized. And the reason is, if the task will take so long time to execute then we do not have to wait and meanwhile can put other task in execution.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>We can see its advantage over the UI where we can put long taking time task in the callback and can avoid to UI be grayout.&#xA;So I would suggest to adopt aync approach.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>But the way you are deciding the execution of the methods is not the better way in Angular way.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Angular has provided you $q.when(method()).then(successCallback(response));, through it control would come in successCallback only when method() execution is done and method() response can be used to make another promise call. This approach would help you to reduce the complexity of the code because you tried to make the chain of callbacks which is not correct conventionally.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>$scope.setLoginToContactEmail = function(){&#xA;    $q.when(searchRead()).then(function(res) {&#xA;        modelRead(res);&#xA;    });&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;function searchRead() {&#xA;    odooSvc.search_read('res.users').then(&#xA;            // @TODO       &#xA;        }&#xA;    );&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;function modelRead(res) {&#xA;    odooSvc.read_model('res.partner').then(&#xA;                    // @TODO&#xA;                )&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 asynchronous methods are the power of javascript which we must be utilized. and the reason is, if the task will take so long time to execute then we do not have to wait and meanwhile can put other task in execution. . ;. ; we can see its advantage over the ui where we can put long taking time task in the callback and can avoid to ui be grayout.. ;so i would suggest to adopt aync approach. . ;. ; but the way you are deciding the execution of the methods is not the better way in angular way. . ;. ; angular has provided you $q.when(method()).then(successcallback(response));, through it control would come in successcallback only when method() execution is done and method() response can be used to make another promise call. this approach would help you to reduce the complexity of the code because you tried to make the chain of callbacks which is not correct conventionally. . ;. ;  . ;

asynchronous methods are the power of javascript which we must be utilized
and the reason is if the task will take so long time to execute then we do not have to wait and meanwhile can put other task in execution
we can see its advantage over the ui where we can put long taking time task in the callback and can avoid to ui be grayout
so i would suggest to adopt aync approach
but the way you are deciding the execution of the methods is not the better way in angular way
angular has provided you q.when method .then successcallback response
through it control would come in successcallback only when method execution is done and method response can be used to make another promise call
this approach would help you to reduce the complexity of the code because you tried to make the chain of callbacks which is not correct conventionally

<p>In PowerShell, the <code>Get-ChildItem</code> cmdlet works like <code>ls</code> (at least with the file system provider). All items returned have a PowerShell-specific property called <code>PSIsContainer</code>, indicating whether it's a directory or not:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>foreach($item in (Get-ChildItem)){&#xA;    if($item.PSIsContainer){&#xA;        "Directory"&#xA;    } else {&#xA;        "File"&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you want to see what's inside each directory, one level down:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>foreach($item in (Get-ChildItem)){&#xA;    if($item.PSIsContainer){&#xA;        # Directory! Let's see what's inside:&#xA;        Get-ChildItem -Path $item.FullName&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<hr>&#xA;&#xA;<p>As of PowerShell version 3.0 and up, the <code>Get-ChildItem</code> supports a <code>File</code> and <code>Directory</code> switch on the filesystem provider, so if you ONLY want directories, you could do:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Get-ChildItem -Directory&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So the second example becomes: </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Get-ChildItem -Directory | Get-ChildItem&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<hr>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You could also list files recursively (like <code>ls -R</code>):</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Get-ChildItem -Recurse&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 in powershell, the  get-childitem  cmdlet works like  ls  (at least with the file system provider). all items returned have a powershell-specific property called  psiscontainer , indicating whether it's a directory or not: . ;. ;  . ;. ; if you want to see what's inside each directory, one level down: . ;. ;  . ;. ; . ;. ; as of powershell version 3.0 and up, the  get-childitem  supports a  file  and  directory  switch on the filesystem provider, so if you only want directories, you could do: . ;. ;  . ;. ; so the second example becomes:  . ;. ;  . ;. ; . ;. ; you could also list files recursively (like  ls -r ): . ;. ;  . ;

if you want to see what s inside each directory one level down

<p>You most likely want to use a <code>UIToolBar</code> instead of a <code>NavigationBar</code>. Then you can add the subviews to the <code>UIToolbar</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Bring the UILabel to the front most view.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>[self.view bringSubviewToFront: label];&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>This is a warning not an error.  It is pointing out that it is good practice to add a <code>serialVersionUID</code> field to any serializable class.  And your exception class is <em>already</em> serializable because it indirectly extends <code>Throwable</code> and <code>Throwable</code> implements <code>Serializable</code>.  </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>(If you don't define a <code>serialVersionUID</code> field, then the JVM computes one on the fly based on the current API definition of the class.  This makes you more vulnerable to problems with serial version UID mismatches due to class changes.)</p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>Why is it saying this if my class doesn't implement the Serialiazble interface? </p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>No.  It is not saying that.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>What do I do to clear resolve this issue. I don't want to have to modify or add anything to my code.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>There are three ways to deal with this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li><p>If you don't want to change any code, modify your IDE's compiler settings to disable this warning.</p></li>&#xA;<li><p>Add a <code>serialVersionUID</code> field; e.g. using your IDE's accelerator which should offer you the option of computing it using the standard algorithm.</p></li>&#xA;<li><p>Add an appropriate <code>@SuppressWarning</code> annotation.  This would be appropriate if there is zero chance that your exception objects would need to be serialized in the future.</p></li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;

 this is a warning not an error.  it is pointing out that it is good practice to add a  serialversionuid  field to any serializable class.  and your exception class is  already  serializable because it indirectly extends  throwable  and  throwable  implements  serializable .   . ;. ; (if you don't define a  serialversionuid  field, then the jvm computes one on the fly based on the current api definition of the class.  this makes you more vulnerable to problems with serial version uid mismatches due to class changes.) . ;. ; . ;   why is it saying this if my class doesn't implement the serialiazble interface?  . ; . ;. ; no.  it is not saying that. . ;. ; . ;   what do i do to clear resolve this issue. i don't want to have to modify or add anything to my code. . ; . ;. ; there are three ways to deal with this: . ;. ; . ;  if you don't want to change any code, modify your ide's compiler settings to disable this warning.  . ;  add a  serialversionuid  field;   using your ide's accelerator which should offer you the option of computing it using the standard algorithm.  . ;  add an appropriate  @suppresswarning  annotation.  this would be appropriate if there is zero chance that your exception objects would need to be serialized in the future.  . ; . ;

this is a warning not an error
it is pointing out that it is good practice to add a serialversionuid field to any serializable class
and your exception class is already serializable because it indirectly extends throwable and throwable implements serializable
if you don t define a serialversionuid field then the jvm computes one on the fly based on the current api definition of the class
this makes you more vulnerable to problems with serial version uid mismatches due to class changes.
why is it saying this if my class doesn t implement the serialiazble interface
no
it is not saying that
what do i do to clear resolve this issue
i don t want to have to modify or add anything to my code
there are three ways to deal with this
if you don t want to change any code modify your ide s compiler settings to disable this warning
add a serialversionuid field
using your ide s accelerator which should offer you the option of computing it using the standard algorithm
add an appropriate suppresswarning annotation
this would be appropriate if there is zero chance that your exception objects would need to be serialized in the future

<p>I would actually look very closely at something like adobe air.  It is cross platform and can be html/javascript based so chances are you won't have a heck of a lot to learn except maybe a javascript library or two.  It has the ability to talk to a local datastore or over the interweb to a webservice or RESTFUL service.  Development is free with aptana.  Check out some of the stuff written in it:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="http://www.adobe.com/products/air/showcase/" rel="nofollow noreferrer">http://www.adobe.com/products/air/showcase/</a></p>&#xA;

<p>Here is some jquery that will do this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>HTML</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;select id="combo1" class="combo" data-index="1"&gt;&#xA;    &lt;option&gt;&lt;/option&gt;&#xA;    &lt;option val="Opt1"&gt;Opt1&lt;/option&gt;&#xA;    &lt;option val="Opt2"&gt;Opt2&lt;/option&gt;&#xA;    &lt;option val="Opt3"&gt;Opt3&lt;/option&gt;&#xA;&lt;/select&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>Javascript</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>$('body').on('change', '.combo', function() {&#xA;    var selectedValue = $(this).val();&#xA;&#xA;    if ($(this).find('option').size() &gt; 2) {&#xA;        var newComboBox = $(this).clone();&#xA;        var thisComboBoxIndex = parseInt($(this).attr('data-index'), 10);&#xA;        var newComboBoxIndex = thisComboBoxIndex + 1;&#xA;&#xA;        $('.parentCombo' + thisComboBoxIndex).remove();&#xA;&#xA;        if (selectedValue !== '') {&#xA;            newComboBox.attr('data-index', newComboBoxIndex);&#xA;            newComboBox.attr('id', 'combo' + newComboBoxIndex);&#xA;            newComboBox.addClass('parentCombo' + thisComboBoxIndex);&#xA;            newComboBox.find('option[val="' + selectedValue + '"]').remove();&#xA;            $('body').append(newComboBox);&#xA;        }&#xA;    }&#xA;});?&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong><a href="http://jsfiddle.net/JaVVe/6/" rel="nofollow">Demo</a></strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>Explanation</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>// Adds an event listener to each combo box that is created dynmically&#xA;$('body').on('change', '.combo', function() {&#xA;    // Gets this selected value&#xA;    var selectedValue = $(this).val();&#xA;&#xA;    // Checks if there are enough options left to create another combo box&#xA;    if (selectedValue !== '' &amp;&amp; $(this).find('option').size() &gt; 2) {&#xA;        // Clones the just selected combo box and get the current and next combo index&#xA;        var newComboBox = $(this).clone();&#xA;        var thisComboBoxIndex = parseInt($(this).attr('data-index'), 10);&#xA;        var newComboBoxIndex = thisComboBoxIndex + 1;&#xA;&#xA;        // Removes any "children" combo boxes&#xA;        $('.parentCombo' + thisComboBoxIndex).remove();&#xA;&#xA;        // Checks if a blank value is not selected to create another combo box&#xA;        if (selectedValue !== '' &amp;&amp; $(this).find('option').size() &gt; 2) {&#xA;            // Gives this new combo box the correct id, index, parent class&#xA;            newComboBox.attr('data-index', newComboBoxIndex);&#xA;            newComboBox.attr('id', 'combo' + newComboBoxIndex);&#xA;            newComboBox.addClass('parentCombo' + thisComboBoxIndex);&#xA;&#xA;            // Removes the selected option from the new combo box&#xA;            newComboBox.find('option[val="' + selectedValue + '"]').remove();&#xA;&#xA;            // Adds the combo box to the page. Disco!&#xA;            $('body').append(newComboBox);&#xA;        }&#xA;    }&#xA;});&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 here is some jquery that will do this: . ;. ;  html  . ;. ;  . ;. ;  javascript  . ;. ;  . ;. ;   demo   . ;. ;  explanation  . ;. ;  . ;

<p>Selectize is a Jquery plugin. If you don't import it, you will not be able to use it. (that is the error, your objects don't have a selectize property).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You can see the <a href="http://plugins.jquery.com/selectize/" rel="nofollow">plugin page</a>, or it's <a href="https://github.com/brianreavis/selectize.js" rel="nofollow">github</a>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Download it <a href="http://github.com/brianreavis/selectize.js/zipball/v0.11.0" rel="nofollow">here</a> and try it.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Remember to add the following lines:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;script type="text/javascript" src="selectize.js"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;&#xA;&lt;link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="selectize.css" /&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

(that is the error, your objects don't have a selectize property). . ;. ; you can see the  plugin page , or it's  github . . ;. ; download it  here  and try it. . ;. ; remember to add the following lines: . ;. ;  . ;

selectize is a jquery plugin
if you don t import it you will not be able to use it
that is the error your objects don t have a selectize property
you can see the plugin page or it s github
download it here and try it
remember to add the following lines



<p>Inspecting an <code>NSIndexPath</code>, why isn't the indexPath�s second value equal to the indexPath.row?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="https://i.stack.imgur.com/1IUVx.jpg" rel="nofollow noreferrer"><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/1IUVx.jpg" alt="breakpoint"></a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Observing an instance of <code>NSIndexPath</code> at a breakpoint, and comparing the variable <code>indexPath</code>, the second value is 192 in the <strong>Variables View</strong>, while <code>po indexPath.row</code> value is 11 in the <strong>Console</strong>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>What causes this discrepancy?</p>&#xA;

<p>make your tests inherit from a base class test, something [very]roughly like this.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>public class MyBaseClass&#xA;{&#xA;    public virtual void DoStuff() { }&#xA;    public virtual void DoOtherStuff() { }&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;public class MySubClass : MyBaseClass&#xA;{&#xA;    public override void DoOtherStuff()&#xA;    {&#xA;        // different to to base&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;public abstract class TestOfBaseClass&#xA;{&#xA;    protected abstract MyBaseClass classUnderTest { get; }&#xA;&#xA;    [TestMethod]&#xA;    public void TestDoStuff()&#xA;    {&#xA;        classUnderTest.DoStuff();&#xA;        Assert.StuffWasDone();&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;[TestClass]&#xA;public class WhenSubclassDoesStuff : TestOfBaseClass&#xA;{&#xA;    protected override MyBaseClass classUnderTest&#xA;    {&#xA;        get { return new MySubClass(); }&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    [TestMethod]&#xA;    public void ShoudDoOtherStuff()&#xA;    {&#xA;        classUnderTest.DoOtherStuff();&#xA;        Assert.OtherStuffDone();&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>most of the popular test frameworks will run the test method in the base test when running the subclass tests.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>or maybe have a look at something like <a href="https://github.com/gregoryyoung/grensesnitt" rel="nofollow">https://github.com/gregoryyoung/grensesnitt</a></p>&#xA;

 make your tests inherit from a base class test, something [very]roughly like this. . ;. ;  . ;. ; most of the popular test frameworks will run the test method in the base test when running the subclass tests. . ;. ; or maybe have a look at something like     . ;

or maybe have a look at something like

<p>You can access each element in your string using the [] operator, which will return a reference to a char. You can then deduct the int value for char '0' and you will get the correct int representation. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>for(int i=0;i&lt;userstr.length();i++){&#xA;    myarray[i] = userstr[i] - '0';&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

you can access each element in your string using the operator which will return a reference to a char
you can then deduct the int value for char 0 and you will get the correct int representation



<p>I am attempting to create a custom Firemonkey control which inheirts from the <code>TListView</code> control.   I want to add some functionality to the control which is automatically executed when a user clicks on the control.  Therefore, my goal is NOT to specify an <code>OnItemClick</code> method on my control's form, but rather add functionality directly into the control itself.  </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I am struggling to comprehend what I need to do in order to tap into the on click handler for <code>TListView</code>.  In my head, I imagine my solution would look something similar to this pseudo code:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>//somewhere in the base TListView code&#xA;void __fastcall TListView::ClickHandler()&#xA;{&#xA;    //logic for handling a click on the list view&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;//somewhere in my custom list view control&#xA;void __fastcall TMyListView::ClickHandler()&#xA;{ &#xA;    TListView::ClickHandler(); //call base click handler so all the normal stuff happens&#xA;&#xA;    //my additional logic goes here&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>However, I cant seem to find anything in the documentation about what method I should attempt to override, or how I should be going about this at all.  </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I did find <a href="http://docwiki.embarcadero.com/RADStudio/XE8/en/Calling_the_Click-event_Handler" rel="nofollow">this information</a> about calling the 'Click-event' handler.  I set up a simple example like so:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>void __fastcall TFmListView::Click()&#xA;{&#xA;    ShowMessage("This is the control's click");&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This works fine, however according to the documentation:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>If the user has assigned a handler to a control's OnClick event, clicking the control results in that method being called.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Therefore, any additional logic I placed in the <code>Click()</code> method of the control would be lost if one of the control's on click event properties was set.  </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>What is the proper way to go about extending the functionality of what happens when a custom control is clicked?</p>&#xA;

 i am attempting to create a custom firemonkey control which inheirts from the  tlistview  control.   i want to add some functionality to the control which is automatically executed when a user clicks on the control.  therefore, my goal is not to specify an  onitemclick  method on my control's form, but rather add functionality directly into the control itself.   . ;. ; i am struggling to comprehend what i need to do in order to tap into the on click handler for  tlistview .  in my head, i imagine my solution would look something similar to this pseudo code: . ;. ;  . ;. ; however, i cant seem to find anything in the documentation about what method i should attempt to override, or how i should be going about this at all.   . ;. ; i did find  this information  about calling the 'click-event' handler.  i set up a simple example like so: . ;. ;  . ;. ; this works fine, however according to the documentation: . ;. ; . ;   if the user has assigned a handler to a control's onclick event, clicking the control results in that method being called. . ; . ;. ; therefore, any additional logic i placed in the  click()  method of the control would be lost if one of the control's on click event properties was set.   . ;. ; what is the proper way to go about extending the functionality of what happens when a custom control is clicked? . ;

<p>You need to add it in dom ready</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>jQuery(function($){&#xA;    $("#test").load("test.txt")&#xA;})&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The problem was when your script is executed the element with id <code>test</code> was not yes added to the dom so the selector <code>$("#test")</code> would return zero elements</p>&#xA;

}, :allow_destroy =&gt; true&#xA;end&#xA;&#xA;#SUBSUBSYSTEM MODEL&#xA;class Subsubsystem &lt; ActiveRecord::Base&#xA;  attr_accessible :hh, :name, :percentage, :price, :subsystem_id, :total_quantity, :unity, :value, :weight&#xA;  belongs_to :subsystem&#xA;  has_many :plannings, :as =&gt; :plannable&#xA;end&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Can anyone help me?! thanks in advance!</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>edit: parameters: </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>{"utf8"=&gt;"?",&#xA; "authenticity_token"=&gt;"vSr7C1+3+RhYArAmYz+zuAsLXsXriwouF771bn79+Is=",&#xA; "planning"=&gt;{"periods_attributes"=&gt;{"0"=&gt;{"planned_quantity"=&gt;"11"},&#xA; "1"=&gt;{"planned_quantity"=&gt;"6"},&#xA; "2"=&gt;{"planned_quantity"=&gt;"8"}},&#xA; "_destroy"=&gt;"0"},&#xA; "commit"=&gt;"OK"}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>If you don't want <code>toggleDescription</code> to be executed on click of a specific anchor, you can prevent the propagation of click using <code>stopPropagation()</code> method of event object in the particular anchors's click event. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>For example if you want to skip execution for the the following anchor</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;a class="dokumente_download"&gt;Content...&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You can do</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>$(".dokumente_download").click(function(e){&#xA; e.stopPropagation();&#xA;});&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 if you don't want  toggledescription  to be executed on click of a specific anchor, you can prevent the propagation of click using  stoppropagation()  method of event object in the particular anchors's click event.  . ;. ; for example if you want to skip execution for the the following anchor . ;. ;  . ;. ; you can do . ;. ;  . ;

if you don t want toggledescription to be executed on click of a specific anchor you can prevent the propagation of click using stoppropagation method of event object in the particular anchors s click event
for example if you want to skip execution for the the following anchor
you can do

<p>Bruce gives the following example in "Seven languages in seven weeks", Ruby day 3, page 38:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>module ActsAsCsv&#xA;  def self.included(base)&#xA;    base.extend ClassMethods&#xA;  end&#xA;&#xA;  module ClassMethods&#xA;    def acts_as_csv&#xA;      include InstanceMethods&#xA;    end&#xA;  end&#xA;&#xA;  module InstanceMethods&#xA;    def read&#xA;       #fill @csv_contents and @headers from file self.class.to_s.downcase + '.txt'&#xA;    end&#xA;&#xA;    attr_accessor :headers, :csv_contents&#xA;&#xA;    def initialize&#xA;      read&#xA;    end&#xA;  end&#xA;end&#xA;&#xA;class RubyCsv&#xA;  include ActsAsCsv&#xA;  acts_as_csv&#xA;end&#xA;&#xA;m = RubyCsv.new&#xA;puts m.headers.inspect&#xA;puts m.csv_contents.inspect&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I do not see any reason for the indirection used by <code>def self.included(base)</code> and <code>ClassMethods</code>. Is there an advantage of the above code over simply including the module InstanceMethods?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<hr>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In detail: With "simply including the module InstanceMethods" I mean the following code:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>  module InstanceMethods #defined as above&#xA;    def read&#xA;       #fill @csv_contents and @headers from file self.class.to_s.downcase + '.txt'&#xA;    end&#xA;&#xA;    attr_accessor :headers, :csv_contents&#xA;&#xA;    def initialize&#xA;      read&#xA;    end    &#xA;  end&#xA;&#xA;class RubyCsv&#xA;  include InstanceMethods&#xA;end&#xA;&#xA;m = RubyCsv.new&#xA;puts m.headers.inspect&#xA;puts m.csv_contents.inspect&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Because of duck typing, isn't this just as good as going via <code>base.extend ClassMethods</code>?</p>&#xA;

<p>Modern (non-IE) browsers have a new file API. Along with the multiple attribute on <code>input type=file</code> elements, you can read a couple of files and upload them seperatly.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Here is a basic of examples of this new feature:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>file.onchange = function()&#xA;{&#xA;    if(file.files.length)&#xA;    {&#xA;        var reader = new FileReader();&#xA;&#xA;        reader.onload = function(e)&#xA;        {&#xA;            // do something with e.target.result;&#xA;        };&#xA;&#xA;        //reader.readAsBinaryString(file.files[0]);&#xA;        reader.readAsArrayBuffer(file.files[0]);&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Also see <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en/DOM/FileReader" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In Internet Explorer (pre 9), this is probably an ActiveX feature. It should not work with the default settings in IE 8, however.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You can look this up with the term <code>new ActiveXObject("Scripting.FileSystemObject");</code>.</p>&#xA;

 modern (non-ie) browsers have a new file api. along with the multiple attribute on  elements, you can read a couple of files and upload them seperatly. . ;. ; here is a basic of examples of this new feature: . ;. ;  . ;. ; also see  here . . ;. ; in internet explorer (pre 9), this is probably an activex feature. it should not work with the default settings in ie 8, however. . ;. ; you can look this up with the term  new activexobject("scripting.filesystemobject"); . . ;

<p>Here's one way to do it, not the most dynamic as you'd need a category for each user but it might suit you if you only have a small number of users.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You could create categories one for each user then use a custom loop to only show categories for that user.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So something like</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>if($user == 'John Smith'){&#xA;    $taxTerm = 'John Smith CatTerm'&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Then create a custom loop using WP_Query (<a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Class_Reference/WP_Query" rel="nofollow">https://codex.wordpress.org/Class_Reference/WP_Query</a>) and use $taxTerm in your tax_query</p>&#xA;

<p>You are printing out a console.log.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>try</strong> </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>var x = " # # # #";&#xA;var y = "# # # # ";&#xA;for (var i = 1; i &lt; 9; i++) {&#xA;  if(i % 2 == 0){&#xA;    console.log(y);&#xA;  }&#xA;  else{&#xA;  console.log(x);&#xA;}&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>or maybe you intended to do the following:</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>var x = function(){ console.log(" # # # #") };&#xA;var y =  function(){ console.log("# # # # ")};&#xA;for (var i = 1; i &lt; 9; i++) {&#xA;  if(i % 2 == 0){&#xA;    y();&#xA;  }&#xA;  else{&#xA;  x();&#xA;}&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>Why is your code not working?</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>when you declare:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>   var x = console.log(" # # # #"); // &lt;- THE STRING IS BEING PRINTED OUT AT THIS POINT. NOT IN THE FOR LOOP.  &#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>console.log is a function which returns undefined. Therefore x is undefined.</p>&#xA;

 you are printing out a console.log. . ;. ;  try   . ;. ;  . ;. ;  or maybe you intended to do the following:  . ;. ;  . ;. ;  why is your code not working?  . ;. ; when you declare: . ;. ;  . ;. ; console.log is a function which returns undefined. therefore x is undefined. . ;

<p>If that pop up window has name, like opening from javascript window.open(URL, name).&#xA;Then it is possible to add the command to check the content of the popup. Like following command:&#xA;waitForPopUp | winId | 30000&#xA;selectWindow | winId&#xA;...&#xA;close</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>However, if the window has no name, like opened from &lt;a target="_blank"&gt; then you are out of luck.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Go to <a href="http://wiki.openqa.org/display/SEL/Selenium+Core+FAQ#SeleniumCoreFAQ-HowdoIworkwithapopupwindow%3F" rel="nofollow noreferrer">http://wiki.openqa.org/display/SEL/Selenium+Core+FAQ#SeleniumCoreFAQ-HowdoIworkwithapopupwindow%3F</a> for further details.</p>&#xA;

 if that pop up window has name, like opening from javascript window.open(url, name).. ;then it is possible to add the command to check the content of the popup. like following command:. ;waitforpopup | winid | 30000. ;selectwindow | winid. ;.... ;close . ;. ; however, if the window has no name, like opened from  a target="_blank"  then you are out of luck. . ;. ; go to     for further details. . ;

if that pop up window has name like opening from javascript window.open url name
then it is possible to add the command to check the content of the popup
like following command
waitforpopup | winid | 30000
selectwindow | winid
..
close
however if the window has no name like opened from a target _blank then you are out of luck
go to for further details



<p>A more porcelain way:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>git log -n 1 --pretty=%d HEAD&#xA;&#xA;# or equivalently:&#xA;git show -s --pretty=%d HEAD&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The refs will be listed in the format <code>(HEAD, master)</code> - you'll have to parse it a little bit if you intend to use this in scripts rather than for human consumption.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You could also implement it yourself a little more cleanly:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>git for-each-ref --format='%(objectname) %(refname:short)' refs/heads | awk "/^$(git rev-parse HEAD)/ {print \$2}"&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>with the benefit of getting the candidate refs on separate lines, with no extra characters.</p>&#xA;

 a more porcelain way: . ;. ;  . ;. ; the refs will be listed in the format  (head, master)  - you'll have to parse it a little bit if you intend to use this in scripts rather than for human consumption. . ;. ; you could also implement it yourself a little more cleanly: . ;. ;  . ;. ; with the benefit of getting the candidate refs on separate lines, with no extra characters. . ;

a more porcelain way
the refs will be listed in the format head master - you ll have to parse it a little bit if you intend to use this in scripts rather than for human consumption
you could also implement it yourself a little more cleanly
with the benefit of getting the candidate refs on separate lines with no extra characters



<p><div class="snippet" data-lang="js" data-hide="false">&#xD;&#xA;<div class="snippet-code">&#xD;&#xA;<pre class="snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override"><code>#Navigation &gt; li &gt; ul &gt; li { overflow: hidden;}&#xD;&#xA;#Navigation &gt; li &gt; ul &gt; li &gt; a { border-radius: 0; //remove border-radius}</code></pre>&#xD;&#xA;</div>&#xD;&#xA;</div>&#xD;&#xA;</p>&#xA;

  &#xd;. ; &#xd;. ;  &#xd;. ; &#xd;. ; &#xd;. ; . ;




<p>Once I discovered <code>boost::bind</code> (and <code>boost::function</code>) I found instead of thinking in terms of inheritance and abstract base classes ("interfaces" in java/c#-speak) I started seeing everything as a functor.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>For example, pre-boost I'd have built a menu system where the menus were containers of <code>IActionable*</code> items and anything which wanted to be hooked into the menu system would have to inherit IActionable and provide an action method.  Post-boost and I'm implementing menus containing <code>boost::function&lt;void()&gt;</code> objects and just throwing anything I want into them using <code>boost::bind</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Another thing: just looking at the way in which boost successfully employs templates really made me raise my expectations of what was possible with them and make the effort to make better use of them in my own code, so I'm writing a lot more "generic" and less "OOP" code.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The smart pointers are certainly useful and get a lot of coverage, but apart from cleaning up some explicit deletes they're hardly a paradigm shift.</p>&#xA;

 once i discovered  boost::bind  (and  boost::function ) i found instead of thinking in terms of inheritance and abstract base classes ("interfaces" in java/c#-speak) i started seeing everything as a functor. . ;. ; for example, pre-boost i'd have built a menu system where the menus were containers of  items and anything which wanted to be hooked into the menu system would have to inherit iactionable and provide an action method.  post-boost and i'm implementing menus containing  objects and just throwing anything i want into them using  boost::bind . . ;. ; another thing: just looking at the way in which boost successfully employs templates really made me raise my expectations of what was possible with them and make the effort to make better use of them in my own code, so i'm writing a lot more "generic" and less "oop" code. . ;. ; the smart pointers are certainly useful and get a lot of coverage, but apart from cleaning up some explicit deletes they're hardly a paradigm shift. . ;
