<p>Hi this will split the text you provided.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>    $text = 'Name|Code|Email|Designation|Number|Salary|Age\t&#xA;    syed|101|syed@gmail.com|trainee|7222877798|6000|21\t&#xA;    hari|102|hari@gmail.com|trainee|9554512582|6000|23\t';&#xA;&#xA;    //remove line endings&#xA;    $text = str_replace(array("\r\n", "\r", "\n"), "", $text);&#xA;&#xA;    $rows = explode('\t', $text);&#xA;    $data = array();&#xA;    foreach ($rows as $row){&#xA;            //don't include empty lines&#xA;        if(!empty( $row )){&#xA;            $data[] = explode('|', $row);&#xA;        }&#xA;    }&#xA;    echo '&lt;pre&gt;';&#xA;    var_export( $data );&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Outputs:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>array (&#xA;            0 =&gt;&#xA;            array (&#xA;                    0 =&gt; 'Name',&#xA;                    1 =&gt; 'Code',&#xA;                    2 =&gt; 'Email',&#xA;                    3 =&gt; 'Designation',&#xA;                    4 =&gt; 'Number',&#xA;                    5 =&gt; 'Salary',&#xA;                    6 =&gt; 'Age',&#xA;            ),&#xA;            1 =&gt;&#xA;            array (&#xA;                    0 =&gt; 'syed',&#xA;                    1 =&gt; '101',&#xA;                    2 =&gt; 'syed@gmail.com',&#xA;                    3 =&gt; 'trainee',&#xA;                    4 =&gt; '7222877798',&#xA;                    5 =&gt; '6000',&#xA;                    6 =&gt; '21',&#xA;            ),&#xA;            2 =&gt;&#xA;            array (&#xA;                    0 =&gt; 'hari',&#xA;                    1 =&gt; '102',&#xA;                    2 =&gt; 'hari@gmail.com',&#xA;                    3 =&gt; 'trainee',&#xA;                    4 =&gt; '9554512582',&#xA;                    5 =&gt; '6000',&#xA;                    6 =&gt; '23',&#xA;            ),&#xA;    );&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>However that said, there is a lot going on in your example, as for reading the file in.  If it's not to large the best bet would be to use <code>file_get_contents()</code> that will read the whole file in one go.  Otherwise in this part</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>   $handle = fopen($file,"r");                         //  Open the file and read&#xA;   while($strBookData = fgets($handle, 4096)) {        //  To get Array from&#xA;        $strDatas[] = $strBookData;&#xA;        $strTableColumn = count($strBookData);  &#xA;   }&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You would be better off just concatenating the text. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>   $strDatas = '';&#xA;   $handle = fopen($file,"r");                         //  Open the file and read&#xA;   while($strBookData = fgets($handle, 4096)) {        //  To get Array from&#xA;        $strDatas .= $strBookData; &#xA;   }&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And then splitting like I did above.</p>&#xA;

<p>You have hit the maximum limit of allowed clients set in <strong>postgresql.conf</strong>. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You should check this configuration file, and increase the <strong>max_connections</strong> variable or check the <strong>min-pool-size</strong> and <strong>max-pool-size</strong> values at your JBoss datasource declaration, and set lower values to meet the Postgres configuration.</p>&#xA;

<p>Create a property <code>indexPath</code> in the cell class and set it in <code>cellForRowAtIndexPath</code> when the cell is reused.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>But there is a caveat: Some table view methods to rearrange the cells don't call <code>cellForRowAtIndexPath</code>. You have to consider this case.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>But if you use always only <code>reloadData()</code> it's safe and pretty easy.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<hr>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Another way is to put the code regarding <em>controlling</em> things back in the <em>controller</em> class and run it via callback closures capturing the index path.</p>&#xA;

 create a property  indexpath  in the cell class and set it in  cellforrowatindexpath  when the cell is reused. . ;. ; but there is a caveat: some table view methods to rearrange the cells don't call  cellforrowatindexpath . you have to consider this case. . ;. ; but if you use always only  reloaddata()  it's safe and pretty easy. . ;. ; . ;. ; another way is to put the code regarding  controlling  things back in the  controller  class and run it via callback closures capturing the index path. . ;

create a property indexpath in the cell class and set it in cellforrowatindexpath when the cell is reused
but there is a caveat some table view methods to rearrange the cells don t call cellforrowatindexpath
you have to consider this case
but if you use always only reloaddata it s safe and pretty easy
another way is to put the code regarding controlling things back in the controller class and run it via callback closures capturing the index path

<p>There is possible than the oriented object method : <code>$date = new \DateTime(); $myentity-&gt;setTimestamp($date-&gt;getTimestamp());</code> will be override by ORM.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>See <a href="http://php.net/manual/en/datetime.gettimestamp.php" rel="nofollow">DateTime::getTimestamp</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<ol>&#xA;<li><p>If you attempt with the procedural style : <code>$date = date_create(); $myentity-&gt;setTimestamp(date_timestamp_get($date));</code> have you any satisfied result ?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>See <a href="http://php.net/manual/en/datetime.format.php" rel="nofollow">DateTime::format</a></p></li>&#xA;<li><p>You can also attempt with <code>$date = new DateTime(); $myentity-&gt;setTimestamp($date-&gt;format('U')); // return seconds since the Unix Epoch (January 1 1970 00:00:00 GMT)</code></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>See <a href="http://php.net/manual/en/function.time.php" rel="nofollow">time()</a></p></li>&#xA;</ol>&#xA;

 there is possible than the oriented object method :  will be override by orm. . ;. ; see  datetime::gettimestamp  . ;. ; . ;  if you attempt with the procedural style :  have you any satisfied result ? . ;. ; see  datetime::format   . ;  you can also attempt with  . ;. ; see  time()   . ; . ;

there is possible than the oriented object method will be override by orm
see datetime gettimestamp
if you attempt with the procedural style have you any satisfied result
see datetime format
you can also attempt with
see time



<p>Imo you'd have to dig into persistence and monitoring database schemas to understand and then build your own API. It would mainly rely on queries requesting these databases.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Appfabric on IIS is a UI for monitoring wcf services, it obviously seems to rely on queries against these databases. It can retrive idle, failed or in progress calls to your services.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>App fabric dashboard also provides details with "where" SQL predicates. You can freely inspire from these to make your own API/UI.</p>&#xA;

 imo you'd have to dig into persistence and monitoring database schemas to understand and then build your own api. it would mainly rely on queries requesting these databases. . ;. ; appfabric on iis is a ui for monitoring wcf services, it obviously seems to rely on queries against these databases. it can retrive idle, failed or in progress calls to your services. . ;. ; app fabric dashboard also provides details with "where" sql predicates. you can freely inspire from these to make your own api/ui. . ;

<p>The whole point of enclosing stuff into IIFEs is to isolate them and not pollute the global environment with unnecessaries. For example,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>var counter = (function() {&#xA;  var current = 0;&#xA;  function getCurrentAndIncrement() {&#xA;    return current++;&#xA;  };&#xA;  return getCurrentAndIncrement;&#xA;})();&#xA;&#xA;counter()&#xA;// 0&#xA;counter()&#xA;// 1&#xA;current&#xA;// ReferenceError: current is not defined&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>We hide what should be private, and expose what should be public.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You hid everything - then the fact that it is inaccessible should not be a surprise.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Finally, <code>&lt;div id="div0" ondrop="drop(event)"&gt;...&lt;/div&gt;</code> is a bad practice. Binding event listeners from JavaScript is much better, if a bit more complicated. Do just this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;div id="div0"&gt;...&lt;/div&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>then in JavaScript,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>var div0 = document.getElementById('div0');&#xA;div0.addEventListener('drop', myHandler);&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>and this can, indeed, be stuffed into an IIFE. Whatever you refer to from HTML (as in your <code>drop</code> function) needs to be in global scope, or the browser will not be able to find it.</p>&#xA;

 the whole point of enclosing stuff into iifes is to isolate them and not pollute the global environment with unnecessaries. for example, . ;. ;  . ;. ; we hide what should be private, and expose what should be public. . ;. ; you hid everything - then the fact that it is inaccessible should not be a surprise. . ;. ; finally,  is a bad practice. binding event listeners from javascript is much better, if a bit more complicated. do just this: . ;. ;  . ;. ; then in javascript, . ;. ;  . ;. ; and this can, indeed, be stuffed into an iife. whatever you refer to from html (as in your  drop  function) needs to be in global scope, or the browser will not be able to find it. . ;

for example
we hide what should be private and expose what should be public
you hid everything - then the fact that it is inaccessible should not be a surprise
finally is a bad practice
binding event listeners from javascript is much better if a bit more complicated
do just this
then in javascript

<p>Our nupkg packages contain multiple versions of the same dll (x86, x64, AnyCPU) and in the csproj files, in references I use conditional references to pick a specific dll depending on the current platform set. As a result I have multiple references to the same library (just different platform compilation).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>here's a fragment of my csproj file:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;Reference Include="xxxx" Condition="'$(Platform)'=='x86'"&gt;            &#xA;   &lt;HintPath&gt;..\..\packages\xxxx.2.7.0.1093\lib\net45\x86\xxxx.dll&lt;/HintPath&gt;&#xA;&lt;/Reference&gt;&#xA;&lt;Reference Include="xxxx" Condition="'$(Platform)'=='x64'"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;HintPath&gt;..\..\packages\xxxx.2.7.0.1093\lib\net45\x64\xxxx.dll&lt;/HintPath&gt;&#xA;&lt;/Reference&gt;&#xA;&lt;Reference Include="xxxx" Condition="'$(Platform)'=='AnyCPU'"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;HintPath&gt;..\..\packages\xxxx.2.7.0.1093\lib\net45\AnyCPU\xxxx.dll&lt;/HintPath&gt;&#xA;&lt;/Reference&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This construction works very well in both MSBuild and in Visual Studio.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Unfortunately after <em>nuget update</em> the csproj references get messed up. Here's the result:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&lt;Reference Include="xxxx" Condition="'$(Platform)'=='x86'"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;HintPath&gt;..\..\packages\xxxx.2.7.0.1093\lib\net45\x86\xxxx.dll&lt;/HintPath&gt;&#xA;&lt;/Reference&gt;&#xA;&lt;Reference Include="xxxx" Condition="'$(Platform)'=='x64'"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;HintPath&gt;..\..\packages\xxxx.2.7.0.1093\lib\net45\x64\xxxx.dll&lt;/HintPath&gt;&#xA;&lt;/Reference&gt;&#xA;&lt;Reference Include="xxxx"&gt;&#xA;  &lt;HintPath&gt;..\..\packages\xxxx.2.7.0.1094\lib\net45\x86\xxxx.dll&lt;/HintPath&gt;&#xA;&lt;/Reference&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So looks like only one reference got updated and... the <em>Condition</em> section got dropped as well as the first dll on the list was used.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Not what I was expecting. Any ideas how to best work around that problem? Anyone using conditional references in your csproj's with nuget? Any advice would be greatly appreciated!</p>&#xA;

 our nupkg packages contain multiple versions of the same dll (x86, x64, anycpu) and in the csproj files, in references i use conditional references to pick a specific dll depending on the current platform set. as a result i have multiple references to the same library (just different platform compilation). . ;. ; here's a fragment of my csproj file: . ;. ;  . ;. ; this construction works very well in both msbuild and in visual studio. . ;. ; unfortunately after  nuget update  the csproj references get messed up. here's the result: . ;. ;  . ;. ; so looks like only one reference got updated and... the  condition  section got dropped as well as the first dll on the list was used. . ;. ; not what i was expecting. any ideas how to best work around that problem? anyone using conditional references in your csproj's with nuget? any advice would be greatly appreciated! . ;

<p>Excel provides a number of "fine-grained protection options" which allow the user to pick and choose what should or should not be protected in a worksheet, such as allowing AutoFilter operations.  SpreadsheetGear offers general worksheet protection, but does not yet support choosing protection options at this fine grained level.  So enabling AutoFilters with worksheet protection enabled is not possible, unfortunately.  </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>We do keep track of these sorts of requests (I work for SpreadsheetGear).  You are welcome to contact us at support@spreadsheetgear.com so that I can add your contact information to this feature request and let you know when we do move forward on this.</p>&#xA;

 excel provides a number of "fine-grained protection options" which allow the user to pick and choose what should or should not be protected in a worksheet, such as allowing autofilter operations.  spreadsheetgear offers general worksheet protection, but does not yet support choosing protection options at this fine grained level.  so enabling autofilters with worksheet protection enabled is not possible, unfortunately.   . ;. ; we do keep track of these sorts of requests (i work for spreadsheetgear).  you are welcome to contact us at support@spreadsheetgear.com so that i can add your contact information to this feature request and let you know when we do move forward on this. . ;

excel provides a number of fine-grained protection options which allow the user to pick and choose what should or should not be protected in a worksheet such as allowing autofilter operations
spreadsheetgear offers general worksheet protection but does not yet support choosing protection options at this fine grained level
so enabling autofilters with worksheet protection enabled is not possible unfortunately
we do keep track of these sorts of requests i work for spreadsheetgear
you are welcome to contact us at support spreadsheetgear.com so that i can add your contact information to this feature request and let you know when we do move forward on this



<p>I'm trying to replace a fragment located in the main layout. These are the configurations used in my project. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Default build version,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>  compileSdkVersion 22&#xA;  buildToolsVersion '22.0.1'&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Dependencies,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>compile 'com.android.support:appcompat-v7:21.0.3'&#xA;compile 'com.android.support:recyclerview-v7:21.0.3'&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This is the code I'm using for replacing fragments inside the fragment class,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>FragmentManager fm = ((FragmentActivity) activity).getSupportFragmentManager();&#xA;            FragmentTransaction ft = fm.beginTransaction();&#xA;            FragmentCategoryContainer fragmentCategoryContainer = new FragmentCategoryContainer();&#xA;            fragmentCategoryContainer.category_code = m.getCatagoryCode();&#xA;            ft.replace(R.id.fragment_container, fragmentCategoryContainer);&#xA;            ft.setTransition(FragmentTransaction.TRANSIT_FRAGMENT_FADE);&#xA;            ft.addToBackStack(null);&#xA;            ft.commit();&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>and here's the layout containing the fragment,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>   &lt;fragment&#xA;        android:id="@+id/fragment_container"&#xA;        android:name="com.example.FragmentCategoryList"&#xA;        android:layout_width="match_parent"&#xA;        android:layout_height="match_parent" /&gt;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This is the expected output,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="https://i.stack.imgur.com/cEHKT.png" rel="nofollow noreferrer"><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/cEHKT.png" alt="enter image description here"></a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Now, most surprisingly if I change the dependencies to this,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>compile 'com.android.support:appcompat-v7:22.2.1'&#xA;compile 'com.android.support:recyclerview-v7:22.2.1&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I'm getting the following output with overlapped fragments,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="https://i.stack.imgur.com/rcc68.png" rel="nofollow noreferrer"><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/rcc68.png" alt="enter image description here"></a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I have no idea of whats going wrong. This is indeed a critical situation. Any kind of help would be extremely appreciated. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>UPDATE:</strong> </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Here's my Adapter class which contains the recycle view,</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>StickyGridAdapter extends RecyclerView.Adapter&lt;StickyViewHolder&gt; {&#xA;&#xA;    private static final String[] header_title = {"New Apps", "Wap Infotainment", "Wap Download"};&#xA;    private static final int VIEW_TYPE_HEADER = 0x01;&#xA;    private static final int VIEW_TYPE_CONTENT = 0x00;&#xA;&#xA;    private final ArrayList&lt;LineItem&gt; mItems;&#xA;    private final Context mContext;&#xA;    private int mHeaderDisplay;&#xA;    private boolean mMarginsFixed;&#xA;    private List&lt;ServicesList&gt; Items;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;    public StickyGridAdapter(Context context, int headerMode, List&lt;ServicesList&gt; items) {&#xA;        mContext = context;&#xA;        mHeaderDisplay = headerMode;&#xA;        mItems = new ArrayList&lt;&gt;();&#xA;        Items = items;&#xA;&#xA;        //Insert headers into list of items.&#xA;        int sectionManager = -1;&#xA;        int headerCount = 0;&#xA;        int sectionFirstPosition = 0;&#xA;&#xA;        for (int i = 0; i &lt; Items.size(); i++) {&#xA;            ServicesList m = Items.get(i);&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;            // Insert new header view and update section data.&#xA;            if (i == 0) {&#xA;                sectionManager = (sectionManager + 1) % 2;&#xA;                sectionFirstPosition = i + headerCount;&#xA;                headerCount += 1;&#xA;                mItems.add(new LineItem(header_title[0], "", true, sectionManager, sectionFirstPosition));&#xA;&#xA;            } else if (i == 4) {&#xA;                sectionManager = (sectionManager + 1) % 2;&#xA;                sectionFirstPosition = i + headerCount;&#xA;                headerCount += 1;&#xA;                mItems.add(new LineItem(header_title[2], "", true, sectionManager, sectionFirstPosition));&#xA;            }&#xA;            mItems.add(new LineItem(m.getServiceName(), m.getIcon(), false, sectionManager, sectionFirstPosition));&#xA;        }&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    public boolean isItemHeader(int position) {&#xA;        return mItems.get(position).isHeader;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    public String itemToString(int position) {&#xA;        return mItems.get(position).text;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    @Override&#xA;    public StickyViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(ViewGroup parent, int viewType) {&#xA;        View view;&#xA;        if (viewType == VIEW_TYPE_HEADER) {&#xA;            view = LayoutInflater.from(parent.getContext())&#xA;                    .inflate(R.layout.header_item, parent, false);&#xA;        } else {&#xA;            view = LayoutInflater.from(parent.getContext())&#xA;                    .inflate(R.layout.sticky_grid_item, parent, false);&#xA;        }&#xA;        return new StickyViewHolder(view);&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    @Override&#xA;    public void onBindViewHolder(StickyViewHolder holder, int position) {&#xA;        final LineItem item = mItems.get(position);&#xA;        final View itemView = holder.itemView;&#xA;&#xA;        holder.bindItem(item.text);&#xA;        if (!item.isHeader) {&#xA;            ServicesList m = Items.get(position);&#xA;            holder.bindImage(mContext, m);&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        final GridSLM.LayoutParams lp = GridSLM.LayoutParams.from(itemView.getLayoutParams());&#xA;        lp.setSlm(GridSLM.ID);&#xA;        lp.setColumnWidth(mContext.getResources().getDimensionPixelSize(R.dimen.grid_column_width));&#xA;        lp.setFirstPosition(item.sectionFirstPosition);&#xA;        itemView.setLayoutParams(lp);&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    @Override&#xA;    public int getItemViewType(int position) {&#xA;        return mItems.get(position).isHeader ? VIEW_TYPE_HEADER : VIEW_TYPE_CONTENT;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    @Override&#xA;    public int getItemCount() {&#xA;        return mItems.size();&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    public void setHeaderDisplay(int headerDisplay) {&#xA;        mHeaderDisplay = headerDisplay;&#xA;        notifyHeaderChanges();&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    public void setMarginsFixed(boolean marginsFixed) {&#xA;        mMarginsFixed = marginsFixed;&#xA;        notifyHeaderChanges();&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    private void notifyHeaderChanges() {&#xA;        for (int i = 0; i &lt; mItems.size(); i++) {&#xA;            LineItem item = mItems.get(i);&#xA;            if (item.isHeader) {&#xA;                notifyItemChanged(i);&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    private static class LineItem {&#xA;&#xA;        public int sectionManager;&#xA;        public int sectionFirstPosition;&#xA;        public boolean isHeader;&#xA;        public String text, path;&#xA;&#xA;        public LineItem(String text, String path, boolean isHeader, int sectionManager,&#xA;                        int sectionFirstPosition) {&#xA;            this.isHeader = isHeader;&#xA;            this.text = text;&#xA;            this.path = path;&#xA;            this.sectionManager = sectionManager;&#xA;            this.sectionFirstPosition = sectionFirstPosition;&#xA;        }&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

So, I'd like to handle any interaction with files, even code editing, but also, just other interaction, like with the menus, or just the IDE itself.</li>&#xA;</ol>&#xA;&#xA;<p>As well as these, I'd also like to be able to store data somewhere. Where is this usually done? Can I add Metadata to the Solution file? <p>In my location field I have :</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>"Location:&#xA;SOME PLACE&#xA;&#xA;Additional Details:&#xA;DEFECT&#xA;"&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Somehow I need this to take out the <code>"SOME PLACE"</code>. I have tried to understand how the <code>regexp_substr()</code> function works, but it is very different from my C# background and I keep getting weird results like nulls.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Normally I would have expected to do something like :</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>regexp_substr(LocationField, 'Location:(.*)\n') as "NewLocation"&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And for it to cut out the part in parenthesis... but I was wrong. Any ideas?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>SOLUTION :</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>regexp_replace(FIELD, 'Location:'||CHR(13)||CHR(10)||'(.*).*$'||CHR(13)||CHR(10)||CHR(13)||CHR(10)||'Additional Details:.*$', '\1', 1, 1, 'n' ) as "Location"&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

solution



<p>You have to run <code>psexec</code> as a user with <code>Administrator</code> permissions to the remote computer. (All the <code>-u</code> option does is to change the account used to execute the command on the remote computer.) Either configure your service to run as an account with permissions to the remote computer, or use a second instance of <code>psexec</code> to run the first instance of <code>psexec</code> as the appropriate user.</p>&#xA;

 you have to run  psexec  as a user with  administrator  permissions to the remote computer. (all the  -u  option does is to change the account used to execute the command on the remote computer.) either configure your service to run as an account with permissions to the remote computer, or use a second instance of  psexec  to run the first instance of  psexec  as the appropriate user. . ;

you have to run psexec as a user with administrator permissions to the remote computer
all the -u option does is to change the account used to execute the command on the remote computer. either configure your service to run as an account with permissions to the remote computer or use a second instance of psexec to run the first instance of psexec as the appropriate user



<p>I am building a linux kernel module for the InfiniBand device.&#xA;The idea is to build a very simple InfiniBand RDMA kernel module to create and send IPoIB frames to another IPoIB enabled system.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The following is the code which I have written so far. But any calls to functions  in ib_verbs library results to kernel crash while doing "insmod".</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>#include &lt;linux/kernel.h&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;linux/init.h&gt;&#xA;#include &lt;linux/module.h&gt;&#xA;#include "totf.h"&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;struct workqueue_struct *myModule_workqueue;&#xA;struct ib_sa_client myModule_sa_client;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;static void myModule_add_one(struct ib_device *device)&#xA;{&#xA;        struct ib_port_attr attr;&#xA;        int s, e, p;&#xA;        u8 temp_ib_port_num = 1;&#xA;        int result = -ENOMEM;&#xA;        union ib_gid ib_port_gid;&#xA;&#xA;        if (rdma_node_get_transport(device-&gt;node_type) != RDMA_TRANSPORT_IB){&#xA;                return;&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        if (device-&gt;node_type == RDMA_NODE_IB_SWITCH) {&#xA;                s = 0;&#xA;                e = 0;&#xA;        } else {&#xA;                s = 1;&#xA;                e = device-&gt;phys_port_cnt;&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;//      result = ib_query_gid(device,temp_ib_port_num,1,&amp;ib_port_gid);&#xA;        result = ib_query_port(device,temp_ib_port_num,&amp;attr);&#xA;&#xA;//      TempDelMe = rdma_port_get_link_layer(device, temp_ib_port_num) != IB_LINK_LAYER_INFINIBAND;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;static void myModule_remove_one(struct ib_device *device)&#xA;{&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;static struct ib_client my_client = {&#xA;        .name   = "myModule",&#xA;        .add    = myModule_add_one,&#xA;        .remove = myModule_remove_one&#xA;};&#xA;static int __init myModule_init(void)&#xA;{&#xA;        int ret;&#xA;&#xA;        totf_workqueue = create_singlethread_workqueue("myModule");&#xA;        if (!myModule_workqueue) {&#xA;                ret = -ENOMEM;&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        ib_sa_register_client(&amp;myModule_sa_client);&#xA;        ret = ib_register_client(&amp;myModule_client);&#xA;        if(ret){&#xA;                //printk(KERN_ALERT "KERN_ERR Failed to register IB client\n");&#xA;                goto err_sa;&#xA;        }&#xA;        printk(KERN_ALERT "KERN_INFO Successfully registered myModule module \n");&#xA;        return 0;&#xA;&#xA;err_sa:&#xA;        ib_sa_unregister_client(&amp;myModule_sa_client);&#xA;        destroy_workqueue(myModule_workqueue);&#xA;&#xA;        return ret;&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;static void __exit myModule_exit(void)&#xA;{&#xA;        printk(KERN_ALERT "KERN_INFO Inside the myModule exit phase\n");&#xA;        ib_unregister_client(&amp;my_client);&#xA;        ib_sa_unregister_client(&amp;myModule_sa_client);&#xA;        destroy_workqueue(myModule_workqueue);&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;module_init(myModule_init);&#xA;module_exit(myModule_exit);&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Problem is whenever I call to  </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>result = ib_query_gid(device,temp_ib_port_num,1,&amp;ib_port_gid);&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>OR</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>result = ib_query_port(device,temp_ib_port_num,&amp;attr);&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>the kernel crashes. <strong>What could be the possible reason and how can I remove it ?</strong></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>NOTE: The modules are being successfully compiled. <p>Did you use some multiplexing system call like <code>select</code> or <code>poll</code> which are able to test of a set of file descriptors has some of them ready (for input, or for output)?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Learn more about <a href="http://linux.die.net/man/2/poll" rel="nofollow">poll</a> or about <a href="http://linux.die.net/man/2/select_tut" rel="nofollow">select</a> and friends.</p>&#xA;

<p>There is no reason why you can't just use the client and server Jersey in the same code, just like it were any other code. However, chaining HTTP requests like sounds like it might not be the best idea. Are you sure this is what you want to be doing? </p>&#xA;

<p>According to <a href="http://www.cmake.org/cmake/help/cmake2.6docs.html#command%3aset_target_properties" rel="nofollow">CMake documentation</a> "DEFINE_SYMBOL sets the name of the preprocessor symbol defined when compiling sources in a shared library" while you are trying to use it on a static library, hence no effect. You may also find <a href="http://www.cmake.org/pipermail/cmake/2005-October/007304.html" rel="nofollow">this discussion</a> useful.</p>&#xA;

 according to  cmake documentation  "define_symbol sets the name of the preprocessor symbol defined when compiling sources in a shared library" while you are trying to use it on a static library, hence no effect. you may also find  this discussion  useful. . ;

according to cmake documentation define_symbol sets the name of the preprocessor symbol defined when compiling sources in a shared library while you are trying to use it on a static library hence no effect
you may also find this discussion useful



<p>Your data flow is backwards. In main(), you're calling get_input1 to retrieve values, much as with input(), but if we look at that get_input1 does:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code># Names its argument, which was a question, "pennies"&#xA;def get_input1(pennies):&#xA;    # Asks a question, converts to int, and discards it&#xA;    int(input("Enter Pennies: "))&#xA;    if int(pennies) &lt; 0:    # Converts pennies to int; but it was a question!&#xA;        print('Error: money cannot be negative')&#xA;        # This is the only place to alter pennies, but it doesn't return it&#xA;        pennies = int(input('Enter correct amount of pennies: '))&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>It looks like this used to be code that was refactored to handle the various coins with a function call each, but it doesn't have the two modifications it needs: a way to alter what it asks for, and a way to return what the answer was. Note that function arguments, like pennies in get_input1, are local variables; main never sees it changing. </p>&#xA;

 your data flow is backwards. in main(), you're calling get_input1 to retrieve values, much as with input(), but if we look at that get_input1 does: . ;. ;  . ;. ; it looks like this used to be code that was refactored to handle the various coins with a function call each, but it doesn't have the two modifications it needs: a way to alter what it asks for, and a way to return what the answer was. note that function arguments, like pennies in get_input1, are local variables; main never sees it changing.  . ;

<p>To achieve something like this, inherit from <code>argparse.ArgumentParser</code> and reimplement the <code>exit</code> method (or perhaps the <code>error</code> method if you like).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>For example:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>class Parser(argparse.ArgumentParser):&#xA;    # the default status on the parent class is 0, we're &#xA;    # changing it to be 1 here ...&#xA;    def exit(self, status=1, message=None):&#xA;        return super().exit(status, message)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>With your Excel and Powerpoint objects the following should work:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>'copy the chart from Excel&#xA;    xlSheet.ChartObjects(ChartName).Select&#xA;    xlSheet.ChartObjects(ChartName).Copy&#xA;'Select Slide&#xA;    Set mySlide = myPresentation.Slides(Charts(r).SlideName)&#xA;    mySlide.Select&#xA;'stall to make sure the slide is selected&#xA;    For k = 1 To 1000&#xA;        DoEvents&#xA;    Next k&#xA;'paste on selected slide&#xA;    PPApp.CommandBars.ExecuteMso ("PasteSourceFormatting")&#xA;    PPApp.CommandBars.ReleaseFocus&#xA;'sit and wait for changes to be made&#xA;    For k = 1 To 5000&#xA;        DoEvents&#xA;    Next k&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The wait loops are in there because my Power Point was running slow and throwing errors.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The only problem with this is that it selects the chart and then the slide so it runs a little slower (and has a flashing screen if you use it in a loop for multiple charts) but when I tried to do it straight I kept getting pastes in the wrong slides and such.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Another issue with this approach is you have no reference to the chart after it is pasted so if you would like to resize/format it it needs to be done right after using <code>PPApp.ActiveWindow.Selection.ShapeRange</code> or something of the sort.</p>&#xA;

 with your excel and powerpoint objects the following should work: . ;. ;  . ;. ; the wait loops are in there because my power point was running slow and throwing errors. . ;. ; the only problem with this is that it selects the chart and then the slide so it runs a little slower (and has a flashing screen if you use it in a loop for multiple charts) but when i tried to do it straight i kept getting pastes in the wrong slides and such. . ;. ; another issue with this approach is you have no reference to the chart after it is pasted so if you would like to resize/format it it needs to be done right after using  ppapp.activewindow.selection.shaperange  or something of the sort. . ;

with your excel and powerpoint objects the following should work
the wait loops are in there because my power point was running slow and throwing errors
the only problem with this is that it selects the chart and then the slide so it runs a little slower and has a flashing screen if you use it in a loop for multiple charts but when i tried to do it straight i kept getting pastes in the wrong slides and such
another issue with this approach is you have no reference to the chart after it is pasted so if you would like to resize format it it needs to be done right after using ppapp.activewindow.selection.shaperange or something of the sort



<p>Without the add-on domain. Use (instead of your code):</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>RewriteEngine On&#xA;RewriteCond %{HTTPS} off&#xA;RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} !addondomain\.com$ [NC]&#xA;RewriteRule ^ https://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI} [L,R=301]&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Force HTTPS to HTTP for the add-on domain. Add:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>RewriteCond %{HTTPS} on&#xA;RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} addondomain\.com$ [NC]&#xA;RewriteRule ^ http://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI} [L,R=301]&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 without the add-on domain. use (instead of your code): . ;. ;  . ;. ; force https to http for the add-on domain. add: . ;. ;  . ;

<p>I'm creating an object stack which uses a doubly linked list in order to reference the bottom objects as they are popped off the stack. My dilemma is that I have multiple classes which take in objects as parameters. The objects represent instances of the other classes so they are not accepted as parameters into a different class unless the methods and fields of that receiving class are declared with the name of the sending class. I don't want the classes to be dependent off of each other since I want to use the doubly linked list later on in other programs. So I am contemplating writing generics into my program or casting the objects. Which do you think is the better choice and why? Also how would the approach be implemented? </p>&#xA;

<p>I spent ages trying to figure this one out, and eventually found that it was my call to <code>CoInitializeEx(COINIT_MULTITHREADED)</code> that was the problem. The recent items folder only works with <code>COINIT_APARTMENTTHREADED</code>. See this <a href="http://support.microsoft.com/kb/287087" rel="nofollow">link</a>.</p>&#xA;

 i spent ages trying to figure this one out, and eventually found that it was my call to  coinitializeex(coinit_multithreaded)  that was the problem. the recent items folder only works with  coinit_apartmentthreaded . see this  link . . ;

i spent ages trying to figure this one out and eventually found that it was my call to coinitializeex coinit_multithreaded that was the problem
the recent items folder only works with coinit_apartmentthreaded
see this link



<p>With the constraints you have what I would do would be to cast and throw errors from inside the overridden SomeMethod.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>public abstract class BaseClass : IMyInterface&lt;BaseFoo&gt;&#xA;{&#xA;    public virtual void SomeMethod(BaseFoo t)&#xA;    {&#xA;        t.CommonProperty = 1;&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;public class ConcreteClass1 : BaseClass&#xA;{&#xA;    public override void SomeMethod(BaseFoo t)&#xA;    {&#xA;        if(t == null)&#xA;            throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(t));&#xA;&#xA;        var foo1 = t as Foo1;&#xA;        if(foo1 == null)&#xA;            throw new NotSupportedException($"{nameof(ConcreteClass1)} does not support types other than {nameof(Foo1)}");&#xA;&#xA;        foo1.SomeProperty = 57;&#xA;        base.SomeMethod(foo1);&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;public class ConcreteClass2 : BaseClass&#xA;{&#xA;    public override void SomeMethod(BaseFoo t)&#xA;    {&#xA;        if (t == null)&#xA;            throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(t));&#xA;&#xA;        var foo2 = t as Foo2;&#xA;        if (foo2 == null)&#xA;            throw new NotSupportedException($"{nameof(ConcreteClass2)} does not support types other than {nameof(Foo2)}");&#xA;&#xA;        foo2.AnotherProperty = 123;&#xA;        base.SomeMethod(foo2);&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;public static class ConcreteClassFactory&#xA;{&#xA;    public enum ConcreteClassType&#xA;    {&#xA;        ConcreteClass1,&#xA;        ConcreteClass2&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    public static BaseClass CreateClass(ConcreteClassType type)&#xA;    {&#xA;        BaseClass toReturn = null;&#xA;&#xA;        switch (type)&#xA;        {&#xA;            case ConcreteClassType.ConcreteClass1:&#xA;                toReturn = new ConcreteClass1();&#xA;                break;&#xA;            case ConcreteClassType.ConcreteClass2:&#xA;                toReturn = new ConcreteClass2();&#xA;                break;&#xA;            default:&#xA;                break;&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        return toReturn;&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Used like</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>class Program&#xA;{&#xA;    static void Main(string[] args)&#xA;    {&#xA;        BaseFoo foo = new Foo1();&#xA;&#xA;        var bar = ConcreteClassFactory.CreateClass(ConcreteClassFactory.ConcreteClassType.ConcreteClass1);&#xA;&#xA;        bar.SomeMethod(foo);&#xA;    }&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 with the constraints you have what i would do would be to cast and throw errors from inside the overridden somemethod. . ;. ;  . ;. ; used like . ;. ;  . ;

with the constraints you have what i would do would be to cast and throw errors from inside the overridden somemethod
used like



<p>You are mapping the <code>description</code> key in the JSON to a <code>description</code> key on the <code>Predictions</code> object, which does not exist.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The property on the <code>Predictions</code> class is called <code>placeDescription</code>, not <code>description</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Replace the dictionary passed to <code>addAttributeMappingsFromDictionary:</code> with:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>@{&#xA;    @"description":@"placeDescription"&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

<p>Another area of use is for iPhone app development (and I believe iPad now as well) via MonoTouch.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>What is MonoTouch?</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>MonoTouch allows developers to create C# and .NET based applications that run on Apple's iPhone and Apple's iPod Touch devices, while taking advantage of the iPhone APIs and reusing both code and libraries that have been built for .NET, as well as existing skills.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Roughly speaking, it goes like this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>MonoTouch -> MonoDevelop/C# -> write an iPhone app -> compiled to native code -> iPhone app.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Relevant links:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li><a href="http://monotouch.net/" rel="nofollow noreferrer">MonoTouch</a></li>&#xA;<li><a href="http://tv.falafel.com/iphone/09-09-18/Writing_your_First_IPhone_application_in_C_using_MonoTouch.aspx" rel="nofollow noreferrer">Writing your First IPhone application in C# using MonoTouch</a> </li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;

 another area of use is for iphone app development (and i believe ipad now as well) via monotouch. . ;. ; . ;   what is monotouch? . ;  . ;   monotouch allows developers to create c# and .net based applications that run on apple's iphone and apple's ipod touch devices, while taking advantage of the iphone apis and reusing both code and libraries that have been built for .net, as well as existing skills. . ; . ;. ; roughly speaking, it goes like this: . ;. ; monotouch -> monodevelop/c# -> write an iphone app -> compiled to native code -> iphone app. . ;. ; relevant links: . ;. ; . ;  monotouch  . ;  writing your first iphone application in c# using monotouch   . ; . ;

what is monotouch
monotouch allows developers to create c# and .net based applications that run on apple s iphone and apple s ipod touch devices while taking advantage of the iphone apis and reusing both code and libraries that have been built for .net as well as existing skills
roughly speaking it goes like this
monotouch - monodevelop c# - write an iphone app - compiled to native code - iphone app

<p>You can remove the default routing and use attribute based routing to achieve this. <p>Your backup source is created using sql server version <code>10.50.1600</code>, but your server is <code>10.00.1600</code> and like the error message said there is incompatible.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>It is not possible to downgrade a database.&#xA;Possible solutions is to upgrade your instance from <code>10.00.1600</code> to <code>10.50.1600</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you're using SQL Express, you can download from <a href="http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?displaylang=en&amp;id=25174" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</p>&#xA;

<p>You can't have numbers delimited by <code>:</code> without wrapping them with <code>""</code> (i.e as strings). You can however do what you intend using <code>slice</code>:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>s = [50.0, 100.0, 150.0, 5.0, 200.0, 300.0, 10.0, 400.0]&#xA;&#xA;it = iter(s[1:-1])&#xA;s[1:-1] = map(slice, *(it,)*3)&#xA;print(s)&#xA;# [50.0, slice(100.0, 150.0, 5.0), slice(200.0, 300.0, 10.0), 400.0]&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<hr>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And can now be used with <code>np.r_</code> and <code>np.concatenate</code> as follows:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; np.concatenate([np.r_[i] for i in s])&#xA;array([  50.,  100.,  105.,  110.,  115.,  120.,  125.,  130.,  135.,&#xA;        140.,  145.,  200.,  210.,  220.,  230.,  240.,  250.,  260.,&#xA;        270.,  280.,  290.,  400.])&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>which yields your desired result.</p>&#xA;

 you can't have numbers delimited by  :  without wrapping them with  ""  (i.e as strings). you can however do what you intend using  slice : . ;. ;  . ;. ; . ;. ; and can now be used with  np.r_  and  np.concatenate  as follows: . ;. ;  . ;. ; which yields your desired result. . ;

you can t have numbers delimited by without wrapping them with i.e as strings
you can however do what you intend using slice
and can now be used with np.r_ and np.concatenate as follows
which yields your desired result



<p>No matter what you do, you need users permission, for that, you need to create a Facebook App first.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Go to <a href="https://developers.facebook.com/apps" rel="nofollow">https://developers.facebook.com/apps</a> and create one. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you are using it only in a website, just fillup the website URL with your <code>http://localhost:12345</code> save it, grab the secret and api key and ad to your <code>web.config</code> file in the Facebook C# SDK area.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Now that you can get information on your page, you need to ask permission to the user to request the wall posts, you will find all <a href="https://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/api/permissions/" rel="nofollow">request permissions in facebook</a>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>That goes on either the javascript if you want to use the Facebook javascript API (fastest) or as an attribute in the Action that needs that permission.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You might find the <a href="http://channel9.msdn.com/events/MIX/MIX11/OPN06" rel="nofollow">Video from the author of this SDK</a> that he gave in MIX this year, to be a nice tool to start you up really nice.</p>&#xA;

<p>I built a single page app based on this tutorial:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><a href="https://scotch.io/tutorials/single-page-apps-with-angularjs-routing-and-templating" rel="nofollow">https://scotch.io/tutorials/single-page-apps-with-angularjs-routing-and-templating</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>this is the file structure that they suggested:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code> - script.js             &lt;!-- stores all our angular code --&gt;&#xA;    - index.html            &lt;!-- main layout --&gt;&#xA;    - pages                 &lt;!-- the pages that will be injected into the main layout --&gt;&#xA;    ----- home.html&#xA;    ----- about.html&#xA;    ----- contact.html&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>the part about the html pages is pretty straightforward - a page to every ng-view. cool...</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>but the script.js seems to me like a bad modeling.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>should I really put all my js code in one file?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>it seems to me like this isn't the best way to model it. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>what happened if I will have a lot of pages in my single page app?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I will have a long long one js file with all the controllers..</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>what is the best practice  to model a single page app in angularjs?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Thanks!</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>// script.js&#xA;&#xA;    // create the module and name it scotchApp&#xA;        // also include ngRoute for all our routing needs&#xA;    var scotchApp = angular.module('scotchApp', ['ngRoute']);&#xA;&#xA;    // configure our routes&#xA;    scotchApp.config(function($routeProvider) {&#xA;        $routeProvider&#xA;&#xA;            // route for the home page&#xA;            .when('/', {&#xA;                templateUrl : 'pages/home.html',&#xA;                controller  : 'mainController'&#xA;            })&#xA;&#xA;            // route for the about page&#xA;            .when('/about', {&#xA;                templateUrl : 'pages/about.html',&#xA;                controller  : 'aboutController'&#xA;            })&#xA;&#xA;            // route for the contact page&#xA;            .when('/contact', {&#xA;                templateUrl : 'pages/contact.html',&#xA;                controller  : 'contactController'&#xA;            });&#xA;    });&#xA;&#xA;    // create the controller and inject Angular's $scope&#xA;    scotchApp.controller('mainController', function($scope) {&#xA;        // create a message to display in our view&#xA;        $scope.message = 'Everyone come and see how good I look!';&#xA;    });&#xA;&#xA;    scotchApp.controller('aboutController', function($scope) {&#xA;        $scope.message = 'Look! I am an about page.';&#xA;    });&#xA;&#xA;    scotchApp.controller('contactController', function($scope) {&#xA;        $scope.message = 'Contact us! JK. This is just a demo.';&#xA;    });&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 i built a single page app based on this tutorial: . ;. ;     . ;. ; this is the file structure that they suggested: . ;. ;  . ;. ; the part about the html pages is pretty straightforward - a page to every ng-view. cool... . ;. ; but the script.js seems to me like a bad modeling. . ;. ; should i really put all my js code in one file? . ;. ; it seems to me like this isn't the best way to model it.  . ;. ; what happened if i will have a lot of pages in my single page app? . ;. ; i will have a long long one js file with all the controllers.. . ;. ; what is the best practice  to model a single page app in angularjs? . ;. ; thanks! . ;. ;  . ;

<p>what &#xA;I &#xA;met &#xA;is &#xA;a code question below:&#xA;<a href="https://www.patest.cn/contests/pat-a-practise/1001" rel="nofollow">https://www.patest.cn/contests/pat-a-practise/1001</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>Calculate a + b and output the sum in standard format -- that is, the digits must be separated into groups of three by commas (unless there are less than four digits).</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>Input</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>Each input file contains one test case. Each case contains a pair of integers a and b where -1000000 &lt;= a, b &lt;= 1000000. The numbers are separated by a space.</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>Output</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>For each test case, you should output the sum of a and b in one line. The sum must be written in the standard format.</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>Sample Input</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>-1000000 9</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>Sample Output</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>-999,991</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This is my code below:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>if __name__ == "__main__":&#xA;    aline = input()&#xA;    astr,bstr = aline.strip().split()&#xA;    a,b = int(astr),int(bstr)&#xA;    sum = a + b&#xA;    sumstr= str(sum)&#xA;    result = ''&#xA;    while sumstr:&#xA;        sumstr, aslice = sumstr[:-3], sumstr[-3:]&#xA;        if sumstr:&#xA;            result = ',' + aslice + result&#xA;        else:&#xA;            result = aslice + result&#xA;&#xA;    print(result)&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>And the test result turn out to be :</p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>??(Time)       ??(test result)  ??(score)  ??(question number) </p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>??(programe language)  ??(ms)[time consume]    ??(kB)[memory]  ??[user]</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>8?22? 15:46    <strong>????[Partial Correct]</strong>(Why?!!!)  11  1001    </p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>Python (python3 3.4.2) 25  3184    polar9527</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>???[test point]    ??[result]   ??(ms)[time consume]   ??(kB)[memory]  ??[score]/??[full credit]</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>0  ????[wrong]     25  3056    0/9</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>1  ????[correct]   19  3056    1/1</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>10 ????[correct]   18  3184    1/1</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>11 ????[correct]   19  3176    1/1</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>2  ????[correct]   17  3180    1/1</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>3  ????[correct]   16  3056    1/1</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>4  ????[correct]   14  3184    1/1</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>5  ????[correct]   17  3056    1/1</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>6  ????[correct]   19  3168    1/1</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>7  ????[correct]   22  3184    1/1</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>8  ????[correct]   21  3164    1/1</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>9  ????[correct]   15  3184    1/1</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;

input

each case contains a pair of integers a and b where -1000000 a b 1000000
the numbers are separated by a space
output

the sum must be written in the standard format

sample output

<p>If you are using PCL, default value of invalid data is not NULL, but is NaN. So if you want to mark a point as invalid, you should first include <code>&lt;limits&gt;</code> file and then set the positions to 'std::numeric_limits::quiet_NaN()'. It is usually done like this</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>const float bad_point = std::numeric_limits&lt;float&gt;::quiet_NaN();&#xA;if( is_invalid_point )&#xA;    p.x = p.y = p.z = bad_point;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>But anyway, configuring ICP can be a pain. You may have to do a lot more parameter tweaking depending on your data.</p>&#xA;

 if you are using pcl, default value of invalid data is not null, but is nan. so if you want to mark a point as invalid, you should first include  file and then set the positions to 'std::numeric_limits::quiet_nan()'. it is usually done like this . ;. ;  . ;. ; but anyway, configuring icp can be a pain. you may have to do a lot more parameter tweaking depending on your data. . ;

if you are using pcl default value of invalid data is not null but is nan
so if you want to mark a point as invalid you should first include file and then set the positions to std numeric_limits quiet_nan
it is usually done like this
but anyway configuring icp can be a pain
you may have to do a lot more parameter tweaking depending on your data



<p>What does your Body Schema look like?   I would start getting that right and make sure that you have something that will create xml with separate records of all the "DOCUMENT_IDENTIFIER    1234" records.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I would use the "DOCUMENT_IDENTIFIER    "1234  bit as the Tag Identifier, and then I would set the Tag Offset to 4, to avoid the first 4 characters.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You should have a </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>RecordForDocumentIdentifiers (Root of your Schema)    Group Maxoccurs=*&#xA;      RecordForDocumentIdentifier   (Set the Tag Identifier here)&#xA;                Fields for the columns you want to parse</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>  RecordForOtherLines   Group Maxoccurs=*&#xA;           RecordForOtherLine   Maxoccurs=* or whatever your rules are.   &#xA;                   Fields for the columns of other lines&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>When that seems to parse your example okay, and generate the XML you want, I would start creating my header and body schemas from that. I know it is 2 steps, but it takes some of the guesswork out of it.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I guess the Header schema would be picked from the RecordDocumentIdentifier and the body would be RecordForOtherLines   (The outer record for that).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I hope that helps. If not, post your actual file and schema and let us take a look at it.</p>&#xA;

 what does your body schema look like?   i would start getting that right and make sure that you have something that will create xml with separate records of all the "document_identifier    1234" records. . ;. ; i would use the "document_identifier    "1234  bit as the tag identifier, and then i would set the tag offset to 4, to avoid the first 4 characters. . ;. ; you should have a  . ;. ; recordfordocumentidentifiers (root of your schema)    group maxoccurs= . ;      recordfordocumentidentifier   (set the tag identifier here). ;                fields for the columns you want to parse . ;. ;  . ;. ; when that seems to parse your example okay, and generate the xml you want, i would start creating my header and body schemas from that. i know it is 2 steps, but it takes some of the guesswork out of it. . ;. ; i guess the header schema would be picked from the recorddocumentidentifier and the body would be recordforotherlines   (the outer record for that). . ;. ; i hope that helps. if not, post your actual file and schema and let us take a look at it. . ;

<p>Impossible: Java enums can neither extend another class nor be extended themselves.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>They can however implement interfaces. Perhaps you can use that to your advantage.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><br/>&#xA;There is something else about enums that may help you: enums are not <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Immutable_object" rel="nofollow">immutable</a>. You could change field values of the enums, however that would change them for the whole JVM.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Another approach maybe to pass your subclass instances into a method of the enum and have the enum use your subclass as a <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Callback_%28computer_programming%29" rel="nofollow">call back</a> to get different functionality out of an enum for a different user of the enum.</p>&#xA;

 impossible: java enums can neither extend another class nor be extended themselves. . ;. ; they can however implement interfaces. perhaps you can use that to your advantage. . ;. ;  . ;there is something else about enums that may help you: enums are not  immutable . you could change field values of the enums, however that would change them for the whole jvm. . ;. ; another approach maybe to pass your subclass instances into a method of the enum and have the enum use your subclass as a  call back  to get different functionality out of an enum for a different user of the enum. . ;

impossible java enums can neither extend another class nor be extended themselves
they can however implement interfaces
perhaps you can use that to your advantage
there is something else about enums that may help you enums are not immutable
you could change field values of the enums however that would change them for the whole jvm
another approach maybe to pass your subclass instances into a method of the enum and have the enum use your subclass as a call back to get different functionality out of an enum for a different user of the enum

<p>There is no feature in the IDE which will do what you want. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You can use <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>C</Kbd> to generate getters and setters from a <code>property</code> declaration. But those getters and setters are empty stubs. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Frankly that is quite reasonable behaviour in my view. How can the IDE be expected to know how you wish to implement your getter and setter. It cannot be expected to know which field you intend to use. Your code is a good demonstration of why that is so. There is no obvious algorithmic relationship between the property name and the field name. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Another point to make is that if you want the IDE to generate the code for getter and setter in your question automatically, why do you even bother with a getter and setter? You could perfectly well write:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>property colore: string read ColorText write ColorText;&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you wish to be able to use a feature as you describe you will need to find an extension to Delphi that implements the feature. The obvious candidates are CnPack and GExperts. Or if you cannot find such an extension, write one yourself.</p>&#xA;

 there is no feature in the ide which will do what you want.  . ;. ; you can use  ctrl  +  shift  +  c</kbd> to generate getters and setters from a  property  declaration. but those getters and setters are empty stubs.  . ;. ; frankly that is quite reasonable behaviour in my view. how can the ide be expected to know how you wish to implement your getter and setter. it cannot be expected to know which field you intend to use. your code is a good demonstration of why that is so. there is no obvious algorithmic relationship between the property name and the field name.  . ;. ; another point to make is that if you want the ide to generate the code for getter and setter in your question automatically, why do you even bother with a getter and setter? you could perfectly well write: . ;. ;  . ;. ; if you wish to be able to use a feature as you describe you will need to find an extension to delphi that implements the feature. the obvious candidates are cnpack and gexperts. or if you cannot find such an extension, write one yourself. . ;

there is no feature in the ide which will do what you want

but those getters and setters are empty stubs
frankly that is quite reasonable behaviour in my view

it cannot be expected to know which field you intend to use
your code is a good demonstration of why that is so
there is no obvious algorithmic relationship between the property name and the field name

<p>You're assigning tourResult <strong><em>twice</em></strong> in your "<code>fetchedData:</code>" method.  The first one allocates it.  The second assignment is an "<code>objectForKey:</code>" from your json object (and "<code>objectForKey:</code>" may or may not return nil).  </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So you're losing (and leaking) the first created object and possibly not getting anything valid in your second assignment.</p>&#xA;

 you're assigning tourresult   twice   in your " fetcheddata: " method.  the first one allocates it.  the second assignment is an " objectforkey: " from your json object (and " objectforkey: " may or may not return nil).   . ;. ; so you're losing (and leaking) the first created object and possibly not getting anything valid in your second assignment. . ;

you re assigning tourresult twice in your fetcheddata method
the first one allocates it
the second assignment is an objectforkey from your json object and objectforkey may or may not return nil
so you re losing and leaking the first created object and possibly not getting anything valid in your second assignment

<p>Using: SQL Server 2012</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I have a self-referencing table called <code>Department</code> like this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>DepartmentID | Name     | DepartmentParentID&#xA;1              Sales      NULL&#xA;2              Outbound   1&#xA;3              Inbound    1&#xA;4              Showroom   1&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The departments such as <code>Inbound</code> and <code>Showroom</code> have a parent department of <code>Sales</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I need to now write a SQL query that will show which users are in which departments. Something like this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>SELECT &#xA;    d.DepartmentID, d.DepartmentName, d2.DepartmentParentID, d2.DepartmentName&#xA;FROM &#xA;    [User_Department] ud ---table that maps users to departments&#xA;INNER JOIN &#xA;    [Department] d1 ON d1.DepartmentID = ud.DepartmentID&#xA;LEFT JOIN&#xA;    [Department] d2 ON d2.DepartmentID = d1.DepartmentParentID ---this has gone horribly wrong&#xA;WHERE &#xA;    ud.Username = @Username&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Forgetting the LEFT JOIN part in the above code for now, I would get a result like this:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Username    |  DepartmentName&#xA;DannySmith     Inbound&#xA;DannySmith     Outbound&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>But what I need is the parent department to also show in the DepartmentName list <strong>(this is what I want)</strong>:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Username    |  DepartmentName&#xA;DannySmith     Sales&#xA;DannySmith     Inbound&#xA;DannySmith     Outbound&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>How is this possible to achieve. I don't want the parent department to be in a separate column like this (<strong>this is what I DON'T want</strong>):</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Username    |  DepartmentName | DepartmentName&#xA;DannySmith     Inbound          Sales&#xA;DannySmith     Outbound         Sales&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Been trying to look over some SQL books but can't find anything that can help me so far. <p>Unclear what happened without more information (logs would probably say why the rbind did not take).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>What version are you using? <p>The error has to do with passing the data as part of the URL query string (which has a limit of about 2000 characters: <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/417142/what-is-the-maximum-length-of-a-url">What is the maximum length of a URL?</a>). You will need to pass this information as part of a form post with all the data passed as a form element  (i.e. your geodata becomes a form 'field' which you post to the URL). There will be no way to pass an arbitrarily lengthy URL like this.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>EDIT</strong> fixed my original post to make sense. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><strong>UPDATE</strong> This post seems relevant, it is just the issue of getting data to your iframe: <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/536538/pass-value-to-iframe-from-a-window">pass value to iframe from a window</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>or this: <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4689145/pass-jquery-variables-between-iframe-and-parent">Pass jquery variables between iframe and parent</a></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Basically, manipulate the frame element from the main window - I think this should work in your situation. If you get it working you should post the resultant jsfiddle - neat tool.</p>&#xA;

 the error has to do with passing the data as part of the url query string (which has a limit of about 2000 characters:  what is the maximum length of a url? ). you will need to pass this information as part of a form post with all the data passed as a form element  (  your geodata becomes a form 'field' which you post to the url). there will be no way to pass an arbitrarily lengthy url like this. . ;. ;  edit  fixed my original post to make sense.  . ;. ;  update  this post seems relevant, it is just the issue of getting data to your iframe:  pass value to iframe from a window  . ;. ; or this:  pass jquery variables between iframe and parent  . ;. ; basically, manipulate the frame element from the main window - i think this should work in your situation. if you get it working you should post the resultant jsfiddle - neat tool. . ;

the error has to do with passing the data as part of the url query string which has a limit of about 2000 characters what is the maximum length of a url

you will need to pass this information as part of a form post with all the data passed as a form element your geodata becomes a form field which you post to the url
there will be no way to pass an arbitrarily lengthy url like this
edit fixed my original post to make sense
update this post seems relevant it is just the issue of getting data to your iframe pass value to iframe from a window
or this pass jquery variables between iframe and parent
basically manipulate the frame element from the main window - i think this should work in your situation
if you get it working you should post the resultant jsfiddle - neat tool

<p>I'm new to Rails and Heroku.&#xA;I don't partly understand system of databases (testing, production, development).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>I created two Rails apps. First with Rails' default sqlite db and second with Heroku-supported postgres db. I created simple data and pushed apps to Heroku, but Heroku absolutely ignores my db data.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>What I didn't understand? Or could you advice me easier way how I can deploy Rails app? <p>By default, widgets in a <code>TableRow</code> have <code>android:layout_width="wrap_content"</code>. That does not limit you to the size of the screen -- <code>wrap_content</code> means "wrap content", not "wrap content but please don't go off the edge of the screen, if you don't mind".</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In this case, you do not need to use a <code>TableLayout</code> and set of <code>TableRows</code>, since you do not have a table.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>So, one approach is to use a <code>RelativeLayout</code> and have your <code>AutoCompleteTextView</code> use <code>android:layout_alignParentLeft="true"</code> and <code>android:layout_alignParentRight="true"</code>. That will pin it to the outer edges of the <code>RelativeLayout</code>, which you can size with <code>android:layout_width=fill_parent</code> to fill the screen.</p>&#xA;

 by default, widgets in a  tablerow  have . that does not limit you to the size of the screen --  wrap_content  means "wrap content", not "wrap content but please don't go off the edge of the screen, if you don't mind". . ;. ; in this case, you do not need to use a  tablelayout  and set of  tablerows , since you do not have a table. . ;. ; so, one approach is to use a  relativelayout  and have your  autocompletetextview  use  and . that will pin it to the outer edges of the  relativelayout , which you can size with  to fill the screen. . ;

by default widgets in a tablerow have
that does not limit you to the size of the screen -- wrap_content means wrap content not wrap content but please don t go off the edge of the screen if you don t mind
in this case you do not need to use a tablelayout and set of tablerows since you do not have a table
so one approach is to use a relativelayout and have your autocompletetextview use and
that will pin it to the outer edges of the relativelayout which you can size with to fill the screen

<p>Cubietruck has a NAND flash, the OS is installed here (If you burn NAND version images).&#xA;You can use your micrsd and hdd as data disk rather than root file system, microsd in the board is named /dev/mmcblk0, and hdd is named /dev/hda or /dev/sda, etc.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>BTW, rootfs is packaged in the img file with bootloader, and other config files, if you real want to see them, (in NAND version), you just</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li><code>mount /dev/nanda /mnt/config_file_and_kernel</code> to see config file and kernel</li>&#xA;<li><code>mount /dev/nandb /mnt/filesystem</code> to see you file system, the same as /</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;

 cubietruck has a nand flash, the os is installed here (if you burn nand version images).. ;you can use your micrsd and hdd as data disk rather than root file system, microsd in the board is named /dev/mmcblk0, and hdd is named /dev/hda or /dev/sda, etc. . ;. ; btw, rootfs is packaged in the img file with bootloader, and other config files, if you real want to see them, (in nand version), you just . ;. ; . ;  mount /dev/nanda /mnt/config_file_and_kernel  to see config file and kernel . ;  mount /dev/nandb /mnt/filesystem  to see you file system, the same as / . ; . ;

cubietruck has a nand flash the os is installed here if you burn nand version images
you can use your micrsd and hdd as data disk rather than root file system microsd in the board is named dev mmcblk0 and hdd is named dev hda or dev sda etc
btw rootfs is packaged in the img file with bootloader and other config files if you real want to see them in nand version you just
mount dev nanda mnt config_file_and_kernel to see config file and kernel
mount dev nandb mnt filesystem to see you file system the same as

<p>Round-robin load balancing of messages is certainly a term in the messaging space. In the IBM WebSphere MQ (aka MQSeries) case, it means that each new message will go to a new instance of the queue, i.e</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>Message 1 -&gt; Server-1/E1&#xA;Message 2 -&gt; Server-2/E1&#xA;Message 3 -&gt; Server-3/E1&#xA;Message 4 -&gt; Server-4/E1&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>i.e. it's not based on the busy-ness of the consumer on each server.</p>&#xA;

 round-robin load balancing of messages is certainly a term in the messaging space. in the ibm websphere mq (aka mqseries) case, it means that each new message will go to a new instance of the queue, i.e . ;. ;  . ;. ;   it's not based on the busy-ness of the consumer on each server. . ;

round-robin load balancing of messages is certainly a term in the messaging space
in the ibm websphere mq aka mqseries case it means that each new message will go to a new instance of the queue i.e
it s not based on the busy-ness of the consumer on each server

 you can multiplication using  lambda   . ;. ;  . ;

<p>If you're unable to change the server output as @Saki had mentioned, you can just listen to the load event and update the records with the new id there.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>store.on('load', me.loaded, me);&#xA;&#xA;loaded: function(store, records) {&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>More details here - <a href="http://docs.sencha.com/extjs/4.2.2/#!/api/Ext.data.Store-event-load" rel="nofollow">http://docs.sencha.com/extjs/4.2.2/#!/api/Ext.data.Store-event-load</a></p>&#xA;

 if you're unable to change the server output as @saki had mentioned, you can just listen to the load event and update the records with the new id there. . ;. ;  . ;. ; more details here -     . ;

<p>It looks like you want the <code>roundrobin</code> <a href="https://docs.python.org/2/library/itertools.html#recipes" rel="nofollow"><code>itertools</code> recipe</a>:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>def roundrobin(*iterables):&#xA;    "roundrobin('ABC', 'D', 'EF') --&gt; A D E B F C"&#xA;    # Recipe credited to George Sakkis&#xA;    pending = len(iterables)&#xA;    nexts = cycle(iter(it).next for it in iterables)&#xA;    while pending:&#xA;        try:&#xA;            for next in nexts:&#xA;                yield next()&#xA;        except StopIteration:&#xA;            pending -= 1&#xA;            nexts = cycle(islice(nexts, pending))&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>In use:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>&gt;&gt;&gt; from itertools import cycle, islice&#xA;&gt;&gt;&gt; for i in roundrobin(xrange(5), xrange(10), xrange(15)):&#xA;    print i,&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;0 0 0 1 1 1 2 2 2 3 3 3 4 4 4 5 5 6 6 7 7 8 8 9 9 10 11 12 13 14&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 it looks like you want the  roundrobin    itertools  recipe : . ;. ;  . ;. ; in use: . ;. ;  . ;

it looks like you want the roundrobin itertools recipe
in use



<blockquote>&#xA;  <p>I am aware of the TCP/UDP "hole punching" method, however, I am not&#xA;  willing to setup and run a server on my machine 24/7 for this purpose&#xA;  (besides my network is behind a NAT anyway...).</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p>I was thinking about setting up servlet code on a URL that the host&#xA;  connects to, and when the client attempts to connect, it asks the&#xA;  servlet to establish the connection.</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you have a servlet, then it must run on a server 24/7. So, you are only choosing between TCP/UDP hole punching and using a servlet.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Since you are behind a NAT, you probably should try to solve your connection issues via multicasting. Just have peers agree on an IP multicasting address and communicate their private ip address to each other. If they want to establish direct TCP connections, that should be enough. You don't need a central server/servlet.</p>&#xA;

 . ;   i am aware of the tcp/udp "hole punching" method, however, i am not. ;  willing to setup and run a server on my machine 24/7 for this purpose. ;  (besides my network is behind a nat anyway...). . ;  . ;   i was thinking about setting up servlet code on a url that the host. ;  connects to, and when the client attempts to connect, it asks the. ;  servlet to establish the connection. . ; . ;. ; if you have a servlet, then it must run on a server 24/7. so, you are only choosing between tcp/udp hole punching and using a servlet. . ;. ; since you are behind a nat, you probably should try to solve your connection issues via multicasting. just have peers agree on an ip multicasting address and communicate their private ip address to each other. if they want to establish direct tcp connections, that should be enough. you don't need a central server/servlet. . ;

so you are only choosing between tcp udp hole punching and using a servlet
since you are behind a nat you probably should try to solve your connection issues via multicasting
just have peers agree on an ip multicasting address and communicate their private ip address to each other
if they want to establish direct tcp connections that should be enough
you don t need a central server servlet

<p>I finally figured out the problem.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Some of the member functions require Scope resolution operator "this->" to build the android source on MAC OS X Lion with xcode 4.3.x, without scope resolution operator compiler will not be able to identify the existence of the function</p>&#xA;

 i finally figured out the problem. . ;. ; some of the member functions require scope resolution operator "this->" to build the android source on mac os x lion with xcode 4.3.x, without scope resolution operator compiler will not be able to identify the existence of the function . ;

i finally figured out the problem
some of the member functions require scope resolution operator this- to build the android source on mac os x lion with xcode 4.3.x without scope resolution operator compiler will not be able to identify the existence of the function

<p>Unicode uses <em>variation sequences</em> to select between different renderings for certain code points�listed in the <a href="http://www.unicode.org/Public/7.0.0/ucd/StandardizedVariants.txt">StandardizedVariants.txt</a> file. In your case, the astrological symbols have both "text style" and "emoji style" variants that are selected between by a <code>U+FEOE</code> (text style) or <code>U+FE0F</code> (emoji style) following the code point:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<blockquote>&#xA;  <p><code>U+2650</code> <code>U+FE0E</code>: ??</p>&#xA;  &#xA;  <p><code>U+2650</code> <code>U+FE0F</code>: ??</p>&#xA;</blockquote>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Note that correct interpretation of the variation selector depends on support from both the application/framework and the fonts being used. On Chrome (42) there doesn't appear to be any difference between my examples above, but on Safari (8) they are distinct.</p>&#xA;

 unicode uses  variation sequences  to select between different renderings for certain code points�listed in the  standardizedvariants.txt  file. in your case, the astrological symbols have both "text style" and "emoji style" variants that are selected between by a  u+feoe  (text style) or  u+fe0f  (emoji style) following the code point: . ;. ; . ;    u+2650   u+fe0e : ?? . ;  . ;    u+2650   u+fe0f : ?? . ; . ;. ; note that correct interpretation of the variation selector depends on support from both the application/framework and the fonts being used. on chrome (42) there doesn't appear to be any difference between my examples above, but on safari (8) they are distinct. . ;

unicode uses variation sequences to select between different renderings for certain code points listed in the standardizedvariants.txt file
in your case the astrological symbols have both text style and emoji style variants that are selected between by a u+feoe text style or u+fe0f emoji style following the code point
u+2650 u+fe0e
u+2650 u+fe0f
note that correct interpretation of the variation selector depends on support from both the application framework and the fonts being used
on chrome 42 there doesn t appear to be any difference between my examples above but on safari 8 they are distinct



<p>Your code</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>#smart-search-form option[selected=selected]{&#xA;    color: #ff0000 !important;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Doesn't work because when you select an option, you change its property <code>selected</code>, but not its attribute <code>selected</code>. So the selector <code>[selected=selected]</code> only matches the default option.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>It seems you need something like <code>option:selected</code>, but THAT DOESN'T EXIST.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>(See <a href="http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1122036/set-selected-option-via-css">Set selected option via CSS?</a>)</p>&#xA;

 your code . ;. ;  . ;. ; doesn't work because when you select an option, you change its property  selected , but not its attribute  selected . so the selector  only matches the default option. . ;. ; it seems you need something like  option:selected , but that doesn't exist. . ;. ; (see  set selected option via css? ) . ;

your code
doesn t work because when you select an option you change its property selected but not its attribute selected
so the selector only matches the default option
it seems you need something like option selected but that doesn t exist
see set selected option via css




<p>I second trying to put the whole path instead.  </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>For relative paths, if you're doing compiling and running in command line/terminal, you need to have that studentrecords.txt in the same directory of your code files.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If you're using an IDE, you need to put your studentrecords.txt under the src/ folder.  This is assuming you're not in maven project setup; otherwise it should be put under /src/main/java/resources/ .</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Hope this helps!</p>&#xA;
