<p>I have gone through all the pain of doing this. </p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Under windows 7/Vista/2008 it is not possible to load any interactive process from a service - without calling a number of Win API. = BLACK MAGIC</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Have a look <a href="http://blogs.msdn.com/b/winsdk/archive/2009/07/14/launching-an-interactive-process-from-windows-service-in-windows-vista-and-later.aspx">here</a> and <a href="http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en/windowssecurity/thread/31bfa13d-982b-4b1a-bff3-2761ade5214f">here</a>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>The code below does the trick, use it with your own risk:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>public static class ProcessAsCurrentUser&#xA;{&#xA;&#xA;    /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;    /// Connection state of a session.&#xA;    /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;    public enum ConnectionState&#xA;    {&#xA;        /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;        /// A user is logged on to the session.&#xA;        /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;        Active,&#xA;        /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;        /// A client is connected to the session.&#xA;        /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;        Connected,&#xA;        /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;        /// The session is in the process of connecting to a client.&#xA;        /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;        ConnectQuery,&#xA;        /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;        /// This session is shadowing another session.&#xA;        /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;        Shadowing,&#xA;        /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;        /// The session is active, but the client has disconnected from it.&#xA;        /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;        Disconnected,&#xA;        /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;        /// The session is waiting for a client to connect.&#xA;        /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;        Idle,&#xA;        /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;        /// The session is listening for connections.&#xA;        /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;        Listening,&#xA;        /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;        /// The session is being reset.&#xA;        /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;        Reset,&#xA;        /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;        /// The session is down due to an error.&#xA;        /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;        Down,&#xA;        /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;        /// The session is initializing.&#xA;        /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;        Initializing&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;    [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential)]&#xA;    class SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES&#xA;    {&#xA;        public int nLength;&#xA;        public IntPtr lpSecurityDescriptor;&#xA;        public int bInheritHandle;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;    [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential, CharSet = CharSet.Unicode)]&#xA;    struct STARTUPINFO&#xA;    {&#xA;        public Int32 cb;&#xA;        public string lpReserved;&#xA;        public string lpDesktop;&#xA;        public string lpTitle;&#xA;        public Int32 dwX;&#xA;        public Int32 dwY;&#xA;        public Int32 dwXSize;&#xA;        public Int32 dwYSize;&#xA;        public Int32 dwXCountChars;&#xA;        public Int32 dwYCountChars;&#xA;        public Int32 dwFillAttribute;&#xA;        public Int32 dwFlags;&#xA;        public Int16 wShowWindow;&#xA;        public Int16 cbReserved2;&#xA;        public IntPtr lpReserved2;&#xA;        public IntPtr hStdInput;&#xA;        public IntPtr hStdOutput;&#xA;        public IntPtr hStdError;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential)]&#xA;    internal struct PROCESS_INFORMATION&#xA;    {&#xA;        public IntPtr hProcess;&#xA;        public IntPtr hThread;&#xA;        public int dwProcessId;&#xA;        public int dwThreadId;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    enum LOGON_TYPE&#xA;    {&#xA;        LOGON32_LOGON_INTERACTIVE = 2,&#xA;        LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK,&#xA;        LOGON32_LOGON_BATCH,&#xA;        LOGON32_LOGON_SERVICE,&#xA;        LOGON32_LOGON_UNLOCK = 7,&#xA;        LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK_CLEARTEXT,&#xA;        LOGON32_LOGON_NEW_CREDENTIALS&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    enum LOGON_PROVIDER&#xA;    {&#xA;        LOGON32_PROVIDER_DEFAULT,&#xA;        LOGON32_PROVIDER_WINNT35,&#xA;        LOGON32_PROVIDER_WINNT40,&#xA;        LOGON32_PROVIDER_WINNT50&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    [Flags]&#xA;    enum CreateProcessFlags : uint&#xA;    {&#xA;        CREATE_BREAKAWAY_FROM_JOB = 0x01000000,&#xA;        CREATE_DEFAULT_ERROR_MODE = 0x04000000,&#xA;        CREATE_NEW_CONSOLE = 0x00000010,&#xA;        CREATE_NEW_PROCESS_GROUP = 0x00000200,&#xA;        CREATE_NO_WINDOW = 0x08000000,&#xA;        CREATE_PROTECTED_PROCESS = 0x00040000,&#xA;        CREATE_PRESERVE_CODE_AUTHZ_LEVEL = 0x02000000,&#xA;        CREATE_SEPARATE_WOW_VDM = 0x00000800,&#xA;        CREATE_SHARED_WOW_VDM = 0x00001000,&#xA;        CREATE_SUSPENDED = 0x00000004,&#xA;        CREATE_UNICODE_ENVIRONMENT = 0x00000400,&#xA;        DEBUG_ONLY_THIS_PROCESS = 0x00000002,&#xA;        DEBUG_PROCESS = 0x00000001,&#xA;        DETACHED_PROCESS = 0x00000008,&#xA;        EXTENDED_STARTUPINFO_PRESENT = 0x00080000,&#xA;        INHERIT_PARENT_AFFINITY = 0x00010000&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Sequential)]&#xA;    public struct WTS_SESSION_INFO&#xA;    {&#xA;        public int SessionID;&#xA;        [MarshalAs(UnmanagedType.LPTStr)]&#xA;        public string WinStationName;&#xA;        public ConnectionState State;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    [DllImport("wtsapi32.dll", CharSet = CharSet.Auto, SetLastError = true)]&#xA;    public static extern Int32 WTSEnumerateSessions(IntPtr hServer, int reserved, int version,&#xA;                                                    ref IntPtr sessionInfo, ref int count);&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;    [DllImport("advapi32.dll", EntryPoint = "CreateProcessAsUserW", SetLastError = true, CharSet = CharSet.Auto)]&#xA;    static extern bool CreateProcessAsUser(&#xA;        IntPtr hToken,&#xA;        string lpApplicationName,&#xA;        string lpCommandLine,&#xA;        IntPtr lpProcessAttributes,&#xA;        IntPtr lpThreadAttributes,&#xA;        bool bInheritHandles,&#xA;        UInt32 dwCreationFlags,&#xA;        IntPtr lpEnvironment,&#xA;        string lpCurrentDirectory,&#xA;        ref STARTUPINFO lpStartupInfo,&#xA;        out PROCESS_INFORMATION lpProcessInformation);&#xA;&#xA;    [DllImport("wtsapi32.dll")]&#xA;    public static extern void WTSFreeMemory(IntPtr memory);&#xA;&#xA;    [DllImport("kernel32.dll")]&#xA;    private static extern UInt32 WTSGetActiveConsoleSessionId();&#xA;&#xA;    [DllImport("wtsapi32.dll", SetLastError = true)]&#xA;    static extern int WTSQueryUserToken(UInt32 sessionId, out IntPtr Token);&#xA;&#xA;    [DllImport("advapi32.dll", CharSet = CharSet.Auto, SetLastError = true)]&#xA;    public extern static bool DuplicateTokenEx(&#xA;        IntPtr hExistingToken,&#xA;        uint dwDesiredAccess,&#xA;        IntPtr lpTokenAttributes,&#xA;        int ImpersonationLevel,&#xA;        int TokenType,&#xA;        out IntPtr phNewToken);&#xA;&#xA;    private const int TokenImpersonation = 2;&#xA;    private const int SecurityIdentification = 1;&#xA;    private const int MAXIMUM_ALLOWED = 0x2000000;&#xA;    private const int TOKEN_DUPLICATE = 0x2;&#xA;    private const int TOKEN_QUERY = 0x00000008;&#xA;&#xA;    /// &lt;summary&gt;&#xA;    /// Launches a process for the current logged on user if there are any.&#xA;    /// If none, return false as well as in case of &#xA;    /// &#xA;    /// ##### !!! BEWARE !!! ####  ------------------------------------------&#xA;    /// This code will only work when running in a windows service (where it is really needed)&#xA;    /// so in case you need to test it, it needs to run in the service. Reason&#xA;    /// is a security privileg which only services have (SE_??? something, cant remember)!&#xA;    /// &lt;/summary&gt;&#xA;    /// &lt;param name="processExe"&gt;&lt;/param&gt;&#xA;    /// &lt;returns&gt;&lt;/returns&gt;&#xA;    public static bool CreateProcessAsCurrentUser(string processExe)&#xA;    {&#xA;&#xA;        IntPtr duplicate = new IntPtr();&#xA;        STARTUPINFO info = new STARTUPINFO();&#xA;        PROCESS_INFORMATION procInfo = new PROCESS_INFORMATION();&#xA;&#xA;        Debug.WriteLine(string.Format("CreateProcessAsCurrentUser. processExe: " + processExe));&#xA;&#xA;        IntPtr p = GetCurrentUserToken();&#xA;&#xA;        bool result = DuplicateTokenEx(p, MAXIMUM_ALLOWED | TOKEN_QUERY | TOKEN_DUPLICATE, IntPtr.Zero, SecurityIdentification, SecurityIdentification, out duplicate);&#xA;        Debug.WriteLine(string.Format("DuplicateTokenEx result: {0}", result));&#xA;        Debug.WriteLine(string.Format("duplicate: {0}", duplicate));&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        if (result)&#xA;        {&#xA;            result = CreateProcessAsUser(duplicate, processExe, null,&#xA;                IntPtr.Zero, IntPtr.Zero, false, (UInt32)CreateProcessFlags.CREATE_NEW_CONSOLE, IntPtr.Zero, null,&#xA;                ref info, out procInfo);&#xA;            Debug.WriteLine(string.Format("CreateProcessAsUser result: {0}", result));&#xA;&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        if (p.ToInt32() != 0)&#xA;        {&#xA;            Marshal.Release(p);&#xA;            Debug.WriteLine(string.Format("Released handle p: {0}", p));&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        if (duplicate.ToInt32() != 0)&#xA;        {&#xA;            Marshal.Release(duplicate);&#xA;            Debug.WriteLine(string.Format("Released handle duplicate: {0}", duplicate));&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;        return result;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    public static int GetCurrentSessionId()&#xA;    {&#xA;        uint sessionId = WTSGetActiveConsoleSessionId();&#xA;        Debug.WriteLine(string.Format("sessionId: {0}", sessionId));&#xA;&#xA;        if (sessionId == 0xFFFFFFFF)&#xA;            return -1;&#xA;        else&#xA;            return (int)sessionId;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    public static bool IsUserLoggedOn()&#xA;    {&#xA;        List&lt;WTS_SESSION_INFO&gt; wtsSessionInfos = ListSessions();&#xA;        Debug.WriteLine(string.Format("Number of sessions: {0}", wtsSessionInfos.Count));&#xA;        return wtsSessionInfos.Where(x =&gt; x.State == ConnectionState.Active).Count() &gt; 0;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    private static IntPtr GetCurrentUserToken()&#xA;    {&#xA;        List&lt;WTS_SESSION_INFO&gt; wtsSessionInfos = ListSessions();&#xA;        int sessionId = wtsSessionInfos.Where(x =&gt; x.State == ConnectionState.Active).FirstOrDefault().SessionID;&#xA;        //int sessionId = GetCurrentSessionId();&#xA;&#xA;        Debug.WriteLine(string.Format("sessionId: {0}", sessionId));&#xA;        if (sessionId == int.MaxValue)&#xA;        {&#xA;            return IntPtr.Zero;&#xA;        }&#xA;        else&#xA;        {&#xA;            IntPtr p = new IntPtr();&#xA;            int result = WTSQueryUserToken((UInt32)sessionId, out p);&#xA;            Debug.WriteLine(string.Format("WTSQueryUserToken result: {0}", result));&#xA;            Debug.WriteLine(string.Format("WTSQueryUserToken p: {0}", p));&#xA;&#xA;            return p;&#xA;        }&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;    public static List&lt;WTS_SESSION_INFO&gt; ListSessions()&#xA;    {&#xA;        IntPtr server = IntPtr.Zero;&#xA;        List&lt;WTS_SESSION_INFO&gt; ret = new List&lt;WTS_SESSION_INFO&gt;();&#xA;&#xA;        try&#xA;        {&#xA;            IntPtr ppSessionInfo = IntPtr.Zero;&#xA;&#xA;            Int32 count = 0;&#xA;            Int32 retval = WTSEnumerateSessions(IntPtr.Zero, 0, 1, ref ppSessionInfo, ref count);&#xA;            Int32 dataSize = Marshal.SizeOf(typeof(WTS_SESSION_INFO));&#xA;&#xA;            Int64 current = (int)ppSessionInfo;&#xA;&#xA;            if (retval != 0)&#xA;            {&#xA;                for (int i = 0; i &lt; count; i++)&#xA;                {&#xA;                    WTS_SESSION_INFO si = (WTS_SESSION_INFO)Marshal.PtrToStructure((System.IntPtr)current, typeof(WTS_SESSION_INFO));&#xA;                    current += dataSize;&#xA;&#xA;                    ret.Add(si);&#xA;                }&#xA;&#xA;                WTSFreeMemory(ppSessionInfo);&#xA;            }&#xA;        }&#xA;        catch (Exception exception)&#xA;        {&#xA;            Debug.WriteLine(exception.ToString());&#xA;        }&#xA;&#xA;        return ret;&#xA;    }&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 i have gone through all the pain of doing this.  . ;. ; under windows 7/vista/2008 it is not possible to load any interactive process from a service - without calling a number of win api. = black magic . ;. ; have a look  here  and  here . . ;. ; the code below does the trick, use it with your own risk: . ;. ;  . ;

i have gone through all the pain of doing this
under windows 7 vista 2008 it is not possible to load any interactive process from a service - without calling a number of win api
black magic

the code below does the trick use it with your own risk



<p>I'm trying to html-escape all strings in my objects when serializing them with Lift's json library. I thought I could do this by passing an escape (partial) function to the objects' FieldSerializer, but this seems to <em>add</em> fields to the json-object - not <em>replace</em> them. You can see what I mean by running the following simple example and note that it outputs&#xA;<code>{"y":"test","x":"test"}</code> while I wanted <code>{"y":"test"}</code>:   </p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>import net.liftweb.json.Serialization&#xA;import net.liftweb.json.FieldSerializer&#xA;import net.liftweb.json.FieldSerializer._&#xA;import net.liftweb.json.DefaultFormats&#xA;case class Simple(x: String)&#xA;implicit val formats = DefaultFormats + &#xA;    FieldSerializer[Simple](renameTo("x","y"),renameFrom("y", "x"))&#xA;Serialization.write(Simple("test"))&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Is there a way I can tell FieldSerializer to replace the field matched by my partial function?</p>&#xA;

 i'm trying to html-escape all strings in my objects when serializing them with lift's json library. i thought i could do this by passing an escape (partial) function to the objects' fieldserializer, but this seems to  add  fields to the json-object - not  replace  them. you can see what i mean by running the following simple example and note that it outputs. ; while i wanted :    . ;. ;  . ;. ; is there a way i can tell fieldserializer to replace the field matched by my partial function? . ;

<p>You may also use the symbol version of the syntax.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li><code>&amp;&amp;</code> for and</li>&#xA;<li><code>||</code> for or</li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Also, <code>=</code> does not mean equals in an if statement.  That is the syntax for setting a variable.&#xA;You would say <code>==</code> (equals to).</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>To say "not equals" you would use <code>!=</code> or <code>!=</code></p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>if (isset($_POST['text']) &amp;&amp; $_POST['rating'] ==  "G") {&#xA;&#xA;//give warning if bad words are used&#xA;&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;

 you may also use the symbol version of the syntax. . ;. ; . ;  for and . ;  ||  for or . ; . ;. ; also,  does not mean equals in an if statement.  that is the syntax for setting a variable.. ;you would say  (equals to). . ;. ; to say "not equals" you would use  or  . ;. ;  . ;

you may also use the symbol version of the syntax
for and
|| for or
also does not mean equals in an if statement
that is the syntax for setting a variable
you would say equals to
to say not equals you would use or

<p>For what it's worth, package gafit is available again without resorting to tricks.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>As suggested above it was broken for some years as the core R system changed some packaging conventions. Hopefully fully fixed now.</p>&#xA;

<p>The error happens in your code. You shouldn't be using <code>.encode()</code> here.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>It is a bit counter-intuitive, but <code>on_error()</code> will be called if <code>on_success()</code> raised an exception, which is probably what happens here (a <code>UnicodeDecodeError</code>). That's why you're seeing an error code 200 ("HTTP Ok").</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Twython is returning data as unicode objects, so you can just do:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p><code>&#xA;print(u"[%s](%s) - %s" % (data['created_at'], data['coordinates']['coordinates'], data['text']))&#xA;</code></p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>You should probably add your own try...except block in <code>on_success()</code> for further debugging.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Also, I'm not sure what your <code>tweetlog()</code> function does, but be aware if you are on Windows that <code>print()</code> might have issues writing some codepoints as it will try to convert to the terminal's codepage.</p>&#xA;

 the error happens in your code. you shouldn't be using  .encode()  here. . ;. ; it is a bit counter-intuitive, but  on_error()  will be called if  on_success()  raised an exception, which is probably what happens here (a  unicodedecodeerror ). that's why you're seeing an error code 200 ("http ok"). . ;. ; twython is returning data as unicode objects, so you can just do: . ;. ;  . ;. ; you should probably add your own try...except block in  on_success()  for further debugging. . ;. ; also, i'm not sure what your  tweetlog()  function does, but be aware if you are on windows that  print()  might have issues writing some codepoints as it will try to convert to the terminal's codepage. . ;

the error happens in your code
you shouldn t be using .encode here
it is a bit counter-intuitive but on_error will be called if on_success raised an exception which is probably what happens here a unicodedecodeerror
that s why you re seeing an error code 200 http ok
twython is returning data as unicode objects so you can just do
you should probably add your own try...except block in on_success for further debugging
also i m not sure what your tweetlog function does but be aware if you are on windows that print might have issues writing some codepoints as it will try to convert to the terminal s codepage



<p>I have written a method whose intent is to load the next level in a game. It finds the index of the level, loads it from the level loader (a class I wrote), creates a layer holding that level, then informs the scene to transition between the new and old level layers. The player sprite is turned invisible at this time, so that there are not two players during the transition.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>We've run into a problem where occasionally, the player will be turned invisible but the transition will not happen. After doing a lot of digging, all I've found out is that the method is not finishing running, even though there are no returns or other calls in the method.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Method (as it is now with logs in to help monitor what is happening):</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>    if([owningScene mayChangeLayer])&#xA; {&#xA;  NSLog(@"May change layer");&#xA;  levelFinished = YES;&#xA;  NSLog(@"Level marked as finished");&#xA;  [carver setVisible:NO];&#xA;  NSLog(@"Carver hidden");&#xA;  GameState *state = [GameState sharedGameState];&#xA;  NSLog(@"game state loaded");&#xA;  state.screenXOffset += xOffset;&#xA;  state.screenYOffset += yOffset;&#xA;  NSLog(@"offset: %d, %d", state.screenXOffset, state.screenYOffset);&#xA;  GameLevel *aLevel = [loader getLevelAtXOffset:state.screenXOffset&#xA;           atYOffset:state.screenYOffset];&#xA;  NSLog(@"loaded level %@", aLevel);&#xA;&#xA;  GameLevelLayer *layer = [[GameLevelLayer alloc] initWithLevel:aLevel &#xA;               withOwningScene:owningScene&#xA;               withLevelLoader:loader &#xA;                 withHud:hud&#xA;               showTitle:NO&#xA;                startTileIndex:startIndex];&#xA;  NSLog(@"Got layer %@", layer);&#xA;  [owningScene replaceLayer:layer xMove:xOffset yMove:yOffset];&#xA;  [layer release];&#xA;  NSLog(@"Done");&#xA;&#xA;&#xA;Log messages:&#xA;&#xA;        2011-01-24 21:38:03.541 Squirrel[14659:307] May change layer&#xA;    2011-01-24 21:38:03.544 Squirrel[14659:307] Level marked as finished&#xA;    2011-01-24 21:38:03.545 Squirrel[14659:307] Carver hidden&#xA;    2011-01-24 21:38:03.547 Squirrel[14659:307] game state loaded&#xA;    2011-01-24 21:38:03.550 Squirrel[14659:307] offset: 4, -22&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>It looks like the code is quitting out at GameLevelLayer *layer= ..., for no log messages appear after that, yet as you can see there are clearly no exits in the code after that point. Any idea what could be causing this issue?</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Thanks in advance!&#xA;-Stephen</p>&#xA;

 i have written a method whose intent is to load the next level in a game. it finds the index of the level, loads it from the level loader (a class i wrote), creates a layer holding that level, then informs the scene to transition between the new and old level layers. the player sprite is turned invisible at this time, so that there are not two players during the transition. . ;. ; we've run into a problem where occasionally, the player will be turned invisible but the transition will not happen. after doing a lot of digging, all i've found out is that the method is not finishing running, even though there are no returns or other calls in the method. . ;. ; method (as it is now with logs in to help monitor what is happening): . ;. ;  . ;. ; it looks like the code is quitting out at gamelevellayer  layer= ..., for no log messages appear after that, yet as you can see there are clearly no exits in the code after that point. any idea what could be causing this issue? . ;. ; thanks in advance!. ;-stephen . ;

i have written a method whose intent is to load the next level in a game
it finds the index of the level loads it from the level loader a class i wrote creates a layer holding that level then informs the scene to transition between the new and old level layers
the player sprite is turned invisible at this time so that there are not two players during the transition
we ve run into a problem where occasionally the player will be turned invisible but the transition will not happen
after doing a lot of digging all i ve found out is that the method is not finishing running even though there are no returns or other calls in the method
method as it is now with logs in to help monitor what is happening
it looks like the code is quitting out at gamelevellayer layer ... for no log messages appear after that yet as you can see there are clearly no exits in the code after that point
any idea what could be causing this issue
thanks in advance

<p>Ok found the solution:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>/**&#xA; * User&#xA; *&#xA; * @ORM\Table("users")&#xA; * @ORM\Entity&#xA; */&#xA;class User extends UserEntity&#xA;{&#xA;    ...&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * @ORM\OneToOne&#xA;     * (&#xA;     *      targetEntity="UserPreferences",&#xA;     *      cascade={"persist", "remove"},&#xA;     *      inversedBy="user"&#xA;     * )&#xA;     */&#xA;    protected $userPreferences;&#xA;}&#xA;&#xA;/**&#xA; * @ORM\Table("user_preferences")&#xA; * @ORM\Entity&#xA; */&#xA;class UserPreferences extends UserPreferencesEntity&#xA;{&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * @ORM\Column(name="id", type="integer")&#xA;     * @ORM\Id&#xA;     * @ORM\GeneratedValue&#xA;     */&#xA;    protected $id;&#xA;&#xA;    /**&#xA;     * @var int&#xA;     *&#xA;     * @ORM\OneToOne(targetEntity="User", mappedBy="id", cascade={"persist", "remove"})&#xA;     */&#xA;    protected $user;&#xA;&#xA;    ...&#xA;}&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>First of all I had to specify mappedBy and inversedBy (which I already tried before but in the wrong direction - mappedBy at the owning side, inversedBy at inversed side). Also I thought that the inversed side did not need to have a separate id and I tried to use the id of the owning side (User#id) as primary key for this one too.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<ul>&#xA;<li><a href="http://docs.doctrine-project.org/en/latest/reference/unitofwork-associations.html" rel="nofollow">http://docs.doctrine-project.org/en/latest/reference/unitofwork-associations.html</a></li>&#xA;<li><a href="http://docs.doctrine-project.org/en/latest/reference/association-mapping.html" rel="nofollow">http://docs.doctrine-project.org/en/latest/reference/association-mapping.html</a></li>&#xA;</ul>&#xA;

 ok found the solution: . ;. ;  . ;. ; first of all i had to specify mappedby and inversedby (which i already tried before but in the wrong direction - mappedby at the owning side, inversedby at inversed side). also i thought that the inversed side did not need to have a separate id and i tried to use the id of the owning side (user#id) as primary key for this one too. . ;. ; . ;     . ;     . ; . ;

ok found the solution
first of all i had to specify mappedby and inversedby which i already tried before but in the wrong direction - mappedby at the owning side inversedby at inversed side
also i thought that the inversed side did not need to have a separate id and i tried to use the id of the owning side user#id as primary key for this one too

<p>I have two generators <code>genA</code> and <code>genB</code> and each of them generates an infinite, strictly monotonically increasing sequence of integers.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Now I need a generator that generates all tuples <code>(a, b)</code> such that <code>a</code> is produced by <code>genA</code> and <code>b</code> is produced by <code>genB</code> and <code>a &lt; b</code>, ordered by <code>a + b</code> ascending. In case of ambiguity the ordering is of no importance, i.e. if <code>a + b == c + d</code>, it doesn't matter if it generates <code>(a, b)</code> first or <code>(c, d)</code> first.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>For instance. If both <code>genA</code> and <code>genB</code> generate the prime numbers, then the new generator should generate:</p>&#xA;&#xA;<pre><code>(2, 3), (2, 5), (3, 5), (2, 7), (3, 7), (5, 7), (2, 11), ...&#xA;</code></pre>&#xA;&#xA;<p>If <code>genA</code> and <code>genB</code> were finite lists, zipping and then sorting would do the trick.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>Apparenyly for all tuples of form <code>(x, b)</code> the following holds: <code>first(genA) &lt;= x &lt;= max(genA,b) &lt;= b</code>, being <code>first(genA)</code> the first element generated by <code>genA</code> and <code>max(genA,b)</code> the last element generated by <code>genA</code> which is less than <code>b</code>.</p>&#xA;&#xA;<p>This is how far I have gotten. Any ideas of how to combine two generators in the described manner?</p>&#xA;

 i have two generators  gena  and  genb  and each of them generates an infinite, strictly monotonically increasing sequence of integers. . ;. ; now i need a generator that generates all tuples  (a, b)  such that  a  is produced by  gena  and  b  is produced by  genb  and , ordered by  a + b  ascending. in case of ambiguity the ordering is of no importance,   if , it doesn't matter if it generates  (a, b)  first or  (c, d)  first. . ;. ; for instance. if both  gena  and  genb  generate the prime numbers, then the new generator should generate: . ;. ;  . ;. ; if  gena  and  genb  were finite lists, zipping and then sorting would do the trick. . ;. ; apparenyly for all tuples of form  (x, b)  the following holds: , being  first(gena)  the first element generated by  gena  and  max(gena,b)  the last element generated by  gena  which is less than  b . . ;. ; this is how far i have gotten. any ideas of how to combine two generators in the described manner? . ;

i have two generators gena and genb and each of them generates an infinite strictly monotonically increasing sequence of integers
now i need a generator that generates all tuples a b such that a is produced by gena and b is produced by genb and ordered by a + b ascending
in case of ambiguity the ordering is of no importance if it doesn t matter if it generates a b first or c d first
for instance
if both gena and genb generate the prime numbers then the new generator should generate
if gena and genb were finite lists zipping and then sorting would do the trick
apparenyly for all tuples of form x b the following holds being first gena the first element generated by gena and max gena b the last element generated by gena which is less than b
this is how far i have gotten
any ideas of how to combine two generators in the described manner
